Reviews.Title: “Good hotel bad location”
Reviews.Author: SagHarborAlice
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is a nice little oasis on in a strip mall area just outside of old town Key West. There is a Walgreens next door. I did think there was a waterfront that was more than a dock and some jet skis, however there wasn't even a bench or a spot of sand on their waterfront. That said, the place is nice..the rooms large and mostly quiet with nice bathrooms. There are a number of pools and a small bar where some food is served up util 7PM. The drive to town and to most restaurants is only about 5 minutes. So the most compelling thing for me was that the price was very good for a nice, clean, and pretty base to visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Shawna lee D
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here!! Chelsea helped us pick a water front king suite for our stay, my husband and I came down for a long weekend this March and we wanted to have views of the water. Key West doesn’t have many beaches, there are like 2 public ones, but the rest is awesome history and different stuff to do. Like Mallory square or the butterfly conservatory. Both are fantastic! It was our first time going to the keys and we were nervous about where to go. When we found Parrot Key online we called the reservations number and spoke to Chelsea. She’s right on property and is SOOO helpful! She told us where to go and helped us get a great price on our room. The room had a comfy king bed and we even had a living room with a mini fridge and microwave. We also had two balconies with gorgeous views! The pools were great and so was Café Blue! Everyone is so nice there and I will be seeing you all again, hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gia P
Reviews.Content: This resort is the perfect quiet retreat... The salt water pools are the best!! 4 to choose from, so if the scene at one isn't working for you, move on to the next. Sandwiches are delicious for an afternoon snack. Walgreens, grocery store, liquor store are all right there... The best part is the hospitality though. Kristen, who works the front desk is knowledgable, helpful, and super nice!!! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort, though I will not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Kitka2001
Reviews.Content: We are Key West lovers who come in March for St. Patricks Day with friends. In the past we have stayed in old town at La Concha. We were looking forward to staying a bit off of noisy Duval and enjoy the beach so we chose Parrot Key. The location is not bad, about $15 for the cab to Duval. Worth it for being able to go back to a quiet room after a night on the town. We planned on renting scooters instead, and the hotel provided a third party to rent the scooters from, Island Vibe Rentals. The worst part of the vacation was the rental experience, where the throttle stuck on one of our scooters, causing a major accident. Luckily we were not injured to the point of hospitalization, but it totalled the scooter, ruined our night, and of course soured the mood of the rest of the trip. I cannot stress enough how much I recommend using another scooter company other than the one provided by the hotel. Although we informed them of the malfunction, they were continuing to recommend this company throughout our stay, which is my biggest complaint with the hotel. The reason we will not stay again is because of their 100% non-smoking policy. As smokers, we never smoke in the home or in hotel rooms anyway, but when it is prohibited on a balcony or in an outside bar, we draw the line. This is Key West, and it is the home of independence and freedom. Not at Parrot Key, though. So, a non smoker can disregard our reason for not returning, but anyone who even enjoys an occasional cigar like my husband can look forward to being shoved off property to enjoy it. The pool is nice, the bar has tasty drinks, though the fact that it closes at sundown is silly. We never tried the food at the pool. Enjoy the comfy and clean room if you choose the resort, but don't rent the scooter there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to Key West, we relied upon everyone else's reviews and the hotel's website to select this hotel. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was everything I expected and hoped it to be. Because of the set up of that room, it felt more like "home" than a hotel with the only exception being that we didn't have a full kitchen. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to ANYONE. Not only was the room great, but the 4 pool areas are wonderful. Even though they are right in the middle of the hotel, they are very tropical and private. Also, every staff member we came into contact with was absolutely wonderful, pleasant and helpful; from those who helped us at checkin/checkout, to those we encountered during our stay; like the housekeeping and cafe staff. The office staff even helped me set up reservations for the onsite water activities; which is another plus for this hotel. Honestly, I can't say enough of Parrot Key! If you stay here, you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation stay at Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I came to stay at Parrot Key Resort over the St. Patricks Day weekend and had the most amazing time. The front desk was so very helpful with giving us suggestions of places to eat...which were all really good. The bartender at one of the beautiful pools was so fun and friendly. She made it so much fun to just hang out by the pool all day. Our room, we could not ask for better...it was beautiful and very clean!! We felt like we were staying in a little beach cabin...so cute. We were able to get a taxi very quickily each time we went out just by letting front desk know. It cost us about $10-$12 each way, which was worth it not to have to find a place to park when we left for Duvall. I would rate this hotel a definite 10 on a 1-10 scale. You will not be disappointed for sure!

Reviews.Title: “"Colorful as the Rainbow, Rewarding as the Pot-of-Gold!"”
Reviews.Author: Dairys
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing vacation at Parrot Key this Spring-Break! Our family traveled from Miami to Key West to relax and enjoy all that the City has to offer, with no particular plan in mind. As we entered the Keys, we immediately felt that we had left so much of the hectic activity of the City Life behind. Traveling through the Upper and Middle Keys offered a Rainbow of Colorful Views... beautiful Blue skies, crystal-clear waters, and much activity along the Highway. As we entered Key West, we were ready to really relax! We arrived at Parrot Key, checked-in to our room, with the most welcoming accommodations. Nothing was more inviting than the open-specious, colorful soroundings of our room. The combination of elegance in the decor, cleanliness, yet cozy-like home feeling - was undiscribeable to us all! As we opened the back doors and walked outside to the deck area, which overlooked the water, we knew then this was the treasure we had been awaiting - what a beautiful view! We walked bare-foot in the sand, and made our way to the Cafe Blue, where we enjoyed a savory Tuna-Melt Sandwich to die for! Had some refreshing drinks, pool side and mingled a bit with the Staff about this and the other Singh Resorts - like Tranquility Bay, located in Marathon - the Middle Keys. They were all so friendly, welcoming and so informative about some personally known fun activities to do in Key West and the Keys... Kyaking, Sailing/Boating - even a simple 3 minute bike-ride to the beach sounded great! Forget about your car here; just park it - walk, bike, or grab a cabb... this is part of much of the fun! As we enjoyed the rest of our weekly stay at the Resort and Key West, there wasn't a dole moment. But, relaxing at the Resort... dinning, drinking by the pool side (a few to choose from), simply taking in all the beauty and comfort the Resort has to offer, and enjoying our family time each day - until night time, when we looked forward to sleeping on the most comfortable beds we have ever experienced at a Resort of this kind - like no other -- the best! We realized... that followed by the beautiful Blue colors of the Gulf View Water, the lush White sand, the invigorating Green-lush Architectural Lanscaping and Sculpture Designs through-out the property, and last but no least --- the BRIGHT, Yelllow Sun of Key West - it was as rewarding as a real "Pot-of-Gold" at the end of the Rainbow! Don't hesitate -come see and enjoy Key West the right way... stay at PARROT KEY HOTEL AND RESORT. You won't be disappointed... we never are!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Eddy
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here for three nights for a long weekend, I must say the property was nicely landscaped, well maintained, and the staff know how exactly how to please guests. Any time we needed anything all we had to do is ask. The pools are very relaxing with all the palm trees and lush landscaping. This hotel didn't disappoint from the moment we arrived to the last afternoon by the pool sipping cold drinks waiting for our driver to take us to the airport. The front desk staff even held our bags while we relaxed by the pool so that we didn't have to lug them around with us. I will be returning here in a few months for a romantic weekend that I am already looking forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved this place”
Reviews.Author: busjgh
Reviews.Content: We loved this place, we stayed in a sea king room with a view to die for. The rooms are huge, nicely decorated with excellent beds. This place is 2 miles out of town (but it says this on their website) so no surprise for us. It says they have no direct water access-so again no surprise. All in all, if you know what to expect this place is a little piece of paradise in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key West”
Reviews.Author: NH1245
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from my birthday trip at Parrot Key. This is an excellent, small boutique style hotel. Planning and coordination was effortless thanks to Chanel in reservations. This was our first trip to Key West and we were overwhelmed looking for and calling different hotels in the area. After speaking to Chanel WE WERE SOLD! She's on property as was able to explain everything in detail. Once we arrived we weren't disappointed. The property is gorgeous and very clean. It's one of those places that actually looks as beautiful in person as it does online. Sam at the front desk greeted us with a smile and checked us in. She went out of her way to help us and answer our questions about the area. She made us feel like we were the only guests staying at the resort. We will definitely be returning. We've already told our friends about this Key West Gem and can't wait to start planning our next trip. Thank you Parrot Key Staff for making this one of the most memorable trips ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Darlene2010
Reviews.Content: We were at Parrot Key for 3 nights and loved it. Check in was easy and quick. The room was wonderful! We had a one bedroom suite on the second floor which had a balcony in both the front and the back - very peaceful. Rooms were clean, brightly decorated, and very relaxing. We loved it so much we didn't want to leave. Also - there were DVD players in the bedroom and sitting room. Now the pools - were simply amazing. Each pool was a little different and had palm trees and planting so each pool was secluded. This was my favorite thing about the hotel! It really made it feel like paradise. The only thing I didn't like was that the restaurant/bar was only open until 8:00pm. We like to go back to the hotel for a nightcap but couldn't here. Not sure why they close at 8:00. If/when I go back to Key West - I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “paradise found!!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah L
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key was a gorgeous resort! We had so much fun in Key West! I must say, everyone has to do the Duval Crawl!!!! Parrot Key was great because we could take an easy 5 minute cab ride and be in the heart of duval and when we were done partying, take an easy cab ride back and be in a nice quiet place to sleep and relax. And the beds- they are so comfortable!! We were in a garden view king guestroom and it was so spacious, more than enough room for the 2 of us. Thank you so much to everyone at the resort for helping us have an awesome vacation! And especially thank you to Chelsea for helping me get a cab back to the resort and for helping us with the room reservation!! We will see you guys again in a few months!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Vivian P
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at Parrot Key and loved the charming and immaculate accommodations. One minor complaint - parking was not close to all rooms and if you got back after 7, you had to park at the Walgreens lot next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: Great property, beautiful landscaping, The room was wonderful. Nice comfortable beds in both bedrooms. The bathrooms were very nice. The rooms were all extremely clean. Check in was breeze. The staff was attentive to any needs. Water-sports are on the property. It was easy to get to town. They charge a resort fee, but so do all the other "resorts" in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations. Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy G
Reviews.Content: Being someone who lives and works in a big city in central Florida, I look forward to my long weekend in Key West every year. A wonderful young lady, Chelsea, booked me a one bedroom suite. It was perfect! Chelsea was more than happy for help me organize my trip and she actually booked me an entire day for water sports and water activities so I didn't have to deal with the hassle. And another young woman, Channel, gave me perfect dinner recommendations! Plus, the hotel was clean and well taken care-of. The other staff members were always nice and helpful. Parrot Key: absolutely worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make for happy stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandi J
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay, but felt like 5* guests from the moment we arrived. Staff were smiling, willing to do what they could to accommodate all the guests. Lovely fresh clean comfortable rooms made this hotel a reason to come back. I would have no hesitation to recommend this to the business or family traveler, 10 out of 10!!

Reviews.Title: “Relax Relax Relax”
Reviews.Author: Aidan L
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner planned to stay here for a week and ended up staying for two. Loved the ocean view from our room, loved the food, loved the pool area and the service from a very friendly staff. I highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Team at Parrot Key Resorts.....”
Reviews.Author: JA6664
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently decided to go down to Key West Florida and was really stressed about accommodations and things to do since it was our first time. We called the Parrot Key Resort and spoke to a young lady by the name of Chanel who assisted us in our reservation. We had other options to explore but spending 15 minutes on the phone with this wonderful lady made me extremely comfortable and very happy that someone in the hospitality industry was actually going on and beyond the call of duty and helping us in our decision. Not only was she hospitable but she also gave us options on what to do while in Key West and booked our choice of activities within the island. We had misplaced some information and another representative in reservations by the name of Chelsea took our call and helped us gather and understand in detail our other concerns which we had missed to ask the first lady Chanel. Parrot Key was a huge and great experience and I can see the professionalism in their staff as well as their facilities....I give it an A++++++. Thank you for your hard work. Jim and Ali P.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical charm & quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed more than a month we liked it so much. This resort has a wonderful tropical garden motif that makes you feel like you are a long way off the busy roadway that goes into Old Town Key West, but itâ€™s just a short drive to Duval. The landscaping is lush green, with lots of tall palm trees and thousands of plants. While the buildings are designed to reflect a more modern Southern Style two story beach house they are split with lower and upper apartments in each unit. Each has a porch or balcony, some two. The upper one we stayed in had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathes and a living room, with frig, micro, coffee maker & toaster. 3 flat panel TVâ€™s in all. Very nice! The work out facility was minimal but okay. The food offerings at the on-site restaurant could stand to be expanded. The four pools were surrounded and separated by tropical trees & gardensâ€”each one had a feel of being exclusively remote. What made the Parrot Key Resort really special was the resort staff. From the front desk to all the maintenance and housekeeping staff, and portersâ€”it was the nicest we have ever been treated as guests. We almost felt like familyâ€”really. They were wonderful to my wife and me. Itâ€™s a great place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “LIGHTS OUT, LOCK DOWN WITH A FEE”
Reviews.Author: ARW101210
Reviews.Content: This place is not a resort even through they charge a $25 resort fee, there is nothing to do here, they have "Resort Actives" listed on the website but if you click on it, you will notice that it tells you what you can do in Key West, as for the ones they say they have onsite, they are really ran by another company and you get a discount on everything but nothing is free, as a matter of fact, the pool towels are in your room and if your room is short a towel, it is a $25 charge per towel. Speaking of the pools, they close at sunset, along with the cafe and tiki bar. The rooms are only good for sleeping, no chairs, I'm sorry there is one. There is no beach, just some sand outside and I have yet to see water because of the over grown trees and garden...yes yet, because I am at the Parrot Key as I type...wish I could get out of tomorrow's stay...the place is cute, but trust me you will be more happy as a cheaper chain or a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “They go out of their way for their guests!”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parrot Key Resort a couple of weeks ago. We went there on the Key West Express out of Ft. Myers. When we took the boat back the next day, we were almost to Ft. Myers and discovered we did not have the rental car keys! It was late and the front desk at Parrot Key was closed. So I called in the morning and Kristen told me, that, yes housekeeping found my wallet and rental car keys. Didn't notice my wallet was gone too, because I didn't want to carry a big purse around Key West, so I had my licence, credit card and cash with me in a fanny pack. I asked if they could please take my stuff to the Ft. Myers boat, and I would pick them up that night when the boat arrived in Ft. Myers. They went out of their way to do that, not only once, but twice, because the boat check in was not open yet the first time they went. Thank you Kristen, I am forever grateful! My husband and I have been going to Florida for 20 years, and have never left anything at a hotel. As for the resort itself, it is beautiful! There is so much lush landscaping, you feel like you are in the rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ValueVoyager
Reviews.Content: We liked Parrot Key very much. Great front desk staff. Comfortable beds, roomy bathrooms. Much bigger than rooms in historic district. Confusion regarding cabs. If you need to be in Historic District by a certain time, allow at least 1 hour to get a cab during busy times. All resort access to Wi-Fi much appreciated. I had a family emergency that required internet. Nice to be able to jump on anywhere on the property. Parking is limited. You may be lugging your bags down walkways and up stairs. Be prepared or ask for bell service.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: laguna5243
Reviews.Content: Finding a place on line can be a gamble. Pictures and comments sometimes lie. Not here, the pictures on their website only begin showing how nicely kept and beautiful this place was. The people that work there are all friendly and approachable, the detail the designers put in to this property is over the top. What a great place. I have no problem recommending this resort to anyone. It's not too pricey, it's not stuffy, it's clean and comfortable, and close enough to downtown that you can get there with a short bike ride. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would return”
Reviews.Author: Thisdoesfine
Reviews.Content: Great front desk staff that recommended lots of entertainment and food. Very glad this is a 100% no smoking business. Nowhere here will you walk through a puff of someone's cancer smoke inside or out. Beautiful scenery walking to and around the rooms. The rooms were spacious and gave our group (two couples) the chance to stay in the same suite but sleep in separate rooms with bathrooms in each. A nice tv in each room although we only played music as there was too much to do to watch tv. The rooms seemed freshly decorated, painted and well kept, beds were very comfortable as was the living room furniture. Not a full kitchen but just enough for a short stay. A sink would have been nice but no stars deducted. We had an issue with our toilet upon late arrival and someone came and fixed it immediately. A bit far from Duval street, rent a scooter or take a cab, don't walk it. Walgreens is right next door as is the liquor store! Parking is limited, but you are allowed to park @ Walgreens. The only downfall that took a star was the breakfast service. For the price you pay, there is no free breakfast. They do offer breakfast at a cost but you should go somewhere else. To eat down by the pool is nice but the food isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Aaahhh...relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Bekah19
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here and wished we could have stayed longer. Was initially disappointed by the location, but the resort is really like an oasis once inside! The four pools and grounds are beautiful and relaxing! We had a room that had a small porch that opened up to the sand, and it was fabulous! I wished there had been a small microwave, and it wasn't as close to the action as I'd hoped, but not that far either. I'd definitely recommend staying here and would stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Island_Wonderer
Reviews.Content: I came to Florida, because of the helpful information from Chelesa the Vacation Planner at Parrot Key Resort, with whom I think the state of florida should bottle her ability to entice people from far away. Chelesa and Kirsten the Desk Manager went above and beyond to provide a superb two bedroom accomodation for my wife and our friends. At the front desk recommendation we really enjoyed the day sail on Danger Charters with snorkeling, kayaking($100 each). The bicycle rentals($12 each/day). As well as the useful information on Key West and the Keys activities. We greatly enjoyed Duval street, Maritime Museum, shopping, Hemmingway House, and of coarse the Resturants and Bars. Finally on the way home we stopped off at the Dolphin Research Center(excellant) and on to Kennedy Space Centre(Manditory man trip). Finally Chelesa, Thank you for the Champain for our 30th Anniversary. Happy holidays- Vancouver Island

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs and landscaping, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: RW E
Reviews.Content: Been to Key West before but wanted to tryout this new resort. Beautifully landscaped, nicely furnished and comfortable beds, but that's where it ends. Advertised as "minutes" from Duval Street but in reality you have to drive or take a cab which costs either way. It took about 30-45 minutes from the property to get to Duval Street. Spent a little more money to get a gulf front suite with balcony. Gulf view was nice, but balconys were way too close to each other. At one point, we actually saw someone peering into the bedroom from the next balcony....ouch! Parking is a HUGE problem at this place. Was told by their front desk employees Alma and Sean that I could "park by Walgreens or Home Depot right next door because parking wasn't guaranteed, read the check- in paperwork". Really not what I wanted to hear after paying $450 a night for the best they had to offer. Forget the fancy cigar you just bought on Duval Street because they won't let you smoke it anywhere on property, you can walk right over to Walgreens and smoke it is what I was told by "Alma". They advertise a fitness center, howeve the "fitness center" consists of 3 or 4 treadmills and a water cooler in a room next to the reception area.....very disappointing. Pros: nice landscaping, clean rooms, comfortable beds. Cons: not enough parking, no place to smoke a good cigar, not very helpful front desk staff. Bottom line, for the money you could do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Quality!!”
Reviews.Author: Claude M
Reviews.Content: Our time at Parrot Key Hotel and Resort was fabulous! Two level, 2 bedroom and a common area added for comfort and privacy. Only minutes from Duval St.( Cab fare $4.00/per one way in 2012) . The pool areas are private with a lush tropical atmosphere. The rooms are very comfortable and the beds are amazing. If you want a place that most represents the Keys, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Hunter P
Reviews.Content: First time to Key West. Had a great time. Took a tour of the city the first day and realized that we had hit a home run with our hotel accomadations. Stayed in one of the suites and had plenty of room. Art was wonderful and beds were comfortable. Loved the landscaping and pool areas. Breakfast at pool was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “returnguests”
Reviews.Author: debbievacation
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very good. I would give it an excellent if it had a place to have dinner on site.They only serve breakfast and lunch. Also no laundry facilities on site which for us traveling as a big family is a necessity. The rooms are great for comfort and the pools are perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: schroeder400
Reviews.Content: their website makes you think you are staying right by the water but unfortunately the beach area they show is the size of a small backyard and there is absolutely no privacy and not way to get to the water. Everytime we wanted to go to a beach we had to get in our car and drive there. The 4 pools are very small. Thie place is not worth the price. If i am going to pay $450-$500 per night i want to be able to walk out and go to the beach! also, my idea of Key West is not to stay next to the Home Depot. there are so many other nice places to stay, don't bother with this one. Also, there are no places to park. we ended up having to park in the Walgreens parking lot next door.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key grounds are paradise”
Reviews.Author: Willwork4trvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GREAT value. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with 4 separate pools which feel like they're hidden in gardens. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. The location was almost 3 miles from Duvall, would have liked to have been closer to the western end of the island but again it was a GREAT value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: REDSOXFANTASTIC
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful luxury hotel. Rooms make you feel like you've died and gone to heaven - luxury everywhere. Walk in shower (but no seat or shelf so you can shave your legs) Beautiful bed (but it's HIGH - need a step stool to get in...) Pretty french doors leading to your deck on the sand (but you cannot get to the water - floral hedges try to make up for that fact, but you can't put your feet in the Gulf). Lots of pools, a Cafe for food and drink (BUT - they stop serving food at 5PM!!! We ended up having to walk across the street to find someplace to eat! With what you pay to stay here (it IS beautiful...) you would expect to be able to have dinner on site (dinner AFTER 5PM that is...), Great place to stay if you like to live in luxurious surroundings but don't mind having to wander around elsewhere for food and ocean. Also, you can't really see the sunset into the ocean from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Capo M
Reviews.Content: It is very rare these days to find a place that is consistently maintaining its top rating and this is one of those rare places.It starts right with Svetlana,the receptionist,a very helpful and pleasant young lady.Room and the bathroom were very clean and so also the bed and the bed-sheets.I wish we could stay longer.We will definitely go back.The cafe next door is a great place for vegetarians.I sincerely hope and pray that the Parrot key and its staff continues to keep this place at the top.Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: motowngeorge
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Parrot Key was fantastic. It is a beautiful, clean and quiet resort. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The cab ride to town was a set price of $4.00 a person. It was worth the extra money to come back to such a quiet place after a day/evening on Duvall. Would highly recommend staying at this resort. No complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Grace S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the most wonderful trip to Parrot Key. We needed a few days away as as I had never been to Key West I googled and chose Parrot Key. The resort is the finest we have ever stayed at. The staff are exceptional (Shelley!, Kyle!), the rooms and grounds are spectacular, and the landscaping is beyond gorgeous. Quite obviously a tremendous amount of work went into creating this beautiful property. Imagine stepping out of your room onto your own verandah and then into the sand! It is divine. For once, a resort that is what is claims to be! This is not a resort if you want noise and partiers. For relaxation, comfort and a serene stay we highly recommend it and no one could possibly ever be disappointed at Parrot Key. We'll return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Pure Bliss!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hwildt
Reviews.Content: This is by far a Top Notch beautiful place to stay at while visiting Key West. We rented a 2 BR Suite while we stayed for 5 nights and had absolutely no comp,ants what so ever! I've been raving about this place since we got here. So clean, it makes you feel like you are home away from home Soooo comfortable too! I could not be anymore impressed with the staff too, everyone was very friendly and so helpful too. The Manager Shawn checked in on us to make sure our stay was just as we had hoped for and let us know if we requested anything they would be happy to get it for us. The front desk staff was so nice and pleasurable people too. We ate at the outside dining for breakfast one morning and loved it! We all had the bacon egg and cheese on toasted thick bread with a fruit bowl!! Delic and priced very nicely for our budget. There are 3 outdoor pools here too that are set in a garden like atmosphere. Very private and one of the pools we got into at night was a heated salt water pool. Nice touch!! I would reccomend anyone to stay here and when my hubby and I get more time away from our small kids we will come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Iffy Location”
Reviews.Author: Eurorunner
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you know what you are getting here. The positives are that the room (I had a garden suite) was very comfortable, roomy, nice amenities, great balcony, and clean. Nice to have a fridge, toaster, etc. Housekeeping was a bit spotty - missed cleaning the glasses and left some trash - but overall cleanliness was fine. The front desk folks were very friendly and accommodating. The downside is no room service, food is served in the tiki bar only until 5 (food is good), and the resort is relatively far away from the key west action. Not a reasonable walk to downtown, but really a $15 cab ride each way. Not the hotels fault, just know this going in, especially since you won't be eating dinner there. The place is in a very congested commercial area - home depot is right next door and parking is at the Walgreens - but the grounds are very nice. Won't go back, but worth a look if you need a big room for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded property”
Reviews.Author: Kristin T
Reviews.Content: The property of this hotel is GORGEOUS! The staff was extremely pleasant and informative. Our room was supposedly the "cheapest" room available, but it was HUGE! The main living area was very large and the bathroom and shower were more than adequate! Our front door opened into the heart of the resort, which is covered in white picket fences and lush flora. Our back door opened to a cute little private porch with two wooden chairs and a private beach area. There is a fence that separates this beach area from the canal, but that is really for safety reasons I think, since there is a little drop down to the canal. The cafe is a little pricey, but this is no different from any other resort. The food was great and my fiance and I really enjoyed our time here. If we ever make it back down to Key West, we are definitely staying here!

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay anywhere else! Parrot Key was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Trent S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the resort with another couple. There was plenty of room in the suite, and everything was wonderful. The staff was very accommodating, and very laid back. The room was cleaned thoroughly, yet discretely every day. The setting was beautiful, with well maintained gardens, and very quite when it is time to sleep. The beds were super comfortable, and all the pools were very clean and warm. I loved the setting. The hotel is next door to a Walgreens, so were able to walk next door to get anything we needed, from snacks and sunscreen to hair supplies and Dramamine. If you wanted to go to Duval, it was a very short cab ride, or nice relaxing bicycle ride to and from. This place would be excellent for families or couples alike. I can't recommend it enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: MsB5711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this resort. The rooms are very comfortable and beautiful. We stayed in a downstairs room and had a lovely porch which went out onto a sandy walkway with a view of the canal. There are gorgeous plants and flowers everywhere. There are 4 pools that beautifully landscaped and very private. We actually checked out the pools at some of the more expensive resorts that we considered before reserving at Parrot Key and they were not even close to what we had here. Also the staff at Parrot Key is fantastic! Everyone was so helpful and nice. We rented bicycles to travel to Duvall Street (just 2 miles) everyday and the PK staff was very helpful in arranging our rental. Very close to a grocery, some casual dining(awesome deli, pizza, chinese), movie theater, and Walgreen's.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations very accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: Can not say enough nice things!!!! We had a reservation with this beautiful resort that we were unable to keep because my father became ill. The reservation manager was very understanding of our situation and graciously helped with refunding our deposit. We plan to make another reservation for a later date and would not think of choosing another resort. We look forward to our stay in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, meh location”
Reviews.Author: okbye
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds, friendly staff, big room w a nice porch, 4 pools surrounded by amazing lush greenery but the overall hotel location left a lot to be desired, especially when you're looking for keys charm. It's located quite a ways from downtown, across from a Walgreens/Home Depot shopping center (where you'll most likely have to park because their lot is packed), just off the overseas highway so you can hear cars whizzing by, and on the bay w no water access as it's elevated...the waterfront "beach" area was depressing really, made me wish I had spent the extra money and stayed at Southernmost. If you want to see a beautiful sunset, you'll need to head downtown as there are powerlines ruining the view.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to the keys”
Reviews.Author: dana p
Reviews.Content: this was my 1st trip to the keys and Parrot Key. The resort was great. We were there for 3 nights in Feb and Parrot was priced less then the other resorts near Duval street. I enjoyed the 4 secluded swimming pools and tiki bar for dinning. We were on the lower level with our own porch. The jet ski tour on site was great as well. The resort is on Hwy 1 and a strait drive to Duval St. I did not bother with a taxi and drove there on 3 different times and had no problems. The resort is out just far enough to enjoy quiet and close enough for all the fun. I would come back and do the same again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the pricy end but an outstanding facility”
Reviews.Author: Geocaching Ace
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Parrot Key Resort and had a really memorable stay. We were staying at another facility on the island and moved here to spend a few nights with some friends who were staying only a short while. The cost for the room was really high when compared to other resorts but I have to say this facility is really amazing. Multiple pools, quiet setting (away from Hwy 1) and brand new rooms. Everything here is 1st class all the way. I did not see any shortcuts to doing things the right way. There were even outlets for people who rented electric cars to charge them up during the night. We did not eat at their poolside restaurant but there was plenty to chose from. The entire staff had an outstanding attitude - there was nothing they could not do for you. You would not know that there was a Home Depot or Wallgreens right around the corner. We did take the waverunner tour of the island offered at the pier right behind their resort. What a blast! 50+ mph on the water for 26 miles around the entire key. We didn't see any dolphins as suggested but the trip was really fun. I'm not sure we would stay here again as the cost really exceeded our budget but it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Marrcham
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. The rooms are very clean and well decorated. We enjoyed the porch every morning for breakfast and every evening. Very private. We love the lush greenery everywhere, provided great privacy and shade. We went to two of the pools which were lovely and private, only about 20 or so loungers for 3 of the pools, more available at the one with the bar area. The only issue I had with the pool area is that the picture on their website actually shows cushions on their loungers but they were no where to be found. The loungers were actually very hard and I really could have used a cushion. The only issue that we had with the room and it's kind of the reason you get a hotel room was the bed and pillows. I actually didn't have a good night sleep as the pillows were very hard and lumpy (we were in unit 66A) and the mattress needs to be changed. It was a king but it sunk so bad in the middle that my husband and I kept rolling into the middle. As a suggestion to management/maintenance, you're going to have some serious repairs in the shower area. The standup shower was great. The problem was that even if you pointed the shower away from the door, the water still flowed out the door. A splash guard would save you a lot of water damage to come. It's really hard to say bad things about this hotel as it is really a wonderful place. So different from the other places that we stayed. I loved the secludedness feel of it with all of the foliage and my favourite, the porch! I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of Trip!”
Reviews.Author: AnissaSimone
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Loved our room(s). My husband didn't realize it but he booked a room with 2 floors (2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms). We loved it! The tub in the master bathroom was nice and big. The hotel is more of a motel style, meaning you enter a small hall with 2 different rooms. One 'A' is a single room (separate party) on the first floor and the 'B' is has a small hall, steps to the first level (master bdrm and living rm) then steps to the second bed and bath. There are balconies in the master bd rm and liv rm.There was a microwave, refrigerator and a toaster in the living area. Flatscreens TVs in both bedrooms too. The resort has a very secluded feel since it's covered in huge palm trees. There are 3 small pool and a 4th larger one with a cafe area. We only visited 2 pools. The room could have been a little cleaner. There was hair all over the tub and the couch was very dirty. Plus we found fruit left over from a previous guest. The hotel is right next to a Walgreens and across from a Dominos and TGIF's. The trip down: We flew into Ft. Lauderdale and drove down. Big mistake. Even though we took the shorter route with tolls it took so long. Everyone drives the speed limit, 45, and it's mostly a single lane through the keys so you can't pass. It's not a scenic drive. We wasted a day traveling. Key West: Unfortunately we didn't love Key West. We went on a snorkeling trip (Echo) one day which was really nice. We saw dolphins! The water was beautiful off the boat. The beaches were not. There was so much sea grass and seaweed that we couldn't even go in the water. The water was very murky; the sand rough. It was very disappointing. We went to Duval street for Fat Tuesday. It was packed. There are a lot of touristy shops, bars and restaurants. Driving in Key West: A lot of people ride bikes and think the whole street is a bike lane. It's not. Be careful of parking. We got a ticket because we didn't realize the meter rules are in effect till midnight. We live in NY and never saw such a thing!

Reviews.Title: “great place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinakillam
Reviews.Content: super clean, staff was great, will go again for sure, we only had 1 day booked but stay 1 more just because of the beautiful place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Staff, including maintance, we're exceptionally nice. Recommend 1st floor ocean units- they have decks that go out to a quiet beach. Drinks were expensive - $8-9 for a small piÃ±a coloada in a plastic cup Pools are great. Very lush with plants- cant tell that there are any roads nearby

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: KikiC58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I greatly enjoyed our Valentines/Birthday celebration at Parrot Key. The staff was outstanding and the room felt like a home away from home. After an evening out to come back to your own little villa and relax on one of our two private decks surrounded by tropical foliage was beyond relaxing! The room was immaculate, bed was extremely comfortable, the pools are beautiful and the grounds are simply amazing! This is a hidden pocket in the midst of a very energetic town filled with great shops and restaurants. But when you enter Parrot Key you feel as if you are very removed from the rest of the world. I would recommend this resort to anyone and I would most definitely return the next time we visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation and Greater Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: MFLEM233
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the Presidentâ€™s Day Holiday weekend at the Parrot Key Resort and had a wonderful experience. The facilities are excellent with every detail taken into account to provide a quality pleasurable experience. We found the staff to be very informative, friendly and always willing to assist. They presented a smile and a warm sincere customer-care attitude. We especially enjoyed the service and food from the CafÃ© Blue. One specific CafÃ© Blue service representative that demonstrated a positive â€˜customer-firstâ€™ attitude was Mindy. Her smile and positive disposition was outstanding! This was our first time at this resort and we will return again soon. A great value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Katethegreat594
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was pretty with nice pools, I was unhappy with the front desk staff upon checkout. I had asked for a late checkout of 2:00. At first I was told I could have a late checkout of 1, but would have to pay a full days rate if I wanted 2. After further questioning I learned that the hotel was fully booked. I decided to speak to the manager when he came in. After explaining my questions and concerns and explaining how unhappy with the service, I explained that I heard of this hotel from trip advisor and would be posting a comment on your site. The manager then threatened to call the sheriff and have me publicly evicted if I was going to write me comments. Therefore I can no longer recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Rugjose
Reviews.Content: This property is a little hideaway off the main road. It's clean bright and has great amenities. The location is perfect to get to dining, the beach and downtown and the beds are heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel30226
Reviews.Content: We selected our hotel in Key West after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, and we chose well! Parrot Key is absolutely wonderful. It was like an oasis after a long day of walking around Key West and viewing the sites. It was so relaxing to come back to a seat on the porch gazing out at the Bay and enjoying the sunset, lying on the comfortable beds, or lounging by one of four pools. Even on a windy day, the lush landscaping blocks the wind from the garden pools. The food at the Blue Cafe was excellent, and we both thoroughly enjoyed our conversations (and excellent cocktails) with bartender, Shelley. I can't wait to go back to Key West, and we will definitely stay at Parrot Key when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kesha p
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Hotel and Resort was a amazing experince for me and my family i dont think we could ever stay any place else when we visit KeyWest. I feel that the resort brought paradise to me i didnt feel the need to due the duval crawl lol. I had an amazing time right on the property. I also have teenage kids and they loved this resort as well. I felt comfortable with the kids at this resort the staff was amazing the suites are huge and relaxing i dont have anything negative to say about Parrot Key Hotel and Resort. I have told all my friends, coworkers and family about this place. THE POITIER'S

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay if you want a serene, modern resort.”
Reviews.Author: melissamacbook
Reviews.Content: This is not the place for people looking to experience the boisterous nightlife of Duval St. The resort was well-maintained-the gardens were so peaceful and lush, it was a nice change from the bare trees we have in Ontario right now! I always rate a hotel on client service and cleanliness. This hotel had both going for it, I was quite happy with the front desk staff as well as the cleanliness of the room and amenities. The pool had ample seating and the poolside chairs were nice, modern and inviting. The bathrooms were large and had a large tub and glass shower, the furnishings were modern and colourful. We also had a balcony with 2 large chairs (it looked like all rooms did). Location shouldn't deter you from staying here, at all...It was literally a 5 minute drive to get anywhere and located beside a Walgreens and a minute away from a Publix, which is actually convenient if you need stuff! You can tell that the management is good - they have high standards and ensure their guests are happy. Oh yeah, the free parking and free wireless was a giant bonus as well! Small, quaint and modern. I think it was a terrific choice for us and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay though a little bit away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: DLC57
Reviews.Content: .Great place and amenties. Rooms and rates are great and customer service is exceptional.Its a bit away from Duvall but worth the stay. have walked to Duvall and taxi back at night runs about $15.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place; good customer service”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithFamily50
Reviews.Content: We were there during the month of Dec, 2011. It was a very busy period; but front desk was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and as described. Although the property itself is stated to be a waterfront property, it is not truly so. Its location is by the water, but it is shileded from the waterfront. The sand-filled patio gives a good feeling. We did not use the pools at all; not enough time. Parking is tight; if you did not park early the lot gets full and you may have to get to an adjacent lot for parking your car. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. To the management - my suggestion is to eliminate or drastically reduce the resort charges. It does not make sense to charge that much in addition to the room rent. Why not add all charges and publish the room rates accordingly?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel....”
Reviews.Author: beachysteve
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Parrot...can't wait to come back! The air in the rooms is ionized like Vegas casinos...You wake up feeling energized! Love this place...

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Rofb
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect to have to climb a steep flight of stairs to reach our first floor and then another flight inside for the second bedroom.And those eaves - gotta watch out for your head! Those with bad knees beware! especially after a long day. It's also away from everything and have to take a taxi or bus to get there. It's a nice setting once you are on the property...breakfast was nice. But the "kitchenette" that was offered was a tiny refrigerator without a freezer, a microwave and coffee pot. We get that in any hotel room. We had thought we could avoid paying for breakfast. There wasn't even a table to eat at or play cards. There was only a 3 seater sofa and one easy chair. Not great for us to spread out on. I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: leannacampbell
Reviews.Content: We really loved our visit here last weekend for a friend's birthday party. The hotel grounds are very nice...love the pool and bar areas. Our room had this nice little porch that lead out to a beautiful view of the water. The surrounding neighborhood is nothing amazing but once you're on the hotel grounds you don't notice. I highly recommend renting bikes to take into the main part of Key West. It's too far to walk and was a fun bike ride. There is no beach access in the area...I read that on TripAdvisor before arriving which was great to know in advance. This really is a nice place to stay...would love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Not what is used to be”
Reviews.Author: oceanstatemom
Reviews.Content: We have been to Parrot Key a couple of times and this past trip will probably be our last. We have always had a good experience however not so much this time. We had a 2 bedroom unit for 4 adults. We checked in on a Tuesday afternoon for a 3 night stay. On Wednesday our room was never cleaned. No clean towels or supplies replenished. We had to have someone come around 10 PM to take care of this after we returned from dinner. Thursday we had to tell them once again later in the afternoon our room was not cleaned again. For 4 adults there is a 4 cup coffee pot and 2 mugs ( again a 2 bedroom suite) We had to ask for a second pot and additional mugs. Extra toilet paper was not replenished so good luck when you ran out because the other bathroom was upstairs. The facilty is very clean. The cafe in the morning was a bit slow. Next time we will be going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: susan n
Reviews.Content: There were several things positive about our stay at this resort. We are 2 families that travel together every year around New Year's to get out of the harsh northern winter weather. We have stayed in several resort locations in Mexico, the Carribean etc. The Parrot Key is the new standard for expectations of great service, beatiful accommodations, convenience and fun. We stayed in the 3 bedroom condo which gave us plenty of room. Best features: wonderful staff, clean, pleasant unit, 4 smaller pools that offered plenty of privacy, easy cab rides to Duval street and Smather's beach ( $4/ head). While these things were not within walking distance, nothing was difficult to get to. Only negatives- no laundry on site and no swimming beach. We usually like to try new locations for the annual vacation but are planning on making a repeat trip to Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing paradise”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: We had a truly relaxing week at this hotel. The staff was so nice. The manager Sean was exceptionally conscientoius. The hotel is outside the hustle and bustle of downtown so it was ideal for a true get-away, yet still close to everything. We rented bikes and actually lost weight on vacation by staying active! The room and property were extremely comfortable and clean and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hideway!”
Reviews.Author: ACBeachBum
Reviews.Content: Two things you need to know - it is not really walking distance to the action in downtown Key West and there isn't a beach per se, but there are water views. We received a special promotion they were having thru travelz** that included a daily food/drink voucher - that was a nice extra. That being said, the resort is beautifully maintained, the staff is helpful and friendly, and the heated pools (4) are to die for. The tropical setting is spectacular. We went with another couple and got the 2 bedroom villa which was perfect - you have your own privacy and lots of room to yourselves. We got there 2 days before our friends and the management put us in the 2 bedroom early for the price of a standard king room (that we originally booked) until our friends arrived. Talk about customer service - that's what I'm talking about! From there we would go into town whenever we felt like it, but it was so great just to stay at the resort. There are shops and stores within walking distance which was a nice option. We had a rental car and didn't have any problems parking. There was a "resort fee" which we don't exactly understand (why not put it in the price) - but nevertheless it's still all worth it. When we go back to Key West, this is the only place we'd stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Class in Fantastic Setting”
Reviews.Author: Allen218
Reviews.Content: From the lush gardens to the waterfront, this hotel creates a Caribbean feeling through and through. With 4 swimming pools, individual patios, lounge chairs throughout, and outdoor dining, it's intimate, clean, and romantic. The front desk staff is friendly, Oriana goes beyond her duties, and each room is well-appointed. Water sports, excursions, good taxi service, and a shopping center across the street makes this place an incredible find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you don't have to park”
Reviews.Author: B D
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very well kept resort. But suggest you do not drive to with own car or rental car as parking is bad. In the notes given at check-in, the resot even suggests that if you want to be sure you are parked near your unit, to leave your car and take a taxi to town. Wow - what a solution! We had unit in the back but had to park in FRONT of resort, NEXT DOOR at Walgreens which is authorized - this is their resolution!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive staff and gorgeous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ashleykins
Reviews.Content: We went down to Key West for just one night and I spent hours researching the best hotel for 4 people. I pick this one because of the 2 bedroom 2 bath accommodations for a reasonable price. And we were blown away by the service and product the hotel offered! Rutany checked us in and spent so much time with us letting us know the best restaurants and things to do for our 1 day there. She really gave us her full attention and explained everything in depth. She even called to try and get us reservations at one of her favorite restaurants. The rooms were large and very island feeling. The pool areas were so clean and serene. We definitely wished we stayed for a week! But, we will back.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch stay!!! Paradise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BA_Vegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel. All I can say is WOW! The salt water pools and landscape are beautiful. One of the pools has a nice tropical bar that we enjoyed. The staff was friendly, helpful and very knowledge. Especially, Rutanya at the front desk. From the time we arrived, Rutanya was so nice and helpful. The rooms are beautiful and clean. I can't wait to go back to relax and enjoy paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base”
Reviews.Author: catborden
Reviews.Content: This resort was a pleasant place to return to after a day out exploring Key West. The rooms are fairly standard. The bathroom had almost no counter space and no tub, but it was very clean. We were upgraded to a water view room, which is always nice. Each little house has two separate units - one upstairs with a balcony and one downstairs. We had the downstairs, so we had access to a pleasant sandy area that overlooked a canal. There are no jacuzzis, but I really liked the pools because they were kept very warm. I could walk right in without flinching. Aside from the pools, there are no amenities, but the grounds are lovely and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: tochance
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Parrot Key Hotel & Resort and leading up to my trip I was so excited from reading reviews from everyone. Once I arrived I was not disappointed one bit. The resort is beautiful. We arrived a little bit early so we decided to try to check in and Rutanya helped us and actually we were able to upgrade to a two bedroom suite which was amazing. She went over everything with us as far as restuarants, boat tours, snorkeling, fishing and any other thing we would need. I was so happy that someone would take the extra time to help out and make our trip even more enjoyable. Everyday we saw her she would check in with us and make sure everything was going great or ask if we needed anything. Parrot Key definitely goes the extra step to make sure their guests are happy! The hotel is not right on the main street but it's not far at all from the action. I wouldn't even say it was a 10 minute cab ride. We actually rented scooters and road them everywhere. The company actually brought the scooters right to the hotel so we didn't have to do anything but leave our room and get on and ride. We also spent some time at the pool and the cafe at the pool which makes awesome drinks and the food was really good as well. I can't wait to go back and I will definitely be staying at the Parrot Key because they made me feel so comfortable almost as if I was wasn't a guest but family! Thank you again Rutanya for making this trip even more enjoyable than it already was!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very comfortable, some tips for you”
Reviews.Author: icecoldnorth
Reviews.Content: From the cold north of Canada, we stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel Resort from Jan 21 - 28th in 63B, a second story walk up facing the parking lot from the living room, the pool from the bedroom. Both had balconies. We didn't use the parking lot balcony. Never having been to the Keys before, we had some apprehension, both on lodging and the actual island. No problems here. Since we had limited time we flew in from Buffalo, a short commute from our home in the Niagara Falls area. I booked online on Delta.com and also booked the rental car which I was able to upgrade to a Camry on my corporate discount. I didn't see a lot of notes on costs n these reviews. The car rental (8000 miles on it when I picked it up) was only $30.00 a day. I promised you some tips: Hertz offered me the full tank of gas offer at the pick up desk. I didn't think I'd use that much. (even after a trip up to Marathon and back and driving around town every day, I only used up about 1/2 a tank, a $30.00 savings.) I was concerned about limited parking noted int he hotel description. When we arrived at about 11;30 pm Sat night, thanks to a late arrival from Delta, we drove around and couldn't find a spot to park. The security guard spotted us, ascertained I was an incoming guest. He advised the front desk was closed but he had my room key in his pocket and said I could report to the front desk in the morning. He further advised we could park in the Walgreens parking lot which is right beside the resort, just not in the front row in front of the store or I'd be towed. Good point. Very friendly. He pointed out the 'crazy' electric golf type cart cars that people rented and plugged in with wires going over the sidewalks which could easily trip you up. Walgreens is open 24 hours. Our suite had a good sized bedroom, separate small shower and separate tub, with a short hallway leading into a living/dinig area. Two TVS, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. For some reason the living room had the digital cable, the bedroom had regular cable. There was a side buffet with toaster, coffee maker, supplies and utelsils, but no sink. The couch and char were fabric and could have used a steam bath. The room was $285 average per night. Maybe it was more on Saturdays. The back balcony was very nice, room for two or three chairs and overlooking the main pool which was obscured by plenty of vegetation. To the right and left of us was many many twin balconies, so if it was party time, you would be in trouble. We didn't see any live residents beside us while we were there. There was another room below us. The Tiki Bar was nice and open until 7:00 for meals. We had a real nice lunch there at fairly good prices and a few drinks. People were in or around the pool all day, but it was quiet. There are either 4 or 5 pools at the resort with plenty of vegetation hiding you from all the room windows. Didn't use the pool but sat at the tables a few times. Apparently there is a gym there too, but we didn't use it either. A very quiet resort, Duval Street was about 10 minutes away by car. Some more tips: When you are leaving the resort there is a stop sign for you and the Walgreens parking lot on the left. Those dudes do not understand the concept of the stop sign. Look out on the left. At the lights, at the entrance to the resort, there is heavy traffic, both on the road and on the sidewalks,. When you are looking left to turn right, a bike will be zooming down the sideway in front of you. Watch out there too. Once you get on the main roads the drivers are peddle to the medal and the bike drivers are crazy too, they'll veer in front of you. We saw an obviously impaired young lady go down hard on a scooter, but she got up pretty fast and her large size seemed to cushion. That was by Duvall St, and you have probably heard about that one already. Now, waterfront: Yes the resort is on waterfront, our room was on parking lot, but it was still quiet. However this resort is not beach front. Although there is a man made beach sand area in the water front units and and canal front units. Just don't expect to fight thru the mangrove swamp to get to the shallow water. Thats not going to happen. There is a small wharf going out to the water, but no steps leading down, so its just for viewing. Not knowing the area, when we flew in and took the rental out, we took a right hand turn from the airport and passed a big public beach in the black of night which we didn't see. At the end of the trip we happened to take the same drive and spotted that beach. Ironically there are not a lot of beaches on Key West. Who knew? Higgs Beach was a little rough including a fully dressed homeless type guy in the 80 degree heat, sleeping on the sand. Since Smathers Beach by the airport is directly across from from expensive hotels, I 'm thinking that one must have a nicer clientel The staffer were quite friendly. The room cleaning was pretty quick, hopefuly a little more intense before the new renters came in. During one stay on the balcony, the maid was in and out in about 10 minutes. If you were party animals, you might want to stay closer to Duval St. That way you could be in stumbling distance of everything. We might consider the Parrot Key again, if we came down again.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask if your unit has a full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: eadyl
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute trip to Key West with my parents for the first week in January 2012. As you can imagine, it was not easy finding an available property at the last minute, but I had waited because my elderly father had been ill from leukemia / chemotherapy treatements and not able to travel. However, he had gone into remission, was feeling better and had his doctor's blessing to travel. He wanted to go to Key West. So I looked and looked online at the available properties and finally decided on this one. I also called ahead and explained I was travelling with elderly parents and needed a 2 bedroom suite with no stairs. Cons: They put us in a 2 bedroom "townhouse" that had a "lift" that would take my parents from the ground floor to their bedroom on the 2nd floor. The unit was on the 2nd floor, so we entered the unit doorway and walked up a flight to our living room. My parent's bedroom was on the 2nd floor. Our bedroom was on the 3rd floor. I was very disappointed to find out our unit only had a small refrigerator / microwave and coffee machine like you would find in motel room. There was no "kitchen" -- no sink, no oven. I asked to be moved to a ground unit with a full kitchen, but was told the ground units only had 1 bedroom, so we would have to get 2 units with no credit for the unit we had paid for. There was a "beach" area, but no access to the water. The front desk was not very knowledgeable about area attractions/ restaurants -- they told me the Sarabeth's in Key West was not affiliated with the Sarabeth's in New York -- it was. They didn't know anything about the sunset cruises on the sailboats either, but gave me a number to call. Pros: The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The "townhouse" was nicely decorated and clean. I did like the balcony views over the pools and gardens. The breakfast in the outdoor cafe, although of limited variety, was adequate and reasonably priced. The location was convenient to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed Parrot Key.”
Reviews.Author: Valynda M
Reviews.Content: We loved the atmosphere at Parrot Key. The rooms were very nice and the bed very comfortable. The only thing I would have changed I wish it would have been closer to downtown KeyWest (Duvall St).

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Marc A
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at different hotels and B&B's in Key West. This was the best overall as far as quality/cost. Met all our expaectations.

Reviews.Title: “Little Oasis 2 miles from the Action”
Reviews.Author: EmilyGeorge75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West for the first time, and chose the Parrot Key Inn. I didn't realize that the resort was a few miles from Duval, but we later appreciated this fact. It is VERY easy to get cabs back and forth to and from Parrot Key. The rooms are nice, and the arty touches around the grounds are great! The four pools are intimate and never crowded. Mindi and Shelley at the Blue Cafe have been fantastic! They offer suggestions on what to do and where to go. The only bummer is that the Blue Cafe closes at 7pm, so no night cap once you get back from your day in town. We would recommend the Parrot Key for folks who want to party a bit, but who want to chill out and get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “We will always remember Parrot Key!”
Reviews.Author: John1633
Reviews.Content: When calling to make reservations, Donna listened to my story, how my daughter and her boyfriend would soon be deploying overseas and I wanted to make their stay the nicest I could. Later, I informed her that my daughter's boyfriend intended to propose to her there, as he had just asked for our blessing. Donna, Kristen, Maxine all were so professional and so kind and bent over backwards to make everything about our stay a treasured family event and memory and so it was. When they come back from deployment, we want to reunite with everyone there. Donna told me that her boss had such a big heart and loves to do special things. Not to mention, the property is a balm to the soul and a relaxing jewel amid the business of Key West. The pier was the sight of the proposal, a most amazing backdrop for the occasion. What I left with was...I was so glad he asked her in a place where truly the folks have a heart of gold and we love them!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rich Z
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West before, my wife & friend, Jessica C (see earlier review) had spent alot of time researching places to stay. But despite all the research & planning, you never know what you're getting until you get there. When we arrived after a long day of traveling, we were amazed at how beautiful this place was. From the moment we pulled into the entrance, we knew we had a winner! We were greeted by a circular drive in front of the main office with a center island of 4 palm trees illumunated with rope lighting & lush, tropical landscaping with various plants & palm trees. Finding your way around the complex takes a little getting used to as the layout for the various buildings goes off in different directions & with the extensive landscaping foliage, things are very secluded. As with Jessica C., we also had a ground level Garden Guestroom with back porch & sandy "beach" area outside the back doors of the room. A beautiful place to sit early morning for coffee or late night for a drink. The rooms were spacious, clean, & modern. What we realy enjoyed is how quiet & peaceful the complex was at night. Just what is needed after spending alot of time down town on Duvall St. The complex is located on the outskirts of town, about 10 to 15 minutes from Mallory Square/Waterfront area. There is a Walgreens next door and the complex is in close proximity to the Key West business district and fast food places. There are, I believe, 2 smaller swimming pools and a main pool/lounge area with a bar that serves drinks + limited breakfast & lunch food. The only complaint I have is the pool bar closes at 7 PM. Should be open later, until 10 PM when pool closes. All told, we were extremely pleased with this resort and would highly recommend it. We, along with Jessica C. & husband, plan on returning here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: BobSorted
Reviews.Content: Brilliant. Excellent service. Hotel is actually better than the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “decent place, overrated as a resort, watch your valuables”
Reviews.Author: handlewithcare3
Reviews.Content: My wife and i live 5 hrs. from Key West. We decided to take a couple days off work and head to the Keys. We called ahead for a 2 night stay sight unseen. We were surprised of the pleasant surroundings and landscaping. When we checked in we were told of an additional $25. resort fee they didn't tell us about when we called for prices. We could have stayed other places now for less $$. Staff seemed pleasant, room seemed clean so we decided to stay. We pretty much enjoyed the stay. THE BAD NEWS. When we left we discovered my ipod and head phones were missing from my tote bag. We notified the manager and he claimed people make these claims all the time but seem to find them when they return home. That may be true, however, i know exactly where i put it and never took it out of the bag. Maybe it fell out in the trunk they said. To make a long story shorter it was taken when we went to breakfast on the outside patio. I know it was stolen because i had a tee shirt stuffed in with it. The ipod could have possibly fell out if you tipped the bag upside down and shook it but there is no way the ear phones could have fallen out past the tee shirt. Management could't have cared less. So i recommend locking any valuables in your car even though it's way the heck over in the Walgrens parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “I love Parrot Key!”
Reviews.Author: Callie M
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in key west. The landscaping is beautiful and makes you feel very secluded from the hustle and bustle of Key West. The townhouse-like rooms/suites and white picket fences around the property were absolutely adorable, and the suite we stayed in was so nice, clean and spacious! My friends and I really enjoyed hanging out by the pool, they have a fabulous menu for breakfast and lunch--much better than what you might expect for "pool food!!" Mitzi helped us at the pool bar and could not have been nicer, and she makes great Keylime Coladas! I cannot wait to go back to Key West and stay at Parrot Key, I would highly recommend if you are planning a trip there!

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back next year!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is absolutely gorgeous! The pools are secluded and the best I've ever seen. The attention to detail and landscaping is outstanding. The rooms are large, comfortable, very clean and the decor is adorable. Beds and pillows - the best! (And I have a bad back and neck) We had a ground floor room with a front porch, back patio, sand, and lounge chairs. We definitely prefer that to the 2nd floor where you only have a front porch and a balcony. We loved that this resort was a short drive from downtown, so when you are tired from a long day/night of activity on Duvall Street, you can relax in a quiet, secluded, beautiful place away from the crowds. The Tiki Bar served a nice simple delicious breakfast every morning. And at night, their frozen cocktails were the best we tasted on the island. I cannot say enough about how great our experience was. I guess the proof is in the fact that were are coming back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Overijsenaar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is build around its 4 pools and has also houses overlooking the water. The room, we have had, was large with its own deck with 2 bearchairs. At the evening we could sitdown for the sunset. We have rented a bike to go downtown, as this was only 15 minutes away. Advantage in Key West no parking problems and no parking fees. The resort itself has not enough parking spots for bikes or cars.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Gorgeous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Claire C
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort was excellent. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Maxine really went out of her way to make sure my stay was enjoyable.The resort is very well kept and beautiful. Enjoyed all of the pools and pool bar very much! Also enjoyed the beach and the great water view from my room! Can't wait until my next trip to the Parrot Key!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: hrs5704
Reviews.Content: I had the most incredible weekend at Parrot Key. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, and the amenities were top notch. Each of the 4 pools were surrounded by lush foliage which created a very secluded, private feel despite being set right in the middle of the Key West action. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Beds were cozy and bathrooms were very nice. The staff at the front desk was so friendly and knowledgable. The atmosphere is so charming with white picket fences lining each row of beautiful rooms. I had a fantastic experience at this resort and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “rating of our stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: dick c
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel for a father/daughter trip for 3 nights and had a great experience and a wonderful time. Ours rooms were very nice and spotless and the staff were there to our every need. From getting us cabs and renting us bicycles to great recommendations for dinner. It was a beautiful place with all the greenery and four pools and a great bar and place to eat lunch at the pool. If and when i go back to Key West this is the place I will stay. I have been to Key West several times before and nothing compared to this place. I would highly reccomend to anyone to stay at this luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Leegga
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful. The desk staff were nice. We thought the description of rooms was a little vague. It was interesting that there was a microwave and little refrigerator, but no sink. Not well equipped. BUT the biggest complaint was cockroaches. One was found in the bathroom. gross. complained about it and they said they would send a maintenance person to spray. the desk commented that this was a tropical place and we should not be surprised by Palmoto bugs. Did they think calling them a different name would change our reaction. Really?? Too expensive a hotel to have to deal with a lack of pest control.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: luvfloridakeys
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived until checkout, we were treated excellently by all of the staff-the grounds and landscaping are just beautiful, as well as the access to four different pools. I am almost reluctant to post it for fear we wont get a room next year! we are ending our trip in Miami Beach. This large hotel has nothing on the parrot key resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jean B
Reviews.Content: The front desk help was the highlight of our stay. They were very helpful in getting us cabs, helping to plan activities, and scheduling an in room massage. The cleaning staff left a little to be desired. Our towels were dirty, and for the most part they were seen sitting in the walkways snacking and using their cell phones. We were woken in the early morning by people going down the stairs in the unit above and closing the shared door to our cottage caused a loud bang to our inside door. Would suggest the upper unit if you can climb stairs. The cook at the cafe was friendly but others were not. The cafe breakfast of belgium waffles were actually toaster waffles. The other food such as eggs and bacon were precooked and slapped between 2 pieces of bread and thrown in a pannini maker. Should of invested in a waffle maker and a fresh cooked breakfast would of been more appropriate for a hotel at this price. Just saying. This is an ok hotel but it tries to pass it's self off as a luxury oceanfront hotel. No oceanfront to walk here. Being next to Walgreens was a perk if you needed something but it's location for a "quote oceanfront hotel" if you can see past the shrubs, was a bit odd. Would probably not stay here again.
