Upon checkout a $25 per day resort fee was added making it a very expensive stay. For that price you can stay anywhere in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in an oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: we've just returned back to LA from our stay at the parrot key hotel and resort and are already nostalgic of our stay. each day after a romp around key west or over to the dry tortugas, we were delighted to return back to our beautiful waterfront room cloaked in palms and banana trees. our happiness with our experience of the hotel as well as with the city of key west was largely due to the AMAZING concierge, priscilla, we encountered upon checking in on our first night. she made sure we were generously accommodated and rich with dining ideas, day trips and local insider tips ;) her suggestion of the bike rentals was brilliant (LA is unfortunately not the most bike-friendly city, so any opportunity to enjoy a relaxing trip through the city by beach cruiser is welcome). all we had to do was call down to her the next day, and she had the bike rental facility deliver them downstairs. before our departure, we dropped the keys back at the front desk and she made sure they were appropriately returned. too easy! we loved her recommendations of the floating buoy for dinner one of our nights (lobster mac and cheese wow) and louie's backyard for lunch another day and think we might have eaten the highest quantity of exquisite food per day that we have in a long time thanks to priscilla's suggestions. i used to spend a lot of time in the keys as a kid, but never felt that impressed with my experience in the past with the throngs of tourists, the ominous cruise ships lining the harbours and endless stalls of pastel tchotchkes. however this time, between the regional architecture of the facilities, the feeling of having your own little house to retreat into each night, the stunning balconies, the quiet and seclusion of FOUR beautifully landscaped pool areas, the above-mentioned EXCEPTIONAL service, and the pace with which we managed to approach the keys this time, it might have been one of the best trips we've had in a long time...and we travel ALL the time. in response to some criticisms i've noticed in other reviews: i found the feral chickens around the city hysterical and didn't find them to be disturbing at all in our time in the hotel nor wandering around the historic district...maybe only a problem if you have a bird phobia? the proximity of the walgreens is a bit disconcerting upon first arrival, but is invisible once ensconced in the hotel and actually proved to be a godsend for stocking up on cheap sunscreens, bottled waters, hats, etc for our day trips. they're also open 24 hours, so it's easy to hop across for a bottle of iced tea and some chocolates for late nights on the balconies (room service closes early). while we had originally thought that the hotel was located on the beach as well, the hotel IS waterfront...and all of the rooms overlooking the water are beautiful with mangrove trees and egrets and hibiscus trees surrounding the water: a lot more characteristic of the views one gets in this part of the country than sprawling expanses of white sand. if you're looking for that, i'd suggest south beach. thank you, priscilla and the entire parrot key staff for a wonderful visit...we'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PurpleEggy
Reviews.Content: We were here from 1/22 - 1/28. Our room was upgraded to an ocean view, and our rate was very good at 159/night Sun-Thurs and I think it was 209/night on Fri and Sat. The room was clean, comfortable and decorated very nicely. The concierge could not be helpful enough. Take the bus from the front of the hotel to Old Town for $2--way cheaper than a cab or the trolleys!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort, Gay Friendly, Family Friendly, Just Friendly All Around!”
Reviews.Author: Nick G
Reviews.Content: 3 of us decided to celebrate my birthday in Key West and the hotel was just amazing to work with! Upon my arrival a bottle of champagne was brought to the room for us as a welcome jesture. Reservations were made for us for jet sking and then we had massages in our private cabanas that the hotel reserved for us. Our massages were amazing and priced fairly. It was amazing, and I have already contacted the hotel for future reservations! The staff was amazing, the rooms were amazing, the location was perfect. Smoke free property made it even better! Everyone was super friendly, made it feel like home

Reviews.Title: “Beachy Clean...But...”
Reviews.Author: KLOSETMONKEY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Parrot Key for some much needed R&R. The Hotel is Lushly Landscaped (beautiful), advertised as a Resort with Several Pools, Fitness Center and Restaurant/Lounge. Set up more similar to a Small Community with Townhouses & White Picket Fences, you do get the feeling of seclusion at night, despite being adjacent to a Walgreen's (this hotel shares the parking lot) and directly off a very busy road. Located @ 2 miles from Duval, we actually found the walk do-able during the day. Our hotel room was beachy in decor and spacious, though sparsely decorated with a no frills feel. The bathroom was tiny (shower only/single vanity). The bed was comfortable; however, the room temperature is regulated by the hotel and we found the room rather stuffy and too warm at night. Leaving the window open was not an option as there are many cats and roosters on the island. (i.e. 3am...cock-a-doodle-doo...meow...etc...) The restaurant is an outdoor cafe serving breakfast and lunch during certain hours only, closing at 7pm. The Fitness Center was a joke...a closet with 3 treadmills, 1 eliptical trainer and 1 rack of dumbbells - hardly what you'd expect at a resort. Although we enjoyed our stay and visit to Key West, we would not stay at this average hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, breezy vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lauren S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort for a much needed vacation from the cold winter of New York City. I found the staff to be wonderful, one of the managers, Kristen Auerbach made sure my friends and I received everything we needed and answered all of our questions. They were especially helpful with recommendations on what to do on the island, where to eat and even went as far as making sure i received discounts on booked boat trips. My room was clean, well decorated and very comfortable. I would highly recommend Parrot Key Hotel and Resort to anyone who is looking for a beautiful hotel, nice friendly staff and a wonderful time. I am already planning my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: taewas
Reviews.Content: There is nothing here that could qualify this place as a resort or justify the $25/night resort fee but overall this place was nice. The rooms are secluded and the busy traffic on the street is quieted by the well landscaped grounds. Parrot Key is located a little too far from Duvall Street and many of the islands activities, but if you prefer to stay away from the hustle and bustle, this place is a good bet. The hotel is located by the water but beach access is nill- the "beach" is actually sand seperated from the water by hedges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay when visiting Key West”
Reviews.Author: Shipley_12
Reviews.Content: We want to express how well we were treated. Priscilla & Rutanye were very helpful in our stay. We would recommend this Hotel and Resort for anyone visiting Key West. Thanks for a job well done. The Shipley's, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Key West”
Reviews.Author: cdnliving
Reviews.Content: Better late than never as they say...I just had to write this review, as I have felt guilty for not doing so up to now... We had an absolute wonderful stay at the Parrot Key. We are a family of four (2 adults ,2 teens), from Canada, this being our first trip to the Keys. We were absolutely delighted with our accomodations, and wouldn't change a thing. We had a three bedroom "waterfront" room, which was exactly as described and equally as beautiful as the pictures on the Parrot Key Website. I did a fair amount of research prior to our booking to ensure we had accomodations that reflected everything I envisioned Key West to be, and this was beyond what I had expected. Upon arriving to our room, my children exclaimed "mom we could live here' . I had to laugh as, this was one third the size of our home, and yet the space was beautiful and functional, with lovely views to what is not the ocean but a lovely sandy walkout, fully enclosed with a waterway beyond. Albeit, it is not the OCEAN, so if you want to go swimming in the ocean from your accomodations, I don't believe this is the property for you. Rather, this is a property with beautifully appointed rooms and accomodations in pristine form, great space, well designed and decorated, with a beautiful tropical oasis at your doorstep, with the water beyond the palms. The suite itself was impeccable - beautiful granite kitchen stocked with cooking necessities and dinnerware - perfect for family dinners which we so enjoyed, given the neighbouring grocery store!!. Our unit had a spacious eating area and living area with walkout to deck perched along a sandy outcropping overlooking the palms and water..It was exactly as pictured on the website. The pool was area was fabulous - pristine and beautiful, lovely loungers, and a nice little cafe/bar to get short order food. Absolutely lovely. The only negative of this property for some folks might be the distance from the Old Town. We took cabs in to town, which were minimally priced by our standards, and it was so not an issue given our beautiful accomodations. However, I can understand if one wants to be close to the "party scene" of Old town, this may not be for them, as they would have to cab back at night....not sure how the service is in the evenings as we did not have the need. All that said, the website photos for us proved completely accurate, and we couldn't have enjoyed our lodging any more than we did, particularly being a family of four. Absolutely beautiful!! Thankyou Parrot Key, for memories that will last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FUN GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: freddy b
Reviews.Content: went back to the hotel for the second time, and the service was great.... front desk was very helpful and the view as fantastic will go back in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tara R
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West in December of 2011 and stayed at The Parrot Key Resort from check in to check out we were given first class treatment, beautiful property and the Canal side was excellant.. Cudos to the front desk (Rutanya if im remembering correct) gave wonderful customer service and advice on where and how to really enjoy the island.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa472
Reviews.Content: We planned a couple of nights at Key West after hearing so much about the area. This hotel offered a good deal and when we arrived we were very impressed with the location, efficient staff, and fabulous suite which we had. It was very clean, comfortable and just right for our stay. We liked it so much, we stayed for two extra nights and plan to go back again on our next trip to Florida. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key was a great home base for our Key West Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Donna L
Reviews.Content: Our total experience at Parrot Key in early January 2012 was terrific. The location was convenient to downtown but far enough away to be peaceful. The grounds were lush and beautiful and the pools were warm and refreshing. The entire resort is extremely well well maintained. The staff was very professional, friendly and helpful. We would not hesitate to recommend Parrott Key to anyone planning to visit Key West. We hope that we can visit again and will definitely choose Parrott Key when we do. The staff was very helpful in referring us to a shuttle service, Florida Keys Express Shuttle, to take us back to Miami. Our experience with them too was excellent and again, we would not hesitate to recommend their services. Many thanks to the staff of Parrot Key Resort and Florida Keys Express Shuttle for helping making our Key West experience amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely gorgeous! The staff are more than accommodating and so friendly (especially Maxine and Oriana at the front desk and Mindi at the pool side bar). It is very evident that every staff member at Parrot Key is absolutely determined to ensure the happiness of every guest. My friends and I had vacationed in Key West just this week, and ended up booking the Parrot Key Resort because we found an ad for it online. None of us had ever been to Key West before, so we really were kind of going in somewhat blind. Parrot Key was everything and more we could have hoped for. They have the option of booking beach cabana massages, which were amazing! They also have a contract with a water sports company that you can rent jet skis right on the property (VERY reasonable rates at that). There really was only one downside to staying here, and that would be the distance. If you have ever been to Key West (or know anyone who has) you probably know that Duval Street is really where 85% of the action is. Unfortunately, Parrot Key is about 2 miles from Duval. If you're feeling somewhat athletic and healthy, by all means, walk to Duval Street. We did just about every day, however, after walking up and down the main stretch all day, we definitely needed a cab ride back. However, the distance may be exactly what some people are looking for, a nice place somewhat off the beaten path. I would absolutely stay here again and would certainly recommend Parrot Key to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Gem”
Reviews.Author: PAS112
Reviews.Content: We love this place! We returned to the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort for a second time, after enjoying our stay on a previous get-away. We traveled with our daughter, son-in-law, and our new grandson, and the 2-bedroom suite provided the perfect accommodations for our whole family--clean, modern, comfortable, with enough privacy for all of us. We enjoyed the suite's front and back balconies, the warm pools and lovely grounds. The beautiful property is like an oasis in the midst of the hustle of N. Roosevelt Blvd. Every staff person is most helpful and friendly; the concierge provided welcome assistance with dining recommendations and directions. We drove to the downtown area and managed the parking without too much effort, but biking on the island is also an easy travel option. Great place to visit, great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “this is not a resort”
Reviews.Author: Bernard K
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - well maintained - nice grounds and pools - BUT THIS IS NOT A RESORT!!! and they charge a $25/day resort fee.........ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Creaky, Roachey and Wet "Resort"”
Reviews.Author: x-well-traveled
Reviews.Content: The pictures on their website are misleading and give you the impression that this is a beach resort. It is NOT! We booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite for the long Thanksgiving Holiday. I called and I was told that we would be able to check in anytime after 1pm. we arrived at 2:30pm and were not able to check in until about 4pm. When we finally got our suite the sofa and sofa chair cushions were soaking wet. The people that just checked out obviously came in from the pool and sat on these in their very wet swimsuits. The staff said they were going to put the covers in the dryer but then I saw that the cushions were soaked through. We eventually got new cushions. My parents stayed in the Master Bedroom. When my mother opened a drawer in their room a big black cockroach ran out (YuK!). Our bed made loud creaking noises every time one of us move so we did not get much rest. I told the front desk staff all this and all I got was a, "thanks for letting us know". They charge an extra $28.13 a night resort fee for this place but I don't know what about this could be considered a resort. There are 3 swimming pools, 2 of which are very small and all are unremarkable. The location is extremely far away from any of the action in Key West and they offer NO TRANSPORTATION to anything. If you have a car you can drive, but it is extremely difficult to find parking near the main attractions. I definitely would not recommend staying at the Parrot Key Hotel in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Key West !”
Reviews.Author: Midwrstgal
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation we've had and it's all thanks to Parrot key! The resort is so pretty and has 3 pools. The staff made us feel like they truly cared and enjoyed being at parrot key as much as we did. We had a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms.it was very spacious and easy with two bathrooms for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: KRB1183
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because it seemed like a quiet, relaxing place to stay in Key West. We were greeted by very friendly staff upon arrival, given our room assignment, given a free room upgrade and our parking paddle. Parking was plentiful this time of year at the resort. The grounds were beautiful and lush. Our room was in excellent condition and very clean with beautiful balconies. The pools were nice, but we didn't use them much as we were sightseeing. The only reason I give this 4 out of 5 stars and not 5 out of 5 is because there was no direct beach-to-ocean access. Which we were aware of, and was fine with us, but it would have been an excellent place in my opinion if there was direct ocean access. Taxis are quick to get to the resort and about 13 dollars to down-town duval street. If you rent bikes are scooters that may be a handy way to get there but parking is tough down by duval. The hotel staff was very friendly in helping us with directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly charming Get-away”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: Wow- what a vacation! I travel all the time and have never reviewed a hotel before- but this time I felt the need to share this gem with everyone. If you're looking for a lovely, charming, relaxed spot to enjoy Key West- this is it. The rooms were wonderful- lots of space, great design and layout and the bed is super comfortable. With three girls sharing a room we had plenty of space in the bathroom and closets for all our stuff. My favorite feature was the white--sand beach and terrace off the back.The ideal spot for cocktails before we headed out or the all important coffee the next morning to pull things back into focus. Plus the staff was amazingly helpful and friendly. I can't say enough and can't wait to go back. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tommyjohnsmom
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. Very nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, will go back to Parrot Key as soon as possible !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emanuel M
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice!!! When we arrived we could get our rooms right away (10.30 am). The rooms were clean, organized and stylish decorated. We checked out the pool and we found 4 or 5, one better than the other. The food at the Tiki Bar was great. We have been so may times in Key West, but this was the best one, thank's to the Parrot Key and their friendly staff. But can I say......you have to go by yourself and enjoy.....!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetcmg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Parrot Key hotel during a vacation to Key West. We originally booked a King Suite, but were upgraded unexpectedly to a 2BR/2BA suite when we arrived. What an amazing room and hotel! We enjoyed the food, drinks and pools during our 3 night stay. My husband also took a jet-ski tour and had a great time. The room was immaculately clean and well decorated. The balconies were a relaxing spot, although they only overlooked the garden walkways (Still beautiful). The bathrooms were modern and full of amenities. We did not really use the 2nd bedroom because it was on the 3rd floor of the suite, but the windows in this room really added a lot of light and made it feel very homey. Some of the pools were closed, but that didn't stop us from enjoying the others. They were never crowded or loud. My only complaint about this hotel is the lack of a kitchenette in a suite this large. There was a wet bar area with a fridge, but not even a sink there to wash cups/bowls/etc. or a microwave to heat up breakfast items. This would make for a MUCH more improved experience, but obviously it did not stop us from enjoying ourselves. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking - In a great way !”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa M
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two nights and it was a very relaxing vacation. The front desk is very nice and so is the owner.We were standing outside waiting for a cab and the owner of parrot key gave some insight on the island.He was very interested in learning our experience. We had no idea he was the owner until the end of our conversation. We thought it was so great to meet the owner of the resort. He is just as nice as the staff members. Hopefully we meet him again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during slow time...”
Reviews.Author: Duane B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parrot Key the week following Thanksgiving. I was told by the staff that the resort was only 20% full, so while it was quiet, it was almost TOO quiet! Of the 4-pools, there were never more than 4-6 people at any one. I'm not complaining, it's just that it would have been nice to see some additional people around. My room was very clean and modern. The "private" beach off my porch was nice for sun bathing--late in the afternoon. The resort is not close to any nightlife, so be ready to allocate funds for taxis. The greenery/foliage was a nice plus--it made for a very intimate environment. I would stay there again, but next time, I may stay closer to the marina or to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab! Fully recommended”
Reviews.Author: evie_g23
Reviews.Content: Helpfull staff, 4 heated swimming pools (one of them open until 22:00 - which was great!) , spacios & clean rooms, great location. Could not fault it! Located next to a 24/7 supermarket (they selled virtually everything) and opposite a shopping place full of restaurants and caffes (great for breakfast). Taxi to Duval Street (town centre) took about 10min and costs apprx $12. Rooms were modern and clean. Furnished in nautical style. We loved it so much we foudn it hard to leave the apartment! (whole resort is in the style of townhouses and each of them has either 1 or 2 apartments). I would definitelly stay here again. The only negative was that the hotel did not have his own beach....but it offered free parking :) There is a fab beach down in Key West in Fort Zachary Taylor Historic Park - you can drive there, it cost $7 for 1 car and you can re-enter during the day as many times as you wish. There is also a restaurant and showering/changing facilities. There is no fee to enter the fort. When in Key West, definitelly have their famous Key Lime pie and drink coconut water!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: moxieamore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in Key West at least 2-3 times a year. This was our first time at Parrot Key. If fun is your aim don't stay here. It is not near the nightlife unless you consider Home Depot and Walgreens nightlife (they share a parking lot with the hotel and we were told if we couldn't find parking we should park in Walgreens parking lot).. It is a completely non-smoking hotel and this is made very clear whether you smoke or not by the threats of fines you were made to sign when checking in. The decor was very "bubble art" mixed with cheap painted furniture. Basically this is a time share with lots of rules and restrictions and a hotel staff that is more hall monitor than gracious host.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key Resort for 2 nights while in Key West and it was a great experience. The entire property is beautiful, clean and not to mention smelled amazing. Not sure if it was the plants or what but no matter where you were there just a nice, clean, refreshing smell. We spent a lot of time on our back porch area and some time at the pool....loved every minute. It was away from most of the popular sights so you'll need some sort of transportation unless you don't mind walking a couple miles each way. The only complaint I have is that when we came back to our room around 2:30pm housekeeping hadn't been there yet. We ended up putting the 'Do Not Disturb' sign out cause we wanted to relax before going out again. Not a big deal but it would have been nice to have had them come before we got back mid-afternoon. Overall great resort and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Diana W
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key. The grounds were beautiful and the rooms were exceptional. It was a very peaceful retreat. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. We did have to drive into town but had no trouble finding places to park. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey, too far away, and not that special”
Reviews.Author: IslandManRides
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. The property is too far away from downtown, which can be cured by a $15 cab ride. Though, when you use the cab up to 4 or 6 times a day, the price tag can add up. So, if you add an additional $60 per day for a cab, on top of the high lodging rate, and the additional resort fee, this become a pricey place to stay and not really worth it. (Cabs might be near to impossible to get during fantasy fest and New Year. Our ride home on New Year was an adventure unto itself.) Except, if you are not in Key West for the Duval St. experience. The resort has the old Key West feel to it and nicely appointed. The rooms are clean and roomy. And, the pools are small yet nice. There are no on-property services for breakfast (that we found), so you are always on your own. Next time, we will bake in the additional costs associated with staying at this resort and will most likely stay somewhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “No Flaws!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Parrot Key for a second time. My first stay was for business and this trip was for vacation. For both occasions, the overall quality of my stay was unbeatable! You couldn't ask for more as far as accommodations, location, and service. The entire staff is very friendly and helpful. I have another trip back to Key West this summer and I have already booked my rooms at the Parrot Key again, really no reason to try anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable property.”
Reviews.Author: henulj-lse
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom unit and loved the privacy with the 2 bedrooms on different levels. It does require some hauling of luggage up and down stairs, so if you would find that difficult ask for someone to carry your luggage for you at check in. The pool was very comfortable temperature for January and we had fun hanging out there. The property would do well to gear at least one pool to younger children, but have not done so yet. We had a 2 year old with us and the water at it's lowest end was 3 feet. But we went to Walgreens next door and bought a noodle that he had fun clinging to with us. The bathrooms are wonderful and the water pressure is great. It is very easy to find and parking was not a problem for us. We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “3 great nights at the Parrot Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: We were in town with a large running group and stayed 3 nights in two 3 bedroom suites. The rooms accommodated everyone just fine, including two toddlers. Each room had its own bathroom and balcony view! The back patio leads out to a sandy/ beach area where we spent the nights relaxing, watching sunset and great area for the kids to play. The living spaces were very large, so it was very comfortable with such a large group, and all the furniture and appliances were new and very clean and comfortable. There were four pools to choose from, so it was like your own personal pool right out the front door. Along with a cafe/bar at pool 1 which served great food! Shopping and grocery access were a minute away, but the whole resort seemed very isolated from all that, which was nice! The staff was extra courteous and very helpful with all that we needed - fresh towels, garbage pick-up, cleaning floors, cab rides, etc! I would definitely recommend for anyone with kids and large groups. All-in-all it was a wonderful stay, and will definitely stay there next time in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here based on the outstanding reviews in trip advisor and the Parrot Key did not disappoint. The accommodations were spacious and comfortable, the grounds immaculate, the pool warm and inviting, and the staff incredibly cheerful and welcoming. The hotel is a mile and a half from the south beaches and two miles from the Old Town; both are an easy (flat) bike ride for those wishing to avoid renting a car. In addition, many cabs have bike mounts for the late evening returns from the Duval Street nuttiness. The jet ski rentals conveniently located on site give great island tours. In short, we had a blast and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Has that Key West "feeling"!”
Reviews.Author: Drhooah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip to the keys this summer. I found this place online and it's appearance was what I wanted Key West to be for my family...adorable cottages, lush greenery, nice private pools, and rooms that were new, spacious and really stylish. I wasn't disappointed at all. Price was good and food at Cafe Blue pool side was too! The beds were very comfy. Extra nice bedding! We stayed in the 1 bedroom Garden Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to placed to stay”
Reviews.Author: shellyjoeybear
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Parrot Key and once again enjoyed every minute of our time there. It was like a home away from home. From the reservations desk to the front desk, everyone was wonderful, friendly and so helpful. Parrot Key will always be our go-to place when we visit Key West. The pools/grounds are the most beautiful I've ever seen. Be sure to request Island Safari Tours for your bicycles and water sports. Angel, the owner, is awesome. Goldman's bagels in the shopping center across the street has amazing bagels. A quick bike ride and your in Old Town. Perfect, perfect, perfect vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, quiet family friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: JHalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Parrot Key for 3 nights. Wish we could have stayed longer. The facility is a quiet and peaceful place even though it is located on the busy strip-mall-filled N. Roosevelt Blvd. There are 4 pools in the center of the resort, a pool bar/restaurant, and beach sands to enjoy behind the room buildings. We had a lower level room with direct access to the beach sands. Upper floors have balconies. Some rooms face the parking lots but the landscaping is so beautiful it really doesn't matter. We did not appreciate or understand the $25/day fee for the pools, and there is not so much as a free cup of coffee offered here, but it was a beautiful place and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in a quite different (awesome) way...”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: We can just recommend Parrot Key. It was an awesome stay over christmas. It's a sandy-beach and jungle like environment. Very clean and uptodate. Four pools connected through a "indiana jones like" path. Despite christmas it was not a crowded admosphere. Always enough beach chairs. A highlight was the breakfast each morning at the pool. What we recommend as well is to do a JetSki Tour, right behind the resort. I did it twice because it was such a great thrill of speed. Bottom line: We gonna go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Weekend of 2012”
Reviews.Author: MyChau D
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. Oriana, Rutanya, and Shenali (sp) overextended themselves and made us feel more than welcome, like we were at home. We are down for a birthday and the staff was helpful enough to recommend a bakery for a cake and set up the room fit for royalty. The atmosphere is beyond anything we expected. The property is lush and exotic. The rooms are very clean. We will definitely be back =)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: PicassoP
Reviews.Content: My wife, our daughter and I spent two nights at the Parrot Key Hotel. We booked this place based on trip advisor recommendations and since it looked nice in the hotel's website. We were not disappointed - the resort is very beautiful and clean, and it has a very relaxed atmosphere. We had the one bedroom garden suite. The room was very big and spacious - the bed was very comfortable, there were two TV's (on in the bedroom and one in the living room) - both equipped with a DVD player; there is a nice little kitchen with a coffee machine (and all the supplies for actually using it), a small refrigerator and even a microwave. The bathroom had both a bath and a shower, and every thing was very clean. Other important things are free wireless internet, 4 amazing pools (heated! this was very important for us since we stayed there in January), ample parking, very close to a Walgreen store, Domino's Pizza, and not far from a Publix grocery store. The only downfall, if you consider it as such, is the fact that the hotel is not in downtown Key West, so if you are interested in spending a lot of time around town, you will either need a car (and pay rather expensive parking fees) or take a taxi. However, if you are looking to have some R&R next to the pool, and mix that with a daily visit to the town, this hotel is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort except....”
Reviews.Author: twinkert
Reviews.Content: Our party booked two rooms in December 2011. We loved the landscaping, the three pools, and layout of the resort. The poolside breakfast was decent and convenient. The reservation agent has very informative. The front desk attendant was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately each of rooms had roaches. Our room had two roaches and the other room had one roach sighting. So apparently this resort has a problem with these insects.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tangOtangO1
Reviews.Content: For my family of 5 the rooms were perfect. We rented both A and B units in one of "villas." The kids were upstairs, my husband and I had the room downstairs. Everyone had their own bed and private space. Two kids had to share a bathroom, but no big deal they do that at home. Rooms were clean and felt new. Four small pools were well kept and heated. It's about a 10-15 minute drive to Downtown Key West. The biggest downfall of this resort is that if the parking lot is full, you have to park next door at the Walgreens and walk back. Most nights when we arrived back after eating dinner, the lot was full. If this is acceptable for you, I think you would enjoy this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort in Key West but layout has flaws”
Reviews.Author: BearTraveler69
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit. We had the unfortunate experience of our bed breaking as soon as we got on it (no jokes, please). Maintenance came right away and fixed it. The pools are nice and the water was warm despite chilly weather. The only issue is that the layout is such that each unit has a common entrance and then you either go into your first floor room or go through a door to stairs to the upstairs unit. We had the first floor and a couple with children had the second floor. From 10 to midnight they ran up and down the stairs continually. Thankfully the were gone the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas vacation with 3 generations”
Reviews.Author: pporteus
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to Parrot Key and it was as fabulous as the first two. Have already made our reservations for next year!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: nancy m
Reviews.Content: Beautiful accommodations, great pools, friendly staff. The reservation process was easy with everything arranged for our group as promised. Perfect place for a family vacation and a romantic get-away too. Sean and Kristen made sure our stay was perfect, and the staff at the pool bar, Eric and Shelly, were great. Close enough to the fun in town without the noise and congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property in a odd location”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler99
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the resort I thought OMG - it is right smack in the middle of the main road through new Key West, next to a Walgreens and Home Depot. Having said that, once you get into the property, you completely forget that. The grounds are lush and tropical and very nice music plays so you don't hear ANY of the traffic. You really do forget where you are. The place is incredibly quiet, which is what we wanted. The 4 small pools are beautiful and very clean, and very lush. Again, very quiet. The rooms are very nice. However, I think it would be a stretch to call the hotel a "resort". They really don't offer any resort type services such as a spa or water activities other than wave runners that you have to pay for. No poolside service. They have a very small menu at the poolside cafe for breakfast and lunch, however we never ate there. We took a taxi into old Key West once and it was only $11 each way, which was worth not having to search for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Tropical Resort”
Reviews.Author: Kathy P
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, close to all the Key West happenings but just far enough away to be secluded and private. Beautiful and lush landscaping, four wonderful pools and the condos had a wonderful tropical bungalow feel. The staff was extremely helpful and so pleasant. Every question and need that we had was attended to immediately in a gracious and friendly manner. We are calling our family members to consider staying here next year for our family reunion. We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: W0wieZ0wie
Reviews.Content: Pros: beautiful property, new and clean, nice pools, nice-sized rooms, coffee maker, small refrigerator, microwave, ten minute walk to trolley bus stop at Fairfield Inn, Walgreens next door which is very handy. Cons: bad location on busy street next to Home Depot in New Town, no view from patio, hotel charges an up-front charge for "incidentals" of $250 to your credit card and then will provide refund within five days of your departure if you don't use it, food in cafe not very good.

Reviews.Title: “great tropical feel”
Reviews.Author: jeremy p
Reviews.Content: What a great place to spend a vacation! The tropical landscape and secluded pool areas are very relaxing. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and courteous. We will definately stay there again when we go back to key west.

Reviews.Title: “New and nice - tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Whatisthematrix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 15th anniversary at the Parrot Key and the staff - particularly Oriana - made our stay memorable. We had a wonderful canal view room with French doors opening on to a small porch with pristine sand and beach chairs outside. From the early check-in to the welcome bottle of champagne, the staff made us feel special from the moment we arrived. The resort is away from the hustle of Duval Street, but nevertheless a short cab ride away. We loved Parrot Key!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, Olivia greeted us with a huge smile and made us feel welcome. After a speedy check-in, Booker showed us to our rooms (yes rooms) and helped us with our luggage. We were on the second floor in a beautifully appointed two-room suite. (These units can be two bedroom with the opening of the third floor.) The grounds are masterly landscaped with a lush tropical feel. The pool areas (four) are clean and inviting. With four pools, none were overly crowded. The tiki bar/cafe is staffed with more friendly faces and the food and drinks are well prepared. Upon check out after three very comfortable nights, Sean bid us farewell and I felt that we would be truly welcomed back. And Booker was there to wave us goodbye. This will be our "go to" hotel in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: jjjsfish
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Close to town without being in the middle of things. Liked the pools. Wish they would keep more of them open later.Really liked having two balconies.Very private.

Reviews.Title: “Condescending towards Asians”
Reviews.Author: GenXYZ
Reviews.Content: The management need to check on the attitude of Sean, the manager, and Alma, the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pickychick
Reviews.Content: Downright adorable boutique hotel! Took a gamble on the website pictures being an honest view of the hotel and we were not disappointed. The heavy garden planting keep you feeling secluded and unaware that a Home Depot is a couple doors down. The four pools were nice and warm. We rented bikes thru the front desk and the company that they referred us to were excellent. It was a fun way to ride around the 2x4 mile island. Very bike friendly. It was strange when I was checking in at the same time as two others. She wouldn't say my rate out loud. Slid the contract over. Obviously we all were given different rates. I keep wondering if mine was the highest. :/ Of course there were some sketchy areas of the island. Duvall street was hopping. Reminded me of Bourbon street. Live music and Hurricanes you can drink while strolling around. I was disappointed at the lack of desirable beaches. Was hoping for more white sugar sand and clear blue water. Overall we can say we checked that box. Been to the southern most point and mile 0!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Feel”
Reviews.Author: lowes2435girl
Reviews.Content: They have the rooms decorated in tropical colors and you just get a happy feeling while in them. The water temperature of the pool is sooo warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay, great rooms, friendly staff. Far enough from down town but close enough to bike , taxi or catch the bus. We will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: I found the staff was very friendly and the rooms to be the most comfortable I have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and loved our rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kara S
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed so well and taken care of over and above by Sean at Parrot Key. He was always around when we needed him and made sure our stay was perfect! We will absolutely be back! The cottage was perfect for our family and we loved the easy access to all of the pools and the beachy areas!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: Esther V
Reviews.Content: The staff will go out of their way with any request.Pools were lush and tropical. The Tiki bar has great food. The rooms were nice too. The ony improvement would be for a shuttle to old town since taxis can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: joefirm
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was excellent, room and service was great. Some FYI that I wish I knew before booking: Hotel is 2 miles from downtown, my impression was it was closer. Taxi for a family of four ran $12-$16 each way depending on what the driver feels like charging you. It would be nice if the resort offered a shuttle to downtown and back. Waterfront property, no beach access. Again, my impression was you can sit near the water or take a stroll along the beach but in reality the beachs are on the other side of town. Some of the resort's on line pictures shows sand which is deceiving and gives you the impression of it having beach access. The hotel is situated and shares an exit with the Walgreens next door which causes a dangerous trek for drivers and pedestrians alike. Otherwise, we enjoyed Key West.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: Charity D
Reviews.Content: Went to Parrot Key last week with my family. One of the best places I have ever stayed. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The staff is always smiling and friendly and helpful. There are 4 pools and a pool bar with wonderful bartenders. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable. I loved it and would go back anytime. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: berdageorge
Reviews.Content: From the reviews on is sights, as well as the photos, I had high expectations. We had a 2 bed, 2 bath suite. The lay out was nice, but we had no acces to the gardens/pool area or to the "beach". There is no water access at this resort, watersports area is owned by an outside company and quite pricey. There was no kitchen in our room, not even a sink. If you want a 2 bedroom suite, the views from the decks are obstructed with trees or you ar looking at a parking lot or your neighbors less than 5 feet away. We were in need of a 2 bed/2 bath unit, which is why I booked here, but I would not sat here again, and I would not recommend it either!

Reviews.Title: “Too pissed for words...”
Reviews.Author: TrueSingaporean
Reviews.Content: This supposedly 4* hotel has the worst customer service attitude I have encountered in my whole life. Our families were accused and threatened.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: stiebo
Reviews.Content: We just left Parrot Key Resort and were pleasantly suprised. The condos are beautiful. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. We arrived late with a wam welcome. Units are nicely furnished, clean and well kept. Beds were very comfortable. I would definately stay at Parrot Key next trip back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandi F
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of a stay at this hotel recently. From the moment we were greeted at the front desk it was 5* from there. The rooms were lovely and in true keeping of our expectations. As seasoned travellers we would highly recommend this hotel and will include it again when back in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: The room was great service was fantastic the people at the front desk were wonderful and helpful and I will be returning to the Parrot Key Hotel. Best vacation I have ever had!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: kathy m
Reviews.Content: had the best time over there will be back every year wouldint miss this experience for anything in the word

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Great place to have a great time and spend time with family or friends, there wasnt one single moment I didnt enjoy and would love to come back every year. P.S: great room service! ; )

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at this beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: UsaSharon
Reviews.Content: The resort and grounds are just beautiful! Our room was clean and comfortable. I especially appreciated how helpful and friendly all members of the staff were. I can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice away from noise, but....”
Reviews.Author: Annix_10
Reviews.Content: It is probably the best place to stay because it's far from the noise and the party of Key West, but not for more than two nights ... the staff is not very friendly, they just do their job. You have to cross your fingers to find a parking space available, otherwise you should find space in the Win Dixie. The blinds of our window was damaged, we ask them to fix it, they confirmed to us that they would, but they never fixed. We were two families, and the hotel confirmed to us that they wouldn't charge resort-fee for the two families, but when we checked out we were charged the resort fee per family. We argue that it was the same reservation by the group, but we didn't get any help. The pool is nice. The rooms are good. There are best options upstairs (A) because they are larger. The bathrooms are beautiful, but again, not for more than two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Celebration thanks to Rutanya !”
Reviews.Author: Jmcandrews
Reviews.Content: We came down I celebrate my 60th birthday and I couldn't have asked for a better time ! The front desk is absolulty splendid. We noticed employees walking around the property everyday saying hello. Rutanya is very unique and truly made my birthday !

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: RJBAQ
Reviews.Content: I relied on trip advisor reviews and truly agree with all the positive reviews about this hotel, traveled with my son and we both loved it..From the moment of check in until departure, everything was a breeze. I will come backâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenTunis
Reviews.Content: I take one vacation a year, and the last 3 years I have found myself at Parrot Key Hotel. The staff is very friendly, grounds are gorgeous and the private beach area is incredible. I would highly recommend Parrot Key Hotel to anyone. I know where Im going on vacation in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “The Epitome of Serenity”
Reviews.Author: bradleymichael
Reviews.Content: The perfect starting point for an island vacation. This hotel proved to be an invaluable gateway to the many activities Key West offers. I always recommend Key West as a vacation destination, yet have never had my "go-to" hotel. Now I do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, well kept grounds, clean/comfy rooms and very helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gia P
Reviews.Content: Great staff, wonderful grounds, and the pools are amazing! Would def go back! Trying to plan another trip for January!!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: redca4
Reviews.Content: Once again this resort has made me feel welcome. The front desk helps with just about anything and the rooms are luxurious. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn G
Reviews.Content: If you want an incredible Key West experience...stay at the Parrot Key Resort. The furniture and color schemes set you in a happy "islandy" mood. I loved the kitchen and granite counter tops. The salt water pools are relaxing and awesome. The grounds are lush and the whole complex looks like a movie set. Cleanliness abounds everywhere. The staff is friendly and most accommodating. The poolside restaurant was great for us to grab a bite to eat. Now what more could you want for a perfect getaway??? We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Parrot Key Hotel and Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Deb R
Reviews.Content: December 2011 - What a gorgeous property. We were given a watefront, 2nd floor 1 bedroom townhouse, per our reservation. The reservationists and the front desk people were kind and knowledgable. The furnishings were very "Key West" - lovely and fun. We felt we were in a cozy inn vs. a cold hotel - but with as many privileges and perks. It was quiet and peaceful. The pools were private and surrounded by lush landscaping. The artwork throughout the resort was quite interesting and an added touch. The landscaping is top notch, and it will make you feel as if you are on your own private island. We spent a lot of time in Old Town Key West, and were so happy to return to the Parrot Resort - no more than 2 miles away. It is a welcome oasis after the hustle and bustle of town. After walking by some of the hotels in town, we were absolutely positive there was no better place to stay in Key West. You will not be disappointed. We want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, clean rooms and beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: Wetwille
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a last minute trip. Got a great price and very happy with the rooms. Service was great and propert was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Parrott Key”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra5
Reviews.Content: December 2011 - We were very pleased with our 1 night stay at the newly renovated Parrott Key Hotel. There were 3 of us travelling together and enjoyed a lovely 2 storey - 2 bedroom unit. Beautifully landscaped and good little poolside cafe with very reasonable prices. Only difficuty would be that you definately need a car to get to the tourist section of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property - incredible staff - incredible value”
Reviews.Author: ChrisClausing
Reviews.Content: Having been a visitor to Key West for over 12 years, I have stayed in over 20-25 different hotels and resorts on the island and I can say beyond a shadow of a doubt Parrot Key is the BEST! The staff is amazing - the property is incredible - the rooms are unbelievable. The Parrot Key staff really pays attention to the small details - the landscaping is always impecable, the grounds are kept pristine, the service is always friendly and prompt. So long as you don't mind a quick cab ride to Duval, I highly recommend you stay at Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: We loved the Parrot Key Resort! The architecture and interior decor were charming, very well designed, and clean. The landscaping, layout of buildings, and materials used were authentic and made us feel like we were in a Key West neighborhood around Duval St. We enjoyed the lushly landscaped grounds, heated pools, and cafe area. We loved the porches and views of the water from our unit. The living room area was comfy, and it was convenient to have a mini fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee pot. We wish there was a small sink in the bar area or more units with a kitchen. It was great for our family to have two full bathrooms and bedrooms. The staff was friendly and helpful, allowed us a late check-out, and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Too many steps to walk up to get to third floor of cottage”
Reviews.Author: Ardentgal
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is very nice, very new. Was not told that I would have to walk up one flight of many steps to get to second floor and yet another flight of many steps to get to third floor of cottage facing pool area. Found it very expensive for what we had. Also, body of water, i.e., Gulf of Mexico, not in sight. Two pool areas on property.

Reviews.Title: “Topical Plantation”
Reviews.Author: Sheila E
Reviews.Content: We loved the decor and amenities in our room. We were able to use our computer at no additional cost. The pool area closest to our room was so beautiful with a bar and open air restaurant in the same area with comfy furnishings. We had a porch which we really enjoyed in the morning with our coffee and in the late afternoon with a glass of wine. Everywhere you looked there was lush foliage. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Remote to be in city”
Reviews.Author: dwilkin999
Reviews.Content: Nice townhouse and quiet. We had canal/bay view and loved that shopping was close by and we were out of the Duval traffic. Nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Found five roaches on the second night in the bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: SandraKing
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the room we got when we first saw it. The receptionist had upgraded us to a room more expensive than what we had paid for (this room had two rooms and two balconies). On the second night, both my husband and I found roaches on both bathrooms (the one upstairs and downstairs). One of the roaches was huge! Anyway, we immediately called the front desk and they were closed (they are not open 24 hours). So we had to spend one more night there. I couldn't get out of my head that we could transport some roaches or roach eggs back to our house in our bags. How could we pay over $200 a night and be in this predicament? Unreal! The next morning we contacted the front desk receptionist who proceeded to tell me that this has never happened before. Really??? Who is she trying to fool. When I first mentioned it to her I did not hear a hint of surprise in her voice and now she is telling me this is the first she ever heard of it. She continues to convince me that I should not worry about transporting them back home (her tone was not sympathetic at all). The hotel manager stopped by to apologize and said that some times guests leave the balcony doors open and stuff tends to come in the rooms because the place has a lot of trees around the property (some plants even hang over the balconies). He was very accomodating...he offered to give us a discount and move us to another room. Of course, I couldn't imagine staying there one more day even if they paid me to do it. After all, I came to Key West for peace of mind. We looked around and found a fabulous Marriot beachside hotel. We paid $300 a night and got a waterfront room. Another good news is that hotels.com (we had booked the Parrot Key room through them) gave us $194 back for our inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: Coughton54
Reviews.Content: Just completed two night stay during a fishing trip. We did not use any of the resorts facilities, but overall rooms were good, fairly clean and no significant issues

Reviews.Title: “Looks better on-line”
Reviews.Author: Melody S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while we visited the Florida Keys. November 15th and 16th. They have 4 pools but don't tell you all the pools except one close at sunset! The so called restaurant is actually a poolside snack bar and it closes at 7:00 PM. We couldn't even get a drink at 8:00 pm which is a little ridiculous when you are on vacation. It is close to Mallory Square but NOT I repeat NOT within walking distance. We were told at the front desk that we could walk down there to see the sunset and it was only about 1 mile. So we took off and when we walked about a mile we took out our gps (i-phone) it said another 2.3 miles! We had to turn around and go back to the hotel and get the car but of course by then we missed the sunset. Our room was a double queen and very clean. It fit the 4 of us comfortably. However we went to sit on our porch and there were no chairs. We called the front desk and were told "oh just take them off someone else's porch"!! Really? You just don't do that! The maid service is actually what they refer to as "tidy" service. They empty the trash and replace towels. I've never seen that before. If you stay and extended amount of time then you get the full service. As for the noise it wasn't too bad but I did hear the people next to us and the one's above us taking showers and talking and shutting their doors. As for the parking....well that is interesting too. I guess parking is a prime commodity in the keys (understandably). This resort has an arrangement with Walgreens next door for overflow parking. We got a parking spot every time we came back but it was really full. I don't know what happens in the busy season? We asked if there was coffee in the lobby but they said no. They forgot to mention there is a small coffee pot (4 cups) in the room. That would have been nice to know because we brought a coffee pot with us. There is not a mini-fridge either which would be nice for drinks and leftovers from the restaurants. There is a blow dryer in the bathroom and an iron and ironing board. The vanity in the bathroom doesn't have any counter so space is limited. The beds were clean and very comfortable. There are flat screen tvs in the room. The landscaping around the hotel is awesome. It's thick and luscious. If it wasn't for all the foliage you would be able to see everyone elseâ€™s rooms which wouldn't be good. There are two strips of sand and chairs to sit on but don't expect to see the water unless you are on the second story. Even though this hotel is on the main road it does feel private because of all the tropical trees and plants. This is a good place to stay if what you really want to do is see Key West. But if you just want to hang around the hotel, it doesn't have a lot to offer. It's a little over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: burkehouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and my mother. We had a 2 room suite which was nice so that my mom could have her own room. The rooms were immaculate, tastefully decorated, and comfortable. Inside our rooms we never heard anyone else. The pools looked nice, we didn't get a chance to try them out. The one disappointment was that the poolside bar closed early, we were looking forward to an after-dinner drink but had to go across the street to the liquor store. Parrot Key is easy to get to and once there it is a short cab ride down to Duval St. For 3 people it cost us about $12 one way. It is too far to walk, but it looked like there might be a bus that you could take. You would pay more than that for secure parking downtown, so the cab is worth it. There were a few downsides to the place. First when they cleaned our room they left all the trash and wet towels sitting on our entry stairs. They sat there all day and were still there the next day when we checked out. I am sure if I had called housekeeping they would have picked them up, but I was testing to see if they were ever removed. Next, to walk to the "sunset pier" you have to walk through the back "beach". While we were walking back there we had to walk past people who had rooms that opened up to that area. They all acted like we were intruding on their space. I will stay here again when I go back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: Ntasmoha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West and spent three nights. The location was good and a short distance by car to the night life. The rooms were clean and nicely setup, but a little noise with housekeeping starting to clean before 9 am. The bed in the room was too lumpy and was a little uncomfortable. Pools were good size and lovely setup with trees to give lots of shade from the hot sun. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MonetLoverRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. I had heard from friends who had previously visited Key West that staying in a hotel in the downtown area (on / near Duval Street) was a must. Duval Street is where all of the action is (e.g., open air restaurants, shops, bars), but it is also a very noisy place - all day and all night. We opted instead to stay at Parrot Key in order to experience more of a resort atmosphere. We are so glad that we did! Being away from "the action" was not an issue at all. We hopped in our rental car every day for a 7 minute drive to Duval Street, had no problem finding on-street (metered) parking, and still enjoyed all of the "action" and goings-on. We loved coming back in the evenings to a tropical resort where you could hear the palm trees rustling in the wind...so peaceful! Parrot Key was such an amazing place to stay! We had originally booked a Garden View King room, but when we arrived, they upgraded us to a 2-bedroom, 2-bath, 2-story King suite at no extra charge. We stayed in 6B (you can view a map of the resort, here: http://www.parrotkeyresort.com/images/pictures/resortmap3.gif), which is an end unit. We had a balcony off the living room, and a balcony off the master bedroom (with 2 Adirondack chairs). One note: the balconies between units are not separated by privacy screens, so you will be "sharing" the space with your neighbors. Both bedrooms were very large; the master bath had a separate shower and soaking tub, and granite countertops; the living room had an entertainment unit with flat screen TV; the master bedroom had a clothes / entertainment armoire with flat screen TV. The entire unit was very clean and painted in beautiful tropical colors. I have heard other guests on TripAdvisor complain that the food at Cafe Blue, the resort's dining facility, was not very substantial. If you are looking for a full service dining experience, then Cafe Blue is not the venue for you. I had no problem with the breakfast choices (cereal, fruit, breakfast Panini's), but my husband chose instead to go out to IHOP for a heartier breakfast. We had originally booked 2 nights, but within an hour of arriving, we just knew we had to stay a 3rd night! We stopped at the front desk and asked if we could extend to a 3rd night at the same price, and after checking with central reservations, they were able to accommodate us! Every staff member that we dealt with (Rutanya, Sahsha, and Sara(h)) was unbelievably friendly, professional, and genuine. They really went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. We can't wait to come back next year! We have found *the* place for us!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a "resort" but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlMP
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is on a busy highway and while not exactly a resort, it is very clean and quiet. It backs up to a canal and a very small strip of sand was added between that and the buildings-not a beach! We ere given a room facing one of the three pools and Tiki area. The weather was quiet cold for the time of year, but we were able to catch a few rays in the pool area. The Tiki bar was closed the first night we arrived. Quite unexpected and apologies were not given. We spent our money at Sloppy Joe's instead and enjoyed the nightlife. No min-frig in our double queen room, which was inconvenient. Good location and a quick cab drive away from the action. As long as you plan to stay without the "resort" expectation, it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie K
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key. Having 3 children, it was nice to have a little extra space, and having two bedrooms, plus a living room was really nice. Having the Walreens and grocery stores close by was very convenient for buying snacks and small breakfast items. We didn't rent a car, and it was fine. Although, taxis are a little pricey, as they charge by the person. So it cost us $20 to get anywhere by taxi. We found that it worked well to pack a few backpacks, and just stay downtown for the whole day - from a late breakfast to an early dinner. Ft. Zachary was nice - and the kids enjoyed snorkling there. Kayaking tour at Lazy Dog was nice, and we followed that with dinner at Hogfish grill on Stock Island. A great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Very Clean, and Key Westy”
Reviews.Author: daveKMiami
Reviews.Content: Only a couple miles from Duval, the best 4 star value in Key West. Our 3rd stay. We drive from Miami and take our bikes so we can bike from hotel to Duval, because spending a day/night in Key West it is difficult to find parking at a decent rate in a secure lot ($25+/day or $4/hour). Hotel is relatively new, right next to a 24 hour Walgreens with Winn Dixie across the street. In room fridge, limited restaurant (breakfast only) fresh fruits, patries and waffles. Eggs are more pre-fab, but we weren't at the hotel for that. Staff is great and professional and trained well. Very friendly and willing to go above and beyond. WiFi is included in the $25 resort charge, (not charged when you make the reservation but mandatory when you arrive), also inluded is in room coffee. The hotel does not have in-room safe, and lock boxes at front desk only hold documents, not electronics or laptop. That's where I recommend they make a room upgrade. But, we had no issues with security. Also room has no 2-top dining or work table. The rooms are spacious so there is room for that. Another suggestion. For those that don't drive-in, bicycles and 2 person scooters can be rented. Scooters for $35/day. That is another great value compared to renting a car and trying to find reasonable parking. Also recommend a 1/2 day fishing trip and 1/2 day snorkel trip. Prices are reasonable and you should not leave Key West without experiencing the two things that Key West has that are the best in the United States. Definitely ... recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Parrrot Key Resort review”
Reviews.Author: T-Bone0030
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to what we thought would be a suite. Turned out to be a tri level condo with 2 balconies, enough sleeping for 6, 3 T.V's, DVR and upgraded cable. There's a $25 resort fee per night for the upgrades but when you consider it has 4 pools and almost a jungle maze we never gave it much thought. Walking distance to a outdoor mall with TGIF and more. Some rooms have sandy beach outside but you can't access the water because of the mangroves. All details in the room are high quality, bedding, cabinets, bathrooms etc. If $225 a night is in your budget then you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly positive”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrive to the minute we left it was surreal. Leading up to our arrival I was expecting a nice hotel for the price, but when I arrived I was blown away. The location was perfect, the grounds were breath taking, and the rooms were perfect. I cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot key”
Reviews.Author: asheyWhitstable
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. 4swimming pools bar and snacks at poolside. Rooms very clean and of a high standard. Must try the the jet skis highlight of our stay. Just far enough from the centre of key west. 10minute cab ride. Would we stay again YES

Reviews.Title: “In one word- beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Mayago
Reviews.Content: The place is just p-e-r-f-e-c-t! you must go there when visiting Key- West. The rooms, pools, staff etc. just great.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Jillian F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from our first trip to Key West. We stayed at this hotel, but would call it more of a resort! As soon as we made our way to our room, we instantly felt like we were in paradise! It feels like home as you walk onto the porch to the front door. The room was spacious and very clean. (slept like a baby on that bed with those cozy sheets also!) Was a definate bonus to have a fridge and coffee maker right in the room. As we made our way to one of the pools, we passed 3 employees. Each one said "good morning", "welcome", and "hello, how are you today". I am very much a people person and it really made me feel welcomed that employees working took a moment to make eye contact and say a few words to us. We had breakfast at Cafe Blue our first morning, the bacon egg and cheese panini delishious!!! We ate there for breakfast and lunch that day and we're highly impressed with each meal (and I'm a picky eater!) In the afternoon of our visit to the pool, the bartenter was great. She offered to take our picture while she chatted with us and made me one of the best bahama momma's I've ever had! I would definatly recommend this resort. Being in Key West is amazing in it's own, but the Parrot Key Resort really was the cherry on top of our week!!! We've already started planning our next vacation in the spring back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bczican
Reviews.Content: The advertised ocean front rooms - aren't. There is no beach and the only view from the second floor unit was of trees. There are very steep stairs in the king suites. The housekeeper had no clean washcloths and said she would return with some in 25 minutes. We never saw her again. The bathroom had two hand towels and two bath towels. The mini-bar had a coffee pot, teeny refrigerator and a microwave but no sink and no towels. To make coffee you had to walk down the hall and into the bathroom to get water. The entire resort is non-smoking and people were smoking on their porches and at the pool. There was no place to set a laptop computer except on a low coffee table. The vegetation around the resort is very lovely. The rest - not so much. One has to wonder if the management is writing the reviews for this expensive resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty townhouses, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Planekate88
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 other couples, plenty of room in the 3 bedroom townhouse. Very cutely decorated with balcony off two rooms. The kitchen was very open and most cooking utensils were provided (we had to request a cookie sheet and took a while for someone to bring it). Besides being a little bit slow the service was great. Such a good location, a little over 5 minute drive/cab ride to downtown area and about 5 minutes to the marina we kept our boat at. The resort has 3 or 4 pools which are very tropical feeling. Our stay was a little pricey but that is expected for Key West I suppose. Would stay again if traveling to Key West and wanted to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “So pretty”
Reviews.Author: Yagen5
Reviews.Content: This place was so pretty and peaceful, my husband and I enjoyed it very much. Would deft come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded paradise in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: The rooms, pools and service was excellent! Staff very friendly and Sahsha and Kristen went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. A wonderful place to relax, read a book and enjoy a quiet day at one of their 4 pools. Close to stores to get your own snacks and drinks. A Walgreens right next store to get those "forgotten" items.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge- Rutanya”
Reviews.Author: LucyD41310
Reviews.Content: We've been to Parrot many times and have enjoyed each trip. We had several friends with us on our recent trip and it was their first time to Key West; Parrot made them feel welcome from the moment they arrived. Rutanya took everyone under her wing and set us up with bikes, scooters, and cabs all from the front desk. Anything we needed, she was quick to respond. The place was very clean and well furnished. We will be going back again next year. We'd been in the 3 bedroom suites as well as the two bedroom suites, and liked both. The 2 bedroom suites have a small living area as well as a kitchenette -perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Caryn B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going through some changes, so be sure you know what you are getting. There are almost no more cottages at Parrot Key, just regular rooms. Many travel books still list the accomodations as cottages with full kitchens. The rooms are comfortable and perfectly furnished with lovely porches to sit with a book and a cold drink. The lush landscaping makes you forget you are right off the main road. I never heard the traffic at all. The pools were all lovely with plenty of shade and comfy lounges. They have what they call a sunning beach. You are not on a beach where you can swim. Every staff member I dealt with was wonderful and helped me immediately. If I have the chance, I'll go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, even better service.”
Reviews.Author: travelinman525
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at parrot key before and was very impressed, so i booked agian, for fantasy fest, we stayed a total of three nights, I will say the location is not in the heart of downtown but that was one of my favorite things about the hotel, a short taxi ride away from the choas of downtown was our quite, spacious room. Where we could catch some well needed sleep. Last time we stayed we stayed we were so impressed with the quilty bedding we spent the next day shopping for new sheets for our house, sleeping at parrot key is like sleeping on a cloud, I can't say enough about this place, staff is top- notch,

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and rejuvenating!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with our accomodations at Parrot Key. We were spending a few days in the Miami/Key West area and wanted a place that was close to downtown but away from the hustle and bustle to relax and unwind. Parrot Key fit the bill, with it's gorgeous landscaping, enchanting walkways and pool areas, and rooms that are well appointed and spotless! We enjoyed having coffee on our veranda, and eating lunch at the tiki bar which was well prepared and delicious. The fish tacos and panninis are terrific! In addition, Kristen at the front desk recommended a fantastic restaurant for dinner, the Roof Top Cafe. We plan on returning when we visit Key West again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NLoveUK
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at Key West for one or two nights so spent a while looking at the hotel options and the reviews. Chose a Friday and Saturday which I accept are the busy nights and after much searching chose Parrot Key due to room size and location which I thought was walkable from the town. We turned up at 5ish and couldn't park as there is insufficient parking for the resort so were told that the Walgreens car park next door had some allocated parking for the hotel. That car park had tow away signs so I had to double check where we could park. We then took all of the cases out of the car rather than the one bag we had packed as I wasn't sure about security - it's also pretty obvious you are a holidaymaker when you walk across thier car park with cases!!. The room was Ok as we had chosen the suite which we discovered is over two floors. It did smell a bit damp though and having just left Hawks Key which was about the same price for the weekend we were very disappointed with the standard. We shared a taxi to the town and then walked back however the front desk had said it was about 15 minutes walk away - if we could do it in that time then we would be in the 2012 Olympics!! Location is very poor.They had no availability for the Saturday night but we wouldn't have extended our stay as we were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: GAYLACP
Reviews.Content: We booked this visit through one of Parrot Key's online specials and can't say enough good things about our stay. I loved the fact that this hotel was "away" from Duval Street and provided a true oasis in Key West. The grounds, the four (yes, four) pools and the rooms (spotless!) are spectacular. Although our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived, we were provide a place to change clothes and store our luggage so we could immediately begin enjoying all the amenities Parrot Key has to offer and some refreshing Key West Sunset Ales from the on-site Tiki Bar. Also, as we were checking in, we asked about scooter rental, and the front desk agents immediately volunteered to hook us up with a company that offers drop offs and picks ups from Parrot Key. Couldn't have been easier! We absolutely loved our stay here and can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! Nice place for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MariannePG
Reviews.Content: We were there for our honeymoon and what a great surprise it was!!
