Although the hotel is not downtown, it is a great scape for a couple: nive room with balcony, living room with balcony, kitchen amenities, great bathroom. The only thing missing was the beach: but i would say it is worth it! The swimming pools are paradise and i strongly recommend this hotel. I am sure we will visit it again real soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service.....real people at parrot key resort”
Reviews.Author: Fernando M
Reviews.Content: Hello Everyone: After 20 hours of constant travelling I have to admit I made the cardinal mistake in travelling.....i went to key west, florida on a Saturday night and I had NO-Hotel_reservations.....I looked for 4 hours all around key West and the story was the same:::::NO-VACANCY anywhere. Because I had gone around the island a couple of times snappy clerks(happened twice) told me in a tired manner "we told you NO-VAcancy"....finally At 10pm, when i thought I either had to drive 156 miles back to Miami or sleep in my car, I entered Parrot Key Resort and like an angel Priscilla helped me, like I deserve to be treated, she was sold out but she double seearched the property and finally found a beautiful one king size bed room with a gate to the beach. I stayed there two days just to find out that Priscilla worked with nice people just like her; next day Kristen and Shauna made sure I had a relaxing stay, which I did. Thank you Parrot Key Resort only the people that works there is more beautiful than the property it self. Fernando Lopez Mateus (shareholder of a major world hotel chain not asociated with Parrot Key)

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rod O
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Parrot Key Hotel and it was perfect. The room was big, clean and very well appointed. The bed was amazing after a day of jet skiing. The service was great and I was especially gratefule to Rutanya! She is one hellofa concierge. She made arrangements for us to go jetskiing, sent us to awesome restaurants in Key West, arranged a gym workout for us and constantly asked what else we needed. The hotel was great, but I have to admit, I would stay wherever she goes. Thank you Rutanya! Rod Ocmond

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GretaB.
Reviews.Content: Lovely and serene resort in Key West! Please note-this resort does not have a beach..I already knew that prior to booking because it does specify this on their resort website, but I just wanted to re-clarify it. Went for two nights and we had a two bedroom guesthouse. One bedroom downstairs with a king size bed and one bedroom upstairs with a queen size bed. Both bedrooms had their own private bathrooms, which was very nice, when everyone is trying to get ready at the same time to go out! Also had a large refrigerator and a nice coffee maker. Big screen television in the front living room and a large balcony with french doors and lovely views of the pretty garden area and pretty plants on the resort property! The master bedroom downstairs also had a private balcony with french doors. The bedroom upstairs had a large window you can also open. Alot of swimming pools on the property and it is large and spacious! I also liked how close it was located to a Walgreens and a mini shopping center across the street..that was very nice and convenient to have close by! Had a wonderful time and I would highly recommend this resort to families traveling in groups!

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dgm10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Distant from town centre & car required but worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Isabel52
Reviews.Content: Our wedding party stayed at the Parrot Key for our daughter's wedding on the weekend of October 22, 2011. There were 19 of us staying at this lovely hotel. Arrangements for a block of rooms were made easily thanks to Ashley's help. This was a bit complicated because I had originally booked the rooms under one of the online hotel booking sites and then realized I needed to do this as a block. Ashley was helpful to hold those rooms for us while I "undid" the original booking. Check-in went smoothly, and when my daughter (the bride) checked in and her king room was not available she was upgraded at no additional charge to a king suite, which much appreciated since this was to be her honeymoon room. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. We all loved that each room had its own private porch and sandy sitting area, and we were equally impressed with all of the semi-private swimming pools and the lush landscaping. The hotel staff took good care of a small package for the wedding that was shipped to the hotel for me ahead of time. Although this hotel is not right in the middle of town, it is very conveniently located near a small shopping area complete with a drug store, grocery store and several restaurants which we all took advantage of during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana E
Reviews.Content: We came here for a bachelorette weekend and it was amazing! The room was more like our own little apartment with very comortable beds :) There are 3 pools that we visited and each one was super cute with the matching chairs. There's a cafe right next to the biggest pool which has sandwiches, salads and drinks. Overall experience is rated A+

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not great because”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: of the location. Next to a shopping center and nice enough location for that purpose but a good 10 minute drive to Duval street and the heart of the action. Alternatively, only a 10 minute cab drive from downtown if you want to get wasted. We shared a two bedroom condo with another couple, and we entered on the ground floor and had to go up a level to one room and up another level to the next room. What we did appreciate was the complimentary wi-fi. Staff was nice, but it was raining when we checked in and no one was around to provide much service. Still, very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goggles38
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel to stay in Key West. Itâ€™s about a $12 cab ride to get to Duval street area or southernmost point. The hotel itself is very nice. It has a great pool setup with 4 different pools to swim in. We always found one that was empty if we wanted to relax in a quieter space. The staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk staff could have been a little nicer but they were at least efficient. The room were clean and had lots of space. Good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Sunfloweraimeeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Parrot Key for a two night getaway. We had a wonderful, relaxing time. Duval Street was close enough to enjoy and then get away from! The pool area was so beautiful and tropical surrounded by palm trees. The music around the pool was soft acoustic versions of popular songs which was very restful to listen to while relaxing. The only thing we didn't understand was that the property has water on two sides and there are so many palm trees that you really can't see the water, no matter what room you reserve. The grounds were very beautiful, however it would be nice to see the water. What we like most about both this hotel and their sister hotel Tranquility Bay in Marathon is that at either location, prices are fair. You don't have to spend $14.00 for scrambled eggs etc. We liked the fact that we didn't feel taken advantage of. The watersports area was also fairly priced. Renting a kayak for $10.00 per hour made me glad I didn't carry all my own kayak equipment down. We enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key and plan to return again!

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. There was 7 of us and we rented to suites that were excellent. The rooms are very spacious almost like a condo. They are two floors.The only thing I wished they had would be a wet bar in the livingroom area and a jacuzzi, but they are very small things, they do have 4 pools.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at the Parrot Key Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lori M
Reviews.Content: The location of the Parrot Key was away from the main downtown area but we liked that. We could go into the town area (nearby trolley pick-up location) and then go back "home" and get away from it all. We also took advantage of the Sunset Watersports located right on the property to walk down and go on the guided wave runner 1-1/2 hour tour of the island which was a blast! We found a 'midweek' special deal and for the location a little away from the downtown, the space in the room, the amenitites on the property, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, it just couldn't be beat. If those are things that you are looking for you will love this place!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay with Great People and Amazing Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a magnificent resort in the midst of the tropical wonderland of Key West FL. Our party of four enjoyed a 5 day stay and we were impressed by every aspect of the resort. Our two bedroom accommodations were comfortable and well cared for. The decor was pleasing and much more upscale than we had expected. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were large and appointed with high-end fixtures. The 4 pools were amazing! Each had its own unique setting and landscaping that made it feel like we were in our own private tropical jungle. With rare exceptions, on each occassion we were the only ones at the particular pool that we chose to visit. We had no challenge in finding parking on premises, and transportation to downtown Key West via taxi was fast and affordable. $4.00 per person per trip, plus tip. Ms. Shelley, the bartender at Cafe Blue, was an encyclopedia of information about what to do and what to see while in Key West. She shared with us who we should ask for in each spot, and shared with us a map with her hand-written directions and notes about the hot spots. The food and drinks at Cafe Blue were very good and reasonably priced - and better in price than some of the downtown spots we enjoyed. The Parrot Key grounds are immaculate and full of surprises. Unique sculptures are around every corner and the foliage is alive with butterflies and small lizards. The landscaping is lush and adds a sense of "coolness" to what were some very hot days during our visit. We consider our stay with Parrot Key a "10" and we are already taking about our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential with LOTS of problems.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingConch
Reviews.Content: I am writing this a little over a month since we checked out with hopes the management would make things right. No such luck... What a disappointment. I will start with the good and move to the bad. I don't believe in bashing businesses on here, so here is my honest opinion. It is very clean, and has a cozy feel. Multi-level rooms make for a nice change to the typical hotel room. The walking distance to some convent stores is nice. Here are the problems. Our biggest complaint is all of the VERY LOUD construction going on from early in the morning to well after 7:00 at night. Relaxing by the pool is not an option unless you enjoy the constant banging of hammers and the loud crashes of boards and debris. I understand the news to maintain and improve a property, BUT WARN THE GUESTS WHEN BOOKING THAT THIS IS GOING ON!! We made a complaint to the unfriendly staff, and I don't think that they could have cared any less. We contacted the manager to see if they could at least drop the pointless $25 a day resort fee and all we got was a quick no. If you stay here you will be charged this fee. I have no problem with that IF there is something in return such as transportation to near by attractions, bikes or water sports equipment, Ect. We inquired why we were charged the fee here with none of the mentioned features, and their response was it was for landscaping, free drinking water by the pool, and a useless stretch of sand to set on with VERY limited views of mediocre water. Things that I think just come with running a place. Moving on the road noise is bad when setting on the balcony, the parking is far away, and the pools close at dusk. No hot tub was a let down as well. It has potential, but until attitudes change, I would stay at one of the MANY other beautiful resorts or B&B's in wonderful Key West.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: amc2299
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here; the staff was very helpful on letting us know where to go to eat on Thanksgiving Day. The pool side cafe is good for lunch and they have amazing drinks! The onsite water sports are nice for your free days when you find yourself wanting to do something. The location is on the northern side of the island so you are away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street but it's just a short 2-3min drive down to the main part of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Quiet, It is an Oasis, just a little distant from the rest of the Island”
Reviews.Author: TravelinAmigos
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Parrot Key very much. The accomodations were a great deal (which compensated for the realitive distant location of the property) and the staff was great. Calling the property an Oasis is an understatement!! Lush gardens provide hidden pools and quiet nooks to hideout in. The music was great, the bar was too. The entire property has classic Key West achitecture and colors, this is no blah hotel chain. The rooms are spacious, new and clean. The hotel recommended a scooter company that delivered the bikes to us and allowed us to spend the money we would have spent in cab fare commutting to get them on Key West Sunset Ales floating in the pool. We paid almost twice the rate to stay in a Westin in Orlando and were made to feel like we didn't want to be there and then Parrot Key spoils us with incredible service and attention to detail. Thanks Parrot Key! (Memo to Self: Ditch the Westin altogether!!)

Reviews.Title: “I love Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: ec052004
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful to us! We had a large group in several rooms down in Key West for our wedding. Everyone raved about what a great hotel selection we made (though we really just took a shot in the dark). Rooms were clean and well furnished and the staff was as friendly as could be. Don't expect to be right on the beach or right on Duval, but we didn't need either of those things. Cab rides anywhere on the island are only $4 per person anyway!! The pool areas were beautiful and the tiki bar was very accommodating. I will be making this my first choice for a place to stay in Key West as long as they can keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: ANNE G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parrot Key for 7 nights in September and in that time throughly enjoyed the resorts pool faclities. The staff were all really helpful especially Mindi in the Cafe and the desk staff. We ate a couple of times at the cafe but it's quite expensive and the choice is small. If you pop across the road to Goldman's Deli you won't be disappointed. It would have been helpful to have had a kettle and not just the coffee maker in the house. Also a shuttle to the main resort centre even at a small fee would have been beneficial as it was $16 dollars each way by cab to Duval Street/centre of Key West town for 4 passengers which adds up over a week. Apart from that it was very enjoyable and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, some problems”
Reviews.Author: mundo222
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, excellent rooms and 4 swimming pools. But we had a problem sleeping for the first 4 nights because the beds had noisy mattress. It's hard to believe but this was really annoying. After complaining they solved the problem. Also the lack of evening restaurant is not good... But i still recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fancy place in paradise”
Reviews.Author: GuiGiustina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice place to rest and refuel the energies after a day in the beach, or a night on Duval street. Also is well located and the pool areas are very good.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven on earth, like Key West itself”
Reviews.Author: Adriana739
Reviews.Content: It really worth the trip to Key West!! The route is awsome and the city is different to any other, the colour of the houses matches with the colour of the ocean. The Parroy Key Hotel is in a very good location, if you are tired, can cross the street and have a good place to eat. It is away from the noise of the city, very quiet and due to the great landscapes, once you get in the hotel, it seems to enter into a paradise. The decoration of the rooms is great and also the comfort. We traveled with our two kids, and I strongly recommend the two bedroom suite, as it really gives you privacy, two rooms each one with suite bathromm and TV. We booked the Hotel through Internet, and sometimes you can get a bad surprise, but on this time, the hotel really exceeded our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove to Key West from NY and were very excited to stay at this resort. We originally booked a waterfront suite but were advised prior to arrival that those units were under renovation. Instead we were given a two bedroom garden suite which was absolutely beautiful! It was the second and third floors of a unit with a balcony facing the garden and another one off the master bedroom which had very nice water views. The suite is nicely decorated and VERY comfortable. The views from the upstairs queen bedroom were fantastic. The resort is convenient to a shopping center which has a supermarket, pizza place, chinese food, TGI Fridays and numerous other stores. Jet ski rentals are right on the resort property and the four pools are beautiful. The staff were all extremely courteous and eager to help whenever we needed something. We will ABSOLUTELY stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family stays (young children)”
Reviews.Author: SouthwellGardens
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of April/ early May in a 3-bedroom 3-bathroom, 2 couples and 2 toddlers. There were 3 swimming pools, and not many people there in the morning, perfect for us. The place was very clean. They didn't clean everyday, but that's partly our fault - they were trying to come I'm the afternoon and it was not convenient for us as this coincided with nap time for the children. They always gave us fresh towels upon request though. There was only one restaurant, it was practical for lunch, supermarkets were very close and there were lots of restaurants 5-10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, quiet location, attractive pools and bar, excellent front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lisasburg
Reviews.Content: A return trip to Key West would mean a return trip to the Parrot Key. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a breathtaking experience!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel069
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were very quaint. I was skeptical that the pictures online would not stand true to the reality. I thought perhaps it was going to be one of those, "that's not how it looked in the pictures" moment. On the contrary, upon arrival I was very impressed with the lush landscape and boardwalk feel of the resort. The site was immaculate and the pools very tranquil. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable with the area. The rooms were very large in comparison with some high end hotels of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Love the property, the saltwater pools, the tropical landscaping and the great location!”
Reviews.Author: Amycoyne
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, cleanliness of rooms, pools and the property. Location is close to everything in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not with all the bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: KarrenBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with a friend and it is really nice. We had a nice room with a patio overlooking the river and sand-nice. The only downside is no restaurant, room service or what you may be use to in a resort. It is a personal 'bug' of mine-they only change the bed linens every 4 days so you have to call each day and request if you want them changed daily. Drives me nuts:) We did the 1.5 hour island jet ski tour-that was fun and pricey but worth the money. So, if you are looking for a nice boutique place to stay-this is good-just know you won't have the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with four pools and a lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KEGillesen
Reviews.Content: We lived in room 58 A (ground floor) for two nights with our two children aged 4 and 2. Parking just outside the back side door. Some of the rooms were upgraded, so there was some constructions work going on during our stay. This had no negative effect on our experience. Rooms were spacious and clean, and decorated with humour and elegance. The four pools were just outside our front door entrance, so there was easy access. Friendly staff who did their best to take care of us. The terrace on the front side had two chairs, so it was perfect for reading and a bottle of wine when our children had fallen to sleep. We visited the fitness room. A small room with a few things to do. Ok, but it was not impressing. Breakfast was a disappointment, and like other guests we tried other cafees (Goldman's just across the street and Camille's in the old town) after the first one. Parrot oat meal was a plastic cup from the store, only with added hot water... We couldn't believe this in such a classy hotel! The panini with egg was not home made, so the fresh fruit that came with it, was not enough to make up for the disappointment...

Reviews.Title: “nice time/nice place”
Reviews.Author: valerie b
Reviews.Content: my husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Parrot. very clean, nice decor, and very friendly staff. The beds were very comfortable which is a must when we vacation. Not to mention the bar/grill served great food and drinks! Mindi L- thank you for taking such good care of us. my husband and I enjoyed talking with you and meeting your handsome son. We wish him well with football. Now that's the kind of personal and friendly staff at the resort. Erich- thank you as well for the excellent service you gave us not to mention your smiling face when we saw you and Mindi first thing in the morning ready to serve! Rutanya- it was really nice to meet you and thank you for welcoming us to the resort our first day. We knew at that moment, this would be a great place to stay. I must say there was a little disappointment when we found out that there was no private access to the beach (which is what was advertised) and for that matter....no beach. Yes, we were right by the water but not able to access it. We quickly got over that when we discovered Sun Set Water sports was located directly behind the resort and there were signs guiding you to "water sports". That made it very convenient as well as a good price. Also, Sun Set water sports gave a 10.00 off for early activities if you were a guest with the resort.....very nice indeed. We would recommend you have some form of transportation to get to Duval St. from the hotel. Taking taxis can be expensive. oh did I mention it has three pools? granted two were small and the third was a nice size. the bigger pool is where many people gathered to eat, drink, and be merry. We've met so many wonderful people there! If you ran out of sunscreen or needed anything else, Walgreen was right next to the resort and only took 2 minutes to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not much service”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bed, ground floor room. The room was large and clean and had lots of character. The hotel is located about a $12 taxi ride from Duvall Street - we were unable to find any bars or restaurants (other than TGI Fridays) within walking distance. It would have been a nice touch if the hotel provided a shuttle service to the Old Town as the taxis added up. There are 4 small shallow salt water pools, which though weren't ideal for doing any swimming in, were great for cooling down. There is a single bar, which was open until 7pm and prices were reasonable. It had a small food menu. There wasn't a waiter service around any of the pools or any room service. It was a nice, pleasant hotel with friendly staff, but not somewhere I would hurry back to.

Reviews.Title: “What a place”
Reviews.Author: pporteus
Reviews.Content: Pool area should be in a landscape magazine! Pool bar staff unbelievable. Made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Relaxing, a classy joint”
Reviews.Author: butterflysunshine
Reviews.Content: We had a Garden View two bedroom suite. It was new, fresh and had a very soothing decor. It actually had a view of lush gardens (vs. the tree in the parking lot that you sometimes receive). The staff was friendly and helfpul. The bathtub had hair in it when we arrived and within minutes they had staff with bleach to fix the problem. The resort is small, centered around four quite small pools. They're all connected by lush landscaped walk ways and decorated very expensivly. For us it was great, we essentially had a small private pool for a day. But I can imagine when it gets crowded it could become problematic. Also, when kids join the pool it definitely changes the vibe. The bar staff was nice but it is quite pricey - $10 for a tiny weak margarita. It's a quick cab ride to Duvall Street and the action, for our party of 3 it was $12 each way. Cab ride from the airport is $7/person. Within walking distance is a WinnDixie, Walgreens and several restaurants. We wanted to relax and chill during the day and then party at night. This was exactly what we wanted. We paid $500 for two nights over labor day weekend. Well worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable home like accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NavSatara
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in a 3 bedroom townhouse . In the front we had pool view and the back had partial sea view, All of us loved the setting.. they have done a good job with lots of tropical trees, bushes.. It gives the areas including the 3-4 pools a secluded look. The pool bar served decent lunch fare and drinks. It"s walking distance to some restaurants and grocery stores. The major drawback is the distance from the main area of Key west. Duval Street is too far to walk, its about a 5-7 minute drive. It would be nice if they added some sort of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, tropical grounds”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine5005
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in late August for a bachelorette party and loved the resort! While a bit away from downtown area (we had to cab it everywhere or drive) it was nice to come back here after spending time out and about. A little oasis with wonderfully setup rooms and nice pool area. The bar appeared to be pretty quiet most of the time, something that was a little disappointing but other than that we had a great time and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible place!”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key ia an awesome resort. We were greeted by one of the most friendly, knowledgable, and professional person - Rutanya. She immediately made it very easy and comfortable to check in. The suite was incredible clean and comfortable. The ammenties were also great. 4 pools, tiki bar, and jet ski availability only short walk away. Cab rides into downtown about 12 dollars one way. We can't wait to go back next year!!! Mike J

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry T
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in a 3-bedroom cottage with another couple and my mother. The cottage gave everyone his/her own space and private bathroom and the kitchen and living room were a perfect place to relax after a day of exploring Key West. The interior of the cottage and the grounds felt very fresh and newly renovated (having been redone in the past 3 years). The colors where bright and the artwork was cheerful. We enjoyed being away from the hustle 'n bustle of Duval St while still only being a 3-minute drive into the middle of town when we wanted to go out. We also enjoyed the layout of having 3, separate pool areas; great idea to have options. Our only regret is not being able to stay longer in Key West to enjoy the hotel more; we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The resost is beautiful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darlene2772
Reviews.Content: The grounds are amazing and I never wanted to leave. I slept so good every night and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Parrot Key Resort is absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JessiHefley
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my stay at Parrot Key Resort! It was my first time to Key West and the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone was very eager to help and offer information and often followed up with us about our experiences. Bob was very nice and informative and I was pleasantly surprised by just how personal, yet private, the resort was. I will definitely stay at the Parrot Key Resort again on my next visit to Key West. Thank you all so much for such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “cocaroches in our room!”
Reviews.Author: deojedar
Reviews.Content: Nasty cocoroaches in our room. Plus the queen bed they advertise is a full so two people do not fit...waterfront what a joke! Need a taxi ti gi downtown? you will wait at least 30 minutes...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrAssenov
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nicely furnished and a great price. The onsite watersports was very convenient - I enjoyed kayaking with my husband in the clear waters of Key West. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: louloue_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, friendly staff, comfortable and luxurious. Pools were great, friendly staff. Totally relaxing holiday and the kids loved it. Wished we had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: scooterBradentonFL
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom condo that was spotless and the staff was very friendly. We recommed it to all !

Reviews.Title: “First class resort for less than first class price!”
Reviews.Author: TrebsterMT
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the resort. Felt like your own apartment with beautifully manicured grounds, picket fences, friendly staff. Make sure to get the B suites, they have two floors and a landing. Worth every dollar. The bed is like sleeping in a cloud. Great views from front and back porches. Will stay here again, would not consider another place in Key West and I have stayed in several.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: The only negative I could say about this resort was I didn't book it for long enough. We had a three bedroomed house which was perfect in every way. Very well presented and maintained. Great views from balconies. Four pools meant that we either had pool to ourselves or there was just one other family there. Every person we met from reception to housekeeping were so polite, friendly and helpful. Free laundry room so didn't have to bring home dirty washing. Amazing landscaped grounds. I had cause to email the resort before going and again they could not have been more helpful. This place really is a bit of paradise, so relaxing in a beautiful location with everything you could possibly want. You could quite happily check in and never need to leave the resort. There is a place to eat at one of the pools although we did not use it but it did look very nice. There is also so much to do and see. Free Internet access is great for the teenagers. Would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Esqnole
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 8 staying at Parrot Key for a 30th birthday celebration weekend. The staff helped us plan an amazing 4 days from the moment we made our reservations. A big big Thank You to Sara, for helping with all our special requests that made the weekend so memorable. The grounds are beautiful, the cottages are amazing, and everyone with whom we spoke was knowledgeable and kind. Cabs are just a phone call away, and it's about $4/person to Duval Street. Parrot Key is quiet, secluded and perfect for couples, families or groups of friends looking to have an incredible Key West experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Key West Escape-loved the garden pools”
Reviews.Author: AWellington
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two bedroom with livingroom suite-which was perfect for two couples. The hotel's lush garden landscape, with 4 pools to choose from really was a hi-light and really allowed guests to pretty much have their own pools to themselves most of the time. The resort is very clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. Walgreens was a short walk away. Our rooms required walking up a flight or two of stairs which provided some much needed cardio after enjoying downtown KeyWest. We would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows of Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: Wyvernian
Reviews.Content: There are many good things about Parrot Key - the superb and well maintained gardens being the chief one. There are 4 pools too, which means that different atmospheres can develop round each one by some sort of unspoken mutual agreement - kids splashing in one, people reading by another, boors in cowboy hats being loud in another....The rooms are great, but make sure you get one higher than number 6, because the lower numbers don't have the waterside verandahs with sun loungers etc which make the place such a good find. It's well out of the centre, which helps with the peace and tranquility aspects, but the taxi into town will cost you $16 so if you're going to the centre a lot, that mounts up. The catering is pretty limited and the (definitely not tiki) bar closes at 8 pm (though we found that isn't that unusual at Keys hotels) - however, there is a Domino's across the road if your tastes incline that way. Oh, and there's a free DIY launderette - much appreciated when you are touring, but bring your own washing powder, there's none provided for you to purchase on site. Our stay was slightly marred by a rowdy group of guests, but sadly I guess you are going to get that anywhere in Key West. On the whole, more positives than negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Another great tip from Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug56Miami
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very well kept. Clean, beautiful and very cozy. The staff very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a 2 couples in a 2 bedrooms suites. It was better than we thought. The rooms and living area is very cozy, clean, and well decorated. Differently than most constructions in Florida the walls are not thin, so you don't listen all noises from all rooms around. It was very quite. The landscape is gorgeous. The hotel is very well located. Crossing the road there is a big sopping area and there is also a Walgreens next door,

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: Very nice property- private, beautiful, clean, and well-kept. The staff was awesome start to finish. So pleasent and helpful with anything (taxis, directions, reccomendations) and just happy in general (Thanks Mindi, Kristen, and Booker!). The location is extremely convenient with several stores (grocery, liquor, convenient) just walking distance from the resort and not even a 5 minute cab ride to downtown Duvall St. I enjoyed the fact that we had some breathing room from the craziness that is the downtown area. You will not be disappointed with your stay at this resort. The rooms are awesome as well, no matter which kind you choose, but know that the suite-style ones are awesome! I will definitely return and I give it a full recoomendation to any type of traveler, solo, family, friends and couples! P.S. The beds are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: littlejred
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key was perfect! Our amazing 3 bdrm was perfect for our vacation. The landscape of the hotel is stunning, we loved swimming in the different pools, we loved the two balconies and full kitchen as well. Service was outstanding, everything was clean and beautiful, and we were able to relax and really enjoy ourselves in Key West thanks to Parrot Key Resort! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort I've ever stayed at, simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dennym1985
Reviews.Content: Everyone was kind and courteous. Rooms were immaculate. The cottage has such a warm and cozy feeling. Makes you feel right at home in the tropical paradise.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique resort”
Reviews.Author: gina_donaldson
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort for families or couples. We were there with friends, but I would definitely plan a larger family reunion or multi-family gathering. GREAT location to downtown or waterway. A wide range of custom accomodations and muliple pools. Lunch poolside was terrific - you MUST try the fresh fish tacos and their famous signature Key Lime Colada! Sean (the managers) is top notch and very customer service oriented as are all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel does not begin to describe incredible nature of this lovely resort.”
Reviews.Author: dwoodson
Reviews.Content: My family and I have spent several occasions vacationing in the Caribbean and I found in our stay here that the best place to stay in key west for seasoned family vacationers looking for the new and pleasant in accommodations is the parrot key. From the tasteful arrengement of the rooms' discrete decor, to the utility of the kitchen, it felt made to order for an easy two weeks at the beach. The resort's gardens evoke tropical multi-colored hedges guarding four child friendly pools, and service was faster than it took to order. Highly recommend it to folks looking to relax with children of diverse ages..

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem on a Beautiful Island”
Reviews.Author: JennBar
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West multiple times before, but have always relied on others to find our hotels. This time, I was taking my husband and our 2 daughters (aged 5 and 7) and needed to find something myself. I went online and finally found Parrot Key. I read the reviews and looked at the pictures and made my decision. Boy, was it a good one! When we arrived at the hotel, the entrance was lovely. There are flowers and bushes and trees everywhere, it is beautifully landscaped! Every room seems to have some sort of landscaping outside the front door, and the 4 pools are also landscaped. The main pool, also the largest, has a wonderful tiki bar and restaraunt with very good food and drinks. Our room was amazing! We stayed in the 3 bedroom cabin, with a sandy area in the back, complete with beach chairs and an umbrella. All the bedrooms have their own bathroom and then there is another 1/2 bath on the first floor (it's 3 floors). The 2 bedrooms on the second floor each have a balcony as well! It was much more than we expected! The only downfall we experienced was with our transportation. We took the Key West Express ferry from Ft. Myers to Key West, so we didn't have a car when we got off the boat, as most visitors to the island. I didn't realize when I made the reservation that the hotel is about 1.5 miles from the Duval Street area. We were offered the options of renting an electric car (way overpriced in our opinion), scooters, or bicycles (the island is very bike friendly). Unfortunately though, given the age of our daughters, those weren't very good options, so we did have to take a cab back and forth. That cost between $6 and $16 depending on which driver you get and how they charge, either by distance or zone (distance is actually cheaper!). The city bus was another, very affordable option (either $1 or $2 per person depending on day and time), but you must print out the schedule ahead of time since waiting on a hot bus bench for over 20 minutes for the next bus is not much fun! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly stay there again and again with my family! The staff was very friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious”
Reviews.Author: chingcm
Reviews.Content: We came with a group for a destination wedding. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. Pros: Spacious Clean Free laundry Quiet - It was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Duvall St. Walgreens and Winn Dixie supermarket across the street. Onsite gym is nice. Cons: No cribs on hand. You have to call a service to rent one. $25 resort fee is such nonsense. Pools were too hot. We were there in early August when it's really hot and humid. Jumping into the pool just was not refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place"”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here last week and enjoyed it so much. The property was beautifully landscaped and placed on the water. It was very relaxing and tranquil. The salt water pools were a perfect temperature. The rooms were spacious and clean and felt like we were in someone's beach home. The staff were professional and courteous. I loved being able to do laundry free of charge and we were within walking distance of a decent shopping and eating area. We would stay there again if we returned to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Smithtim0509
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at Parrot Key Hotel and Resort for our honeymoon and loved it. The staff was friendly and couldnt have asked for a better room. We have a 2 bedroom 2 floor house that views the ocean in the back and the pool in the front. However, the "ocean view" wasnt really the ocean more of an inlet. The walls were also thin so we were able to hear other visitors. Overall, we would definately return and bring friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: chum88
Reviews.Content: We had a family trip with my husband, one year old, my parents and brothers. Location for us was ideal. With a baby we did not need to be in the heart of Key West with all the bars. We were also across from a grocery store where we did our food shopping. And when the occasion arose, we were able to pile everyone into the minivan and drive into town and park without much problem. The hotel had 4 pools as advertised but they were small and intimate. It was nice to have the pool to ourselves one day. Beware, they charge 25 dollars for the pool towels if you do not have the same number of towels in the hotel as the day you arrived. The daily maid service does not give you new towels but does take your old ones away. You have to go to the front desk to request for more towels. The pool towels are terrible, thin, and in need of replacement. The rooms were decently clean and well furnished. It was a plus that everyone had their own baths. We stayed in a 3 room cottage. No one was fighting for a bathroom. Plus it had a nice kitchen that overlooked a small dining area and living room. The sofas were dirty and needed to be cleaned. I guess this is true of all hotels. Only issue was that they staff comes and does a full cleaning only every 4th day. My fault for not reading the little signs in our rooms. I think a full cleaning every 4th day is too long. We over looked the water and enjoyed the sunsets. Overall a great vacation and everyone was happy to share a nice cottage together but still have their space. Would stay again if we visited Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: merideth f
Reviews.Content: This place is priceless... from every room the views are breath taking.. The rooms were very big..3 bedroom 31/2 bath full kitchen even balconies to sit and enjoy.. They even have onsite laundry room that is at no charge. The full setting if your by one of the pools or sitting have a drink at the outside bar is very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpfull in whatever you need. We will back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is ALWAYS Great!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Memphis
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here as a solitary couple previously, we also brought 40 people down recently for a combined bachelor/bachelorette party! Each time the staff made us feel as if we were the only people on the property! The place is large enough and so well secluded that you can either go to the main pool and listen too music while drinking cocktails, or one of the many others and float/relax by yourself. The rooms are great, as is the landscaping and architecture. Sean (property manager) and his staff bent over backwards to accommodate us each stay we've had. You get a great deal at PK for a great value. This is the ONLY place we will stay on KW!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort is a class act.”
Reviews.Author: Rita L
Reviews.Content: Very restful and tranquil environment. Knew you were in the keys by the colors of the rooms, pictures on wall and chairs on the porches and palm trees swaying outside your door. I loved it here and Parrot Key Resort will be my place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMom42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 2 nights before heading to Naples in June 2011. Very lovely place -- pool is beautiful; room was lovely and spacious, beds and lines soft and grounds well kept. Lack of a beach surprised us -- we didn't realize that there wasn't one until we ended up at the dock!! : ) Didn't matter -- pool was great. They need a shuttle to downtown for folks without a car. We rented one from Ft. Lauderdale and drove to the hotel in the Keys, but then returned it, and flew to Naples on a (tiny) plane. Would have appreciated a ride into town for dinner.......cabs are easy to get though. Key West is definitely laid back. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing stay. We particularly enjoyed the large verandah balcony and chairs to relax in the afternoon during the (typical) Florida T-storms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're staying with family or a group"”
Reviews.Author: Strapaholic
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 3 Bedroom Garden-view Cottage and it was a pleasant experience. The rooms are spacious and clean, plus there was a full kitchen, dining area, and living room. Additionally, each bedroom has its own bathroom (a nice feature when everyone is trying to get ready at the same time), as well as a half bath on the first floor. If you will be spending time in your room, there are flat screen televisions in each bedroom and one in the living room. The kitchen is nice if you don't want to eat out every meal or you just want to have access to a fridge to cool your drinks and store restaurant leftovers. In our cottage, the bedrooms on the second floor had balconies, and the first floor had outside porches as well, each with sitting areas which was nice to enjoy some fresh air and the view. There are four pools on the property, and finding one that wasn't crowded was no problem. We didn't really have any issues with the place, but I'd like to point a few a few things out. First, parking on the property was limited. If the parking lot is full, you have to park at a lot they share with a nearby Walgreens (not a long walk, but I didn't like leaving my vehicle in a lot off property). Secondly, the floor-plan of the cottage we stayed in was 3 stories, plus stairs to reach the first floor. If you're traveling/staying with people who have trouble with stairs or are disabled this could be a problem; the property may have disabled friendly rooms available, I didn't check. Also, the bedroom on the third floor was much warmer than the first and second. Adjusting the AC to cool that room to "room temperature" (78 F) meant the second floor was around 68 F. It's always hot this time of year in Florida (Florida Native), so this may not be an issue in cooler months. Lastly, the location of the resort is on the new side of Key West, so you will have to take a Taxi or drive to the historical side (where most of the "tourist" things are). Parking near Duval St. can be expensive ($20) and hard to find. I'd recommend the taxi (~ $10-12 each way) just to save yourself from the hassle. Overall, the property had a very laid-back feeling while still managing to meet guest needs. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the room was one of the best I've stayed in Key West (compared to the 7 other properties I've stayed in on other trips). My family and I are already planing another trip back for next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traci K
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here! Sean the manager was very accommodating to our large group ensuring that we all had a great time. The rooms were extremely clean with very comfortable beds! The food and drinks were great. It was nice to have several pools to choose from. We had several villas and each one was very well kept and beautifully decorated. The location was also very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have an AMAZING time in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “No matter what size your group, they'll take care of you!”
Reviews.Author: Smorales4
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing! A large group of 40+ people and the manager, Sean, made a point to learn all of our names. He and his staff spared no expense making us happy! At one point, he even bought us pizza. Beautiful, located close to everything, clean...nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... Will definitely be coming back.”
Reviews.Author: OAcosta1374
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing weekend. There were 40 of us! And all ready to party and have a good time. The entire staff dealt with us with class although we were a little rowdy. Sean went above and beyond in handling a group this large and I honestly have no complaints. I have already recommended the resort to friends and family and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & exclusive with a fun pool!”
Reviews.Author: Jeepgirl318
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank Sean for being gracious and wonderful to our big group! The rooms were beautiful&spacious with scenic views. It was off duval street a bit but nothing a $5 cab ride couldn't solve..it was clearly the best of both worlds..party & go out on Duval street but retreat to a Caribbean escape when you were done&wanted to relax&unwind.. thanks again Sean!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: mdrgator10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at in a 3 bedroom oceanfront cottage (#35 which is right on the corner of the building offering a panoramic view of the gulf). Check-in was a breeze and the staff very friendly. Parking was horrific. The lot is very small for the size of the hotel, but you can park right next door in the Walgreens lot (which is just a very short walk). The room itself was very nice. The main bedroom had a tub and walk in show with double vanity. The balcony overlooked the gulf. The adjacent room was nice, but smaller with only a walk in shower (tiny, but ok). The third room, which is on the 3rd level of the house was so so. The air conditioner really didn't seem to cool the room that well, so it got warm at night and during the day, but it wasn't too bad. It really is a beautiful property with lush landscaping and is very well maintained. Here are a couple of things I wished I would have known. The "oceanfront suite with a private beach" is kinda misleading. Yes, you are right on the ocean, but there really is no beach. There is some sand outside your door with a couple of beach loungers. It is really nice to sit outside and watch the sunset, but it isn't private and there is certainly no beach to go into. Many nights, random people from other rooms would come and use our lounge chairs. No big deal to us since we were not using them at the time, but if you want "private", you will not get it. Another issue was with the pools. There are three SMALL pools. All of them are surrounded by landscaping, so there is no room for a breeze, and not much sun. The pools were HOT. Since they are so small, the summer heat really warmed them up. This was a big bummer for all of us since we just wanted to relax by the pool with some drinks. Didn't happen. Too hot, and no refreshing pool to jump into. the hotel is only a short drive to Duval street (maybe 5 mins). There is a Walgreens right next store and other restaurants, grocery stores nearby. Overall, it is a very nice place to stay, but not to "hang out" at during the day.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VACATION SPOT”
Reviews.Author: KSJ900
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key was a fantastic experience from check in to check out. We didnt want to check out because we loved it so much!! The hospitality couldn't have been any better. We checked in, and the room that we had originally booked wasn't available. Without any troubles what so ever, they upgraded my husband and I at no additional charge to an amazing ocean view room! It was unbelievable. They were wonderful with getting us anything that we needed. Calling a cab, and great resturant reccomendations. They had the cleaniest and luxiourious room we had ever stayed in. There are four pools in the complex. This was great becasue my husband and I could pick and choose which pool we wanted to hang out at. The main pool was big and was near the pool bar and cafe, The other three pools were a little more private and you could relax and enjoy laying by the pool. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone who is traveling to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Myersfamx2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The bungalows are very large and easily accommodated our entire family. The downside: in the third bedroom upstairs there was no ceiling fan and it was very warm. The walls are also very thin and anyone climbing up and down the stairs can be heard. Not to mention our noisy next door neighbors who woke us up when they came stumbling in at 2:00 am. The grounds are beautiful and well groomed. The restaurant served excellent food and great drinks. There are 4 small pools with nice chairs. There is a shopping plaza across the street, however this hotel is located very far away from the heart of Key West. We took many a cab into town. We were okay with this but if you would like to be close by to the action this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot key's manager Sean Bacon is why we come back time after time.”
Reviews.Author: Danludwig
Reviews.Content: The 4 beautiful pools nestled in an amazing lush tropical garden, and the beautiful private beach front over looking the ocean with it's own private dock are only two of the reasons we love parrot key, the third being the amazing staff!! We just left and already booked for next year! Thanks again to Sean Bacon for making our stay at Parrot Key a lasting memory!!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of true paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: The staff members and management of the resort were very friendly and welcoming! Needless to say, Key West is truly paradise. Not only was the island filled with extremely friendly people willing to share the local attrations, the location was prime! The resort was very clean and contemporary. Beautiful decor and amazing gardens/landscape. The option of four different pools to chose from really allows a feeling of relaxation and privacy, and the bar is not too far from any of them!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: busche777
Reviews.Content: Booked this Resort mostly because of availablity and price. It was an excellent choice! Great location, great pools, lush atmopshere, not to mention staff is super friendly and helpful, especially Rutanya! We decided to extend our vacation for an extra night and Rutanya went above and beyond for us! I would stay again and again. Thanks for a stress free week, Parrot Key!

Reviews.Title: “As a return guest, still shocked at how amazing this resort is!”
Reviews.Author: reemard
Reviews.Content: Had beachfront 3 bd cottage again and all was perfect! Tons of space , clean, nice views from all bedrooms. Rutanya at front desk helped us out- our return flight was cancelled and she was able to make a few magic moves to get us a room in sold out situation. The only minus- our bill did not reflect early booking prepay discount and after many calls for a supervisor and stops at desk , sup was never there or returned a call. And I have a suggestion, make at least one pool adult only. The pools are on small side and nothing is worse than trying to relax on loungers with screaming and at times fighting children splashing you and their parents not wanting to control them. The adult guests should be able to enjoy pool areas too....

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Tripps88
Reviews.Content: Shelley at the outside bar is amazing!! She knows everything about the island and all the people!! And she makes fantastic drink recommendations!!! Love her!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and relaxing-we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne064
Reviews.Content: Place was charming and very well stocked. Our cottage porch opened up onto a man made sandy area which created a wonderful feel. Units were clean and it was so nice to have access to a laundry facility with plenty of washers/dryers. Resort is beautifully landscaped and was a great value price wise for our family of 4 with teenagers!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Resort and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: kma3323
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day early in Key West and the staff was able to accomodate us even though they were sold out and it was the opening day of Lobster Season. We spent 6 nights at the resort with our teenage son and every expectation we had of this resort was met or exceeded during our stay. Every staff member we encountered was always friendly, helpful and accomodating. From breakfast poolside to late afternoon Key Lime coladas we never felt like we were staying right next door to a Walgreens and the busy main highway. The Resort itself is less then a 3 minute drive to Duval Street and Mallory Square. Don't let these items deter you from staying here. Once you enter your room from the front door and step out your back door you enter into an oasis of swimming pools and lush tropical gardens. We will definitely be returning to this resort on our next visit to Key West and will recommend to anyone who is planning a trip to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with huge rooms and great pools”
Reviews.Author: Kuprasm
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is trully good resort. The idea of four small pools Â is excellent. Two bedroom suites with two bathrooms and a living room are huge. Interior is fresh and modern. If you don't care about the water view than you have a bargain for what you get if you choose for the garden view. You pay a lot extra for water front. Like already others wrote, there is no beach. Â Service is excellent.Â CafÃ© Blue is basic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical oasis in the middle of Key West!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFamily5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great stay at Parrot Key Resort. This place was wonderful. We enjoyed the quiet and relaxation of the entire resort. We had a waterfront guestroom which was fine for a short stay. The waterfront was not very visible because of the foliage but, we were right by the sunset deck which was nice to walk out to view the bay. The chairs on the back porch were lovely as were the potted plants on each porch which gave the resort a personal touch. The only thing I wish the room provided was a couple of throw rugs or at least a broom as the sand on the tile floors was quite annoying. The pools were beautiful and tropical, exactly what you want when you are traveling in the Keys. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis R
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and found the hotel staff very accommodating and friendly. The property was beautifully maintained and the rooms very comfortable and clean. Location was great and very convenient with a Walgreens next door to help with last minute things you might have forgotten. Would wholeheartedly recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll never stay anywere else!"”
Reviews.Author: rnwthit
Reviews.Content: The Grounds were great very clean and very tropical The room was very nice and clean The staff took care of us very well

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! But not on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kimmi0810
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite with 2 balconys, which is more like a townhouse. It was beautiful! No complaints at all about the room at all! :) Hotel is not on the beach though. The pictures on the website were slightly deceiving. I didn't see anything about room service in the room, they did hand out a bunch of papers at check-in that included a breakfast and lunch menu, but did not say where you could get it... whether is be a restaurant or room service. There is a fridge in the room, but no mini bar. Overall, it was a fantastic stay and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Jewelz2584
Reviews.Content: We loved Parrot Key. The rooms and grounds were absolutely beautiful. We especially loved the little porches. Everything was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We also enjoyed the onsite jet ski tour! The only down side of Parrot Key is that the cab ride to Duval street/ mallory square was about $15 each way which got pretty expensive. We would defiantly stay at Parrot Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for such a beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: Marqhines
Reviews.Content: Resort was beautiful, peaceful and our 3 bedroom cottage was clean, spacious and decorated nicely. For the price of stay this was a great bargain and exceeded my expectation. My family will be definitely returning to Parrot Key Resort when visiting Key West again. From West Chester, Oh

Reviews.Title: “Its really really nice hotel but far away from the fun and party scene”
Reviews.Author: simhapurlion
Reviews.Content: its one of the best hotels as far a ambience and decor goes. Its really very well kept. But its far away from duval street where most of the clubs and restaurants are, it also has a policy of no smoking anywhere on the hotel property, if u do smoke its a 500 dollar fine. Its nice place would recommend it to anybody. I wouldn't stay there again. I dont smoke myself, but i still thought that policy was a little bit too harsh and pompous. Everything else is 5 star rating there, its super clean, super nice staff, amazing gym. free wifi was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “One word Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Audra11
Reviews.Content: From check in to departure simply wonderful! Wished will could have stayed longer. Front desk staff the best-Alma and Andrea so sweet, we stayed in three hotel on our 8 day trip across FL and truly this staff was 5 star-THE BEST, and they didn't even have to give my kids cookies. Our cottage/suite extreme clean and large-trust me you will not be disappointed. Pool areas picked up and staff in all areas professional and always ready to assist. Too many PROs to list only CON we came in late one night and had to park next door at Walgreen, but good thing about this area lots of provisons-Winn Dixie(Food Store) Walgreens and Pizza Joints in close walk to resort. I signed up on TA to rate this hotel-enjoy your stay at Parrot Key, I know we can't wait to go back!!!! Thanks PK for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this place”
Reviews.Author: KarenSMichigan
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations. Just as pictured at their website. We've stayed there twice (May, 2009 and May, 2011). Both stays were great. We had a 3 bedroom cottage the first time and a 2 bedroom suite the second time. Very clean. Very comfortable beds. It's about 3 miles from Duval Street, which is just the way I like it.... Duval Street is fun, but I like being able to escape from the craziness. I would definitely recommend Parrot Key to anyone wanting quiet time at the end of the day. Love this place and will stay again if I ever get back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: tara1403
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to stay!! Parrot Key is spacious and updated, but still has all the charm of Key West. I have stayed in Key West many times, and this is my favorite place yet. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with plenty of room for everyone. I stayed with my best friend and two teenage sons - and we all LOVED it! The view from the porches is stunning...the water is beautiful, of course - but the gardens surrounding the property are gorgeous. They have exceptional service and a very friendly, and helpful staff...especially Rutanya at the front desk. The swimming pools are small, and therefore quite warm - like bathwater and don't offer much relief in the summer. We didn't mind too much - we would rather spend our time on the Gulf or in the Atlantic. Mallory Square and Duval are close, and there are plenty of stores and restaurants that are super convenient to Parrot Key. We will definitely be back, already looking at our trip for next year - and plan on staying at Parrot Key of course!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, look forward to re-visit”
Reviews.Author: WPBTA
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, staff very accomodating, the lush vegetation as well as newness and cleanliness lent to a wonderful family stay. we stayed in the 3 bedroom cottage both garden side and waterviews. Both were lovely but worth the extra money to have the beautiful bay view. The accomdations were extremely comfortable, family friendly and the pool area and tropical vegetation makes it even more appealing. Great stay! Too bad they don't allow pets- then it would be perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Resort is nice, location is ok, pools are nice, no real access to the ocean as the beach in the pictures is not really a beach..”
Reviews.Author: allieik
Reviews.Content: Just Ok, stayed here after the Orchid Key & would pick the Orchid Jey everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Surrondings with Old Florida Charm”
Reviews.Author: groovinlvfam
Reviews.Content: This hotel that should be rated a five star resort in Key West. I felt like I was staying at the Ritz Carlton! The customer service is superior to none. The grounds are lush and the architecture is authentic. The rooms are adorable and roomy. My kids loved the four pools! I loved the individual artwork at each pool. If you can stay at Parrot Key, consider yourself lucky. It's truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and valued priced”
Reviews.Author: Pdonatyandkids
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Nice pools. Large rooms with clean bathroom. Friendly and helpful staff. A little far from the action...however taxi's are fast and walking never hurts anyone. If you are looking for a great dinner...high recommendations to the flaming buoy filet co.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kcbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were vacationing with two other couples so we rented a 3-bedroom cottage at Parrot Key. We loved the fact that we were all able to stay at the same place with a common living room and kitchen, but each couple had their own private bedrooms and bathrooms. My only complaint about the place is that one of the second floor bathrooms was tiny, but not a big deal at all. We had everything we needed. It was great that Winn Dixie and Walgreens were both within walking distance for any groceries or other supplies we might need. As many have already stated Parrot Key is not within walking distance to Duval St. and the downtown area but we didn't have any problems. We did not rent a car. We took taxis when we wanted to go downtown. Since there was a large group of us they would send a van and we usually paid $4/person to go downtown. On our final day some of us rented bikes and some of us rented scooters and we used those to get around town. Biking around Key West is very easy. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: NY1LOU
Reviews.Content: What can i say about the Parrot Key Resort. It is a beautiful hotel that is well kept and clean. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the bay and it was a well appointed room with one king on the 1st floor and one Queen bed on the second floor. Both of the rooms had bathroom suites. Balcony was a treat and best of all we got 16B which was right by the pool and Bar. The airconditioning was premo! The bar tender made good drinks and the pools were clean but the water was HOT!!. Well, that is what I get for going in July. The 24 hour walgreen was nice to have. This hotel is close to everything and yet far enough from the Duval craziness that allows you to relax after partying. We loved this resort and would recommend it to everyone. It is family friendly and the staff was on the ball. Parking is a bit weird but overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdmac
Reviews.Content: We were on a family trip and loved the space this hotel room offered us. It was nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff was helpful, especially Rutanya Hardin who went out of her way to help us stay an additional night which made our trip complete. Her service was excellent and we would recommend the Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, beautiful, top-notch!”
Reviews.Author: farawayNJ
Reviews.Content: Just came from a 3-night stay with my family including 2 teenage daughters. I'm amused by some of the reviews here expressing disappointment at "no beach" given that there is NOTHING on Parrot Key's website that would indicate the resort has a beach, only a "sandy, sunning terrace." We also had no problems with parking or with housekeeping, as some others have expressed here. I admit I was nervous when we pulled in to the resort, given the proximity of the Home Depot and Walgreens. But when we entered the resort grounds I was pleasantly surprised. The setup and landscaping are very private and lush, like a secluded tropical garden. The four small pools are so relaxing; there is none of the loud, rowdy, "cannonball" behavior you might find at a larger resort with one big pool. We enjoyed lunch at the poolside grill (delicious, although expensive), and bartenders Mindi and Shelley are both VERY generous with drinks! TIP: if you're looking for a budget-friendly, quick breakfast, hit Goldman's Deli across the street in the shopping center. We had a 2-bedroom suite which was perfect for a family with teens. Two full bathrooms and 3 flat-screen tv's. No problems with the wi-fi. The balconies were both also very private. I felt like I was sitting in a tropical treehouse. We did have a small issue with the bed in the upstairs bedroom. The frame was a little loose resulting in very loud creaking that woke us all up every time one of my daughters rolled over. I alerted the front desk in the morning and it was fixed by the time we returned that afternoon. Also, we had a small issue with bugs when my daughter left a glass of gatorade sitting out on the coffee table (NOT bedbugs!!). I suppose this is part of living in a tropical climate, but my advice is don't leave food or drink sitting out!! The workout room is small, only 4 machines and a decent supply of free weights. No windows though, so I didn't particularly enjoy it but I was glad it was there! The resort location, as many have noted, is not a comfortable walking distance from town. That was fine with us as we had a rental car and drove wherever we wanted to go. We had no trouble parking in town but if you get desperate note that there is a parking garage at the Westin where, for $4/hour, your car is in a covered garage keeping it far cooler than having it parked in full sun! All in all, a fabulous stay at Parrot Key. We would definitely go back again if we're in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: TBugz
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parrot Key Resort was wonderful! We stayed in a two bedroom garden suite with two balconies, two bathrooms and a living area. These accommodations were so clean, nicely decorated and extremely comfortable. We have older children so one slept in the bedroom with a queen and the other on the full size couch; it would have been a little more comfortable if it had been a pull out bed. The grounds are lush and well maintained, the four pools had great padded lounge chairs to relax on and the largest pool had a wonderful Tiki bar with great food (a little expensive). The staff was very friendly and ready to answer any questions and help in any way. There is not a beach so you will have to drive to the beaches as well as into downtown Key West; all with in a two mile radius! The place and the price were amazing...can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Beach?”
Reviews.Author: golfer864
Reviews.Content: Pictures show sand, chairs, but no water, that is because it is on the other side of a fence and hedge row. Daily maid service consisted of trash pick up and making beds. Had dead wood roach in upstaires bedroom for four days before it was removed, service consisted of exchanging towels daily. They have parking available for about 75% of the guests, additional parking is next door in Walgreens parking lot. I will go back to Key West, but I will not stay here. Great bartender Shelly with lots of information on resturants in area. She was correct on every recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Virginiagirl50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel only one night. We wished we were going to be there longer. We were a little put off pulling into the resort as it was next to a very busy road and shared a driveway with a very busy Walgreens which is, literally, right next door. Our room was almost next to the busy road and we were worried the noise would be a problem with our sound-sensitive family, however, it was not an issue at all. The room was very quiet and we never noticed the Walgreens or Home Depot unless we left the resort. Pool areas were great, though we all thought the pool was too bright after dark (big spotlights on!) and closed about an hour too early. Landscaping is incredible! Wonderful walkways all through the resort. Very nice tiki bar that was an even nicer place to have breakfast. Highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Traveled the country...this was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: beckles130
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Parrot Key Resort in Key West. This was one of the best vacations of my life. There are jet skies on property that we rented...had a blast. Room was VERY clean. Beds were super nice/soft-had a very good night's sleep. Staff were friendly and attentive. There are FOUR pools to enjoy with a cafe at the main pool for breakfast and lunch. I miss the place already!! We will definitely be staying here again and again. We're already planning a trip back to Parrot Key next summer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, renovated, clean, super comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailor07
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here especially considering the price. We got a 2 story condo room even though we didn't pay for that. There was an entire bedroom and bathroom upstairs that we didn't even use and a living room outside of our bedroom. The place was immaculate. Although the maids service could really be improved. They didn't come in during the day until around 5...which is exactly the time of day we are always back at our hotel relaxing and getting ready for dinner. Not to mention showering! They probably saw my husband naked at one point. When they would finally come in, they would often leave way too many regular towels but not give us our beach towels back. But anyway, that seemed minor all in all. The bathroom was very nice and the beds....oh my....SO comfortable!! The only reason I gave Parrot Key 4 stars is because of they are not located near a lot of things and maybe don't have the best view. But even though we couldn't see the water, we had 2 porches and the back view was beautiful with lush palm trees and flowers overlooking the pool. There are 4 pools and we enjoyed hanging out by those in the afternoon and getting a drink at the bar. (Make sure you bring your ID. The bartender refused to serve me even though I'm 30!) We had a car but chose not to drive in the evenings since we knew we would be drinking. Plus parking at night down by the main area is about $20. A cab was about $10-12 each way.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled”
Reviews.Author: LOVETA2011
Reviews.Content: After our stay in Key Largo at what was supposed to be a wonderful place and wasn't, we were absolutely thrilled with Parrott Key. It is convenient to everything as long as you are not wanting to stay in downtown Key West. There is a mall nearby, a drug store, a grocery store, all within walking distance. You don't need to leave the resort to see a beautiful sunset. Each unit is very private and beautifully kept. The surroundings are lush and well tended. There are three pools, one with a bar and breakfast/lunch service. The service was great throughout the resort. There is also a workout facility. The drive to Key West is short and there was planty of parking available so the fact that the resort was not "downtown" was not a drawback for us. I would definitely return to Parrot Key. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key is a great value”
Reviews.Author: briremo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and was very happy with the beds and the rooms were spacious. The grounds are lavishly landscaped and impeccably maintained just like the web photos. ONly complaints are the parking (manageble), the internet was a tad slow and the pools need chillers installed as the water was quite warm. Still, the stay was fantastic, the beds and pillows were comfortable and we felt like the accommodations were worth more than the rate we paid with a 4 week advance reservation. Our teenage boys loved the grille food and the adults found the drinks to be poured on the heavy side (yay!). You'll be very happy with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pools and landscaping, comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Lucha11
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom suite was huge. Hotel felt brand new. Beautiful swimming pools - loved that they were salt water! Next door to a 24 hour Walgreens - very convenient. Maybe take taxi from hotel to Duval St. and not drive there because parking is awful in that area. Loved the ambiance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: OlavSundquist
Reviews.Content: We spnt a weekend there to discover Key West. We had a 2 bedroom suite, it was modern, clean and very comfy. The highlight were the 4 pools, in between the palms. They are designed very different from normal hotel pools, much more individual and personal. The bar at the pool had a small selecton of food for breakfast. Great were the drinks at the bar.
