The service was nice, but given that it is a resort with no restaurant etc there are only few things which need service - for example there is no room service. The only downside was that the bar closed at 8 pm - definitely too early.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jjimjake
Reviews.Content: We had 2 couples in a three bedroom cottage, we wanted a full kitchen. The place was great. Its quiet and laid back very, very clean. Also you can rent Jet Ski's right at the resort they offer a $99.00 per jet ski tour around the entire island a must!!!! It is a 10 minute drive to duval street no problems parking once down there $10 for the whole day. If you are going to be partying the cab ride runs around $15 each way. We would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: TamsinC
Reviews.Content: We booked a garden room cottage, it was a 3 bedroom self catering cottage right by the pool, there are 4 pools and 2 bars/cafe's to choose from. All the staff are friendly and the whole resort is spotless clean. There is a shopping center opposite the resort which we used to get food for ye apartment so we didn't have to eat out all the time. We did go to the nearby beaches but they are man-made and not that exciting, they are quite a trek too, the nearest beach is a good 2 mile walk which is hard in the heat Luckily the resot had everything we need so we were happy by te pool and most days we had it to ourselves. The sunset boat trips were good too, dolphin watching was brilliant fun. Taxis are reasonable and probably the cheapest way to get down to Duval street where all the main shops and bars are.

Reviews.Title: “OK.”
Reviews.Author: LHH_7
Reviews.Content: The resort was slow in check-in and had completely inadequate parking. It was mostly clean, excepting the hair in the shower. Reasonable compared to Key West rates for 3 bedrooms, but ridiculous in terms of water view (next to none), inconvenient to walk through like a rabbit warren to get to the room. All pools close at sunset except one which is only open till 10. Very, very closde quarters, all rooms tight and small. It was only fair.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip and we will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Mscrete2
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key was everything you see on the website. The resort was very clean and perfect rooms. We are already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Weekend !”
Reviews.Author: Costacoast
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Parrot Key in Key West and it was great! This resort has 3 pools and lush grounds everywhere. Mindi at the bar was very nice and made our pool experience fun. I would like to say the management at this hotel was very impressive to me. I had a concern with my debit cara and the front office supervisor assured me that her collogue will follow up with me the next day. I didnâ€™t have to call the hotel, Sean the manager called me and took care of it all. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulouse place!”
Reviews.Author: pbanderson
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Parrot Key! Our condo was incredible, right on the Gulf, with beautiful water views. The staff was great. The pools, tiki bar & grounds were beautiful and everything we had hoped for. We will be recommending Parrot Key to all of our friends visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in key west!”
Reviews.Author: army8183
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 5th to 7th. We were absolutely pleased with the hotel. The rooms were big and clean, very comfortable. The layout was great and the pools were well placed. Having 4 pools made it easy to choose one that wasn't crowed. It was nice to have a Walgreens right next door. Having the hotel away from downtown was nice not having to deal with all the pedestrians and traffic. Overall it was an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families that do not want to experience Key West”
Reviews.Author: tracythall1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked based on the photos and website. it sounded like paradise for my in laws. The rooms were clean, spacious and had their own porch. The porch on the back had a sandy back area which was great for small children that love to play. The pool area was nice and clean and the pool was not overcrowded. The Pros: the rooms were spacious, clean, the bathrooms were spacious. The resort was quiet and neatly laid out. The Cons: the beach mentioned on the website does not truly exist, the housekeeping does not have very good timing (the day we were their all day, they did not clean until about 3:00). The location for going downtown for dinner is terrible, you end up paying the resort fee for parking and then parking downtown. They should have a shuttle service or something to make the resort fee worthy.

Reviews.Title: “It was great staying there.”
Reviews.Author: jorgie69
Reviews.Content: Everything was good. From the rooms to pool, it was all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Key West... I'll be back with friends...”
Reviews.Author: cash_flo_41
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Parrot Key Resort Hotel for 2 weeks. Two of the best weeks of my life. These rooms are highly affordable. Saying that you get more for your money is a great understatement. The rooms are comfortable and very large. I looked the hotel up online and books over the phone. Once I arrived, I was shocked at how nice the property grounds were and even more shocked at how beautiful the rooms are. The balconies are also great with plenty of room as well. The Hotel/Resort has a convenient laundry room and gym. There are 4 pools that are separated by beautiful garden with palm trees as the highlight. There is a Cafe called the Blue Cafe located by the main pool that serves breakfast and lunch. They also have a full bar as well. The food is mostly Paniniâ€™s for breakfast and lunch and they are delicious. There are water sports available as well at the Hotel/Resort and also others you can book through the hotel. Everybody that worked at the hotel/resort was very kind and helpful at all times. The hotel manager is also a gentleman. It was always nice and peaceful during my entire stay there. My room had two balconies, a very nice sized living room, a bed room with a full bathroom and a bedroom up stairs with a half bathroom. There were three flat screen TVs in each room with DVD players in all of them. Each room had cable. The bed and sheets were so comfortable and got caught up on so much needed rest. Sometimes I didn't want to get out of bed because they're so relaxing. I would recommend this Hotel/Resort for couples, families or single men and women.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Awgranger
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were unable to check in immediately, however were notified by cell phone when our room was available (~2:45 pm). We reserved a 2-bedroom garden view suite and were extremely pleased with our accommodations. Our suite had charming seaside cottage decor with authentic-looking prints and artwork that immediately put us in Key West frame of mind. Each bedroom had a connecting bathroom with granite countertops and tile floor. Soaps and shampoos were above average. Bedding was plush and extremely comfortable. First floor consisted of a large entryway with mirror and coat/towel rack and stairs. Second floor contained a separate bedroom and living room. Living room had a very nice large flat-screen TV. Additional amenities included a counter area with coffee pot and in-room small refrigerator (empty). Second floor bedroom and living room had balconies -- view from bedroom was of the tropical lush garden surround the pools. Nice Adirondack-style chairs provided a great place to drink a glass of wine in the evening. We used the gym one day and found it to be very nice and well-stocked, though somewhat small. There are 5 pools on the grounds, each surrouned by feng-shui type foliage and sculptures. Each pool is connected through a series of arbors or gates consisting of "ancient" carved wood or tropical palms and plants. Noise does not travel from pool to pool. Chairs are well padded and umbrellas are plenty. No need to get up early to grab your chair for the day. Tiki bar is fine, though there are better dining options elsewhere on Key West. Resort is located less than 2 miles from Duval. Not ideal for walking. We drove into town each day and walked to the main drag. Resort is close to shopping and dive shops.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticTravelLover
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is PHENOMENAL! We had room 19A facing the inter-coastal with a walk out to heavenly sand path and lush gardens! There are FOUR pools thay enveloped by secret tropical gardens. The famous Duval St is just a 5 minute drive away as is Southernmost Point. I highly recommend this quaint resort - just be sure to get a room with a view as it seems there are a few rows that face the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort -- Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ebbbush
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short trip to Key West, Florida. We had never been before, but after doing some research on line (through Trip Advisor), we decided to stay at Parrot Key. It is a beautiful resort,! We travelled with our two sons, who are 18 and 24. We all thoroughly enjoyed this resort, as well as our stay. We stayed in the 3-bedroom unit, which worked out great. Our unit had a full kitchen, so we were able to purchase coffee, water, etc. -- so we could make breakfast and carry cold water with us wherever we went, instead of having to spend more money. The staff were very friendly and helpful, whenever we had questions. The last night the people staying in the next unit arrived late, with several small children. They were apparently excited and not well supervised, so they were running up and down the stairs making lots of noise. I called the Security office and the Security person arrived within 5 minutes. She knocked on our door to talk to us first, addressed the people in the unit next door, then reported back after she spoke to them. She told us to call if we had any other issues, which we did not. The resort is located on it's own, away from the hustle and bustle of downtown, which we really liked. Everything was within close proximity. The units are bright and cheer and there are four, relatively small, swimming pools. Conveniently, there is a Walgreens right next door. I would stay here again, we had a GREAT trip!

Reviews.Title: “PK Exceeded in every way”
Reviews.Author: Aeroplay
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best value I've found in years. The grounds are absolutely lush.

Reviews.Title: “theÂ intelligent management of the hotel was obvious”
Reviews.Author: Porscheturbodriver
Reviews.Content: I am a commercial airline captain. I was in the Florida Keys on official aviation business. Due to the nature of my job, one that will not tolerate mistakes. I had a true appreciation for Mr. Bob Bauersachs and his obvious level of intelligence. During my entire stay, theÂ intelligent management of the hotel was obvious.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly new and roomy. On our own when AC broke at 4 AM. Front desk girl RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: univac123
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West, which was very beautiful place. We made lots of great memories with our children. Ate great food, great tours. Would recommend Fury excursions only. Room placement that was requested, when room reservation was placed 3mo in advanced, was not fullfilled. Our room was overlooked and not cleaned 1 day of our stay. Our second night stay our AC stopped working at 4AM, called front office. Voicemail said office closed, and offered no emergency contact or any other numbers to call for help. Food at pool area, not impressed for the cost! Front desk girl, was rude to Elderly guest that was in line in front of me. And he was just asking for directions to his room?

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: eyleras
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key for a family vacation to Key West. It was an excellent bargain being half the cost of the Waldorf which was the other property we considered. The free parking and internet were a bonus. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the property just beautiful. I loved the fact that it was quiet and away from the main streets of Key West. There were well-kept gardens and pools on the grounds. The sculptures and art pictures throughout the property were awesome. If I had to be nit-picky, the beds were squeaky--but truly that is my only complaint about this hotel during our stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lush and sophisticated beach chic resort”
Reviews.Author: avitalee
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Parrot Key for the first time and absolutely loved it! While it is located off a busy street you would certainly never know it once you enter the property. The resort is private and relaxed, the grounds are lush and everything is impeccably maintained. There are three beautiful pools, each nestled among tropical foliage and very serene. The staff is extremely friendly and professional--Rhonda greeted us at reception and provided excellent recommendations. The rooms are beach chic with tile floors, vibrant but minimal furnishings and cool white linens. Each has its own porch--ours overlooked white sand and had a beautiful water view. A few things to note--the hotel is not right downtown, so you'll need to drive/cab about a mile; there's not much of a swimming beach on the property; the cafe serves very basic breakfast/lunch fare only, but it works if you just want a quick bite and good coffee before setting out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: annemarieklumb
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits on one of Key West Channels, and has a great water view and surrounded by lush landscapes plus it's own man made sandy areas that give to the place a wonderful feeling. Beautiful Key West Victorian Architecture, clean, well kept, nice ambient, family friendly! I was advised that it was not a beach hotel by the manager, so we where hesitant to travel 8 hours and find a place that would not be to our standards. But when we arrived we realized that the pictures that are on the internet are absolutely what you get when you arrive, a great hotel! Plus you are received by wonderful kind warm hearted people! Who really make your stay absolutely fantastic! From the Manager Sean, to the front desk, the lady's at the pool restaurant (the manager who's name I forgot and Shelley) and the Lady's that do the room service are the sweetest people! Another plus is that the hotel is located at the entry of Key West and nor very far from downtown. The hotel is close enough to travel to downtown , but also far enough to be at a very peaceful and enjoyable corner at the Island with total peace and no traffic next to you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in the Slow Lane”
Reviews.Author: BamaRowersMom
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful place for a get away. Our room was very nicely appointed, the pools were beautiful, the staff was friendly and accommodating. We arrived early, and they graciously allowed us to store our luggage for the day. They even arranged to have a scooter delivered to us there at the resort. As to the location, it is 10 minutes by scooter to anywhere on Key West. Granted you are not at Mallory Square, but that's okay. The bed was a big, comfy, fluffy cloud, and if we didn't have other things we wanted to do in Key West, we could have slept all day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, poor restaurant accommodation, less than ideal location”
Reviews.Author: rlwillis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Key West/Parrot Key. The room at Parrot Key was really nice, spacious, and had a generally relaxing atmosphere. Others' comments that there is no meaningful beach access are spot on. We selected the location in part for the price and in part due to the high reviews here on TripAdvisor. In hindsight, it may have been worth it to pay the higher rates for one of the more "convenient" hotels (though we did appreciate grocery store and 24 hour Walgreen access as we were traveling with an infant). We took a chance on the eating spot (it couldn't really be classified as a restaurant) on the premise. It was a gross waste of money. The bagel spot is good and IHOP is down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: VinceBuckley
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I decided to go to Key West for a mini-vacation in May 2011 without our kids; we stayed at Parrot Key Hotel & Resort. We arrived and checked in with Alma Espinoza. Alma was very professional and courteous. Alma asked us what are plans were, if we wanted any recommendations and was very helpful. She booked our restaurants, made suggestions on sight seeing and even gave us an upgrade on our room. It was so nice to have someone so helpful. The hotel and rooms were very nice, we enjoyed the 4 different pools; it made it much more private and perfect for just the 2 of us and the room was amazing!! The location is not in the heart of Key West, but getting downtown was a $12 cab ride or a 15 minute bike ride which made it very easy. Thanks Alma for making our second honeymoon an enjoyable experience Tammy & Vince Buckley Oakville, ON Canada

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and wonderful. Hopefully we will be back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: rv5296
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. Was surprised at the front desk when we were upgraded to a cottage. There were 3 stories, 4 bathrooms, balconies on 2 out of 3 bedrooms and full kitchen!!! Leave your DVD player at home... the TV's already have one. Sandy beach (no water) right outside the living room. We will never stay anywhere else when we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The resort was beautiful and the staff swept us off our feet.”
Reviews.Author: vict0ria_renee
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I stayed at the Parrot Key Resort this past May. Our room was colorful, clean, and comfortable. The pool areas and paths throughout the grounds were gorgeous and well-kept. More importantly, the entire staff was friendly and helpful. (In particular, Rutanya and Kristen) I believe it was Rutanya who handled our check-in. Not only was she professional and courteous, but we had a few good chuckles with her as well. Her genuine smile and warm personality made us feel right at home. I wish she was one of my employees! I highly recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay at Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: SONOMO99
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The resort is beautiful. The landscape is peaceful and refreshing. Very Key West style. Extremely friendly staff. Would have loved to stay longer. Hopefully will be back soon. There are four small pools at the resort. There is also a Cafe onsite. Can't comment on the Cafe or the pools because we did not use them.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: NCFamily5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in the garden view, 3 bedroom cottage. The cottage was just awesome (clean, modern, very roomy, comfortable). We were early for check in, but they called us when the room was ready. As mentioned in other reviews, the proximity to Walgreens, groceries, etc. is actually a big plus. The landscaping gives a feeling of seclusion both for the resort and each cottage. We knew ahead of time that the hotel was not within walking distance to the historic district so this was not an issue for us (though it is a little bit of a pain to deal with Key West parking/traffic.) Overall, we highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave!”
Reviews.Author: xmaschik
Reviews.Content: Don't let that Walgreen's near the entrance fool you - the resort is beautiful and totally secluded - a real paradise. And...the Walgreen's turned out to be a great convenience! The resort rooms/facilities were wonderful and the staff was awesome. We'll definitely be back - and hopefully that will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: thenoseSarasota
Reviews.Content: brand new and well worth the money people were great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful Pools, Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AllPro44
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Suite with Garden View, for 3 nights. Room is very nice, with updated features including granite countertops, upgraded bed and nice bathrooms. Room had 2 balconies, one front and back off the master bedroom. The living area was nice with couch, chair, flat screen television and "wet bar." There are 4 pools on the property and none were ever overcrowded. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. We will definitely stay here again when we return. 2 tips: 1. Ask for the "B" room - it is upstairs and you won't have to hear your neighbors. 2. Parking can be tough to find after about 4 or so, so if you can take a taxi or rent a moped if you will be out and about.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: red1sj
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and comfortable. Conveniently located away, but not too far from the hustle bustle of Duval and Mallory square it provides a tranquil and picturesque place to relax. We stayed in a 3 bedroom cottage overlooking the water. There is NO water access from this property even though they advertise a "beach". They do however have 4 gorgeous (saltwater) pools with plenty of shade and a cafe with a nice menu & bar. This property is a short driving distance to all the activity in Duval St. & Mallory Sq. Parking was easy. You can rent bikes, scooters and adventure from here & there are plenty of amenities within walking distance i.e. Walgreens, restaurant etc. Our cottage was very clean and comfortable. Landscaping was beautiful. Gym was small but user friendly. We LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: beckeboo
Reviews.Content: I was down in south Florida in January with my husband and his parents and at the last minute we decided to drive down to Key West. So we quickly booked a room at the Parrot Key online before we left. We arrived quite late as anyone who's driven through the Keys knows it about a 4 hour drive from Miami to Key West. When we arrived we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, and it was amazing! Very clean, comfy beds, gorgeous en suite bathrooms, and nice views from the terrace. There is no beach at this hotel but with the beautiful tropical setting that surrounds the four pools who cares... I would definitely stay at Parrot Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet, clean, and laidback spot - will be back.”
Reviews.Author: MBruck
Reviews.Content: I did my homework on places for our first stay in Key West. I was initially attracted to the big name hotels, but wanted something a little more quiet and off the beaten path. Parrot Key was perfect - it's practically new, very clean and well kept, and just outside of the busier downtown area (a plus vs. the Westin & Hyatt hotels I was considering). The rooms are very large and well appointed (i.e., ceramic tile on floors, granite counter tops, stainless appliances in full kitchen, large flat screen TVs, etc.). There are multiple pools and a nice bar area at the larger pool by the reception area. The beds are very comfortable - nicer than my bed at home I have to admit. :) I have NO complaints about this resort - it was exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PartyPlanning
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort and so close to all kinds of goodies. The trip to town is very short We had bikes delivered and rode bikes all day and it only took about 15 minutes to get to the buoy! There is a Walgreens next door along with several eating places and a grocery store. We had a 2bedroom that was very spacious. One bedroom downstairs and another up stairs both with bathrooms. The pools are great and it looks very tropical all around the property. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & will be back”
Reviews.Author: Tracyb68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! We rented the 3 bedroom cottage. It was amazing. 3 couples, each room had a queen or king with their own bathroom. Plus a 1/2 bath down stairs off the kitchen & living room. Very Spacious & Clean! Definately worth the money we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lush landscaping and relaxed vibe on top of great value.”
Reviews.Author: PRicanAce
Reviews.Content: Our Parrot Key 3 bedroom suite had to accommodate 5 adults and 2 young children. It did so very well. This place is huge and comfortable. The kitchen is well equipped and we made breakfast and some meals almost every day. TV's in every room and free WiFi allowed for plenty of entertainment and connectivity. The kids loved the sandy area right behind our cottage for them to play. The resort is so beautifully landscaped you'd think it's been there 100 years. It's a joy to walk around its paths. Instead of one huge busy pool they have created 4 smaller pools with lush landscape so you never need to feel crowded. The pool areas feature art work and antique doors. It's really a sight to see. The staff came in every day to tidy up, change towels and empty trash. The front desk staff was extremely helpful but we are very self-sufficient and didn't need much. The fitness room is small but you can get a work out in. There are 2 - 3 groceries stores within 1/4 mile and a Walgreens you can walk to. You have to drive into town about 1 mile but there are no places in town that provide this much space and value. It's too bad that one reviewer was complaining about no beach. Guess what? Key West is a rocky island with no natural beaches. The few you might see are man-made! Give Parrot Key a chance, especially for a family vacation. Plenty of room to stretch out and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will stay when we come to Key West.”
Reviews.Author: dawnmckenzie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are always clean. The gardens and the pools are absolutely beautiful...so nice that you could spend your whole vacation just at the resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Kepster1980
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with spacious nice rooms in a beautiful garden with pools. Clean and comfortable. The location is not the best as you have to take the car to go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianafromShropshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and thought it was great! We particularly liked having our own front and back doors, and porch area for sitting out. The plants and bushes made it very private. Despite some of the reviews, we found that the rooms were cleaned every day and the towels changed. My only issue was that the mattresses were quite creaky!

Reviews.Title: “really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: yum64
Reviews.Content: the pool areas (4) are great. nice,quiet and beautifully landscaped. comfortable bed. room clean and cozy. just to let you know there is no smoking on the property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: claudiasil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times on small getaway weekends and we love it! The rooms are awesome! Clean, open, bright, and make you feel like if you are staying in a top luxury resort without the price tag!!!! It is has everything to give you the Key west feel.... We have stayed at both the regular rooms and the 2 bedroom suite. The kids prefer the regular rooms because they don't like to feel isolated on the top floor by themselves. I love the bathroom soaps, lotions and shampoos... definitely not the cheap kind hotels usually use. They even have good wgp coffee. Down side to some might be the distance from Duval street. It is on the gulf side and doesn't really have a beach area like you would expect. It is a little far from all the action, although if you are traveling with kids it might be just what you are looking for like us.... there is a Walgreens right next door which is great when you have little ones. we rent a golf car and that becomes our main source of transportation. the main road to the hotel is a little busy but drivers give the golf car users their space and its ok.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: nancyzelenock
Reviews.Content: The reservation staff were great, front desk staff was great. Rooms were amazing. Pools and outside tiki bar were clean and the staff was great. We will definitely plan on staying here for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Experience!”
Reviews.Author: chewiekw
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Sean and the staff at Parrot Key for making my Key West wedding a perfect experience. We needed a late checkout and we were stressed out that we would have no place to go before our wedding, and Sean called me personally and side don't worry i will take care of it. He said you don't need any stress on your wedding day! As far as the resort itself goes, its perfect!!! It has a unique feel that makes you feel you are staying in old town. This is not your average resort....Sean thanks for taking care of our bar tab too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzka32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here spring break 2011. Granted, it's far from the excitement of Duval St. but it was everything we were looking for! The "rooms" are actually townhomes. Our family had plenty of room to spread out and each kid had their own room with a tv AND bathroom. The only drawback was the room on the third floor was a little sparsely decorated and had no ceiling fan and got quite warm. There was even a kitchen which came in quite handy if you don't want to eat out for every meal or preferred to save some money at cocktail time as the drinks from the bar add up. There were 4 separate, smaller pools instead of one big pool. This was good because you can move from pool to pool. They only have one restaurant which served a limited menu for breakfast and lunch and drinks until late afternoon. I think an adult only pool would have been beneficial as well as poolside service. If you have small children or looking for somewhere quiet, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Girlfirend Getaway Memorial Day Weekend 2011”
Reviews.Author: DaynaMarie9160
Reviews.Content: I only wish that there were more Singh resorts. I had a 2 bedroom unit overlooking the pools. The grounds were lush and rich and had a true Key West feeling! We loved having wine on our balconies! Even though it is not in walking distance to Duval Street whe had no problem parking. We were quite surprised that on a holiday weekend parking was not a problem. Love Love Love Parrot Key!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical retreat in Key West”
Reviews.Author: vinandjuice
Reviews.Content: Everything at this resort was amazing! Cottage type builidings are surrounded by lush tropical gardens with pathways connecting. There are 4 pools, though we spent our time at the main pool because of the bar. It was wonderful being poolside with a cool frozen drink! We stayed in a Garden King Suite which was clean and fresh and well appointed. Bed was super comfortable, furnishings were modern and bright. We had two balconies that we used every morning to drink our coffee. I needed an iron and did not see one in the room. We called the front desk and they delivered an iron and ironing board to us immediately. Definitely would recommend and we will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to staying again in the future”
Reviews.Author: Kcarb
Reviews.Content: Very clean and had a very keysy feel both inside and out. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mimi15DeKalb
Reviews.Content: Not near Duval street. About a mile or so away. However, easy to get there by car or cab. We liked that the resort was away from the crowd. Very nice room and great pools. Really enjoyed our stay. If we were ever to go back to Key West we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: whhbjh
Reviews.Content: We were six family members in Key West for a wedding. We stayed in one of the 3 bedroom suites. The rooms were well appointed. The first level had a fully equiped kitchen, dining area and living room. Each bedroom had its own bath and flat screen TV. The grounds are lushly landscaped. Staff is friendly and helpful. All in all, a lovely place. We will stay there again on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - with a twist...”
Reviews.Author: thvid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parrot for 3 nights. We booked the room several month in advance, and got an early bird discount (20 % off) - at least that's what we thought. A couple of days before arrival prices were checked, and we were surpriced so see that the price was 40$ lower than our (special early bird rebate) price! We mentioned that upon check-in but it was not until we demanded a discount or something else that we were upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite (to a price that we original paid...). The rooms were nice and very well kept - no critisism there! Free wi-fi, nice pools (although it would have been nice with a childrens pool instead of 4 almost identical pools!). Agree with some other comments, that the pictures of the "beach" gives the wrong impression and that this is definately overselling the resort. Also the 25$ resort fee is strange...why not just include that in the price??

Reviews.Title: “Pre Memorial Day Vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: ErikAlv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key for 1 week. It was my wife and two kids and my parents. We stayed in a 3 BR with a beautiful Sunset view. The apt was all brand new. Granite Counter top and SS appliances in Kit. Nice new Flat Panel LCD in each room and Living Room. The back opened to a nice sand covered area for laying out in sun and kids to play in sand. There is a sunset bridge where I took lots of Pics. There are 4 pools and they are heated. They were not too deep and had walk in stairs for kids to sit and swim from. The resorts was within walking distance of Walgreens,CVS and a Windixie Supermarket. There is a Publix Supermarket it is better stocked and nicer than WinnDixie it about 2 lights away. The poolside bar and restaurant is OK for adults but lacked a menu for standard meals and kids stuff. We ended up going to Wendy's down the street for reliable Chix Nuggets for kids. The hotels is away from the Duval Street party scene but the island is so small only takes a few minutes by Cab.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! A definate must!! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CharlesandCharlie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week family holiday to Disney in Florida. We decided to visit the Keys for 2 nights and booked this resort. We paid $288 and it was a true delight when we arrived at our wonderful, clean 2 bedroom apartment. The buildings are designed like minature wooden cottages in amongst trees and flowers and surround 4 swimming pools. A lovely relaxing resort and within a short distance from the centre of Key West. I would recommend couples, families and groups to stay here. We had a separate lounge area with sofa's and fridge plus a 42" plasma tv on the wall. In fact their was a 32" plasma with cable TV and on demand TV in each bedroom. We had an ensuite in each room (large with bath and separate shower cubicle). Both rooms had large king size beds and were decorated in light & modern decor. Very high spec. A jewel in the crown in all and the Reception staff were overly friendly and helpful. Book your stay now!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Reyna27
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to the Keys in years and I was skeptical as to what resort to stay in because I was with my children and I didn't want to be in a location that was too hectic or close to the bars in Duval street. I also didn't want to be far from the beach and of course far from all the activities. So when I found this resort and I saw all of the other fantastic reviews, I figured I'd give them a chance. Might I add I was NOT disappointed. As soon as my 7 year old and I walked in, we were pleasantly surprised and thrilled with how beautiful the cottage was. It's more like a New York style townhouse with three floors of blissful beauty. The rooms are rather comfortable. The kitchen fully equipped. The balconies (all three of them) VERY spacious and all with gorgeous views. To top it off, the location of this resort is superb. It's right down the road from Publix, right next door to Walgreen's, and a K-Mart across the street.... and any mother with 3 children knows how important it is to have access to these stores. Moreover, as soon as I walked in to check in, I was greeted by an inviting, friendly staff who was extremely knowledgeable of the current activities in the area. Once again, this was a remarkable resort. 5 STARS all the way. In fact, we plan on booking my birthday at the Marathon Resort.

Reviews.Title: “I found paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Kurzurlauber0711
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely beautiful! The landscaping is immaculate and the accomodations flawless. I received an upgrade to a cottage and felt spoiled and appreciated. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Hotel was just what we needed; a true relaxing, beautiful getaway.”
Reviews.Author: MarieK26
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so beautiful from the soothing colors inside to the lush green outside. We found our rooms perfect. It was wonderful to walk the grounds. My husband and I were at the hotel w/ dear friends. The layout gave us ideal privacy. WE LOVED THE PARROT KEY HOTEL and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You would be CRAZY to rent/ go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Dave57999
Reviews.Content: The title review says it all....!! My wife and i will ""definately"" be back and we will bring all our friends next time too!! We traveled with our adult children 21 & 26 and their respective bf's and gf's. We rented one of the 3 bedroom cottages, so that everyone had their own bedroom and bathroom. The cottage was great had a kitchen and dining room, large family type room and 4 decks! If you are like me, Iread trip advisor before i take any trip. I usually start with the negative reviews as you can often learn some things that you would not otherwise find out until it was too late. Sooo for the sake of giving Parrot Key Resort their just due, and this place was the best, I was going to put this in the 1 star category so "nay sayers' would see this (if you are like me looking there first), but than I found out that it would drive the resorts rating down, and I just can not do that as our stay was that great!!! Ssoooo, I have decided to take excerpts from the "negative reviews" and address them here.... * The reservation guy Dave was great!! Helped us out over the phone and Iwould give him 5 stars. * The manager Bob Bauersachs was better than great - I would give him 7 stars our of 5. * Check in was a breeze, sorry I can not recall her name but she was helpful * There is ""not"" real noise and yes they are located by Walgreens and Home Depot, so what, you have to be located near someone else, come on, this is key west! if you want piece and quiet, and don't want to be located near anyone - rent a place in fiji..! * Coffee is in the room and we had no problems with the tv's and I am "not" a computer geek! * Oh my...! not enough parking?!!??!?!? I had to park in Walgreens three of seven nights, sure did!! When we came home from Duval at 2am or later- ohh and guess what, the walk from Walgreens parking and our room was just about the same distance as our room to one of the great pools that they fabuously maintain - come on get real! Maybe a 150 yard walk - big deal and I have a bad right knee ready for replacement! give me a break here it was NOT far at all as some would have you believe! *The rooms were nothing shy of spotless / immaculate!! The housekeeping staff did an outstanding job in cleanliness...!! and this ""included the bathrooms""...! * OH NO...!, what it is 3 miles to duval...??? get a taxi, spend a buck or better yet, take your rental car as we did , there was ""plenty"" of parking in and around duval street!! We ""never'' had a problem with parking any night - period! You're on vacation, enjoy yourself and stop worrying about this stuff. and guess what, if you get a room down by Duval, you save on taxis and parking, but here you will have plenty of noise, circus atmosphere until late and maybe even some sewage smell...! *Parrot bay has a wonderfull staff, that is more than adequate in size, we saw staff all the time during the day, cleaning, fixing, gardening, bug spraying etc to keep it in the ""immaculate condition"' that it is...!! BRAVO!!!!!!!!!!!! * UH OH... guess what - """it is""" on the waterfront!!! We had a great room that over looked the bay and the resort built a dock to watch the magnificant sunset every night!! The water is not visible from every room but it is from the cottage , which by the way are reasonable priced to boot!!! * Awww, we did not have any privacy on our deck that oversaw the water, but we made friends with the people next door and we had "'plenty of privacy"" in our room. you want privacy to the max, go to an all inclusive and pay an all inclusive price!! * Our cottage had a kitchen and dining room. Great for a quick breakfast or snack. *** what would i suggest to the owners to change - ""3"" very simple things.... 1) I would put ceiling fans in the 3rd floor bedrooms, it does get hot up there and it would help reduce the a/c load and power load. 2) I would give your wait staff at the pool the ability to change to a different station on Serius radio, other than coffee house rock. i did not have a problem with it, but I think island music, jimmy buffet, bob marley, 70's/80's rock or a combination of all. but no deal breaker for me.. 3) Maybe a Teflon or silverstone pan or two for whipping up some eggs in the morning, but again NO deal breaker here! Soooo the bottom line on Parrot Bay.... this place was fantastic...!!! My wife, family and friends will return, I have recommended this place to at least a dozen or more people since we got back less than a week ago. It is clean - actually VERY CLEAN, the pools were great, the grounds were immaculate, the staff was helpful and if I were able to give them 7 stars out of 5 I would...! My hat is off to the owners and operators of this great resort. see you all again next year!! Regards, Dave B

Reviews.Title: “Nice :)”
Reviews.Author: AbbySayers
Reviews.Content: It was much nicer than I expected. A continental breakfast would have been nice, but otherwise the hotel was well worth the money. The set up was more like condos than hotel. The be was super comfortable and I wanted to take he pillows home. A little far from the action of Duvall Street, yet would be perfect if I had a bike. I would stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and Relaxation at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Dairys
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Hotel & Resort delivered the perfect dose of a paradise and relaxing get-away experience! I highly recommend this as the perfect vacation spot for solo travelers, couples, close-family & friends -- and even a business stay for those professionals wanting to work in a stress-free environment, while they are hard at work, but taking time to unwind and relax through-out their day, and getting a wonderful night's rest! The environment around you -- even on a short stay at the Hotel & Resort, will leave you refreshed! Enjoy exeptionally clean & comfortable rooms with beautiful views, choose from 4 pools, have a delicious bite with a refreshing drink, take a stroll through-out the property and feel at ease with the beautiful landscaping and art, walk barefoot or lounge on the lushious white sand -- you name it... It is Paradise and Relaxation at Its best! It will leave you wanting to come back for more -- again and again, just like it does to us as a couple, with family, friends and on business. From check-in to almost not wanting to check-out -- everything about Parrot key Hotel & Resort is exceptional -- The staff through-out, including the friendly & professional accomodations at the Front Desk, the Room Service, the Cafe, which by the way -- the food & drinks served are delicious and unique! When planning your next vacation or short stay consider Parrot Key Hotel & Resort to be your first choice -- you will not regret it! It offers a location close to the famous Duval Street and the fun of the City of Key West, while being away from it all, as if it were an oasis all at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation I have had”
Reviews.Author: Oliver010
Reviews.Content: If you want a laid-back, relaxing vacation, this is the place to go. Very quiet - the best sleep I have had in any hotel or at home. The beds are wonderful. I loved all the room to put clothes and toiletries away so you were not living out of a suitcase. Loved the mirrors - made putting on make-up so easy. If you have an extended family or some couple wanting to stay together - this is a great set-up. Definately had a "Key West" feel. I loved the decor. The bathroom was very roomy - not your typical hotel room bath. Parking got tight towards the weekend but that is absolutely the only negative I could see about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Emptynesters59
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 night stay with my husband. This resort is about 1 1/2 miles from all the hustle and bustle of the Duvall Street area, but it seems like a different world. The grounds are simply lush and gorgeous. The rooms are simple but comfortable -- somewhat sparsely furnished, but more than enough for a comfy stay. The waterfront rooms (where we stayed) open right onto a beautiful mini-beach on the gulf. A coconut tree was right outside the door! The pools -- FOUR of them -- are somewhat small, but the chairs are comfy and plentiful, the grounds are just beautiful, and there's a poolside bar and restaurant serving much better lunch fare than you'd expect, with reasonable prices. ($12 for a HUGE and delicious panini sandwich). Pluses -- comfortable, beautiful, tropical paradise. Away from the noise and traffic of the downtown area. Convenient to grocery store, drugstore, chain restaurants if you need such things. Affordable for what you get. Minuses -- Too far to walk or bike to the downtown action, and no shuttle service provided. We took a cab one night, but the second night we found a private parking lot that cost less than round trip taxi fare. The front desk closes at 11 - which could be a problem if you arrive home and your keys don't work. (happened to us twice, thankfully during business hours!) Maid service is minimal. They make your bed and empty trash, that's about it. (sign in room says they thoroughly clean every 4 days) Bar closes at 8. And, if you want to be close to the action, this is not the place. Front desk staff not extremely helpful, although not rude. Our check in took much longer than it should have -- some confusion over our reservations, which is never good to hear after driving 8 hours! But all was worked out eventually. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Resort in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Fab-Dad99901
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parrot Key last week. It's a great place with very friendly and helpful staff. Lot's of different room sizes to choose from; I was buy myself so finding a smaller, affordable room, in at a great resort was awesome! Lot's of pools, workout area, laundry...all you need for a great stay in beautiful Key West. I highly recommend staying at Parrot Key!!

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: SunshineTony
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 other couples in a 3 bedroom cottage. The cottage was nicely appointed with a full kitchen. The pool was great and loved the lush grounds. There was so much privacy!!! This was out a bit further from old towne Key West then originally planned but well worth it. Cab's are easy to get and there are so many stores near by which were great! We plan to come back every year and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place... Must See...”
Reviews.Author: Cheff187
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a great place to stay while in KW. This place is plush!! You are very short cab ride away from Duval street, yet far enough away to enjoy the peace and quiet of this amazing resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, could not ask for anything more in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: CaptVaca
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start by saying that if you are looking for a resort where you can have a full bar/restaurant/spa with couples massages/room service/and an actual beach with access, then not only is this not the place for you, but KEY WEST is not the place for you either. There is only one, maybe two resorts/hotels in Key West with actual beach access which are truly not even worth having "beach access." This Resort has everything one needs could ask for who is looking for a true Key West experience. I traveled with my girlfriend(20-23) , brother and wife (20-25) , mother and father(50-60) , and oldest brother (40). We had two of the three bedroom cottages, which were fantastic. The beds were extremely comfortable, we had a full kitchen which was also very nice. The entire place was extremely clean and we had cleaning service each of the 4 days we were there. There are four pools, kind of small but there is four of them and the landscaping is gorgeous. Only one of the pools has a bar but thats really all you need. I dont understand why people want a full restuarant and a bar that stays open late at the hotel if they want a true Key West experience. If you want a true Key West experience, then go explore and experiene all of Key West. There is a Walgreens right next door and a grocery store right across the street which is very nice. The entire staff was very friendly and always said hello. Check in and check out was a breeze. We had a party of 7 so we called for a taxi once, he was there in 5 minutes. Once he arrived, we got his phone number and he was our taxi driver the entire trip, except on his day off we got another driver and he took care of us the whole day. It is only a 5-10 minute taxi drive TOPS to Duval street, also very nice. All in all, this is an amazing resort with beautiful grounds and it is in the perfect spot. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in The Keys!”
Reviews.Author: KeysGuy99
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to be headed to the keys, but even happy to be staying at Parrot Key! Everything about this place screams excellence! From the moment I checked in, I was treated like a VIP. Even having Lunch at the Cafe Blue was outstanding (and tasty!). The property itself is breathtaking, and the cleanliness of the place is compared to none. The rooms are immaculate and so comfortable! Great job Parrot Key Team!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth119
Reviews.Content: While pleasing in appearance, this very "Key West style" hotel is not for someone who wants to taste Key West. It is billed as a waterfron hotel, which, I guess is not inaccurate in that you see water-just not access it. What stands out about this Singh group hotel is it's miserliness. There is no mini bar, no bath robe, no slippers, no smoking ANYWHERE on premises, no vending machines, no real beach, no room service. Should I continue? Oh, no real resturant , and a bar that stays oopenn until 8 pm. Even the lobby closes at 11pm. If you want to get something to eat, you have to go to the Walgreen's next door. Ditto for smoking. There are complimentary shampoos, conditioners, etc. in each bath-however the bars of soap are miniscule. Only one telephone, next to the bed, and as this hotel boats cottage style accomodations, on 2 levels, it is difficult to have to run into the bedroom when the phone rings, from the living room. What stands out the most, however is the lack of dining facilities. You are a good 20-25 mminute cab ride from all the action on Duval street. That being said, the horel has a snack bar/bar by one of it's 4 pools. Open limited hours, it's menu features on the most basic offering, paninis, dips, chhips, etc. Breakfast is very limited too, if you can get someone to actually wait on you. Expect, yogurt, bagels, fruit, oatmeal. I found it a very spartan menu, not what I would expect from a hotel with 5 stars. The 4 pools are clean and not crowded, however, the towells provided are actually thread bare! You could acttually see through them. Also intresting was that your room was cleaned every 4 days. Trash was emptied daily and fresh towells provided if you ask. Cab service was at a snails pace, even when you placed an order for one in advance.The price was quite fair, considering what you get for your money. Would I return? No. Would I reccomend it to friends or family? No Not unless you just want to kick back and lay by the pool, and order in pizza from across the street. I booked a "couples" massage for my son and daughter inlaw, and was taken aback when the masseur arrived solo and gave one then the other a sports massage. Not at all what the description insinuated. There is no spa, so I have no idea what the photo showing a hot stone massage is intended to mean.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Weekend. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: btimberl
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a more perfect 3 day weekend. From the time my friends and I arrived until we left, everything was amazing. Very friendly, helpful staff throughout the resort. The rooms are extremely nice and very cozy, perfect for a weekend getaway with the girls. The beds were comfortable and having the living area in the room was nice. The landscaping is beautiful, makes laying by the pool very peaceful. Good food and quick service at the Cafe. HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - Great vacation in Key West”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCA
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Parrot Key resort, and had a very good stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were emailed by somebody from the hotel a couple of weeks before our stay, and she helped arrange things for our stay. ROOM - a two bedroom suite - was nice, well maintained, and nice furniture and decor. We had a small but comfortable living room with sofa, chair and TV, a mini fridge, coffee maker and toaster, so we were able to have breakfasts in the room. Balcony off the living room with Adirondack chairs, which we used a lot. On the same level, the master bedroom with king sized bed, TV and nice ensuite bath, and a balcony off this bedroom facing the water. The second bedroom was up a flight of stairs with a queen bed, TV, cathedral ceiling and it's own bathroom. The room was quiet during our stay & we didn't hear anything at night. The pool area and bar close down at sunset, which is good because it's quiet after that. LOCATION - We were willing to stay away from the downtown in order to have the bigger accommodation, which was a good price, booked directly thru the hotel. We walked downtown a couple of times. It takes about 40 minutes, and it's a nice walk, much of it by the water. By taxi, it's about 5 minutes and cost $12. If we had stayed downtown, we would have had more meals there, and so many restaurants to choose from. Near the Parrot Key, we had good meals at the IBIS Resort a short walk away, and Outback Restaurant, and TGI Fridays. There are a couple of Thai restaurants walking distance, but we didn't try them. There are 3 big grocery stores in walking distance, one right across the road, and a Walgreens right next door, open 24 hours was handy. AMENITIES - The 4 pools were nice, and it was nice to have the choice because sometimes families with small kids made a lot of noise, so we could go to another pool. The TIKI bar made good drinks. The water in the pools was a bit warm, and the music a bit monotonous - always the "coffee house" on XM satellite. We went to the Fort Zachary Taylor Beach some afternoons. It's near downtown and it's the beach recommended by locals. There is a guest laundry room at the resort which is free to use. The landscaping is amazing - like a tropical paradise. LIKED MOST - The quality of the resort. Everything seems new. Furniture and decor is good quality. The buildings & landscaping are top notch. The atmosphere is relaxing and laid back. LIKED LEAST - The proximity to downtown. We would have liked to have more dinners downtown, but it was more convenient to eat near the hotel, so that's what we did most nights. However it was a trade off we were willing to make.

Reviews.Title: “three visits and can't get enough of this awsome place love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike10million
Reviews.Content: From the very first time I stayed there on a short pleasure weekend I feel in love with the resort. I was looking to get away to a tropical place not far from my home in Fort Lauderdale and I found it. Relaxing in the pool, working out or sipping cocktails in one of the three great salt pools took me where I wanted to go to peace and tranquility yet only three hours from home.... I have been back now two more times and it's becoming my home away from home. I hghly recommend the resort and all of the staff memebers Sean was the best ask for him when making your reservation..... go and enjoy stop reading now... trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne1717
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Hotel and Resort is the perfect place to stay in Key West. It's a quick ride to the hustle of Duval Street but is a beautiful place to stay, relaxing, 4 salt water pools, and the most gracious staff ever! Close to everything you would ever need, but this resort offers the quiet you might want for a getaway. Cafe Blue is the ideal place for breakfast, lunch, and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for 'the fly in the ointment'.”
Reviews.Author: Kake0
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is an attractive resort complex, landscaped with lush tropical growth. It has four separate swimming pools which allow you to always find one that is tranquil. Our nicely decorated and clean room, a King Garden Suite, was exceptionally spacious compared to typical hotels. The living room had a balcony overlooking the parking lot and the bedroom had a balcony overlooking the garden pool area. The latter was our preference for the sunset cocktail hour. Downtown Key West is a busy place, so it was a pleasure to rent bikes and cycle into town just 10 minutes away, and not have to face parking problems. The only fly in the ointment was at the patio poolside cafe â€“ â€œCafe Blueâ€� which offered continental breakfast, light food and evening cocktails. It could have been much nicer but for the wait staff. In spite of the simple menus, they seemed to have no urgency or sense of priority and kept you waiting, especially if you said nothing. The exception to this was the evening cocktail lady. Ultimately this was not such a problem since there were many restaurants and shops in the vicinity. On the whole we enjoyed our stay very much, everyone was friendly and helpful and there was ample parking. We would stay again and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “okay experience...disappointed in a few things”
Reviews.Author: Blmcnabb
Reviews.Content: First off...Parrot Key is a beautiful resort but I was disappointed in a lot of things. EVERY night we had to park at Walgreens and walk to our room which was all the way at the other end. Extremely disappointed that you couldn't bring your own beverages to the pool...YOU MUST buy from Cafe Blue! It's the keys....come on!! Oh and the kitchen or lack there of was not good! We could barely fit a half gallon of milk in the fridge and at it's max temp...was not very cold! This was our honeymoon and we wish it could have been a little better The cleaning staff was very nice and did a wonderful job! The sunset was beautiful from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: FWTime
Reviews.Content: I went on a girls trip to Key West and we chose this hotel on the recommendation of someone who had stayed there before. We loved it! The gardens and four pools are gorgeous and never crowded. The staff at the little tiki bar was fabulous. Our only complaint is that housekeeping never swept the floors in the room and that we could never get a pool towel. Tip: The hotel is not very close to Duval Street. We rented bicycles and used them during the day (who wants to battle parking anyway?). They'll deliver the bikes right to the hotel. Cabs at night will cost about $13 each way plus tip so bring your cash.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely resort.”
Reviews.Author: sallyc19
Reviews.Content: The property is a little gem and what a great place to make your base for exploring Key West. We had a 3 bedroom house and it was fantastic, we had a great view of the ocean. Our house was in a very quiet and relaxing location on the resort, so very peaceful when watching the sun sink into the sea. The grounds are well looked after, with 4 pools. 3 are really quiet for the adults, with the larger one having a more family atmosphere and Tiki bar. All in all, we had a great holiday and I would recommend this property,

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort is "Paradise" in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: LSea50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with a friend stayed in a 2 bedroom cottage..it was adorable. Having two separate bedrooms with their own bathrooms was great. The rooms were so clean, the beds were extremely comfortable and the outdoor decks were perfect to relax and enjoy looking at the lush gardens and pools. There are four pools to enjoy, each better than the next, so clean and private with excellent soft "coffee house" music in the background. You are less than 2 miles from downtown KeyWest Historical district, which is awesome...plenty of good food and spirits and an awesome sunset. We will definitely be going back to Parrot Key for years to come....it's like being in Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: traveler1307
Reviews.Content: This resort was everything and more then there web site shared. The lush foliage gave you the feeling of being in the South Pacific. All of the staff were helpful and accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown Key West, but quiet and restful.”
Reviews.Author: legoset
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and very private property, yet close enough to downtown Key West to make it easy to see all of the sights. Rooms were spacious, clean and very well equipped including refrigerator, porch, big screen TV and a great bed. All were in working order making our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, relaxing, beautiful resort, missing a few smalls things..”
Reviews.Author: kevkrishark
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with another couple for a 4 night relaxing get away. We have all stayed at tranquility Bay in Marathon, so we wanted to try Parrot Key. It is similar to Tranquility, the plush and beautiful landscaping, quiet walkways, well cared for and manicured property. We stayed in a 3 bedroom "waterfront" townhome. The home itself was very nice, clean, new, lots of light. We were disappointed that our waterfront view wasn't much of a waterfront, basically the canal. The sand outside the back porch was nice, but I guess we were expecting the other side of the resort where the sand was larger and you had better views of the bay. Check in was a breeze. We liked having a choice of the 4 pools, they were all clean and the area was well kept. There were quite a few loud guests, so it was nice to be able to move pools to escape from them! I will never understand why people feel the need to scream at each other across a pool or a patio? :o) Cafe Blue-the poolside bar/cafe was nice. The breakfast service was brutally slow, we actually got up and left one day. The waiter seemed to be very confused by any order or request and got frazzled easily. At lunch it was a bit better. The female bartender was great, very nice and quick. The food was really good, the panini's were awesome, salads were great too! Drinks were good, definitely not watered down! I recommend the cafe blue pink lemonade--yummy! My only complaints/suggestions: 1.)Dont be stingy on pool towels, I get the "green" aspect of it all, but it is annoying. I like resorts that have pool towels right at the pool. Here you received a pool towel per person in your room. If the towel was on the floor when cleaning arrived, they were supposed to replace it, otherwise if it was hanging up you could use it again. Well they never replaced ours. We flagged down someone outside the house and he quickly got us more, but it is just a hassle. We almost went to Walgreens to buy pool towels for our stay! 2.)This resort would do great having a large hot tub, the pools all close at night, it would be fun to have an alternative. 3.) Stingy with the coffee in your room/home. There was one pack of coffee and 2 decafs in our house at arrival, we assumed they would restock with cleaning. They dont. So much for enjoying a cup of coffee on the deck. 4.)Their sunset pier, is not really a pier, it would be nice if they had something a little bigger or someway to truly enjoy the waterfront. There is no beach close by, you would need to bike or drive to a beach, so keep that in mind if you are looking for a "beach" vacation. We knew this going in, but because we loved Tranquility so much, we wanted to give this a try. Also we got the townhome because we thought it would be good to have the kitchen for breakfast or snacks. We didn't really use it at all, there are so many food options in Key West, if we stayed again, I would just get a guest room. I have seen people complain about parking, it really wasn't a big deal in my opinion. We had to park in the overflow at the Walgreens one night, so it took us anextra 45 seconds to walk to our house? We liked having the Walgreens right there, there was a liquor store too! Parrot Key is very pretty, nice and quiet (aside from a few crazy guests) and was perfect for relaxing all day by the pool. The free WiFi was great too, very fast! That being said, we probably wouldn't stay there again as I would rather stay by a resort that has a beach or a place that we could walk to a beach. We do plan to return to Tranquility in Marathon! Key West is a great town that we love coming back to!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor staff.”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolFoodcritics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our holidays around Florida. The hotel was nice and clean and what we expected but the hotel would not cash a traveller cheque nor accept one as payment! The breakfast was very poor, consisting of single serve cereals( complete with plastic container) and the manner of service left a lot to be desired!! The other staff we encountered were equally uninterested in ensuring our stay was enjoyable and overall left us feeling thoroughly dissapointed with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key is a tropical paradise within paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TopDog49
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort is an amazing place. I was concerned when I saw Walgreens and Home Depot next door, but once you enter the resort you are in paradise. Sitting at any of the 4 pools all you see is lush vegetation, flowers, blue sky and sun! Our favorite pool had the Tikki bar. The service was very good. The frozen key lime colada was delicious. My daughters favorite was the mango sorbet served on half a mango. Our room was spacious, quiet and very simply yet elegantly appointed. I particularly like the eco friendliness. They only replace towels when you left them in a heap. When I sat out on the porch to work on my computer it was quiet and comfortable. Even with rooms next door, I was not aware of them. I look forward to traveling back to Parrot Key with my daughters and experiencing a 2 bedroom suite.

Reviews.Title: “All Good!”
Reviews.Author: jcarey3
Reviews.Content: Delightful stay at this resort with family. Great service, loved the property, always a seat at the ( four) pools. Could not have been better. Take rolls of quarters for parking at Duval Street!

Reviews.Title: “A tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mjs0108
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights this past March, and never wanted to leave! Parrot Key is a beautiful, serene resort situated right outside of the busy downtown area of Key West. It's about five minutes driving to Duval Street. I loved how the rooms felt like condos - our's had a living room area with a large flat-screen TV with satellite channels, a full bathroom, a king-sized bedroom with another TV, and two private balconies. All of the rooms surround a courtyard area that contains four small swimming pools, each secluded and separated by lush palm trees. They all have very comfortable lounge chairs and the main pool has a tiki bar. Incredibly relaxing and quiet atmosphere. Waterfront rooms available. Rates were high because it was a busy travel time, but we thought that it was well worth it. This is definitely where we will stay next time we're in Key West. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything seen in the pictures and described on their web-site is true”
Reviews.Author: mamaofgirls
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom cottage and it was very roomy. This place is away from all the noise of Duval street, and there isn't really a restaurant on-site for dinner later in the evening, but it is convenient to grocery stores, and a pharmacy right next door. We had a car, so we were able to come and go as we pleased, but you could also take a taxi anywhere on the island from there. The resort is very well designed for privacy and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular accommodations and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jwglenn
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations, a three bedroom beach cottage, were spectacular, even better than expected. Food and drinks at Cafe Blue were great and staff was extremely eager to please. The only downside to the resort is limited parking on site, but there was plenty of overflow parking next door. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful tropical resort!”
Reviews.Author: JoannaCaroll
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew we were on vacation. Thestaff was helpful, friendly and always smiling. The rooms were large, beds very comfortable and there was no shortage of towels for bath or poolside. The surprise was the porch off the bedroom leading to a white sandy beach right outside the room - the landscaping tropical, the palm trees bursting with coconuts, colorful planters filled with equally colorful flowers. A great place for morning coffee or late night libation. We had breakfast and lunch some days in the poolside cafe; great bar, comfortable group seating and, again, a wonderful staff. Parrot Key is unusually beautiful and the vegetation, colorful and lush. Meandering down the "Lanes" is a must as is visiting all the pool areas. There is special "art work" woven along the scenic pathways which will make children laugh and adults stop to admire the details. I brought home wonderful ideas for my own garden. By day two, we did rent a car. As others have suggested, a shuttle would have been perfect. That said, I think Parrot Key will have to be my destination again. Enjoy the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tiffanychong21
Reviews.Content: We booked the cottage and to our surprise, we have wonderful ocean view, the cottage is so clean and beautiful, lots of spaces, we have guess visit and they all praising how great the set up and how clean the cottage is. Across street is grocery store and Walgreen is next to the hotel, very convenience yet quaint and quiet in the back Highly recommend to anyone that book this hotel, you won't regret

Reviews.Title: “LIKE A RAINFOREST”
Reviews.Author: goodfarm
Reviews.Content: This is my fist trip to Key West. I'm an outdoors man from New England and I really appreciated being in a setting with so many large and lush trees. The Hotel feels like a rainforest. The overall cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. When I retired to my room it was very quiet. I've never stayed at a hotel where all the staff talks to you and greets you all the time they were exceptionally friendly. We stayed by the pool and had breakfast there every morning which was a nice slow way to start our day. I can not wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious with Tropical Feel”
Reviews.Author: waterwell_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful landscaping with tropical gardens that surround luxurious pools made my stay even better than an upscale hotel stay. The balconies overlooking the grounds gave me and my family the feeling of staying on a plantation.The interior furnishings were really comfortable and pleasing to the eye. We felt at home -but also so away from it all. The service has been excellent. My room was very spacious with a huge closet and a really comfortable bed. My next visit will include my girlfriend and her kids-because I know they will have a wonderful stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once we decided not to stay in the downtown of Key West, we settled on Parrot Key after doing a lot of research. We were delighted with our stay. We stayed in a 3 bedroom cottage. The cottage was spacious, beautifully decorated and well designed. The resort's amenities -- pools, cafe, grounds were great too. The staff was always available to help us with whatever we needed from taxi's to bikes to great Cuban coffee. As the reviews state, you are not close to downtown, which is both a blessing and a curse. If you're up to it as we were, you'll spend your time biking into town during the day the cabbing in at night as parking is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Dream resort!”
Reviews.Author: Anaana1
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our stay in Parrot Key! Our children loved the pools and the friends they did there. We loved the room, the tranquility, the surroundings... it was a dream place!!!!! We can't wait to visit again!!!! We absolutely recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely relaxing. Want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: nursesar
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The grounds are so pretty. Rooms very clean. The gardens in the middle of the property that surround the 4 pools are just beautiful. There are plenty of pools so we never found them busy. The pool water was warm and the pool size was not small. It was so nice to have a lounge chair outside your own room. The porches step out onto sand as the outer edge of the hotel is surrounded by sand. This is an unique hotel. I highly recommend it. Paradise in the city. It was nice that the hotel is not right in the Duval St. area and away from the bar area. We rode bikes from the hotel one day and it is easy to get to the Duval St area on bike. We had a problem with our room but the staff took care of it promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: zippylizzie
Reviews.Content: This resort is so wonderful it is hard to describe! The gardens are lush and beautiful and the 3 bedroom suite we stayed in had everything one could need. The beds were so comfortable and the whole suite was beautifully decorated in the caribbean decor. I even took pictures of the inside and I never do that! We didn't need to go to the Sunset Pier to see the sunset; we just watched a beautiful one from the back porch over the bay. The only thing missing was beach access and a parrott!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be on a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Cees3072
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a great place to be on vacation, the concept of 4 little pools in wonderfull landscaping is great.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Stay at Parrot Key Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: Travelasalifestyle
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Key West made possible in significant way by extremely kind and attention/help of Mr. Sean Bacon of the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort. Facility is extremely nicely situated with beautiful grounds and magnificient views of the sunset. Wonderfully comfortable, spacious & luxurious. Cannot rcommend highly enough. Would welcome any and every opportunity to stay again or at its sister resort(s) in Marathon....Dale Snoddy, Jacksonville, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “My 50th was fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: CAL5050
Reviews.Content: After looking on the internet for an extended time to locate a hotel that could house 5 to 6 guest, the Parrot Key Resort was the only facility that had a 3 bedroom cottage. I found lots of condo's and houses but not comfortable with dealing with a third party. This property is beautiful and quite. I had a wonderful 50th birthday with family and friends. They also have water sports available on the property as well. The Jet Ski tour is a must. Don't forget your sun screen...

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous resort.........would stay longer next time!”
Reviews.Author: lovevacations07
Reviews.Content: The grounds are unbelievable........well designed, awesome pools, and beautifully maintained. Everyone employee we encountered was very pleasant from the front desk, to the housekeeping staff, and the grounds keeper. The rooms are beautifully decorated, and the beds super comfortable. We had a beach front room........it was awesome! Only drawback to resort is distance from Duvall St., but taxis are readily available, and front desk was more than happy to call for taxi when needed. Would definitely recommend this resort. We were only in Key West for one night, would love to stay longer at the Parrot Key Resort next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: CubsFan1717
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay with another couple, and this property is beautiful. We had a beautifully decorated 3 bedroom condo. The artwork and attention to detail is evident throughout every room. The grounds and the pool areas are unbelievable. The pictures on their website are no exagerration-the landscaping is spectacular. Everything about this place is totally relaxing. There are only a couple small things they could do to improve. One is the maid service. Some days, it was great, but other days, they would forget to leave items. When we called the desk though, they were brought promptly. The other thing that could make this spot perfect is to have a shuttle into town. It gets very expensive taking cabs in for every trip. But other than those very minor improvements, this place is amazing. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away. Beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: msdresch
Reviews.Content: We drove down from West Palm Beach and planned a one day trip in the keys and when we arrived at Parrot key it was a nice surprise at the end of the drive. With three kids and four pools to pick from allowed for a nice cool down time and get ready for a night in town.

Reviews.Title: “The resort is absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Penelope1946
Reviews.Content: My sisters, husband, granddaughter and I spent three nights at Parrot Key when we went to Key West in April and enjoyed every minute. The rooms were spacious, beautifully designed, extremely comfortable and clean. The grounds are gorgeous and the staff friendly. We can't wait to go back! Our visit was much too short.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful resort but poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: ldt43
