Reviews.Content: My family had a beautifully decorated and well-equipped 3-bedroom unit on their sand beach area (no access to gulf). The quality of housekeeping was poor - dirty floors, beds not made properly, kitchen not cleaned, missing supplies. The general maintenence of the unit was not well looked after - loose and falling off knobs and towel bars, quality German knife set not sharpened, Cuisinart thermal coffee maker broken through cleaning in dishwasher, missing cutlery, plates and glasses, etc. Also there is no transport service to downtown Key West which most of their competition provides.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: gkgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. While only 100 feet off of the busiest 4 lane in Key West, while on property you feel secluded from the masses. Everything about this property is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “This place is paradise”
Reviews.Author: passionatetraveler35
Reviews.Content: A nice change from the craziness of Duval street but close enough to go out at night Gorgeous water views, lush tropical foliage, 4 beautiful relaxing pools, beautifully decorated rooms. I didn't want to leave! This place forces you to relax and appreciate your beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I didn't have to leave!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMia42
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we were looking for! A beautiful, laid back resort with helpful staff. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Eileen20
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Great for picking up food at Winn Dixie across the street. Landscaped so you'd never know you were on a main road. Biked the 2 miles to town each day. Bike was only occasionally inconvenient when I was running late. I didn't mind the bike ride into town all dressed up for dinner but then i wasn't there to "meet" anyone. Rode home at 10 or 11pm. I like the empty streets but it may not be for everyone. But I might stay closer next time.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Raquelbrito02
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room was perfect. The pools good. The Tiki Bar is amazing! And, it's near just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and lush respite”
Reviews.Author: viabellisima
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the better part of a week at Parrot Key. It is a short drive from the airport and nestled in a commercial area, though once on the property you would never know it. We were greeted warmly by Booker, whose last name eludes me, upon arrival who assisted us with our bags and routinely showed us the way or offered suggestions for family friendly activities throughout the week. It is a new resort fashioned in the traditional Key West style architecture. The property is absolutely lush with tropical plantings and on occasion upon opening the door to our pool side balcony we would enjoy the fragrant scent of some of these trees and plants. While out on the balcony one can look left or right and it would be reminiscent of looking down a line of Cape May porches (with some jutting forward or back a bit for privacy), however the dense planting of trees and palms provide a canopy of privacy from the accommodations across the property. The furnishings are comfortable and tasteful with the wood pieces being of the shaker style. Since we are a family of five we took a two bedroom suite with the master bedroom, bath, ample living room and front and back balconies on the second level and the second bedroom and bath on the third floor upstairs. There is a wet bar area in the living room with an empty refrigerator under the granite counter in the cabinet (no sink). It should be noted that we were not told prior to arrival (nor did I ask) that our six year old would not have a bed of his own as they do not have a sleeper sofa nor roll-away beds on the property. He was happy as a clam though and didn't mind sleeping with additional linens on the sofa. The third floor bedroom has ample space for a small day bed for a younger child and perhaps the Parrot Key will find a tasteful way to accommodate this in the future. If the reader has a family of five or more than the three bedroom accommodation would be best. We enjoyed our choice of four small pools separated by plantings and connected by hidden pathway with artful free-standing open doorways, three with it's own bathroom and I believe all had an outdoor shower to rinse if needed prior to dining in the outdoor cafe by the larger of the pools or for use as some did for a flight after check-out. The hotel is located a little more than a mile from the center of town and that is where most restaurants and activities are located. We had arranged through the hotel to have bikes delivered. Though after one trip over a bridge with a sidewalk sized passage for pedestrians and bicyclists to share, my husband nearly abandoned the bikes and only after a relaxing supper was he able to attempt the breath-holding experience for the return back to Parrot Key. We promptly arranged to trade in our six year old child's bike for one that attached to an adult bike. The hotel offers a laundry room with four washer dryer units for your use free of charge along with ironing board and irons. Alma walked me over to the building though she easily could have pointed the way. The property is surrounded by mangroves and thus there is not a beach area with access to the water. Our children enjoyed the dock with railings at the back of the property over the shallow water. We did go by bicycle to Fort Zachery and enjoyed the white beaches and green waters backed up by shady pines and picnic area-- though beware of Portuguese man-o-war if you are in shoulder deep water and there is a south wind. The dock is a nice place to view the sunset quietly if you are unable or unwilling to go to Mallory Square. Finally, this resort attracted a range of guests from younger and older couples, families with young children and teens, and groups adult friends traveling together. The layout of the pool area kept everyone in smaller groups in a tranquil setting. The best sound was of quiet adult conversation and children's laughter.

Reviews.Title: “loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: gailmc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 4 sisters in a 3 bedroom condo on the west side where we could watch the sunsets from our patio each night. It was a beautiful , quiet accomodation, great kitchen, lovely quiet pools and pool bar. Less than 2 miles from Duval Street and from the airport. ...very convenient to all of Key West. I would stay here again......the next time I would stay longer! The front desk & staff were helpful and friendly. Need a car to get around town or cab it from this location.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hyde93
Reviews.Content: This was really a great place. We had the 2 bedroom and it was worth it!!! We traveled with 2 teenage boys and they had a room and bathroom all to themselves upstairs. Walgreens was right next door for late night snacks and beverages but you did not see the store from the Hotel. We rented bikes ( cheapest was KeyWestWheels.com) and were able to ride the whole island!! Pools were gorgeous as well as the grounds!! With 4 pools we never had a problem with over crowding. The Cafe was a little expensive for drinks. I would return to this place the next time I'm in Key West. My family really enjoyed it!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort with exceptional rooms and lush landscaping”
Reviews.Author: bigylady
Reviews.Content: We spent our 30th anniversary at the Parrot Key Resort in Key West. We had traveled all day to get there between flights and renting a car and the drive from Miami to the keys. Upon our arrival we were told we had been up-graded for free. We had rented a king waterview suite and we ended up with a 3 bedroom, 4 bath, 3 story townhouse with muliple balconies looking out to the water and a full kitchen/living room. It was decorated with a light and beachy feel. Extremely comfortable beds and very quiet at night. There were 4 salt water pools to chose from, one with a bar/restaraunt. Plenty of chairs by all the pools with music playing all the time. The landscaping was so green and lush that you could barely see the room next door. It's right off the main road but so secluded by all the trees you cannot even see the resort from the road. The only trade off for staying here was it was 2 miles from Duval St. where all the entertainment was. The parking downtown was about $10 a night, well worth it as there was much to do and see. It was a little on the pricey side but an endulgement well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This was paradise”
Reviews.Author: TFergMiddletownMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the staff is great. Housekeeping leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty resort, but odd location and an unhelpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: Asietz929
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is in an odd location, in a parking lot along with Walgreens and Home Depot. That being said, you hardly notice that once you've entered the resort. They have alot of greenery and little walkways that make it feel as if you're in an exotic location. They have 3 or 4 pools... All of which are really nice but happened to be filled with loud little kids when we were there. The Tiki Bar is cute and has a limited food selection but is only open until 7pm. The room itself was really cute and had a little porch with chairs in the sand outside our room. The front desk employee looked surprised and not prepared when we asked her for a sunset cruise recommendation. She also rolled her eyes and said "you're safe ma'am" when we asked if there was security. Aren't those typical questions she should expect...? also, don't be fooled by website pictures - there is NO beachfront on this property. I guess this hotel is nice, but I just expected more for the price. You're better off staying at the Hilton in Key Largo or spending the extra $$ to stay at the Hyatt in Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST RESORT ON KEY WEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: trishtrish5
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with Parrot Key resort. We booked online and we not sure what we would get but we were overjoyed. The pools and grounds are SUPER CLEAN. The staff at Cafe Blue, one in particular (SHELLEY), was super nice. The laundry facility was an unexpected bonus for us, since we had been traveling for days before we arrived AND it was FREE to wash and dry! The staff was very friendly also. Note the people who clean your rooms do not speak English though. Very hard to communicate with them to get what you need. Beware of the homeless people that roam around Walgreens next door. Security will get them out of there if you report them. A+++++ ALL THE WAY. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karole88
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Parrot Key for 1 week last February. The hotel is beautifully laid out and even though you are close to a main road, you feel "away from it all," so to speak. Our room had two large beds (though one of them was rather noisy) and a nice bathroom. We had our own porch that looked west so we could see the sunset every night. The pool areas were lovely- trees and other fauna separated each pool so you felt like you had your own private pool. They were also heated so on the cooler days it was still pleasant to be in the pools. It was about a 45 minute walk into town, but taxis were readily available. The hotel also had bikes to rent. The staff were all lovely and it was really a very peaceful setting. I would recommend this hotel for families, couples, and other vacationers. My only complaints are as follows: -Our key cards were a little iffy- we had to go to the reception 4 or 5 times to get them reset. -We could hear a bit much of what was going on in the room above us. -Though the hotel's website touts its Cafe Blue, it's really better to think of it more as a snack bar. There's no real kitchen, and though they do have hot meals, it's a fairly limited menu. Barely any vegetarian options, and definitely no vegan ones. The staff however are very acommodating and if you get leftovers from a restaurant in town will reheat them for you. -The shower in the bathroom was kind of weird. It was just a shower, no tub, but was rather large- it felt like something was missing in there. It would have been nice to put a bench on the wall opposite the shower head, otherwise it was really just wasted space. The water pressure was also a little lacking. These complaints notwithstanding, we had a lovely and relaxing time at the Parrot Key and would definitely stay there again should we be fortunate enough to return to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, size of rooms, location, lousy beds.”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiseN0W
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Parrot Key Resort. There are 4 pools all enclosed in their own garden area with many lounge chairs. The rooms are spacious, clean, and quiet. The location is great for a morning jog along the sea wall and close to downtown Key West. Our one BIG complaint is the beds. They are incredibly noise every time you move. They are built up off the ground like a slat bed and every turn with one person on the bed or two is NOISY!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a National Hotel Chain!”
Reviews.Author: aspenglengirll
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key website says: King Bed in Master Suite and Queen Bed in Second and Third Bedroom! Well...our Adult Family had to sleep in Full-Sized Beds....hard when you are tall, etc. No "Ceiling Fan" in the THird Floor Bedroom.....the rest of us had to "Freeze" to keep the Third Floor Bedroom Cool! You would save on "energy bills" if their was a fan in all of the bedrooms. Pool towel situation is unbelieveable! Towels do not absorb and you are forever having to call the Front Desk for new ones! Too many cottages/hotel rooms for Housekeeping. Housekeeping arrived after 2:00 everyday and the Front Desk never told us. Stay with a National Hotel Chain and gain your points for future travel! Plus...you would have a "shuttle service" to Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!! Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Clever5Clever
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Totally exceeded my expectations. If you are looking for a place to relax on your Key West vacation, this is the place. Not in the heart of all the Duval activity, but that is what we wanted. The beds are awesome. The 4 pools are awesome. The landscape is gorgeous. Everything was awesome. One thing...if you are not back to your room by early evening, good luck finding a parking spot. That is the only drawback, but still totally worth staying at for a Key West resort. (It seems you can park next door at the Walgreens).

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: alim58
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights over the phone after reading the good reviews. We booked a two room condo. While the main level is decorated nicely with a very very comfortable bed, the second bedroom is actually a smaller room which is an attic conversion. It was ok for us nevertheless. The resort has 3-4 different sized pools and you can always get a chair/umbrella, was never over crowded and if you settle for the smaller pool, you can have the pool all to yourself. Right next to the resort is a Walgreens and right across the street is a strip mall with TGIF and some regular outlets. Best thing we liked were the pools completely surrounded by plants and foliage. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: trichick50
Reviews.Content: The three-bedroom townhouse was perfect for us. We loved the 4 pools and the way they were separated. The artwork around the pools and grounds was well done. It is a bit alarming when you first pull up to find the Walgreens and Home Depot right next door but once on the grounds, the hotel was very nice. We had lunch at the pool cafe. The food was excellent. The only negative was that if you returned late at night, there was no room in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “I needed rejuvination and my goal was superbly achieved!”
Reviews.Author: nphillips721
Reviews.Content: I chose this location because of its distance from Duval street and all the action since that was NOT my intent for coming to Key West. There aren't many restaurants near the resort but the Tiki bar had excellent food and friendly attentive staff. My room was nicely appointed and I loved the little veranda. I really had a lovely time after a terribly stressful year and this is just the environment I needed. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Hotel and Resort...more of a resort feel than a hotel feel.”
Reviews.Author: kellierox
Reviews.Content: I visited Parrot Key in early March 2011 for a long weekend. Located directly off Roosevelt in what is considered "New Town" Key West, it's conveniently located near a shopping plaza and with views of Florida Bay. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and beautifully decorated. In addition, the rooms were quite spacious. I stayed in a garden view guest room, suite 8A (ground floor). It would have been nice to have been a little closer to the parking area since I was traveling with my 5 month old son and by myself, but other than that I can't complain. This resort is close enough to walk to Old Town Key West attractions, but it's just as easy to drive and park in the garage at Caroline and Grinnell, or any of the other off street parking in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: hard2please2
Reviews.Content: While away from downtown, (a 45 minute walk or 10min cab ride to Duval St.), I will definitely stay again whenever I go to Key West. Spotless rooms, quiet, gorgeous grounds and pools. Very helpful staff. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, worth your time”
Reviews.Author: klubacca
Reviews.Content: this resort is a little on the pricey side, but it's worth every penny. if you're thinking of staying in key west, i would recommend just spending a little bit more and staying at parrotkey, it's awesome. the rooms are brand new, like full condos. the size is really pretty ridiculous for the price, full kitchens in some set ups, and the pool right outside the guest rooms is great. actually there are 3 pools and 1 large outdoor bar. we had a really relaxing time, the staff is really cool. nightlife and sightseeing is a short cab ride away, the entire key isn't that large anyway, and if you drive, that's even better. the parking is free at the hotel, and there is a drugstore and a market right next door.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: babe72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key on March 1, 2011. From what I could tell after we toured Key West this was one of the nicest hotels in the city. Our rooms were beautiful and I wish we could have stayed for more than one night. Well worth the price - at least in our opinion. On arrival it was kind of busy but the staff was efficient and friendly so we didn't wait very long and were even able to check in much earlier than the posted check-in time. Our kids (9yr, old twin girls) were absolutely thrilled with our "room" because there were 3 levels to it. The entrance was one level, the main level included the master bedroom with attached bath, living room and mini-kitchenette area. The third level was for the children and they were thrilled to have their own little "bungalow" to stay in. Even though we didn't get back to the hotel until 9:30 or l0pm after touring Key West and walking around Duval St. they enjoyed the time we were there. None of the rooms were super huge but were still large enough to provide a very comfortable atmosphere. The rooms were nicely decorated in a tropical theme and pastel colors so were very relaxing. The beds were very comfortable with feather pillows that we absolutely loved as they were just like home. The grounds of the resort were lush and beautifully maintained and surrounded the three swimming pools so you almost didn't think you were in the city. The only things I was disappointed in were very minor and definitely wouldn't prevent us from staying there again if we ever get back to Key West. One was the floor in the children's room on the third level seemed somewhat barren as there was no carpeting or area rug under the bed. The other was the breakfast. Part of it was free and included your basic breakfast food such as toast and bagels, cereals, juice, milk and fruit but eggs or omelets were only available at a premium price. Other than that it was wonderful and we were very happy to have found such a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Island paradise”
Reviews.Author: dwatson108
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key was an absolutely great place to stay. The total place was extremely clean and the staff was terrific. Its not right on Duval but only a 10 dollar cab ride away. 100% recommend.

Reviews.Title: “met expectations”
Reviews.Author: sjoh13
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds and pools were great. Room was clean and modern. Workout facility was nice. Food was good. Not a lot of extras ie spa, activities etc. Prior to booking our reservation we knew the hotel was not close to downtown Key West and you have to drive or take taxi to bars/restaurants. It wasn't bad for us but can be inconveniencing as downtown parking is scarce and expensive. Our main complaint is that there wasn't enough service staff at the bar/restaurant. If the hotel is booked (as it was while we were there) 2 bartenders were not enough to service 4 pools. At the same time, I think a lot of people ended up mixing drinks in their rooms and bringing them to the pool. In the end, this is a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Duffy-Smith
Reviews.Content: Love this resort! The staff were friendly and accomodating (especially Mindi at the poolside bar/restaurant). Casual atmosphere led to a great time with other hotel guests and making friends was a definite perk for us! You know who you are! We'll be back for sure ;-)

Reviews.Title: “No Disapointments”
Reviews.Author: cgervai
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort everything was as advertised.We could only stay a couple of days so we did not get a chance to use all the facilities but were very happy with the 3 bedroom cottage we were in. The rooms were large and very clean. The location is only a short cab ride to downtown and is very quiet so you can have the best of both worlds the excitement of Duval street and the comfort and privacy of your own home. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: cruise1521
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a ton of resorts throughout my travels and this resort is the absolute BEST for the money. It exceeded every single one of our expectations. The resort layout, theme, decor, and atmosphere was well thought out and so relaxing.It resembled almost like a little key west town, with the side walks, fencing, vegetation, 3 story houses w/ porches (which were the hotel rooms). I've never stayed at a more relaxing resort. The hotel rooms were HUGE, just like a town house minus the kitchen (although they did have rooms with kitchens). The resort was only built a few years ago so everything was like new and so clean. Separate deep soaking tub from the glass door tiled walk in shower. The beds were extremely comfortable, as well as the bedding. The room had TWO, yes TWO balconies each with french doors. We had 3 flat screen tv's. The upstairs bedroom on the 3rd floor had a beautiful view of the water. The pool areas were so serene, relaxing, comfortable padded lounge chairs and seating, relaxing music, very spa and zen-like. I would have to say the only downside to this resort was there was no beach, yes there was tons of sand that mimicked beach front and a pier to watch sunsets over the water and an area to rent jet skis but there was no actual beach to enter the water. From what I understood most hotels on key west do not have actual beaches though most are just waterfront as this one was. All and all I would recommend this resort to anyone and we will be going back soon, it is like the hidden gem of key west!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: Dilbee_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Parrot Key, and we will hopefully be back sooner than later! We booked through Expedia, and the rates were extremely reasonable for how much you get. The staff was friendly, the check-in and out were painless, and the grounds are beautiful. The room we had was a large suite on the second floor (they are all set up like apartments or condos, which was neat) and it was clean, spacious, comfortable and had lots of perks, including a king-sized bed, a shower with great pressure and seperate bathtub, a large living room and two decks. The resort had four pools, all beautifully landscaped, and very clean. The outdoor cafe was located at the largest (main) pool and the food/drinks were delicious (but not cheap...the least expensive thing was a hot dog or grilled cheese for $5). The entire resort is non-smoking. It is located with a drug store and grocery store very close, and there is abundant parking if needed. The resort is a few blocks from Duval Street, which is good if you want a quiet night's sleep! If you go into town to enjoy the night life, a taxi is the way to go, which is approximately a $12 ride (or if you share with others, $4 a person, which can be a very economical choice). If or when we return to Key West, I hope to stay at the Parrot Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort away from the madness of Duval Street.”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort is located just outside the historic Key West district, and although it is right next door to a Walmart, you would not know it once inside, due to extensive and beautiful landscaping. Check in was quick and our room had a separate lounge area. A smoke alarm was beeping (flat battery) in our room upon arrival, but it was seen to immediately and we had no other issues during our stay. The resort's pools are a wonderful place to relax, and because there are 4 of them it was easy to find one that was quiet. The only room for improvement would be the bar/dining area. Very limited food choice and breakfast was not great. But being in Key West you are spolit for choice when it comes to dining off premises.

Reviews.Title: “High quality resort in key west”
Reviews.Author: oporat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the parrot key resort for two days. Like others have mentioned, there is very lush landscaping and a few pools within, so you can spend a lot of time at the pools. The cafe next to the pools has good food and is pleasant. Some Rooms have a nice back porch with a sandy area which is great for kids. Overall this is a VERY well kept (and relatively new) resort. Pricey but a good value for money in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort is a beautiful hotel - Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: nyikesa
Reviews.Content: We picked Parrot Key resort through the internet and are not disappointed in our choice. The hotel was absolutely immaculate. The rooms were pristine. We had a 3 bedroom waterfront room. We each had our own bathroom. There were 2 bedrooms that faced the waterfront and one that faced the garden. We had our own kitchen (supplied with all necessary supplies - even a blender!) The front desk was so helpful when you needed something and Mr. Jones was a wonderful bellman. It was my friend's 40th birthday celebration and we actually had a 2 bedroom booked but because they were not sold out, they upgraded us to a 3 bedroom - talk about making our vacation! If there were any drawbacks I would say that if you are looking for a party hotel, this is NOT the place to stay. You need to stay closer to Duval street. This was a very relaxing atmosphere. They have 4 pools. The music around the pools was very low key. They played "coffee shop" music and it did almost put us to sleep! But once again, we picked the hotel for its great reviews and cleanliness. We also needed to take a cab into the downtown bar area, it was really not walkable. However, the cab ride was $4 per person and worth the ride. The one night we rode our bikes into town an then had to ride back when it was dark - probably not the best idea. I would recommend this hotel with the highest stars. Service, rooms, front staff, housekeeping, etc. Was absolutely wonderful. Back to Key West in 2 years for my birthday celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room no frills,”
Reviews.Author: ladydi456
Reviews.Content: the room was very nice and comfort table. The chamber maids didn't come to clean until 4:00 pm the first night 4 of them were there and did and average cleaning, No trash can, sticky floor. 2nd night they did not remove a pile of beach towels on the floor! Which we were told that we would be charged $25. for ea towel not returned. How would they know if they never picked them up. The ice machine does not work like the door you have to LEAVE the card in the slot, we were not told this, even though went to report trouble with the ice machine. Defineately no "extras" The most positive was the location forced us to check out area, long walks. $13 cab ride into Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - NOT a resort”
Reviews.Author: Tomlin2232
Reviews.Content: Taveled with husband and another woman. Needed two rooms. This place had 2 room "bungalow" with sitting area for less than price of 2 separate rooms (here or elsewhere). Because of sitting area there were 3 tv's. Expected this to be first level entry with second bedroom upstairs. Turned out that these were originally townhouses with first floor kitchen, living and dining areas and bedrooms upstairs - giving each bedroom it's own balcony and having a full kitchen. They were intended to be SOLD. Since only about 20 were sold - they are renovating the others. Therefore, as we entered our unit there were two doors. First level is single unit rental. We had to immediately go up a flight of stairs (handicapped, elderly - TAKE NOTE- ask for unit with elevator). Our first level had sitting room (formerly bedroom) with balcony overlooking the gardens, and one bedroom with balcony overlooking the water way and gulf. Up another flight of stairs was the bedroom for our friend - it did not have a balcony. Again, because of the renovation, our unit had a toaster (no microwave) and a micro fridge that held hardly anything. Since this was not originally set to be a hotel/resort, one needs these things to make some food or else plan to spend a lot of money in the tiki bar which is expensive and has a very limited menu.There is a wonderful Deli across the street (shopping center) that makes the bagels for the whole island. Great breakfasts - good price. Fortunately, I had negotiated vouchers for the Tiki bar, so we were covered for lunch. Housekeeping ??? They come in to change towels daily, but did not make the bed or clean rooms. If you want a fresh pool towel, you have to turn in the one you have to get it. Remember,this is more like a time share, where you do the work. The staff was friendly and responsive, if you do ask for something. The units are comfortable and the grounds are beautiful. We had no trouble with parking or crowding at the pools. Liked that there are 4 separate ones - less noise. Travel to Duval street - about 2 miles - if you are able to bike - best and least expensive way. We took cab first day for dinner and were floored to discover it was $12-$15 EACH way. Parking lots downtown are about $30/day. There are meters, but it takes 5 quarters/hour. We had a car,so we got a roll from the bank and used it from about 3-9 pm another day. It was cheaper than cab or lot. One day in Duval was enough for us - touristy shops and expensive restaurants and bars. Went back off Key West about 5 miles to local restaurant (Bubalu's) another night - no cab, free parking, good home-cooked food. Bottom line - beautiful, comfortable place. We enjoyed our stay, but be aware of what I said in this review.

Reviews.Title: “The outside world melts away once you turn into their gardens.”
Reviews.Author: streake
Reviews.Content: My mom and stayed at the Parrot Key for four nights. We decided to splurge and get the two bedroom waterfront condo and we did not regret it! The 'cottage' is built in a townhouse style with a full kitchen, dining room and living room. A 'beach' is right off the back patio. It is basically a lane of sand that backs up to all of the waterfront properties. It is waterfront, but it means a channel and so you aren't 'on' the water but can get some great veiws if you have the right room. The bedrooms were spacious and private (each with their own balcony). I would easily stay here again and bring my husband and some freinds of ours and feel completely at ease with the amount of space each room has to offer. We didn't have any issues with housekeeping, but we normally leave a tip for the maid so I don't know if that helped us out all. No real issues with cleanliness but it did appear that the tile floors could use a good scrubbing. The property is kept immaculately. The flowering trees and shrubs really help you forget that you just turned off of US Rt One to get here. The pools are very nice and relaxing. The bar can be a bit pricey but I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food they served. I got the veggie pannini for lunch and it was very good. The hike down to Duval Street can start to be a drag after a few days so we rented bikes and it helped a lot. We were able to go wherever we wanted with them, we just had to be careful how many drinks we had before riding home from Old Town on them :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific vacation for our extended family”
Reviews.Author: SFL5
Reviews.Content: The staff was a little light for the size of the place. The rooms were great. We had 2 two bedroom bungalows and 1 room with two queen beds. The rooms still seemed new and very nice. We were disappointed that they closed several of the pools in the evening and only had the pool by the cafe open. We had several elderly people in our group that loved the porch and nice walkways. The cafe does not have a full kitchen but there are restaurants that are close to the resort. The sitting area in the bungalow did not have drapes to darken the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of my week in Key West”
Reviews.Author: gwillie51
Reviews.Content: I was told that I would be pleasantly suprised by my stay. That is an understatement. My only regret is that I can not establish permanent residency there. First class accomodations, exceptional decor and grounds, and staff that you would bring home to meet Mom. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the mark - neither luxury or family friendly”
Reviews.Author: WaltzingMatilda_pmv
Reviews.Content: We booked Parrot with the understanding that it was not a full service resort with a beach. Just don't get that on Key West really - we are not fussy. We just wanted a nice hotel with a location a little removed from the night life of Duval Street. We booked a three bedroom condo for myself hubby and our 13 yr old and a friend. It looked nice based on the pictures and friendly when we called. The condo was pretty but housekeeping has been terrible. Had to clean our bathtub and dishes ourselves. Breakfast crumbs still on counters when we get back. Sand everywhere. We remove pots from shelves and find them filthy and the cleaning supplies are lightweight at best - despite the granite counters, you have plastic cups wrapped in plastic for drinking. We have had a bachlorette party in the adjoining condo that has gone on for 4 days - wall are thin and we hear everything. No help from staff. Pools are very small and little more than a place to wet down - very warm with lots people. There is limited food service, a small cafe that closes so you have to leave the hotel. There is a Home Depot and Walgreens next door - Dominos across the street. Helpful as parking at night involves going to an overflow parking lot on their properties. Considered changing hotels, looked at a lot and there seems to be a lot better accommodation with more dining options for the same price around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Madsen2610
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort in Key West, and was meet by a friendly and helpfull staff, checking in in this wonderfull hotel. We stayed 5 people in each "room" with a seaview. It was a spacefully equipt 3-level house, with a large kitchen and living area. Great stay and if we ever consider to return to the Keys, it will deffenitely be at the Parrot Key Hotel. Alice Madsen /Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getawat from the norm”
Reviews.Author: Msp33d
Reviews.Content: This place was a little farther from Duval St. than I thought, but we didnt mind. It is beautiful, since it is one of the newest places in Key West. The bar/cafe is excellent, though a bit pricey. We did have some BOGO drink coupons though, which made it nice. The sunset pier and beach area are gorgeous, but we were not sure if we could use the lounge chairs outside, or if they were reserved for the rooms behind them. It was a great deal though, as the beds were comfortable and the rooms were spacious. A short cab ride (or a scooter as we did for a day) will get you into town for under $10.

Reviews.Title: “Going back !!”
Reviews.Author: robin071
Reviews.Content: Great resort..... wonderful place to just kick back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: headparrot2039
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, and the the rooms are outstanding. The beds are very, very comfy. I have been to Key West several times, and this hotel, is among the best. The downfall is you must taxi it downtown, and at approx $24 R/T can get costly. The staff, was great, and very helpful. There is nothing to complain about other than what is listed.

Reviews.Title: “Keep the Kitchens!”
Reviews.Author: pan1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Parrot Key Resort in Key West, Florida. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit just as we did last year. However, we were dismayed to learn that most of the units have been converted into smaller rooms that do not have a full kitchen. One of the reasons that we, and our friends, and our children chose to stay at the Parrot Key was the fact that the units had full kitchens. Having the full kitchens made our stay much more enjoyable than it would have been. Without the full kitchens, quite honestly, we will probably look for other accommodations in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but there are few cons.”
Reviews.Author: kushta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. We loved the pools - they were heated and so relaxing. I liked that their were four secluded pools instead of one giant pool area. The landscaping was amazing and really filtered out the road noise - it was quiet and relaxing at the pools. However, because of the seclusion of the pools, it doesn't really matter that you are in Key West. There are no views from the pools, so you could be anywhere really. The beds were very comfortable and the a/c worked great. The cons: I knew it was not oceanfront, but waterfront doesn't really describe it either. There's no sand that touches the water, in fact when sitting in the sand area you can't even see the water. The other con is that it's a ~$12 cab ride to downtown, each way. We didn't want to deal with driving and it seemed parking downtown would have been a hassle. Several people had rented bikes, but we weren't interested in evening biking after drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: JustinBeaver
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort. Recommendations on tripadvisor.com held true for us. Hotel pictures are accurate. Resort is nearly new and extremely well maintained. Our room was immaculate. We took the king room which was bath and bedroom only. Rooms lacked the added amenities of a coffee maker and iron, but each room has a flat screen and small refrigerator. You can also upgrade to multi-room suites with kitchens. The four pools are the high point of the resort. Poolside bar service and limited menu is available. Sun exposure on the pool area sets behind the buildings at 4:30 p.m. in February, so I recommend that you ask for poolside or gulf or bay side room or suite when reserving. Gulf and bay side rooms provide increased afternoon sun exposure, whereas most other room decks and balconies are shaded. Limited number of rooms may be too close to highway 1A, but you cannot tell that you are in the middle of a city once inside the resort and pool areas. I compared to other 4-star hotels in the same vicinity on Highway 1A and would opt to this resort again in an instant. We spent everyday at one of the resort's four pools, then walked to downtown for dinner and drinks and took a $12 taxicab back. Weekly bus pass is available for $8 with bus at the corner, but the bus runs only every 1.5 hours and does not run at night. Parking downtown Key West is a premium. Bikes and scooters appear to be the mode of choice in Key West. Available bike rentals are pricey. Best option would be to bring your own bikes.

Reviews.Title: “For the tranquility”
Reviews.Author: sudu1259
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege to stay at Parrot Key Resort last November, although the location is a bit far from downtown we did appreciate the tranquility of the premisces. I recommand to take a cab (Five 6's Taxi) for 15$, it is different and you really feel on vacation. We had a wonderful dining experience at Mangia-Mangia and at Bagatelle. I would also recommand breakfast at Camille's Restaurant and Azur Restaurant. We went for the sunset celebration 3 nigts in a row... it is a must! We also played golf at the local Golf Club, just ok, not much to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Relaxation, Pool Time”
Reviews.Author: lazytravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parrot Key this past summer, so this is a little overdue, but I didn't want my experience to go unreviewed. The resort is not in the center of Old Key West, but you're not far either -- I'd say it's about a 7-8 minute drive. The resort itself is very well-maintained. The rooms are large, and ours looked out on an intracoastal waterway, plus we had a small deck. The decor is Florida tropical -- kind of "Golden Girls" -- but it's all still quite charming. There are four pools on the resort grounds, some are salt water and some are chlorinated. The poolside beds are DIVINE, and I have no complaints about the maintenance of the pools themselves. Our only problem was that since we were there in August, the water was boiling hot -- like stepping into a hot tub -- no joke. But that couldn't be helped. I imagine it was the same all over South Florida. The poolside bar was ok, but seriously overpriced. The cocktails were worth it, though. A few things to keep in mind before booking here. -- The facility is totally non-smoking -- you're not allowed to smoke ANYWHERE on the grounds, so if you're a smoker, this may be something to consider. -- You're allotted only one parking spot per room -- This is mostly a family/group friends resort... not necessarily the best place for a romantic getaway -- Ask for a room overlooking the waterway or the pool. Don't get stuck with a room overlooking the parking lot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: landmark-7
Reviews.Content: We had the 3 bedroom ocean view cottage. Due to the lush foliage, the ocean is only visible from the decks off the upper rooms. The rooms are spacious and well furnished. The only thing lacking is a washer/dryer and you could live there. The only reason I would not go back is the price - including the resort fee, the lowest rate available in February was just under $600 per night when booked months in advance. We enjoyed our stay, but will try to find something less expensive next time.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: dinx4563
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parrot Key Resort in November 2010 for my destination wedding. We reserved a 2 bedroom waterfront cottage and a king waterfront suite. Upon our arrival our 2 bedroom was upgrade to a 3 bedroom cottage which was very nice. The front desk representative was very nice and welcoming. The 3 bedroom cottage has three floors. The first floor has a fully stocked kitchen with granite counter top and stainless steel appliances, dining area/large size living room, and a half bath. The second floor has the master suite and queen room each with its own bath and a walk out deck with brightly colored Adirondack chairs. The 3rd floor was a one queen bed room with it owns bath and a great view. The beds were very comfortable and rooms were clean. The dÃ©cor is very tropical and cozy. The back deck on the main floor walks out to a white soft sandy backyard with your own sun chairs an umbrella overlooking the gulf. The grounds are very well landscaped from the tropical palms to the fuchsia colored bougainvillea, you feel like you are in a tropical oasis. There are four pools scattered around the property. To access them you must walk through lush tropical gardens where you will come across the great eclectic artwork around the property or freestanding doors that looks as if they were hand carved and sent from Bali. They were so nice that my photographer took some shots here prior to my ceremony and they are some of my favorite photographs. Even though this is waterfront property there is no beach to access the water, but we did a lot of scuba diving and used other beaches around the island so this was ok. They were building what appeared to be a dock when we were there so that would be nice. The resort has a Walgreenâ€™s next door and a food store right up the road. The location is not downtown but is a very short ride by car or moped. One benefit though from being further away is that you can sit on back deck at night sip a cocktail and hear nothing but the water and palms in the breeze which was very nice and relaxing. Overall I was very impressed I work at a Hilton property and I tend to compare everything. This is like renting your own house in paradise compared to getting on an elevator and going to just another fancy room. Renting 3 bedroom definitely gave us the wow feeling! We will go back and definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/pools...but not such a great location”
Reviews.Author: rachelmle
Reviews.Content: The Pros.... -- The set-up of our cottage was awesome for our needs. We reserved a 2 bedroom cottage and to our surprise we arrived to find out that our 2-bed property was actually a 3 bedroom/3 1/2 bathroom cottage! It was absolutely perfect for our needs since my husband and I were traveling with my father and his girlfriend. The accommodations in the cottage were great. The kitchen was a nice size and finished w/ granite countertops, new appliances, and decent cookware. The cottage was really beautiful - I only have nice things to say about the physical look of the unit. The Cons.... -- Housekeeping was average - at best. When we first checked in, everything appeared to be clean - but it wasn't. After my 11month old crawled on the floor for 5 minutes (literally) his knees were black from dirt on the tile floor. Also, the master bathroom (although appearing clean to the eye) had a smell that smelled like it was "cleaned" with an old dirty mop. I actually picked up some spic--n-span at the dollar store across the street and wiped down our bathroom b/c the smell bothered me so much. (I figured this was an easier remedy than calling the front desk to complain within the first 10 minutes of my week long stay. That's just not my style....) -- The hot water heater in the unit can only supply hot water to one shower at a time. If two (or more) people try to shower at the same time - you'll both only get lukewarm water. Also, for some reason the "hot" water in the tub in the master bathroom never got hot. It was (at most) warm - but never hot. This was very annoying since the deep soaking tub looked so inviting! We called maintenance - who quickly came to our room to check things out - and we were told that this is a problem throughout the entire property. The maintenance guy told us that hot water heaters in the units are not large enough and it's a design flaw in the buildings. He told me that there was actually no way to get hot water to fill up the tub! He was very nice about the whole thing - I think he genuinely felt bad. He said that he gets tons of calls per week regarding the hot water issue and he hopes that the company will do something to switch over the hot water heaters. -- The location of the hotel stinks. You are in the middle of local-ville (not in a good way) and right off the main road that leads to downtown. It's a 5 minute drive to Duval Street - but parking can be kind of annoying depending on the time of day. We ended up throwing the car in the garage at the Westin for $4/hour when we didn't feel like hunting for a meter or free spot. -- It's not a huge deal - but the cable is not HD even though the unit has beautiful large screen plasmas. Even the big TV in the living room doesn't have an HD box. Oh well. Additional notes.... -- The pools are private, heated, and cozy. The only downside is that the bar/cafe kind of stinks. I don't understand why they don't make this better. -- Parking is first come, first serve - but we never had a problem finding a spot. -- The staff was always very helpful and nice. -- Overall - Parrot Key was great for our needs, but if you want to spend a lot of time downtown, I wouldn't recommend it. I would check out the Westin since its location is awesome - but I have no idea what type of rates and accommodations they have.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Betsy1968
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, and the rooms are very clean and new. We loved the many heated pools! I would highly recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: reginawood70
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I spent 5 days at Parrot Key. We enjoyed every minute of it! The rooms were beautiful, the bar and cafe area clean and well maintained. The 4 pools were spectacular! We can't wait to come back next year1

Reviews.Title: “Nice but "waterfront" is misleading”
Reviews.Author: mistyinsf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parrot Key for a week with friends. The resort is fairly new so everything looks fresh. We had a 2 bedroom townhouse(cottage) which had nice rooms, a decent kitchen and good common areas. We booked a "waterfront" cottage and our first surpirse was to find the waterfront was actually a "channel" and not beachfront. So there was no sand, waves or walking on the beach. The bedrooms are nice but the second bedroom has a very small bathroom! Next, the resort is located in a very busy part of town and shares an entrance with Walgreens. The resort has a done a good job with the landscaping so you are somewhat secluded from the traffic and other noise. The housekeeping was lacking...the trash pick up was infrequent so we put our trash out on the front porch almost daily. There are 4 pools and pool bar but the food at the pool bar was substandard. Room rates are not cheap and the resort charges a "resort fee" on top of your room rate...for what I don't know. There are no special amenities in your room, no special parking facilities... so not sure why the "resort fee". The staff was courteous. All in all, Parrot key was nice but I would really have preferred that "waterfront" experience that I thought I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to get away to”
Reviews.Author: Croxford64
Reviews.Content: As the photos show, its a complex of attached houses that can be used as a traditional one bedroom hotel room, up to a multi-level house with full kitchen etc. We were in a single room with a tiny fridge and with people above us, but noise was not an issue. Having a back balcony was awesome to relax and maximize time in the sun. Its a great place away from downtown Key West. The parking overflow into the strip mall next door is a non-issue as it close. its also nice having a CVS next door. Across the street is grocery store so that's great too. Pools are nicely heated and despite the hotel being full, getting seats around the pool was a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh......”
Reviews.Author: peaceluv08
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this luxury resort! Wasn't crazy that it's just off the main road because you hear a lot of the road noise but it was still a beautiful place to stay and I would recommend. There are a lot of palm trees which sometimes block your views but it was very quaint and inviting. There are 4 pools and the resort is very clean and well kept. Lots of roosters & chickens running around but they are "everywhere" in the keys and don't really bother you. The pictures on the website do the place justice!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: keysgrlc
Reviews.Content: The Florida Keys is an attraction to tourist and to friends/family of those who are lucky enough to call this home. Parrot Key Hotel is where we stay when my family/friends want to visit good ol Key West. The well maintained landscaping, cleanliness of the rooms, comfortable beds and helpful staff have always been consistant on all of our visits. I've stayed there quite often and have never experienced anything but professional service. Even those who live here like to feel like they are on vacation and I would like to thank Singh Resorts for always making my stay a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? Who Says? You Can Do So Much Better Than This Place”
Reviews.Author: Pamela57
Reviews.Content: First, you are two miles outside of town, and could be anywhere USA. To get into town, a taxi costs $12 plus tip. Do the math. A couple of trips into town in a day...The hotel claims it is a four star - where were the amenities? The robe, the safe, not even a pen and paper in the room. No sign posting rates and check out times on the door. (Is this even legal - I'll have to check Florida law). The hotel decided they would change your sheets every fourth day, (ecological concerns supposedly) - other hotels I've been in, let you decide. They turn down their water heaters as well - I had lukewarm showers every day - I asked at the front desk if that were normal - oh yes, said one, that's how it is, the other receptionist seeing my facial expression said she'd send someone to look at it - but there was no change in water temperature. The resort fee of $25 is absurd - what makes it a resort? Are there tennis courts? No. Not even a hot tub! (I was surprised with this). Simply 3 or 4 very small pools. If you have a resort credit each day good luck trying to spend it - the food is awful. They don't have a real kitchen so you can't get a burger for instance. Just paninis which aren't heated through and are ghastly and a couple of "make shift" salads. But really, for this money you could be in the middle of old town - so skip Parrot Key and head to the Westin or Hyatt. As for the positive reviews posted here, I have to think one of two things - hotel staff and friends are posting them, and/or folks coming down from the East Coast where they've been buried in snow, are a bit dazed and confused.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: 5wickhams
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the cost (I would stay there again without question). Clean room, bedding, and bathroom. The staff were very helpful and pleasing to talk to. Our TV wasn't working and in a matter of minutes, Steve, was there to fix it. It is within walking or biking distance from Duvall St (main drag for tourists). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in Key West. P.S. Check out El Siboney for dinner, Great little joint off Catherine St.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, super clean and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dlevkovits
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. I stayed in what they call a suite, is a two floor building with two rooms and a common area with sofa, TV, mini bar and coffee maker. I stayed with my husband on the first floor and brother stayed on the second floor. The layout gave us privacy and the possibility to hang out all together. The staff was super friendly and helped us canceling one of our reservations, I booked two suites (2 buildings /4 rooms) by mistake. The rooms were very clean. We had a parking spot. The suite was in mint condition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice piece of paradise off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: newton908
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Parrot Key and would highly recommend staying there. You were about 2 miles from town and could either rent bikes for the weekend to head into town or cabs were only $4 per person when had at least 4 people in the cab. Groceries and other supplies right across the street for easy convenience. Four pools made it fabulous and easy to get a chair. We stayed in a cottage and it was awesome to have a full kitchen to stock up food for breakfast and lunch and then head to town for dinner. The facility is surrounded by lush plants, trees and flowers and you hardly know that you are right off a main road. The staff were phenomenal and extremely responsive when our AC broke and needed repaired. Would highly recommend staying here if you don't want to be in town and right around Duval street - but again you are only 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: adrianmeli
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West for a friend's wedding and got a great deal for this hotel on travelzoo. I had never heard of it and I think originally this was supposed to be a condominium or there are condos there. Anyway, a lot of the Parrot Key is now a hotel complete with a couple of pools, an outdoor restaurant, etc. The staff was great and extremely friendly. It is very close to restaurants, a Walgreens, etc. and not too far from downtown. We had a really great time and the room was very clean and nice. I would definitely recommend it without hesitation. - Adrian Meli

Reviews.Title: “Expect a condo not a resort.”
Reviews.Author: badgerboy
Reviews.Content: Parrot key is a condo hotel. This I was not aware of. The units were originally built to be sold as townhomes, but due to lackuster sales they changed course. They divided the townhomes into two. The Room; I stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom 2 bath with a living room. We paid a paltry $140 dollars a night for the room. We had booked a deluxe room, which according to the hotel website was a 1 bedroom with den. Either we were upgraded without knowing or the description was wrong. The room, bathrooms, two balconies were fantastic. Above I gave the rooms 5 stars. The Grounds: 4 small pools in the couryard of the grounds, surrounded by a tropical setting. When I was there the hotel was not full. So we met another family and basically had our own private pool. They keep the temp of the water at 90 degrees. I liked it! Downside to pools, no sun after 3 due to the huge trees shading the area. Fitness center is tiny and not comfortable. Really a joke how small it is. Across the hotel there is a local gym where you can buy a week membership. Otherwise, run outside! Service: I detailed my frustration in a previous post. Bottom line, the service is mediocre at best. Our room did not get cleaned daily, did not get new sheets on the 4th day. Staff is slow to fix issues. Of course there were some bright spots to the staff, but if you bill youself as 4 star, u should have 4 star service. I would call it a 4 star condo hotel with a pool, minimal amenities and unreliable service. Now that I have proper expectations, if the price was right, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Key West now that I've stayed at Parrot Key!”
Reviews.Author: swampfox919
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is quiet, clean, beautiful and the staff in just incredible. We went from a very overwhelming spur of the moment trip to having everything layed out for us, literally. From maps and Key West 'secrets', to transportation to extra 'emergency' ice, our every need was taken care of. Plan on swimming, the pools are gorgeous. Our reservation agent went above and beyond - thank you Michelle! We can't wait to come back, next time without the kids! ;) One thing to note - don't walk to Duval, take a cab, especially if it's hot out.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom016
Reviews.Content: What a great little resort! I had no expectations except from photos I had seen on the website...and it more than exceeded my expectations. I am used to 5 star facilities, and while this is not billed as 5 star, it comes very close. It is just beautiful - clean, well appointed (we had a regular room and a 3 bedroom villa) and over the top in terms of landscaping. You don't feel like you are in a small resort because it's so well planned. I loved the 4 pools - all quiet yet if there were kids around splashing happily it was somehow fine! The resort is very tranquil which I welcomed - far enough from the madding crowds of downtown yet a very easy drive into to town to fabulous dining and general wandering around...then you could go back to Parrot Key and breathe a sigh of relief! I will definitely recommend to ALL!! and plan to return again. Oh, and the best? I slept well! Parrot Key is a jewel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Kinkeywest
Reviews.Content: We are locals to key west, we have stayed at over a dozen different resorts. Hands down parrot key is our top choice. We do staycations here nearly monthly. The rooms are huge, the grounds are meticulous and the staff is always friendly. Dollar for dollar you will not find anything like this in key west

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: msboston
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3 bedroom cottage. Beautiful rooms, very clean, relaxing, tons of space. Beds/pillows excellent quality. Very peaceful for sleeping. Great view from balcony. Convenient drug and liquor store a few feet away. Deli, grocery store, gym across the street. Approx 45 minute walk or 5/10 minute taxi to Duval. Taxis are plentiful, even for groups of 6. Really enjoyed staying just ourside of town. Much more relaxing. It is important to know that parking is first-come first-serve and all spots fill up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, beautiful hotel and grounds - Great for groups!”
Reviews.Author: Writermgb
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling with a large group (we had 12 people), the Parrot Key is totally the place to stay. We really could not have picked a nicer hotel for our needs. Our group had two beautiful 3-bedroom cottages with water views. The cottages were HUGE (even bigger than the pictures) and had 3.5 baths each, so everyone had plenty of privacy and space. Everything was clean and new and the beds were incredibly comfortable. Private balconies off the bedrooms were a great touch for relaxing. The real treat, though, were the lovely grounds and the great pools... the landscaping at Parrot Key is top-notch, and the pools felt like little private retreats. So relaxing and wonderful! The only thing that's too bad is that Parrot Key isn't closer to downtown, but really, it's a quick taxi/car ride to all the restaurants and shops, and the hotel was nice and quiet, which better suited our needs for this trip. Staff was very accommodating and helpful, even let us check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: JohnBauer62
Reviews.Content: First time in Key West and this resort defined the Keys. Waterfront, great pools and the service was great. I will be bringing my family back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: kdole
Reviews.Content: My son and I just finished a great trip to Key West. We were vacationing with another family of five. Both families stayed at Parrot Key and had a great time! The large condo style rooms with kitchens definitely made the trip. The accommodations were excellent, the kitchen was well stocked with cooking utensils and the staff was more than helpful. Having four pools to chose from was a big hit with the kids. It also allowed us the ability to segregate ourselves from the honeymooners and give them some piece. All-in-all it is a really good setup and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Parrot Key Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: RonFromOregon
Reviews.Content: Wow. . . another great stay at this wonderful resort. Had a view of the bay from our back deck under the palm trees. We really enjoyed our 3 bedroom and 4bath condo. It was immaculate! This time we really got to enjoy the variety of swimming pools and Cafe Blue the poolside cafe. The staff is absolutely fantastic! One of the staff Sean, helped us plan some great activities in town and was three for three with restaurant recommendations! Being from Oregon, I'm always so impressed with the unique landscaping throughout the resort. It's like you are in a tropical jungle as you wind through the resort. I would once again highly recommend Parrot Key Resort to anyone and everyone. It will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: gloria78
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 6 day family vacation at Parrot Key resort.... This was our Christmas celebration over New Years.... the staff at the resort went above and beyond in helping me make our unit feel like Christmas ... they arranged , at my request, for a live Christmas tree with lights to be set up in our unit when we arrived... they made sure that several boxes I had sent with gifts were in our unit upon arrival as well... All of their attention helped to make this a very special vacation for all of us coming in from Germany, Colorado and Indiana to celebrate.. Our unit was lovely and the perfect setup for us with 3 bedrooms and 3 baths.. we enjoyed the 4 swimming pools on the property... they are surrounded by dense foliage that offers a very private and secluded feel.... Our only suggestion would be that they provide more pots and pans for cooking and a larger coffee maker as the one in the unit was only 4 cups and not adequate for the number of people that would be staying in a 3 bedroom unit. I would highly recommend this resort .. we definitely plan to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A place I would go back to!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey D
Reviews.Content: This resort was a great pick! The staff was very friendly, the rooms were very nice, and right by the water! The only con in our case was the fact that our room was located by the road, and by a jet ski club... the latter created a bit of noise upon our arrival, and the former when we were sitting in our porch. Besides that, the room was very clean, and well-furnished. The parking was very convenient. Definitely a place I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Monkeymezz
Reviews.Content: We were contacted twice by reservation agent Sarah following our phone inquiry regarding a stay at Parrot Key. The first call was a follow up call and the second was a call with an offer to prepay two nights at $159 + a $25 resort fee each and receive a "resort credit" of $50 per day. First tip: these people have caller ID and they use it. My guess is that Parrot Key's percentage of return customers is pretty low and they probably rely on nonrefundable prepay package bookings to stay afloat, thus the aggressive sales tactics. We were enticed by the too-good-to-be-true offer and promptly booked a three night stay. Our mistake was not researching this property more thoroughly. Parrot Key is nestled between a Home Depot, Walgreens, and a host of other chain establishments and located nearly three miles from Duval Street on the busy US Route One. It is in a very poor location due to surroundings and noise. I was not even able to find a cup of coffee to start the day in this neighborhood. After a 15 minute wait for the front desk agent in the makeshift lobby, we were handed several lose Xeroxes of the restaurant menu, list of rules and fees for breaking said rules, and an out of date map of the property and a key to our King room. I was quite disappointed to find we were located on the 1st floor in a room with dirty grout on the floor and in the shower. In their brochure, Parrot Key describes the property's rooms having "spectacular views" of the pool and waterfront. Our room, a pool view, overlooked a plywood structure and mangrove trees. I couldn't see the pool at all. We immediately returned to the front office and requested a change of rooms. We were given a much cleaner two bedroom suite in exchange and it was the saving grace of our stay. The 925 square feet almost made up for the nonexistent waterfront view and noisiness of the busy interstate. Unfortunately, we were unable to use our two patios as the noise from external air conditioning units and traffic from road completely prohibited any relaxation outside the unit. Singh resorts owns the Parrot Key resort, along with a handful of others in the Florida area. The night we were forced to park in the Walgreen's parking lot next door really piqued my curiosity on the motivation of these people regarding their business practices. Clearly, they make little effort to disguise their lack of commitment to service once a guest at their properties. There are only 74 or so parking spaces for this 118 room property, not to mention that some of these units have two or three bedroom. The "restaurant" is open only 6 1/2 hours out of the day (11 to 5:30 PM) and serves microwaved fish (where do they actually cook this stuff? kitchen is outdoors with no real cooking facilities), there is no jacuzzi or hot tub on the property, and guests who don't check out at 11 am are charged a $50 an hour fee if they aren't checked out by one and a full night's stay thereafter. Guests who violate the no smoking rules are charged a $500 PER DAY cleaning fee, and don't expect the luxury of daily housekeeping. Trash is emptied and towels are delivered on a daily basis but that's the extent of it. This place is woefully understaffed, cramped and definitely not a resort or hotel. It barely qualifies as a motel. I am certain staffers are padding these reviews. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra if you are looking for service, much less luxury ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation spot for a romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: RaidersOfTheLostKeys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently vacationed to this resort. We were delighted with the service and the cleanliness of the grounds. It was a very romantic getaway. All of the staff memebers were very helpful and friendly. Not only did they make our time at the resort great, they also helped us experience the island with local attractions and other fun things. We plan to make this trip again next winter. It was a great break from the midwestern weather and we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shellyjoeybear
Reviews.Content: Perfect is the best way to describe our stay at Parrot Key. The grounds were beautiful, staff was helpful, pool was warm, room was comfortable. Since the location is away from old town I would recommend having the staff schedule a bicycle delivery upon your arrival so that you don't have to keep paying for taxis. We biked everywhere. Best Cafe con leche at Cuban Coffee Queen, best dinner at Hogfish on Stock Island, best beach at Fort Zachary Taylor. Will definately be back to Parrot Key resort.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and so relaxing - great staff & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: finman1959
Reviews.Content: had an opportunity to stay at "parrot key" - what a great place - rooms very spacious & clean - staff exceptional and very nice - would recommed to anyone going to key west

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Get Away”
Reviews.Author: travelinman525
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been traveling from California over the last few weeks and decided to do the new year holiday in Key West. We stayed at Parrot Key for four nights and were delighted by the resort. It really was one of my favorite stops in my travels. Great knowledgable employees,many pools and very tropical plants on the grounds,large clean well furnished room. With all the crazy night life of downtown it was great to have our little quite "hide-away" , we even had a pool to our selfs one night, I have nothing but good things to say,and will be the only place I stay if on future visits to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: gocoltsgo
Reviews.Content: We are a retired couple that ha d never been to Key West before. Enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped find restaurants each night we were there. The pools and landscaping were amazing. We stayed in a traditional hotel room that far exceeded our expectations. This is a great place to stay. . Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Parrot Key made our stay over New Year's Eve fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DellaK_11
Reviews.Content: My family travels frequently for business and leisure. The staff at Parrot Key excelled in providing the service that makes you want to return. They answered my questions prior to arrival and even found a great restaurant for a great New Year's Eve dinner at the last minute, since I forgot to make reservations. Every call was promptly returned both prior to and while at the resort in a friendly and helpful manner. When one family member left an item behind, the staff found it, returned the call promptly, and forwarded it to her.

Reviews.Title: “Rain forest ambience, five star quality and four pools.”
Reviews.Author: inverlochy
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here, there are four gorgeous pools surrounded by lush, tropical plants, and amazing art work from around the wold. The cottage looked like it was out of an architectural magazine and was done up to the highest standard. The staff were spectacular and the Blue Cafe was friendly and had great food and great value. We went out on the jet skis one afternoon for an adventure I will never forget....all and all a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great property with Fantastic Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: nymags36
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVE staying at Parrot Key. The property is beautifully landscaped and well maintained. The villas are tastefully decorated keys style and the beds are the most comfortable beds you'll ever sleep on! We really enjoyed the sandy patio right off our back patio, the pool, and a balcony right off one of the bedrooms for a peaceful retreat is just lovely. We will definitely come back again and again to Parrot Key for girls weekend in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “lush....beautiful grounds.......cute furnishings”
Reviews.Author: suemac82
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the beautiful lobby and spoke to the front desk folks, we knew we were in for a treat. It was a lovely place, with comfy, stylish furnishings and lovely pools that felt like you were in a tropical paradise. The food at the pool was tasty and service was great. Thanks for a great Florida Keys holiday!

Reviews.Title: “My fav getaway!”
Reviews.Author: takemeawaysomeday
Reviews.Content: We love getting away from South Florida and Parrot Key has been our favorite spot for several reasons: we love the tropical ambiance, love being close enough to Duval to party but far enough away to sleep, love the clean comfort of the rooms. I'm very surprised at the other reviewers - we have been consistently impressed with Parrot Key. Hidden fees?? I don't get it... fees are pretty clearly described when you make your reservations. Happy New Year - go to Parrot Key, you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: tr8velr
Reviews.Content: What a great resort! My wife and I decided to stay here after searching many other options throughout the keys. Our family values relaxation and privacy and Parrot Key provided just that. The rooms are more practical for a family with kids then a typical hotel room with no amenities that facilitate practicality and ease. The resort values quiet time and quality above all else. The hours that the pool and tiki bar were open were perfect and considerate for families with young children who need rest after a long day in the sun. It was such a pleasant surprise to be completely isolated from the more classless and obnoxious alcoholic/loud/partymongering crowd that frequently populates tropical tourist areas. And the no smoking policy was beyond appreciated, vacation is a time for rejuvenation; the last thing anyone wants is to be surrounded by toxic smokers who show no regard to the value of health and the importance of making this filthy habit obsolete! The staff was friendly above and beyond the call of duty. They were upfront and honest about all costs, charges/fees, and rules of the resort, and were eager to go out of there way to make you feel welcome and help you plan a wonderful day playing in the sun. The rooms were exceptional and clean! The furniture was fun yet elegant. Most of all it was affordable and worth every dollar spent! My kids loved the tiki bar particularly, and the food was varied and delicious! I couldn't believe the art work and sculptures throughout the gardens around the pools... I will absolutely be coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Fees”
Reviews.Author: flyguybob
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located on the Gulf side of Key West and has some spacious rooms. Beware of additional fees, such as the "resort fee", which was $75 for the stay and or parking fees which were $25 per night. Even if you don't want/need to use the TV, internet, or parking they charged $25 per night. This is their way of hiding what was a $259 room which was really a $284 a night, making the Marriott cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not great for price”
Reviews.Author: statestreet96
Reviews.Content: Clean large rooms. Only a few have view of water. Lots of highway noise. This hotel is not near the main attractions.. You must drive everywhere. They do not have shuttle. Expect little service. They might know where the cart is so YOU can take your bags to the room. It is an Eco friendless place... Translated that means virtually no daily service and no clean towels. I traveled with two teenagers but was only given two bath towels. When i asked for clean towels the hotel employee brought two i asked for third and was met with resistant. Staff is okay but not particularly helpful. There is no one at the front desk after 11pm the evenings so you are on your own if you need something. we had to leave early due to a family illness and the staff would not consider any refund though they were busy and could clearly could re-rent the room. At this hotel you do not feel like you are in Key West. It is literally next to the Home Depot. The strip mall across the road is convenient for groceries, the CVS and Dominoes Pizza. Not exactly the conch republic. This place is pricey for little service and bad location. If you have a large party, this will work well. Bring your own towels if you expect to have dry one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort”
Reviews.Author: WayOut6
Reviews.Content: We expected a resort with SOME amenities, but there really weren't any!
