Bare minumum staff, rooms cleaned only once every four days, restaurant really a bar with a few food items, advertised 'sunning beach' not even indicated on hotel map being given out (seems to be reserved for the most expensive rooms being let). Other than that, it's really more like a fairfield inn with multiple nice pools and nice gardens ( with terrible music piped everywhere). If that 's what you are looking for, you will like it. Just don't expext a resort!

Reviews.Title: “NOT as advertised,TERRIBLE Service, overcharged, OWNER made no response”
Reviews.Author: mcfamily05
Reviews.Content: So many problems, so I went to front desk, only one worker, she wouldn't help at all. Very strange, there wasn't any other worker there. After our vacation I called and wrote the owner an email, but sadly I never received a response. POOL, BAR and FITNESS CENTER were CLOSED when we arrived and we were told it's only open during daylight. BIG disappointment when you have a child that came to swim. And there is NO BEACH and no water access unless you go to the swampy river area where I saw 2 snakes. NO jacuzzi, no customer service. Upon checkout, we were WAY overcharged. Once again, the front desk worker, said that's what we already charged you.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: oplong
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend for X Mas. Had a great time. They have 3 pools, had lunch and drinks, food was excellent. Staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst Hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: alysakim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last summer with my family and this was definitely the single most unpleasant vacation hotel experience I have ever had. Let me just point out that when my family and I stayed here last summer, we called Parrot key before booking a room to make sure that they had a working TV in the room. (*Note: We were looking forward all day to watch the Olympic soccer game that night in which one of the two countries playing was our home counry. Yea, now you know why the tv was so important to us) We were assured a confident yes, and we booked the room through phone and we got there pretty late on a weekday. The room was decent(I remember it was kind of expensive though compared to other similar hotels in the area, but this one was the only one with an available room). As soon as we got there, we eagerly turned on the TV, and it didn't work. So we call the reception desk and they told me they would send someone. No one came. We then call again. They tell us the mechanical guy left for home so the receptionist would come herself soon. Oh what a surprise, she doesnt show up, so we wake up the next day and try to talk to the manager- shes not in, so the reception dude asks us what we were having a problem with. So we tell him the tv problem then he tells us that it was our fault and that the tv was actually working. Really? Really?? No apologies, whatsoever. I have never been treated this way for something they were negligent for. I mean, the least they couldve done is have one of the employees just come in for a minute and show us the "right" way to turn on the tv. COME ON STUPID PARROT KEY EMPLOYEES/MANAGER, it doesn't take an Einstein level genius to work a TV-- I highly doubt we were turning it on the "wrong way." and after I specifically asked them before booking the room if they had a working TV, I could not believe they were so rude and inconsiderate in handling the situation. I was almost resigned to the situation and just decided that this was an unfortunate hotel experience, but I called the hotel again later that day to speak to the manager and get a sincere apology and a partial refund. However, one of the employees refused to let me speak to the manager, and was unbelievably rude. Wow, thinking about that experience now makes me mad even today. You are much better off spending that money for another hotel in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: familyof4bpwj
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean, quiet resort. The rooms, pools and grounds are impeccably kept. We would definitely stay here again. The pools were nice and warm, so our kids could swim in them all day- if we would have let them!!

Reviews.Title: “The Parrot Key resort is a great value and a comforting experience.”
Reviews.Author: r0adbu77y
Reviews.Content: A shuttle to the old town Duval street area would be great. Having to cab it to Old Town is the only negative thing I can thing of regarding our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Fantastic Atmosphere and Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: JPCastellano
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a very clean, beautiful, and reasonably priced hotel with great amenities and a wonderful staff. While its location is a few miles away from Duval Street, I wouldn't say that this is a bad thing. Getting their is only a short walk or drive. The grounds are beautiful, the Tiki Bar has great food, and the staff is exceptionally helpful. Parking was never an issue. The rooms were clean and each one has a sunning porch. Sitting out there with a good book and a drink was a great escape when we needed one. Palm trees provide a break from the wind and the landscaping affords one privacy from neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort & Cozy accomodations”
Reviews.Author: sandyrobinson4
Reviews.Content: Our visit was short just an evening with some friends to enjoy Key West. The grounds were beautifully landscaped once on the property you did not realize you were just off the main road. The units are cozy and tastefully designed with a caribbean flare. We stayed in the 3 bedroom cottage. The beds and pillows were some of the most comfortable that I have ever slept on. I would definitely stay longer next time. Will recommend to my friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was under construction and could not use pool area.”
Reviews.Author: lennyo00
Reviews.Content: We could not use the pool area because of the compressors running in the immediate area of the pool on a Sunday afternoon. A complaint was made at the front desk and in response to an e-mail and no follow up action was taken. When placing the reservation they did not state that construction activities would be ongoing and some of their facilities would not be available for use.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and room!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy77_10
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the grounds were absolutely beautiful!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility”
Reviews.Author: Larry_English
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this accomodation for 5 nights, VERY spacious 2 bedroom apartment with a sand "beach" right off my livingroom porch, 2 bedrooms, large dinning area and a modern full sized kitchen which they fail to mention at all. Just a top notch place to stay, about a 5 minute drive to Duval Street. Quiet, secluded, 3 pools on the grounds. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Singh Resorts has done it again!”
Reviews.Author: KeysGuy99
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in Marathon at Tranquility Bay, however this time around I decided to stay at Key West at Parrot Key. Wow! Singh has kept everything that is good at Tranquility Bay, and made it better. Everything from the rooms, to the grounds and even the pools and Tiki Bar. The staff all had the same caring attitude that I have grown to know and love from the Singh team. The management has really outdone themselves in keeping up the good name of Singh Resorts. Thanks again guys!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Home away from Home in Tropicle Paradice”
Reviews.Author: rogerfcannon
Reviews.Content: All the amenities of your own home you could live here literaly

Reviews.Title: “A week in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: RamonaCinTN
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Parrot Key Resort, I realized I had made the right choice for my stay in Key West. The location is in new town and away from the noise of Duval Street yet close enough to zip back and forth to the action in about 5 minutes. There was an ample supply of free parking around the resort that granted easy access to any area. And the grounds are simply gorgeous! Very tropical in nature with palms and flowering plants everywhere your eye gazes. My room was a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite on the second and third floors on "Slow Lane". This room was very clean, nicely decorated, and very comfortable. A bonus was a balcony off both the living room area and master bedroom complete with two adirondack chairs. Each room had its own flat screen tv which certainly made the place feel like home. The bed in the master bedroom was extremely comfortable. So much so that I didn't need the one or two day adjustment period before I could sleep. As an aside, there is a grocery store, drug store, liquor store and other shopping and restaurants directly across the street and next door to the Parrot Key. That proved quite handy to stock the fridge with drinks and breakfast food. I should note that my particular room did not have a microwave. I believe some of the other rooms in the resort did have a full kitchen which would have been nice for those tasty leftovers. All in all, I am eager to recommend Parrot Key Resort to anyone headed down to Key West. The accomodations are very comfortable, reasonably priced (for Key West), and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort is the only place I would stay at Key West”
Reviews.Author: RosaBolivar1
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is my favorite place to stay al Key West for many reasons: The facilities in general are absolutely beautiful, intimate, romantic and tastefully decorated. The rooms are brand new, exquisitely decorated, lots of space and high end appliances. Each room has a patio or balcony where you can sit and enjoy the beautiful view. They thought about every detail including a fully equipped kitchen where you will find any imaginable utensil you might need to make a meal, plus plates, silverware, pots and pans, etc. There are several pools available, nicely decorated and surrounded by a beautiful landscaping. I also enjoyed the ambiance music, very relaxing. The food at the Pool CafÃ© is also really good and there are many healthy choices. I loved the fish tacos and shrimp salad. The staff throughout the resort is super friendly and personable. Another thing that I like is the location; itâ€™s conveniently located close to supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, etc. About 2 miles from Duval Street so you are isolated from all the noise and parties, itâ€™s a little paradise! If you are looking for an intimate experience where you will stay in a stunning facility but at the same time you will feel at home this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “My best and only choice to stay in KW!”
Reviews.Author: gapgibson2111
Reviews.Content: Espectacular Resort! the best location in Key West. The room was outstanding! it had everything you need, the beautyfull beach-style deco, the kitchen and all of its utensiles (if you wanted to prepare a Â¨Paella" you had every single thing to cook it). The pools were great, with warm water, the music in the area pool was magnificant, very relaxing and friendly. The food we ate in the Blue cafe next to the first pool was delightfull and tasty, the fish tacos, the cuban panini, the wines and the cold beers: Eric the waiter gave us a very good and special attention. In conclusion, we had a great and relaxed time there during the weekend. I will recommned this hotel to anyone I know who travels down there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jenjmurray
Reviews.Content: I will come back again and again. My husband & I can't stop talking about our stay. The view of the lush gardens and ocean is breath taking. It is amazing how beautiful this place is. As you turn in off Roosevelt you are immediately taken to a quiet paradise right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. We had an ocean view, which we were a little disappointed that the view was blocked by huge palm trees, but after laying down on the bed with the balcony doors open watching the breeze blow through the palm trees we couldn't have asked for a better view. The pools were beautiful, wish they were open longer. The desk staff were all very helpful from providing me with a blow dryer to recommending scooter rentals & trolley tours. You will not be disappointed, we will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “A visit to paradise”
Reviews.Author: Wendy701
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Parrot Key Resort. With the Gulf at our back door and beautiful gardens out front, it was very enjoyable. Each night we sat out under the moonlight on our balcony overlooking the Gulf with a glass of wine. It doesn't get much better than that. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SGBMarathon_FL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parrot Key once before when it first opened and loved it, so I chose this property again when I needed a room in Key West for Fantasy Fest. The grounds look even more lush and beautiful than before. From the road it's hard to tell what paradise awaits you as you step into the property. My sister and I had a two-level suite that was fantastic. The front desk gave us all the inforamtion we needed on the events and how to get to and from Duval during this busy time. We absolutely loved it and will stay at Parrot Key again next year!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: michelle_wright3
Reviews.Content: I took my first adult time since have a child two years ago and we had a great time. We flew into Miami and spent a few days in Miami Beach and then drove down to Key West. First I would say you are better off flying into Key West. The drive from Miami took us 3 hours. We had fun and stopped at little shops along the way but its a lil too long of a drive. The resort is a lil ways from Duval Street but I think thatâ€™s why we enjoyed it so much. The resort was picture perfect. It was very clean and quiet. The pools were heated and it was just perfect. Although they donâ€™t have tons of options for food the food that we ordered at the pool was good. The young man running the front desk when we check in was very helpful and hooked us up on a great package deal, we did a all day tour where we parasailed, jet skied, scuba, took a sun set cruise on a boat with a live band. When I mean we had a great time we had a awesome time. We shopped and enjoyed food and drinks the whole time we were there. We took taxis back and forth from the hotel to Duval Street which only cost $10 each way including a tip, next time we are going to rent scooters which only cost between $15 and $25 a day. Key West is a hidden gem and the resort was great. We are going to go and visit Key West again and take our daughter and will most definitely say at the Parrot Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: flamingo18
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Parrot Key and both times we loved it. Although the weather worked against us this time (Tropical Storm Tomas) and we weren't prepared for the colder weather, we still had a great time. The townhouse was beautiful, the rooms worked out perfect for all of us (three couples) and we enjoyed both cooking in and eating out equally. It was close to both Publix and Ross' (which was important for shopping of course!!) and we could easily navigate our way to Duval. Overall, looking forward to going back for the warm weather and the heated pool, which we love!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT KEY WEST EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: heatherdadic
Reviews.Content: Great for a weekend getaway. Rooms are spacious and clean. Will stay here again the next time we travel to the keys.

Reviews.Title: “We never wanted to leave our townhouse or the property!”
Reviews.Author: nfaus
Reviews.Content: It was a "chick trip" and we were so thrilled with our relaxing and fabulous accomodations. The 4 pools were landscaped beautifully and afforded privacy. The pool temp was divine. We all slept well in our big fluffy beds and I would stay here over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, tranquil hotel, however there is no beach, only a strip of sand at the back of the house!”
Reviews.Author: JMurray_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The grounds were beautiful and extremely well maintained. There was everything you needed and more in the house and the kitchen area was well equipped. There are 4 different pool areas, all with ample loungers and when we were there, all very quiet. There is a bar at the larger pool where we had lunch twice. There is a varied lunch-time menu of salads, paninis and wraps which we all enjoyed and was not expensive. Our only disappointment was that there is no beach. We arrived and eagerly opened the back door of our house waiting to see the beach and ocean, there is none - only a small strip of sand which is obviousely imported, and although from some of the houses there is an ocean view, there is no ocean access. We would stay there again if in Key West, even now knowing there is no beach or ocean access. You do need to use a car to get arround, however the taxi into town and Duval Street was only $16 for 4 people, and only took about 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: Swampbunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November. It was comfortable, quiet, convenient to grocery stores etc, however you need a car to get to old Key West and any beaches. The inside of the units are tastefully decorated and quite spacious. It is a nice retreat from the craziness and grittiness of the town. The pools and grounds are well maintained and the pool temp was nice and warm when the air turned chilly. Instead of one large pool, there are four smaller pools, which feels so much more intimate. The loungers are very comfortable. Other than relaxing at the pool or out at the strip of sand, (there's no beach, but there is a waterfront) there isn't much to do at the resort itself. It didn't have a lot of occupancy at the time we were there, we often had one of the pools to ourselves, which was very nice. If this resort was at full capacity, it might feel a bit crowded in the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable stay at the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort!”
Reviews.Author: chicken328
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Florida, which was highlighted by our 3 day stay in Key West. We arrived just in time for the last days of our very first Fantasy Fest. It was quite an unforgetable experience...enough said! The staff was pleasant at check in/out and the one call we made to housekeeping was quickly answered and resolved. Our stay at Parrot Key was quite pleasant. It was quiet, comfortable, relaxing and overall very enjoyable. There were 6 of us (3 couples), and we stayed in one of the 3 bedroom cottages. We all had our own private bedroom and bath which was great and it had a full kitchen which leads me to believe that the property is in ther process of being converted from a time-share facility into a resort. There was a lot of construction in the rooms while we were there, but it seemed that the owners took care to make sure that the guests were not placed near the buildings that were being worked on. The grounds were very clean and extremley well groomed. The pools (4) were all clean and all of the deck furniture appeared to be new and very well maintained. We pretty much had the pools to ourselves the day we were out there which was very pleasant. We did get drinks at the Tiki Bar, but did not try any of the snacks or lunch that were available. The drinks were good but rather pricey. If we return to the Keys, we would definitley consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodations with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: DubyaMC
Reviews.Content: I was down here for a conference for a few nights and I can't say enough about this place. Truly a great experience from start to finish. The separate pools make for quiet poolside relaxing and the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. I won't stay anywhere else in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenic spot far away from Duval”
Reviews.Author: Jane195114
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom bungalo with four smallish courtyard pools in the center. It is not conveniently located to the downtown action. Rooms were clean, but try to get ice and the hours of operation to get it are limited. When booking (we had 4 people), they neglected to inform us that there is 1 very long stairway to the living area and 1st bedroom and then another very long stairway that leads to the 2nd and no alarm clock in the 2nd bedroom for them to use. Also taxi's were very pricey to go downtown, for 4 people $20.00 each way. We stayed 4 days so the taxi price at the end was very high. The pools are very nice but there were children screaming in 3 of them so we had to use the pool farthest away. I think they should allow one pool for children and designate 1 at least have 2 or 3 for adults only. I realize it was Fantesy Fest weekend but for a 4 night stay it cost a total of $1,762. Also they have a small refrig with coffee and cups but no sink to rinse things out or put the ice in after it melts, and no water so the people staying upstairs in the 2nd bedroom if they awoke eary had to go all the way back upstairs to their room to the bathroom to fill the coffee pot. I believe for a place this pricey they should have a sink if they provide a refrigerator. Had a good time in Key West despite some of the hardships of the hotel. Would stay closer to the downtown area next time and save the $ on the taxi's. Also they charge an extra $24.00 a day tagged onto your room for use of their pools and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Nutwell103
Reviews.Content: After looking at many hotels around Key West we chose Parrot Key. And we are so glad that we did. On arrival the staff were welcoming and very helpfull. A very king gentleman took us to our rooms. The setting of this hotel is outstanding, just how i pictured Key West to be. The rooms were stunning, we had a garden room with our own little beech front, sun deck sunbeds it was ideal. Four great pools to choose from. Our children who are 8 - 15 had a great time in the pools. I would recomend anyone to visit Parrot Key. Key West got the thumbs up from me. Short taxi ride to Duval street, Mallory Square to see the stunning sunset and street entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: BronzeLadyA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a little getaway. The room was fantastic with a great view. Service was wonderful and the cleaning staff was discreet and did a thorough job. This hotel is not in the heart of the action but no more than a 10 minute car ride away. That was perfect for us as we were looking for a tranquil getaway and could interact with people when we chose. The only thing that would have made this place better is better on-site food offerings. I'm not much for the sandwiches so we had to leave the hotel to get something to eat (only a hassle because we weren't on an adventure vacation but a relax as much as possible vacation) several times.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tracy_field_1965
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hidden gem . After driving in the wrong direction for 2 1/2 hours from Miami because the Sat Nav told us to,Upon arrival to this hotel all our anger and frustration was quickly abated. The rooms were luxurious, private and roomy. The decor was to a high specification and the plump beds were to die for. We felt like Kings and Queens. The Pool areas were well maintained with a Caribbean feel to them. The food served at the pool area was averagely priced, well presented and of good quality. The staff were extremely helpful, polite and appeared very happy in their duties which indicated to us that this place is well managed. There is free access to the internet, WI FI, printer, and ice was delivered if requested at no extra charge. There was ample car parking when we stayed there. The hotel is a little bit out of the way. Duval Street is walkable but it is a long walk.... approx 1 hour. We hired bikes to overcome this so we could have a few beers without worrying about driving. All trips can be organised through reception as well as bike hire. This hotel was faultless other than you can't smoke anywhere on the premises not even on the veranda or car park.... there is a Â£500.00 fine if spotted but this will be a plus to non smokers. Overall this hotel is the best hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful....quiet...comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: MARTINIGURL
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. Would highly recommend staying there. Helps if you have a car. A bit of a walk to Duval street where all the action is. Very clean and the beds are top notch. Reserved a one bedroom garden and was bumped up to a 3 bedroom ocean view. AMAZING!!!! Only had 2 nights to stay there. Wish I could have stayed a week. Try it...you wont be dissappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Girls Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: ghill5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parrot Key Resort in October 2010 with six of my closest girlfriends to celebrate all of us turning 40 this year. We had two of the three bedroom garden/pool view cottages right next to each other. The resort is beautiful and the landscaping makes is really special, very lush! The cottages are wonderful, first floor has a living room, full kitchen with granite and stainless appliances and a half bath. Second floor has the master bedroom with a king and another bedroom with a queen. Third floor bedroom has another queen. Each bedroom has its own bathroom and all rooms have flat screen TV's. The decor is fun and beachy, beautiful colors, updated furniture, super comfy beds and nice artwork. We were able to do laundry in a common area by the fitness center, buy groceries at the Winn-Dixie across the street and get other essentials right across the parking lot at the Walgreen's. We rented bikes from "Easton Bikes" for $10 per day and it was the perfect way to get around town, only a 15 min or so ride to Duvall St. Other times we took a cab which was about $4 per person because we had a group. It's a $7 per person ride to the airport. I would like to thank the supervisor named Sean that was on duty when we came in to have him help us divide up our bill, he was very helpful and friendly. Not as much was the lady that was working that afternoon. Overall a fabulous place to stay for a great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “It took me sometime to find a hotel hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ManuBol
Reviews.Content: It took me sometime to find a hotel hotel in key west that had value but also a good stay. So I was caught up with this option and it was a lucky bet. The resort is amazing. The lil houses have everything you need. The room are well decorated and very cozy, with big, comfy beds!! They have 4 pools so you don't feel you're sharing it too much. And the tikki bar is also something you should try!! The wallgreens next door it's open 24h and can supply you with the basic for the kitchen. If you looking fr a comfortable stay bot so close to the busy central area of the city that must be your choice!!

Reviews.Title: “An Artistic and Serene resort”
Reviews.Author: BC00k
Reviews.Content: Lush gardens and special artwork everywhere you turn. The rooms, condo-like suites, were clean and comfortable. The staff were fantastic, helpful, friendly, and universally said that they liked working at Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Key West, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ihrc
Reviews.Content: Like stepping into Old Key West on the outside (lots of white porches and balconies) with all mod cons indoors. Beautiful grounds abundantly planted with tropical greenery. Rooms were sleek and clean. Staff polite and helpful. Concierge had loads of info on nearby and Old Town eateries and entertainments. Gotta say I liked the proximity of Walgrens and some other shopping, but once on the grounds you'd never know it was there. The resort seems totally remote and relaxed. Four swimming pools and a light food and drinks bar provided everything I could want and more.

Reviews.Title: “A world away, yet so close”
Reviews.Author: Porscheturbodriver
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday and my friends wanted to know what I wanted. I told them let's go to key west. From the moment we arrived on the property, I was impressed. The friendly and professional staff bent over backwards for us and our many special request. As I entered our three bedroom condo, I was over powered with the feeling of home. I felt instantly relaxed, and comfortable. As I spent some time exploring our new home for the next couple of days, I discovered all of the fine details of the craftsmanship. This property is high end, no expense had been spared. High end flat screen tv in each and every room. And top of the line build quality, in and out. As our three day journey started taking us out of the condo and around the property, I was equally impressed. I can't come up with words impressive enough to describe the secluded swimming pools. Being at anyone of the four pools makes you feel as if you have been taken away to your own private island. The journey from one pool to the next is like a hike in your own private jungle, with hidden artifacts just waiting to be discovered around each and every mysterious corner. Eventually I found my way to the poolside bar and grill. Once again, I was greeted with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The cocktails, and food were on par with what I had now come to expect from this top notch resort. I could go on forever but I just don't have the time. In short, I deeply enjoyed my stay and did not want to leave. Don't forget to take some extra time to enjoy the awesome artwork scattered around the resort. And you will appreciate the convenient location, to all that key west has to offer. I can't wait to go back, and I'm confident you will feel the same after your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: eliseo918
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and relaxing place to stay. The room was large and beautifully decorated. The pools and landscape are gorgeous. The staff was courteous and welcoming. I highly recommend it. Elise from Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jboyle17
Reviews.Content: A three day conference very busy time staff went out of their way to care for ALL of our needs. Accomodations were wonderfull, clean,neat and beautifuly decorated. Will return for fun and Highly recomend to any one. Thank yuo and your staff

Reviews.Title: “Calgon take me away.... ah the private pools and the art work and the lush vegitation!”
Reviews.Author: iowakate
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice place. I was there for a conference with a large group of people. They accomodated us when we decended for lunch and had to pull staff from all other areas. The staff were great, helpful, kind and efficient. The room was beautiful, I wish I was there now...

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect - right on the water”
Reviews.Author: Mco-Man
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit, but never have been to a resort quite as nice as this. We liked the large rooms, and the layouts of the units we saw. Covered porches on both sides of what appeared to be every unit. The rooms face the four pools, in the center, which are surrounded with so many huge trees and plants, that the pools couldn't be seen. Hugely relaxing. We'd go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Comfort in Style”
Reviews.Author: bettinger
Reviews.Content: This is truly a tropical sanctuary! The grounds of this resort are lush with tropical vegetation that is thoughtfully and tastefully groomed. I loved the four, yes I did say four, private swimming pools. Each one is surrounded by vegetation and palm trees and intriguing sculptures. They convey such a feeling of serenity and beauty. The artistic touch flows into the rooms decorated in soothing colors and attractive art. I'm very particular about beds and pillows and these lent themselves to a great nights sleep. The staff is particularily friendly and service oriented. You have to be sure to talk with Shelley in the cafe/bar. I look forward to my return visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: jgabmg
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort is designed to help you slow down from the moment you step in the property. I particularly enjoyed the 4 pools because they are intimate, lush and quiet. The tropical vegetation around the pools and the rest of the resort gives you the feeling of being in your own private island.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, comfortable, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: gracienicholas
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. The rooms at Parrot Key were the quietest I have ever experienced and among the most comfortable. Great service, beautiful grounds. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “This is absolutely the nicest hotel that...”
Reviews.Author: karashop
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the nicest hotel that I've stayed in for the price. The staff, every one of them was genuinely pleasant and always had time to say hello or help with anything. The grounds and landscaping are breathtaking. It feels more like a garden with little porches tucked away than a hotel. The pools (all 3!) were beautiful, always somewhere private to swim or sit peacefully. The rooms were beatifully appointed, decorated with splashes of color and local art. Spacious and comfortable rooms. The temperature seemed always just right. I rented a bike, arranged by the hotel, which was delivered and picked up, no charge. Quick ride to town, safe, liesurely and no parking hassles. The drinks and food at the bar were beyond expectations. I was surprised how often I chose to skip the trip to one of the fabulous local restaurants to have a traquil and delicious meal just outside my door. Go to Key West, stay with the wonderful folks at Parrot Key, it could be one of your favorite trips.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TrudyWesley
Reviews.Content: When you pull into the driveway and around to the front lobby, you feel like you've entered a whole new world removed from commercialism and tourism. The grounds are lush and full with tropical foilage creating a feeling of being on an island with in itself. Staff is incredably friendly and helpful, and the rooms and grounds are very clean and in top shape. The rooms have high tech. features of flat screen TV's, coffee pots and cable, but still keep the island charm with the decore and furnishings. I would highly recommend this resort to someone who wants to get away from it all, but have nightlife and shopping just a small ways away!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Hotel provides a satisfying, tropical experience of Key West”
Reviews.Author: silverfox03
Reviews.Content: At Parrot Key Hotel and Resort I was immersed in a lush, tropical paradise with a helpful and friendly staff, beautiful and charming accommodations, and a relaxed atmosphere. It was a special treat to find the crystal-clear swimming pools maintained with a dilute salt solution rather than chlorine. I swam every day; sometimes twice. It was very pleasant to sit poolside in the evenings with friends, enjoying the tropical air. It would have been especially nice to have a bicycle or scooter to get around the island. There is still more I'd like to see. I recommend a visit to Fort Zachary Taylor park for a nice afternoon at the beach, and the Sunset Celebration at Mallory Square at--you guessed it--sunset.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect atmosphere for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Carnalito79
Reviews.Content: I loved the smaller, more intimate pool decks surrounded by palm trees. This results in more privacy along with a quiet, more peaceful atmosphere. I also loved the location as it was only a couple minutes from every attraction in Key West but not in the hustle and bustle of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, and exceptional service!!”
Reviews.Author: maracgleason
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail at this resort is incredible; down to the interior design, the landscape, the music they play, the comfort of the bed, and the incredibly kind and attentive staff. I absolutely loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieTtravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Parrot Key Hotel and Resort for four nights while attending a conference in Key West. Parrot Key did everything right. From the smiling and friendly staff at check-in, to the beautifully decorated rooms and grounds, to possibly the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, it was a beautiful experience. The grounds were beyond belief, the many pools felt very private and were surrounded by beautiful, tropical vegitation. The entire resort has been perfectly planned to give a feel of privacy, rain forest lushness, and peace which is amazing so close to the bustle of Key West. One pool has a bar and serves some food. The service there was superb too, with friendly staff always willing to be helpful, even finding out the exact time for sunset when we wanted to make the trek to Mallory Square for the event. My biggest regret for our time at Parrot Key Resort was that with the conference, we did not have more time to enjoy the beauty and comfort of the resort. I hope to get to visit Parrot Key Resort again --soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Tropical Oasis with attention to all the small details”
Reviews.Author: MsEC27
Reviews.Content: An incredible delight to stay in this Resort. The biggest rooms I've ever seen, with comfy beds, bigs showers and bath and lots of room to lounge around. All the rooms have fantastic balconies that look on to tropical gardens which surround the property and the 4 pools. What amazed me, and what makes this a 5-star YES is all the attention to detail - not just in the rooms but everywhere! The artwork is beautiful, lots has gone into the decorative touches, great towels, nice bath products that actually smell good, large mirrors, hairdryer - every time I needed something it was right there. The crown jewel are the gardens create a little paradise all around you, dotted with great sculptures, carved doorways, and again 5-star attention to detail. You feel like you are staying in a luxury resort, and service is friendly and top-class. Loved the free internet and good connectivity! My only criticism is I was here on business and there was working desk or table in my room. They brought in a chair and I improvised, but if you had to do any serious work from your room while here, it wouldn't be all that comfortable. If you are someone who can work from their lap, you'll be fine. But who comes here to work anyway? I would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort for body and soul”
Reviews.Author: dujee39
Reviews.Content: Many hotels have lovely decor and well-appointed facilities and comfortable beds. But not many hotels welcome you like a member of the family, and really care whether you are comfortable and happy. The staff was so generous and cheerful and hard-working, and had a true spirit of service. In my mind, there are many lovely places to stay in Key West, but Parrot Key offers more than a tropical paradise; it offers a warm, human touch.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: twilson58
Reviews.Content: I came came officially to attend a conference, unofficially I came to rest and regenerate. Parrot Key Resort met and exceeded all my expectations. The set-up of the rooms were unique and afforded me the privacy that I cherish, The common area was ideal for entertaining friends and enjoying casual conversation. The setting was relaxing and casual and provided an atmosphere for rest and relaxation. Best of all, the beds were superb and the night's sleep was refreshing. I would highly recommend this slice of Heaven

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel due to super lodging (rooms, furnishings etc) and friendliness of the staff”
Reviews.Author: kobekatt
Reviews.Content: Try to get a water view and then enjoy the sun going down. Walgreens next door and TGI Friday across the road are good value. Take one of the "villas" if you can

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in key west”
Reviews.Author: FoodboyBob
Reviews.Content: We've stayed the last 2 years for the poker run bike event The 3 bedroom units are as nice as any place I've stayed Full kitchen 3 bedrooms/3.5 baths Huge living/dining/kitchen with half bath on the first floor 2 bed/2 bath on second 1 bed/1 bath on third Grounds look like Disney 4 pools Look out for the $25/day resort fee, but still $110/couple/night is great 2 bedrooms have a mini fridge and 1/2 the living room To me it's worth the extra $100/night for the 3 bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfection, can't wait to go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnNelson
Reviews.Content: Almost perfection, can' wait to go back!!!! This resort is simply gorgeous. The only bad point for some,if there must be one, which also could be a very good point for others, is that the resort is ex-centred and if you want to venture around Key West, you really need a car! But apart from that this is a little gem, a piece of paradise.... Accommodations set in lush surroundings are very well appointed (wonderful beds!), dÃ©cor is simply superb and ground floor rooms have their own private patio(with chairs and lounger) onto sandy sea front with amazing views, service is discreet and efficient, pools(x4) are so so nice and their settings thoughfully appointed and above all very clean. Car parking(even when hotel full) is ample (Walgreen overflow is almost part of resort and patrolled by security at night).No main restaurant (but Key West Duvall street has soooooooo many!) but the Tikki (pool) Bar food was well above expectations and New Yorker Shelley extremely helpful and professional as was Sean in reception. And the whole place is non-smoking, hooray.... We just can't wait to go back......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: BxNY20
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past weekend at the Parrot Key Resort. It was my first time in Key West and I will be going back and staying at Parrot Key. Michele in reservations was very friendly and informative. The young lady who checked me in and out was friendly and helpful. For those looking to relax and have some piece and quiet the resort is in a perfect location. It is away from all the madness of Duval Street but close enough to be there in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home Base”
Reviews.Author: keywestbrideAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for our base camp for our Wedding in Key West! It was perfect. The hotel was beautiful and quiet! You are about a 5 minute drive to Duval Street and any other attractions in Key West. The hotel has all the ameneties if you have tie to use them. There are even 4 pools to choose from. We had a 3 bedroom cottage that was very beautiful. We even had our own private beach! The beds were like what you would find on a cruise ship and everyone slept great! This hotel was a great bargain for everything we got!

Reviews.Title: “great room great location great value Like being in an upscale home with all the comforts”
Reviews.Author: tersh68
Reviews.Content: key parrot Resort exceeded all of my expectations. great rooms with tons of space with all the comforts of home. The beds are extremely confortable and greatly helped my Lumbago, The mattress was firm yet soft with incredibly plush bedding. I had currenly been getting back and neck adjustments from my chiropractor Dr. Lemley in Chicago at 917 south oak park avenue great service, who highly recommended the matresses. Very spacious accomodations and incredible value for what you get. We couldnt have been happier. would recommend to anyone. great for couples family with kids or large group. The best accomodations thus far i have experienced in key west. I was amazed at how spacious the rooms are We all loved this place highly reccommend to any and all desiring to visit key west!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: AshGator1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful, tropical, peaceful, quiet, luxurious...I cannot say enough great things about our stay here! The landscaping and gardens are so abundant, you feel like you're in a tropical rain forest. Since there are 4 pools, each one private from the other, there were times when we had an entire pool to ourselves! Our room was on the first floor, so we had a very nice back deck, complete with Adirondack chairs, that we were able to hang out on, or walk straight to the pool or tiki bar. The location is only about 2 miles from Duval Street, and we were able to drive in a park for the day with no problem. The rooms feel very lush, are very clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay here again, possibly in one of the two story townhouses in the back. These look right out onto the water, have their own private beach area and cabanas! Love the Parrot Key resort!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: deejdee
Reviews.Content: The facility was peaceful, well appointed and very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vsellers
Reviews.Content: The web site is very misleading. The beach is just sand that was brought in to cover a lawn. There is a water view but you cannot access the water. There is no mention on the web site that smoking is not allowed anywhere on the property and there is a $500/day penality if you smoke. The condo we stayed in had a kitchen so we bought beer and wine; however, the rules prevent guests from taking wine and beer to the pool area --- you must buy drinks from the resorts bar. The property was located a great distance from the downtown activities which requires you to take cabs or you need to rent a car. The condo was furnished nicely and clean, and the bedrooms comfortable. However, we would not stay at the property again because it was very pricey for no more than a nice, comfortable and clean condo. Additionally, we were very disappointed that the web site was so misleading and did not include all the information you need to make a decision on where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway from the craziness of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Robyn9690
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with nice landscaping. We had reserved a 2-bedroom cottage but received a 3-bedroom cottage. The views of the bay were very nice but I understand not many of the cottages offer that. The cottage was super clean and very updated. The beds were extremely comfortable with soft linens. The only one thing that I wish it had was a jetted bathtub instead of a soaker tub but it didn't ruin the stay without it. We lost power one night due to an accident in town but the emergency lights in the cottage went on right away and was well lit to move around. It's far from Mallory Square and downtown but provided parking so you could get around without any hassles. Over all, very nice resort and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further stay here!! Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahS76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 15 year anniversary for 4 nights and absolutely loved it! Very spacious and clean. The property is gorgeous. We had a 2 BR cottage overlooking the Gulf and it was beautiful. After researching where to stay in Key west for quite some time we really feel like we made a great decision. Far enough away from Duval st. to avoid the hustle but only a 5 minute drive to visit the area. We had a minor complaint of no washer/dryer units in our place since we were doing a lot of water activites but they do have them on the grounds but it was hard for "us" to get back to do it since we were so busy. All in all a great place. I did see one review where they mentioned they were slammed with fees at checkout. We were made very aware when booking our reservationsand "IT IS" on the website! Just about everywhere that has the word resort in it you have fees tacked on.

Reviews.Title: “This resort tops most!!”
Reviews.Author: Beverly_Jane98
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort was an amazing experience. We were a group of friends in Key West for a wedding on the beach. If not for the wedding, we would have stayed at the resort the entire time!! The rooms/condos were excellent. Decorated very island-like with comfortable but luxurious furniture. The service was excellent - we had to call the hotel front desk about two minor problems. Both were repaired very quickly and didn't change our opinion about the resort or our trip. The tiki/bar food at the largest pool was unbelievable. We could eat lunch, have drinks all within the pool area without thinking of leaving. It was our own paradise. The beds/linens made for the best sleep I had in weeks. Very relaxing and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: JaneSeelbach
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this resort. Normally we do the Southermost at the end of Duvall. But this time we had additional people and wanted to all be together. Saw this advertised and decided to give it a shot. Wow, what a beautiful resort. Upon entering the tropical plants and the entire surroundings welcome you. We had a 3 bedroom cottage on the gulf side. Our room was unbelievable...clean, beautiful, peaceful, modern, (with a bit of homeliness to it), Everyone was very nice, they thought of everything. Even the wine bottle opener!!! I did not use the gym, but they have one. Jet skis, kiyaks, everything. About a 10 min. drive to the craziness, but fun Duval street and great food, drinks, etc....we certainly will stay here again upon our next trip down. We are regulars in Key West, a couple times a year. Living in Fort Lauderdale, it is an easy 4 hour trip for us. Believe me when I say, great quality, great prices, great surroundings, great time, great fun!!!!! Thanks Parrot Key....you have a gem in Key West. Keep up the great work....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with bad surprise ending”
Reviews.Author: flyinbutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Hard to sleep with next room so loud after midnight. Further from Duval than we were led to believe. We couldn't get food on the property after 6 pm. Worst thing was the surprise $150 resort fee at the end of the stay. We were not told of this fee when making reservations. This is not what I would call a resort. I would not recomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience at Parrott Key Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: RonFromOregon
Reviews.Content: Traveled all the way from Oregon. At check in the staff could not have been more friendly or efficient. It reminded me of how great they were when I made my reservation. Both the reservation staff and check-in staff gave me great information about the resort and suggested places to go and things to see. As I walked to my room, I had no less than 5 employess greet me. The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable. I wanted to take the bed home with me. The outdoor cafe/ Tiki bar by the pool was a great place to relax and visit with other guests. The people at the watersports dock were super fun and helpful. This was an awesome experience and I would highly recommend this resort to everyone. Great for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “all the action, none of the noise”
Reviews.Author: montyjett
Reviews.Content: been to the Keys many times..enjoyed this trip.. close enough to Duvall and the fun but nice a quiet to unwind

Reviews.Title: “an excellent choice for the family”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller055
Reviews.Content: Arrived after traveling from London so a long day, staff at check-in were extremely helpful and provided helpful hints and tips on what to do in key West; We stayed in 3 bedroom house and the accommodation was excellent, providing plenty of space for us and or two teenage children. Pools were clean and being split in to 4 smaller units meant it was easy to fnd one thta was not too busy. I would happlily recommend this hotel as a place to stay for families

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back and chill”
Reviews.Author: everash
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Parrot Key Resort for the 4th of July weekend, 2010. We stayed in a two-bedroom townhouse. It was immaculate and very spacious, and the kitchen was nicer than my kitchen at home! All four pools were beautiful, with lush gardens and beautiful sculptures. The food was excellent at Cafe Blue, and make sure to take notice of the ceiling - it was remarkable! I would highly recommend the resort - the grounds were lovely, the employees were all helpful and friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxing, quiet and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “"A home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: misslinad79
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the parrot key resort and we all fell in love with the gorgeous resort and did not want to leave. The resort has 4 different themed pools in a very intimate setting and relaxing background music. The first pool aslo features a small cafe, serving drinks and food. The 3-story villa's was very charming and beautiful with great coloured interior and SUPER comfortoble beds!! The rooms also features terrace with private sand area. The landscaping was amazing and you felt good being there. It is very close to Duval street and other sighseeing in Key West. I have been to Key West several times and stayed at different resort, but Parrot Resort certainly make a difference in making you feel very special and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Henderbells
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 2 nights at Parrot Key Resort and loved it so much we stayed for 4. So much to see in Key West but the pools and landscaping are so attractive we could not drag ourselves away. Lovely rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of Heaven tucked away in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: BecB_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in June. The resort was excellent!! Staff and service was impeccable. The resort is the right mix of relaxation. We spent most of our days relaxing in the 4 beautiful pools and sitting by the outdoor bar. It is a bit of a drive away from duval street but we weren't too keen on the drunks and parties that you find there so we were quite happy to relax at the resort. We were upgraded to a two bedroom cottage and it was spectacular! I would definitely go back to the parrot key resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and relaxing. Loved it even without the beachfront”
Reviews.Author: DeborahLS
Reviews.Content: This place is the perfect getaway for a family vacation if you don't have to have oceanfront. The property is great. Our 3 bedroom cottage was clean and spacious, with a front and back door, as well as two balconies. All the furniture was comfortable and artwork gorgeous. The poolside bar, fitness room and laundry room were also nice. There were some kids there, but not so many that the adults couldn't enjoy themselves. We spent 3 days in the pool, and never once had to share it with kids or more than 5 people. It's close to the beach as well as Duval Street, both within 5 minutes. Scooter rentals are cheap, and they deliver to the resort. Took a minute to get used to the lizards, small snakes and iguanas, but hey it is Florida. We will return to same resort next year.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the beach?”
Reviews.Author: japan2112
Reviews.Content: Altogether a very nice resort with 4 swimming pools and wonderful flora, but our "beachfront" cottage sat on a narrow sandy strip the resort had put in, behind a low fence behind a wide mangrove growth, hence, no swimming at this beach. Also because of the fence and plantings all sunsets had to be viewed from our 2nd floor bedroom balcony. There is a no smoking anywhere on the grounds policy that you need to be aware of especially of you are thinking about enjoying that Cuban cigar while watching the sunset. Besides the standard taxes there is a daily $24. resort fee tacked onto the price that I did not understand what it entitled us other than use of the pool and laundry. Quiet, convenient, lush, and well appointed apartments with a couple of quirks

Reviews.Title: “Can't judge it by the outside!”
Reviews.Author: rdstrubel
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 friends wanted a few days in Key West that was not near the noise of the crowds yet not too far to drive to the sights either. We had made an early reservation at this resort a month prior for 2 days. During an unexpected death in our family during the previous month, we took the time to drive by the parking lot. We were ready to cancel....you really can't judge this book by it's cover as once we arrived for our stay, we extended an extra night. It is beautiful but as many others we heard complaining, it is somewhat misleading that this place is on the beach. We stayed in the most expensive 3 BR waterfront which is pretty much blocked by bushes and growth, it's beautiful, don't get me wrong, just don't plan on having anywhere to put your feet in the water except the pools. And they are nice and it is quiet! We had previously stayed at Tranquility Bay for our honeymoon and these houses are laid out almost identical. If you split the rooms between the bedrooms you can't beat the price. Each is private and has it's own bathroom and tv. We didn't mind the short drive to Duval Street and there is plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance from the resort. The people were very nice that worked there. Everything was clean and new in appearance, the appliances were stainless steel, large kitchen for cooking and eating in if you prefer. Parking lot can be crammed at times, esp. during busy season. Overall a wonderful place to stay in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Major security Problem”
Reviews.Author: laceychavarria
Reviews.Content: Our main problem at Parrot Key Resort was a security issue. At 2:00 in the morning, I was up with my daughter when I heard someone enter the front door downstairs. I sent my husband down there and by the time he got in there, there was already a man standing inside our room!! He quickly said that he thought we needed help with a problem, although he did not announce who he was or what his job was. My husband told him to leave. The following morning, I made 4 trips to the front desk to figure out who this man was. He not only had the card to get into our room, he also opened the door with a deadbolt key...Scary. We thought at first that he may have been a security guard, but the description of the man did not match the security guard. So, they had no idea who he was or what he was doing in our place (could have been there to steal or to hurt one of our children). They acted as if it was no big deal. There was no one in management there to speak to, they only have one person at the customer no service desk. It was handled completely inappropriately. Multiple emails and letters have been sent to the property manager, but i have never received a response or apology from anyone. They have a huge breach in their security at this resort. If you want to feel safe with your family, I would not recommend taking them there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Parking Accomodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: maryb123
Reviews.Content: Noone expects to park in Walgreens while on vacation. Unless you do not mind parking in a retails parking lot and wish to drive far to get to Duval Street and other tourist attractions and museums, do not book this venue. I will never stay here again. p.s. Paid for Ocean Front room and all I could see from our room where power lines running across the Gulf/ Not our idea of Oceam Front!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel014
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West for a weekend getaway and truly enjoyed our stay at this resort. The grounds are absolutely beautiful, and it was easy to get from the hotel to downtown Key West, although you will need to drive or grab a taxi. When we arrived our room was not yet ready, and while we did offer to wait at the bar until it was ready, the front desk staff was extremely courteous and upgraded us to a suite. The room was large, very nicely decorated and comfortable. Our only minor complaint is that the gym is quite small, but we were still able to get in a workout each morning. Overall, our experience was wonderful and we will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WFSteve
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nights at the Parrot Key and I wanted to let people know that I highly recommend this resort. It's quiet and pretty and a great place to relax. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath room and it felt more like a condo than a hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. We're not a high-maintenance family, but value is important to me. Parrot Key went well beyond my expectations. It felt like we were in a tropical hotel on a Caribbean island. As far as the location, it is next to a Wahlgreens, but there are also two hotels in the Marriott chain in the area too. When you're in the resort , you forget about the location because you don't see or hear a thing. It's only 5 minutes or so to anywhere on Key West by car, and we didn't have to deal with the Duval Street noise at night. My 15-year old daughter already is talking with her friends about our going back next year and staying at Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Strict, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Anders80
Reviews.Content: Looking for decent hotels in Key West we decided to try the Parrot Key Hotel. After 6 days at the best hotel we have ever stayed in on Miami Beach we were a bit disappointed when we arrived. This was a much more expensive hotel but the rooms were only average. Two beds, a chair, a desk and a TV.. As you can see in other reviews there are no water pressure at all, the Internet was dead slow and timed out all the time and there was never any towels at the pool after 9pm. They had 4 small pools isolated from each other, and its to bad that they dont have at least one bigger pool. It was just an average hotel, and we expected more from what we had payed, however i would recommend it to others as there were no "really negative experiences". However consider whats important for you before choosing it. If you are a smoker find somewhere else, as their policy on their entire premises is extremely strict. And you have to sign a form that you will pay alot of money if caught. It also felt weird that you had to sign a form saying that if you weren't out of your room before 11am, you would get a $50 fine on your credit card. And as check in is 4pm they sure have enough time to clean the rooms..

Reviews.Title: “This resort is by far one of the cleanest, most spacious, and beautiful resorts that we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: dawnmckenzie
Reviews.Content: Has all amenities, just bring your clothes! It is very clean and cleanliness is extremely important to me. The atmosphere is lush and relaxing. Beautiful pools, unfortunately, they close at dusk. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Parrot Key Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BandBLover18
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the grounds were beautiful. We would definitely stay here again. A great location, too!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, bright and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MDM2401
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in the resort - our room was a very nice, bright room on the ground floor with a very comfortable bed. We had the best sleep of our entire holiday in the room - no small achievement given how hot and humid the weather had been. The whole resort area was spotlessly clean (usually the main thing I care about) - the pools are small, but the loungers are comfortable (and free of charge) and the pool bar is very welcoming. The resort is a little remote from the main tourist centre of Key West - we ended up taking cabs to and from, but there is a Walgreens close to hand for essentials and there's a small shopping mall across the street which is good enough for most shopping needs. In short, we would definitely recommend the hotel - it's a suprisingly quiet, relaxing spot and the rooms were perfectly welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly relaxing, perfectly located, fantabulous accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: KEWPIE_10
Reviews.Content: Garden view cottages were incredible; 14 and 15 are perfectly located. Cannot wait to return. Recommend stocking up at the grocery store or Walgreens as you may find it very hard to leave "your house". Made good use of the many restuarants that deliver. 3 bedrooms is HUGE, each with it's own bathroom, wonderful beds and room darkening shades. Best sleep I have had in a long time. Highly recommend this resort - short cab ride to Duval or marina; if you don't want to leave, great on-site facilities (4 pools and jet skis and a gym). Forward my mail, I live there now...

Reviews.Title: “For the perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: JupiterDiesel
Reviews.Content: The stay At Parrot Key was more then expected. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and great pools. Just a bike ride or a taxi ride to Duval street makes the hotel a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Linseyduo
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful place to stay. The rooms and pools are amazing. The staff is friendly. It is very reasonably priced too. The cafe is small, but the food & drinks we ordered were great. The drinks are overpriced...but it's vacation! My only wish would be a shuttle to Duval. We had a car and had to pay to park each night. It is a pretty far walk, especially in the summer heat. I would definitely stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort just few minutes drive before down town Key West”
Reviews.Author: ZuerichKokoladka
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location as we were coming with a car. The resort looks like brand new and definitely is a very pleasant place to spend few days of holidays. Rooms are spacious and new with lovely colourful furniture and very comfortable beds. Our room - 24 A was great, with a lovely sandy backyard overlooking a small channel where some ski jets were coming from time to time. The room didnâ€™t have a proper closet though, only few drawers and two side cabinets (but no place for hanging clothes). The entire place is very clean. Small gardens and pathways are organized in a romantic, cosy way. Pools are small but as long as there are not many guests one can enjoy privacy, as there are a few of them. Pools close at 10 pm and the gates are locked afterwards. Small pool bar serves some drinks and basic dishes for breakfast and lunch but we never tried it, as it was most of the time empty. You could always ask them for ice though and they were very happy to be of help. I enjoyed the location of this resort â€“ next to Walgreens and opposite the street from another shopping complex with Publix, Ross and couple of restaurants and bars, TGI Ftidays etc. Stuff was friendly and helpful and offered us upgrade and some discount prices as we were coming shortly after the end of the local season. I also enjoyed the fact that they had a laundry room free of charge. Another pleasant thing was a very well working WIFI, which was also free of charge. They also offer beach towels free of charge. I recommend restaurant Blue Moon.

Reviews.Title: “The Beautiful Parrot Key Resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: pudnj
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was a wonderful experience. We were greeted by Booker a gentleman with a friendly smile, the front desk juat as pleasant Melissa, Tanya, Elena, Patricia and Sean always so helpful to all our needs. We enjoyed the the pool daily and our exceptional service by Jeanne always with a smile. The rooms were beautiful, the resort is well maintained. Our Key West stay was great and we will definitely return to this resort. Thanks to all for a great time. Sincerely, Joanna and George Helfrich Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “This place exceeded our expectations---we're coming back and bringing friends!!”
Reviews.Author: skerns
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful with lovely landscaping, lush and generally tranquil (depending on how many enthusiastic kids are enjoying any one of the 4 pools) surroundings. We rented a 2 bedroom cottage which was nicely decorated, well appointed and in excellent condition. The resort is located away from, but a relatively short and direct drive to the madness of Duval Street and Mallory Square. We rented scooters (which the front desk arranged to have delivered to and picked up from the resort) and buzzed all around Key West on them---great fun and much easier to park! We loved it and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of the Trip”
Reviews.Author: kwhite8802
Reviews.Content: The resort exceeds what you see on the website! It is even more beautiful in person. We actuaully watched the famous Key West sunset from our Master Suite Balcony, it was great. We will return there again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Vane80_10
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful place. I really recommend it. The rooms are in a very good conditions and clean. The pools are beautiful. The hotel is quiet. The hotel doesnÂ´t seem to have enough parking spots but there is parking available at Walgreens next door. Not to big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a little village”
Reviews.Author: Miami_FloridaSandy33
Reviews.Content: I was there with my hubby for our 17th anniversary. I loved it from the start, even the lobby is great and relaxing with the swing chairs on the porch. We had to walk through what looked like a small village within a garden to get to our rooms. My hubby was disappointed that there was no beach (I don't think they say they have a beach on their website) and that the house we had did not have a complete ocean view so he complained to the receptionist and he offered a $30 refund per night. We had a view on the canal and partially on the ocean (room 34) but I loved it anyway. great views from our balcony on the second floor. The townhouses have three floors, a big living room opening on a sandy yard, kitchen with everything included, and three bedrooms with comfortable king beds, white linens, a flat screen TV in each room. The pools are great, I prefer to have 4 intimate pools like this rather than a big noisy one. you could pick and choose which pool you wanted so we avoided the one with only young and noisy couples and went to the one with an older, quieter couple. Towels are available in each pool. The people at the cafÃ© are very nice and helpful. We had breakfast there twice, although the menu is quite small it was enough for us. The only thing that I did not like is that the shower in our bedroom did not have enough pressure so I had to go and bathe in the other bedroom's shower.

Reviews.Title: “No beach, canÂ´t be in ocean, but beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tapitapi
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT A RESORT AT ALL. Beautiful Key West style hotel, well maintained, wonderful landscape, NO ocean, fake beach with nice sand facing the ocean which is complete blocked by trees. Even rooms with ocean view, on the 2nd floor are blocked by the all the trees. Distance to downtown is 0.34miles if you take a helicopter, if you drive or walk is 2.5 miles. We had a great time, enjoyed their great 4 pools but we DID NOT ENJOY a Resort hotel in Key West, which is what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort although expensive and some distance from the downtown”
Reviews.Author: Boingboing77
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had an overnight stay at the Parrot Key Hotel and Beach Resort having driven down to Key West from Sarasota on June 6th. We booked through www.expedia.com where the resort is listed as a 4* and we paid $214 in total for our overnight stay. This did not include breakfast and therefore, we felt that the cost was a little excessive. We were also a little surprised that there was only one place you can eat within the actual resort - a bar/restaurant that is located towards the side of the main pool. The meals served here are fairly standard and prices range from $10-$20 and cocktails from $7.50-$10. Opposite the resort is a large plaza with a number of stores and restaurants which are easily accessible. The stores include Publix, Walgreens, TGI Fridays, etc. In regard to the rooms, they are a good size and facilities such as en-suite bathroom, cable TV, DVD Player, telephone, air conditioning and complimentary hot drinks are all included. There is also a refrigerator although we were a little disappointed that it was not stocked up! In terms of cleanliness, the entire resort was immaculate and we found that the staff were willing to go that extra mile to ensure that we were comfortable. There is a lobby situated at the front of the resort which is staffed 24 hours a day and complimentary internet access. There are 4 swimming pools on the resort - a main pool situated towards the front and 3 smaller pools further back. The pools were all very clean although the water temperature in the main pool was too high - we were not sure whether this was a fault with the cooling system or due to the very high temperatures whilst we were there (88f-98f). Towels are provided and there is no limit on the number you can use. The resort itself is quite small and is located approximately 2 miles from the downtown area - a taxi will cost between $10-$12 and you are also able to hire scooters for around $35 per day. Duval Street was absolutely buzzing during the evening - plenty of places to eat/drink and lots of shops. Mallory Square is where everyone stands to watch the sun set and there are also many entertainers (buskers) here who 'wow' the crowd in return for money. Although we only stayed overnight at the Parrott Key Hotel and Resort, we would recommend this to those who are looking for a relaxing break away from the hustle and bustle of the downtown area. Our only regret is that we stayed for one night instead of two or three nights which would have enabled us to have explored more of Key West. We didn't have time to upload our photos on this occasion but we are willing to forward these to travelers upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Got Singed by "Singh"”
Reviews.Author: TNTraveler3687
Reviews.Content: Paul Arthur Labombard a.k.a. "Pritam Singh" has cleverly created a cash cow in his so-called "resort" named "Parrot Key Resort". The powerless and scared "managers" at the front desk are clearly under the hocus pocus spell of "Singh" when they dutifully extract the hidden resort fees and additional "damages deposit ($200)". Parrot Key LOOKS like a resort but to quote "Singh", â€œI think the thing I do well is that I see things that arenâ€™t there.â€� Expect to pay bid bucks to "Singh" for Things that Aren't There! Hint to "Singh": Unplug the nonstop poolside elevator music.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Rinabean99
Reviews.Content: I went on this trip was with my husband and our two friends, and we all agreed this was the nicest place any of us have ever stayed at. Not only were the rooms awesome, but the just walking to the rooms through the beautiful gardens was wonderful! It was very relaxing. When you step out on the patio from your cottage, it's all white sand and palm trees. Parrot Key is close enough to Duvall St. (where all the action is) yet far enough to have peace and quiet when you need it. This place also had four heated pools, which is nice because there was not many people in each pool with us. On top of it all, the entire staff was polite and heplful throughout our stay. I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising- Don't be Fooled By Brochure”
Reviews.Author: Donadevin
Reviews.Content: Booked an expensive waterfront suite to view sunsets from a private balcony. The water we were looked at was a skinny canal, overlooking mangroves and tin roofs at the neighboring property. The property has some units facing the gulf, but even those views are not that great. The sugar sand in front of the cottages in the brochure photos is the walkway behind the connected buildings, nowhere is a great water view to be found unless you are on the third floor attic looking out a window. Not worth the extra money we spent. Asked nicely for upgraded room and was turned down. We won't recommend or be back to the Parrot Key Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: zzd112
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort was wonderful! The rooms were great, the staff helpful and friendly, and the pools/landscaping were beautiful. This was our first visit. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite cottages in a serene and beautiful, lush, tropical setting.”
Reviews.Author: DiamondMik
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our artistically decorated and very comfortable cottage and the large porches that perched us above the bounty of tropical trees, foliage and one of four pools. The resort is so beautiful that you may not want to leave to explore historic Key West. Beds are superbly comfortable. We all will definitely return. Tip: Key West taxi's are expensive $8 / person from airport to resort (1 1/2 miles) for 4 = $32; to historic center from resort $16 (1 1/2 miles). Add that together in one day it is the price of a rental car. I recommend a rental car from the airport (providing it's not high season... shortage of parking in town) or rent two-seater scooters on the island (not obtainable from the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: happytravels260
Reviews.Content: I was aiming for a relaxing and romantic getaway with my boyfriend and this hotel was one of our favorite parts of the trip. Although it doesn't seem like it would feel secluded (right off the main drag, next door to a Walgreens) once you enter the property you feel as if you've left the rest of the world miles and miles away. They've done a great job with landscaping and design to make the most of their space and it helps their guests feel as if they've entered a lush oasis. Great customer service- we began our stay on an off-day (Sunday-Monday) and were upgraded free of charge from a room with a view to a 3-story house with a view! More room than the two of us needed, but great to have a balcony that overlooked the water on the second floor and a deck that opened onto the beach on the first floor. It's nice to have 4 beautiful pool areas to choose from instead of one large, overcrowded pool. The adults who wanted peace and relaxation didn't have to share the water with the louder families with children. Much quieter and nicer than a lot of the hotels more centrally located on Duval st. or in Old Town Key West. Only a 5-10 minute drive from all of the main attractions. We will definitely stay here again. Only minor down side was an unexpected hefty security deposit for our stay and a $24/day "resort fee" that gets tacked onto the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the World”
Reviews.Author: DomZRoss
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Awesome location, brilliant staff, onsite free laundry and parking, 3 pools and an outside bar.
