Reviews.Title: “A true honeymoon in the keys”
Reviews.Author: jblb0515
Reviews.Content: The new wife and I stayed at the Parrot Key for the first time ever staying in Key West. What a great find. The room was like a townhome...large, clean and comfortable. The furnishings and the view were great. Everything is close in Key West, but you will need a car of scooter to get to the downtown hot spots from this resort, but the beautifully landscaped gardens surrounding the pools, the Tiki bar and friendly staff make time spent here enjoyable and relaxing. The rooms are modern and fresh and decorated in keeping with the area. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Sam_ala9
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at Parrot Key and I loved it completely. Although it is located on a busy street in Key West, you would never know from inside. You enter a beautiful, quiet oasis overflowing with plants. I stayed in a Garden view room which was great. I loved the pool setup as well. The pools are small, but there are 4 of them so they never get too busy. My only complaint is that there is no beach access, but that is to be expected from Key West. Also, itâ€™s a trek to the Duval area, so you will be using cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: tuesdaysgone
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Parrot Key in April 15 - 20. We loved it. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The cleaning staff did a great job. The beds are really high but very comfortable. The decks and chairs are really nice, not too private but so nice. The pools were very well kept as well, with lots of seating and umbrellaâ€™s. The grounds are beautiful, and so lush. It was so nice to just sit outside and take everything in. Upon Check in we also found that the front desk staff that friendly or inviting. The people we spoke with when we booked were very nice and very helpful but checking in not so much. Iâ€™m not sure what is up with that! I also was startled by the pool staff having a big loud argument very early one morning. All in all itâ€™s a very relaxing place, with beautiful gardens, very clean family friendly and safe. Itâ€™s away from all the crowds, tourists and partying of downtown. There is so much to do and so much to see. We canâ€™t wait to go back! We would stay at Parrot Key again for sure. Helpful tips 1/ we both had to check in with work and the internet connection in the room is brutal. We were able to get a weak connection on the balcony. It worked best at the pool area which was under lock and key at 6:30pm in April when we were there. Not so good for being able to Skype home to check on the family. 2/ we loved the restaurants Blue Heaven and Michaels they were the best we visited there. 3/ If you want a relaxing day around the pool Goldmanâ€™s deli in the plaza across the street offered great breakfasts and sandwichâ€™s. We also ordered pizza in one night from Big Johnâ€™s which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CYCLEPAIR089
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, great facilities,staff was wonderful. They have free use of laundry facilities for guests which was a plus for us. Bike rentals and jet-skis are available on-site too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the misdt of tropical gardens”
Reviews.Author: eguzkizalea
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to visit Key West for a short two-day trip. The hotel is composed of several buildings around a central courtyard where four swiming-pools are located. The landscaping is of a beautiful tropical nature, and the buildings are of Caribbean (West Indies) style: white wooden buildings with tin roofs. I rented a two-bedroom cottage which was very good value for money (it was the low season). The cottage had two bedrooms, an attic, a sitting room, a kitchen, a bathroom, a shower room and a toilet, enough room for up to eight guests! There is a big parking lot and we never had trouble finding an empty spot. The swiming-pools are fairly small, so don't expect to be able to swim long laps, but they are good for chilling. The only drawback is that the hotel is located in the northern side of Key West, about two miles from Duval Street. Driving around Key West is very easy but be aware that finding parking space around Duval Street and the Old Town is difficult and time consuming. Otherwise, if you plan to use the kitchen in the cottage, there is a Publix supermarket nearby. The hotel has a fitness center but it is teeny-tiny.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Classy300
Reviews.Content: Having planned our trip, our first stop was the Keys, staying at the Parrott Bay Resort. This was recommended and the best. We were also recommended to another resort, Duck Keys and that differently was not for us. Parrott Keys is the one to experience. Away from the busy Duval Street action, but just 5 minutes away from the action., There is also Walgreens, next store for anthing you may of left behind. I give Parrott Keys a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: yocrodo
Reviews.Content: We were positively impressed by our cottage, on the first floor there was 2 big bedrooms ensuite each with cute balconies and the ground floor had a kitchen and living room, a little veranda at the back. We loved the pools and gardens, it was really relaxing to stay at the resort and we would definitly come back. When I read the reviews before booking I was a bit concerned about the location which is not in the center and according to some reviewers near a big car park of a shopping center. it's true that it is near a Walgreen and other shops,but for me i thought it was a bonus as we could nip in the supermarket to get our drinks & snacks to enjoy out on the veranda in the evenings ! because we had a car it was no problem for us to drive to the center of Key west (about 5mn drive). What I wasn't impressed by was the attitude of the staff at reception, not very friendly at all, when i checked out I had to wait for the young lady to finish her private phone conversation with a friend which took a while (I knew exaclty what her friend had commented on facebook and where they would go out that night etc), I read that other travellers have had the same problem so i hope that the hotel management will take action on that. We also did not find the resort fee we had to pay justified, apparently it is for parking and the use of the pools, totally overdone and a rip-off . we still loved the place and recommend the hotel but I believe the resort fee should be lifted and the reception staff should be changed to make this place nr 1 in Key West !

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Sink2
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Singh, Parrot Key Resort. Staff & accomodations were superb! We didn't feel as if we were staying in a "hotel" but a little island of our own. Landscaping couldnt have been more beautiful. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: JohnCincinnati
Reviews.Content: The best features of the resort are the accommodations and pool area. We stayed in a 3-bedroom oceanfront townhome. Stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, plasma TVs in the living room and all bedrooms, individual bathrooms for each bedroom, and plush, comfortable beds merely scratch the surface. The poolside tropical gardens are phenomenal--I felt like I was in the middle of a jungle, miles from civilization. Plenty of beach chairs around the pools, never a problem finding a quiet spot. Nice quiet location within short drive to restaurants, bars, and attractions around the island. No direct access to a beach--not a problem if you prefer pools, but a negative if you want to swim in the ocean or hear waves while you lay out.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Funny_traveler_10
Reviews.Content: Parrot key was great! I got the reservation through their spring sale so the rate was cheaper. The hotel is about 2 miles from duval street. We rented bikes and rode our bikes around key west. Keep in mind hotel doesnt have beach access. There are extra costs per day that arent included on the reservation rate per day but I knew this going in so no suprise, ~30 extra a day. Good things: The room was great! Furnishings were great. Very clean! The pools were awesome. Bad things: Internet is very slow and prevents you from going to some mainstream websites.

Reviews.Title: “"A" for Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Suds37
Reviews.Content: To quote my husband Mr Singh must have a very large extended family to get this hotel ranked No. 3 on the list of hotels in Key West. We booked this hotel through booking.com for one night on a road trip around Florida with the intention of seeing Key West. Please note this hotel is at least 6k from Key West and they do not provide a shuttle. We were surprised to find the hotel was essentially located in what was a shared parking lot with the adjacent Walgreens. This was all the more amusing as when we asked what the $24 dollar resort charged covered - car parking was was top of list (did they not notice the rather large and free car park next door). Not only was our query in relation to the resort charge met with derision but also what could be described as a "get lost and just pay up" attitude; this was merely a prelude to what was to come. We had a double room which I must admit was furnished appropriately and looked the part and the outside deck was a nice touch, however both my husband and I agree the beds were the most uncomfortable we encountered over our 2.5 week road trip. The following morning we discovered there were no glasses/cups in the room. There was no phone to call reception so I walked up to enquire if they could arrange for same to be sent to the room. On entering reception there was a full scale argument ensuing between a guest and the girl behind the desk. I won't go into the details on this as it's not my story to tell but it was inappropriate and unprofessional. Once the argument had finished and the guest had left I was shouted at for my room number and had a invoice practically thrown at me. When I explained that we weren't checking out quite yet and I just need two cups or glasses there was a big sigh and much scribbling of the required items on paper. I asked it it was possible to get them now as we planned to check out within the next 30 minutes. Needles to say "help" wasn't high on the agenda, I got the required items from one of the housekeepers who I noticed on the way back to the room. I could out it down to a bad day but all in all two reception staff with serious attitudes means we would not recommend this hotel. Nobody deserves to be spoken to the way I or the other guest was spoken to. I think the Singh resort needs a brush up on customer service and dispute resolution.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better......”
Reviews.Author: cvmtjp
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Keys with 5 friends. Parrot Key was perfect because we all had our own rooms (rented 2 town homes). The homes were perfect - clean, well equipped, beautiful decor, the grounds were gorgeous and we were able to do some kayaking right there. Close to shopping and the main tourist attractions. We could not have had better accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and landscaping, quiet, comfortable and well-decorated”
Reviews.Author: NovemberBlue
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort. Row-house style units that have all of the comforts of home and are beautifully decorated while still being comfortable. Everything was very clean and the staff were polite and friendly. I was not wildly impressed with the Florida Keys, but this hotel was an exception. It really did look like the photos on the website.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: redsmurphy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Key West & couldn't be happier with our accommodations at Parrot Key. This place is absolutely GORGEOUS. The landscaping/gardens are lush & fragrant. The mineral pools are inviting & relaxing. The rooms (we stayed in a water front cottage) are spacious & comfortable. The staff is friendly & extremely helpful. The location is perfect--it's 10 minutes from the airport & just a 5 minute ride to town! There are plenty of places to grab groceries, etc. within walking distance (Walgreen's next door & a shopping center across the street). We highly recommend staying here & look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds but nothing else about our room was comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Linda_NewfieldNY
Reviews.Content: Although the room was reserved for 4 people, there were only 2 towels and we had to ask for more. The next day, they took our 4 towels and replaced them with 2 towels...so again, we had to ask for more. Although the beds are very comfortable, they are too high to sit on and there is really only ONE chair in the room. This makes the room very uncomfortable for 4 people. So we went out on the very nice back porch, but there were no chairs out there either. We basically couldn't stay in our room unless we were ready to go to bed!! In addition, we were charged $24/DAY for some sort of "RESORT FEE" (covering internet, pools, parking, fitness center), which was ridiculous because all we did was sleep here. We did not use the pool, the internet, the "fitness center" or anything else. We couldn't even use the parking lot as it was always full and we had to park in the adjacent drug store parking lot. All in all, if it wasn't for the "RESORT FEE", I might recommend this place to others (if they bring lawn chairs). I felt that charging us a $24/day RESORT FEE on checkout, after we had paid $170/night for a room with 2 beds) was a complete ripoff and I would not recommend this place for that reason. (I had no knowledge of this fee until after I had paid online for the room, which I think was VERY deceptive).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Convexity1
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific. The hotel rooms are owned by individuals and therefore there are some larger, townhome rooms that have 3 br/2 ba. They offer full kitchens and are beautifully decorated. The place is new, clean and outstanding. The staff is good, so is the food and the three pools are private and tastefully done with sculptures around them. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples looking for a retreat, young families or someone traveling by themselves, like me. You will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Gem”
Reviews.Author: Ana1973
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking scenery, wonderful location and large well appointed rooms. Our family went to Key West to celebrate my Husband's 40th Birthday, and we had a blast. The rooms all had an island feel to them, the unspoiled views from the balcony were amazing. A wonderful way to wake up every morning. The only disadvantage is that our trip was too short, we have been trying to plan another trip to Key West and plan to stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay in Key West is at the Parrot Key!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsGlamorous
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to the Keys without a group. I was on line months before looking for a really good Resort. There were a few that came up, but the detail information on the of the Parrot Key Resort sold me. Being able to see the picture of the diffirent rooms also sold me. I contact the hotel the person on the other end was so helpful with booking, ideas and thing to do. I knew right then, thats where i wanted to stay. The rooms was super clean and lovely. The decor was awsome! The staff was outstanding!!! To the Parrot Key Staff Thank You! Go stay there, you won't regrat it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jimneaf
Reviews.Content: Five of us made last minute reservations at Parrot Key. The staff, accomodations, Tiki Bar and pools were just about perfect. We had a great time and everyone in our party felt the same. We shared a three bedroom, four bath condo. The rooms were more than spacious and the furniture and beds were clean, attractive and comfortable. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: afpadc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with two adult children stayed at Parrot Key in mid-April. The facility is lovely with a pool right in back of the the building we stayed in. There were plenty of lounges and umbrellas so it satisfied all of us. For those who want to stay on the beach this is not the place to be. Although there is water nearby, it is not and doesn't advertise itself as a beachfront resort. But, it is far enough away from the main drag that you do not hear nighttime noise or road noise either. The three bedroom villa we stayed in was well-appointed with comfortable beds and furniture. The kitchen was sufficient for any cooking we wanted to do. The grounds are lovely with beautiful flowering shrubs everywhere. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I really meant to do more sightseeing, but the Parrot Key was so relaxing we hardly left the grounds.”
Reviews.Author: coloradoeagle
Reviews.Content: We visited Parrot Key last March and were just blown away by the charm and beauty of the resort. Our cottage had a lovely Bay view, was beautifully furnished and maintained, and was only steps from the three pool areas. The staff was uniformly well-trained and responsive. The plan had been to get up early each day and sightsee until mid-afternoon, then come back for a short rest before going out for dinner. But the bedrooms were so quiet, the air blowing in through the French doors so soothing that we never managed to get up early. Then we found the pools so enticing that we couldn't manage to skip spending the middle of the day there, having a super lunch served at the Tiki bar. And later in the afternoon the bartender made us her special Key Lime Coladas and we napped in our comfy chaises.. The only time we went out for was dinner and a bit of touring in the evenings. I think I might have loved seeing more of Key West, but I could not have relaxed more nor enjoyed myself more by doing other than what we did right in Parrot Key. I loved this resort!

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: hia5056
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during Valentines Day...I really have to say that we had a wonderful stay at Parrot Key Resort...in fact, better than what we were expecting...the room is very nice, big and comfortable, you have a back door to the room with a wonderful garden viewâ€¦very nice to go sit and relax ...just enjoy the day...the staff was great and very helpful...they gave us some inside tips of the best places to eat, shop, and rent bikes and scooters during the our stay......like I said, we had a wonderful time and will definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda107668
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West . The Hotel was excellent. Rooms were beautifully furnished and very clean and comfortable. We had a suite overlooking the water which was really beautiful. We had to take a taxi ride into Duval Street but didnt mind as it meant we could park up the car and enjoy all the bars! Small shopping area opposite Hotel and restaurants nearby for breakfast made it a great location for us, We would definitely stay again. Linda and Laurie (Merseyside England)

Reviews.Title: “Best price for the quality in Key West”
Reviews.Author: w820
Reviews.Content: We were with a large group for a family event and although the bulk of the group stayed at the Parrot Key people were scattered all over Key West. Several of the events were at other hotels in Key West so we were able to evaluate a number of luxury hotels in Key West and the Parrot Key seemed to offer the best combination of quality and price. We stayed in both a hotel room and a 3 bedroom condo and my only suggestion would be to have a couple of reading chairs in the rooms. Overall we loved the Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very clean, and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: dwfish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually travel by RV because most of the accomodations we've stayed in are not very clean. Due to logistics reasons we decided to make this trip by plane, and this resort has changed our opinon that there's no really nice (and reasonably priced) accomodations out there. The rooms were very clean, had nice furnishings, and the kitchen was well stocked, even dow to the cork screw for our evening wine. The staff members were polite, and willing to help make our stay memorable. And it was only minutes from the sites that we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: kgg11
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest facilities we have been to. The grounds are gorgeous, the staff extremely friendly and helpful, and the rooms beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing resort.”
Reviews.Author: iwestra
Reviews.Content: The pools and the rooms were wonderful. Located away from the noise and action of downtown so that made it quiet. We rollerbladed to downtown but it would have been a long walk. The children/teenagers loved the pools. Parking was great.. We brought paddleboards and left them locked on top of our car without problem. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel rules required one parent to sleep in each room with anyone under 25 so it wasn't romantic but it could be if you didn't bring children.

Reviews.Title: “This is what a vacation should be!”
Reviews.Author: mdr67
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a few miles away from busy Duval Street but its location is perfect. Easy to find, located on the water (no access though) and plenty of shopping (food, clothes, coffee etc.) just steps from your door. Upon arrival we were amazed at the lush tropical flora, the grounds are perfectly landscaped. Checking in was a breeze, after parking the family van close to our building it was a short BEAUTIFUL walk to our conch house. Opening the door to our 3 bedroom vacation room was shocking! Well Stocked gourmet kitchen, comfortably furnished family room with LCD TV (and cable), powder room and dinette set all found on the first floor. French doors led us to a private deck with adirondack chairs and a chaise lounge nestled in the sand of our private "beach". Mind you there is no water access, but the 4 pools located in the garden courtyard was a great substitute. Second floor of our home had 2 bedrooms, one being the master with another LCD TV, king bed, shower and soaking tub. The highlight of the room was our balcony, 2 adirondack chairs looked over the gulf of mexico. Second bedroom was well appointed, LCD TV, queen bed, and bath with shower. This room had a balcony that overlooked the pool courtyard. Third floor contained a perfect teenager retreat, large room , large full bath, queen bed, LCD and plenty of storage. Furnishings throughout were beautiful, functional and comfortable. Towels and bed linens were luxurious. The atmosphere was fun, yet peaceful. Staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. Plenty of ice, plenty of towels, high quality toiletries and maid service was quick and professional. Had we not planed to do so much in Key West we would have never left the grounds. Free high speed internet too! Sunset Water Sport is in the complex and I suggest you take a jet ski tour of the keys. cant wait to go back, Parrot Key is the definition of a relaxing vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: bblack3
Reviews.Content: It was just my daughter and I, but we somehow got upgraded to one of the BEAUTIFUL 3 bedroom cottages! It was like being at home. This is a quiet peaceful place to stay and everything in Key West is close by. Will be returning again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay with friends!!!”
Reviews.Author: TU123
Reviews.Content: There were 3 couples that traveled together. We like to stay up late, play games and have some drinks after our nights out. This place was awesome and spacious and it allowed us to have breakfast, snacks and drinks on hand. There was a grocery store right across the street. Since the beaches are lacking in the Keys, it was nice having 4 pools to choose from. It felt very tropical and serene. The bartender also made us excellent key lime pina coladas! We loved this place and would stay again for sure! It is not right on the strip but with the space we had, it was worth it. It was only 2 miles away from the hub bub...maybe less. Also across the street was a gym that we had free access to while their was getting renovated!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: emilycomings
Reviews.Content: My husband and his brother and wife stayed and had a wonderful time. We loved all the pools and how quiet it was. The flowers and landscaping was beautiful and the condo/townhouse was absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, insulated, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: efriedme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this resort! It was a little chilly, so we didn't use the pools very much, but they were always sparkling! The staff was friendly and eminently helpful, and the rooms were beautifully decorated. The beds were so comfortable it was almost like being at home. We stayed in a 2-bedroom, 3-floor condo; we loved the full kitchen (as eating out in Key West is very expensive), and there is a grocery across the street! You would never know that, though, because the landscaping is well-kept and very tall- it is a very insulated resort area. Also, it seems as though everyone on the island smokes, so the smoke-free resort is a welcome breath of fresh air after Duvall Street! My thanks for a wonderful week in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Value without compromise in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: lynn_morrissey
Reviews.Content: Our family vacation was exceptional from the drive down the Keys to the final destination at Parrot Key! I have stayed at many other hotels in Key West and even though they were also extremely nice, this was by far the best value for the money!!! We had 3 bedrooms and our teenagers could spread out without getting in each others way! The home was very clean, the bedrooms were fantastic and staff was more than accomodating! The laundry facilities were being remodeled and the front desk was very helpful and did the laundry for us without charge!! The teenagers (4) were able to swim at different pools and still be on site! The water sports were very convenient right there also!! I am looking forward to staying at their other resort in Marathon Key on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “I'm from Ohio and was planning my wedding...”
Reviews.Author: Jrabbit13
Reviews.Content: I'm from Ohio and was planning my wedding in key west!!! The resort is beautiful!!!!! I would recommend it to anyone!!!! The rooms are big and very clean!!!! It really is alittle piece of paradise;) can't wait to go back for my anniversary!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The accommodations were great!”
Reviews.Author: ddbelf
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. We swam in the pools and kayaked in the mangroves. A car is needed to get downtown. Hotel staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent holyday”
Reviews.Author: ziszisz
Reviews.Content: Sorry, about my english.... It was a perfect vacation with 16 freinds. We enyojed the time in this hotel because staff and evrhything was more than perfect. Food in the pool area, atmosphera was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key made our wedding trip to Key West a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sammi42
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Parrot Key was everything we could have hoped for. We were looking for a place that could accomodate three families that were all travelling to Key West for our wedding. Parrot Key provided a wonderful atmosphere for a great price. The kids loved the pools and the staff was so gracious throughout or stay. The day we were set to leave, a snowstorm dropped 24 inches at our house , so we ended up extending our stay when our flight was cancelled. The staff was so helpful and made getting stranded a complete pleasure! We did end up needing to rent a car since the resort is a bit far from the downtown area, but we still loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: mojorisin80
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent resort. 3 bedrooms each with bath, full kitchen, dining/living room, another 1/2 bath. Quiet, clean, beautiful landscaping, great pool, convenient to shopping, restaurants. 20 minute walk to old Key West, 5 minutes by car. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had a really relaxing and fun stay without any hassles. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key is what the Keys are about-unwind and feel welcomed.”
Reviews.Author: ShySirena
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the resort , I felt as if I stepped back in time. The fflora and fauna is was breath taking. The rooms are nicely sized and furnished perfectly. One of the rooms had a really small bathroom (if sharing) but otherwise, everything was there, at our fingertips.The location was great. 10 minutes from everything in Key West and easy to go North to the middle keys. The stores are minutes away and the kitchen is stocked with everything you need to cook at home..The only downside of the 3 floor unit is that it is very warm on the third floor, otherwise the second floor freezes! The pools are great- as is the outdoor cafe. A great way to start or end a day in the keys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, spotlessly clean resort!”
Reviews.Author: Tabwasmybev
Reviews.Content: Our room was exactly what we had requested. The room and resort were spotlessly clean. The view was spectacular, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A New Key West Treasure”
Reviews.Author: kelbasikid
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key. The staff was courteous and efficient. What is nice about the resort is it's design. Although it is a relatively large resort (100 + rooms) you feel like you are staying in someones guest cottage. Due to the staggered arrangement of the units, you can only see the immediate ones surrounding you. The multiple pools also added to the intimacy of the resort. The suits were spacious, and the view we had of the water was quite picturesque. All in all, it is a gem. They are also very responsive to suggestions. We mentioned there should be ice machines more strategically located, and to our surprise they listened, and were advised the machines had been ordered. The rates, as compared to the larger, more well known "resorts" in the area was considerably less. (almost half in some cases for comparable rooms). The gym facility was adequate, and I was able to get a good daily workout to counter act the Key West nightlife. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: mantaraya45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. (before our early departure to Dry Tortuga) They put us in a 3-story townhouse. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We enjoyed the beauiful pool areas when we arrived and the bay view from the townhouse. We liked the decor and spacious feel of the unit. The only complaint was the bed; it was nice and fluffy but everytime you moved it made a noise!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous property!!”
Reviews.Author: patriciaoregon
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key was an absolutely fabulous property!! The condo was so beautiful I took a picture of every room! The pools were great for the children. The staff could not have been any more pleasant and accomodating. I would highly recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: zippit_FL
Reviews.Content: Definately one of the nicest resorts we've stayed in. The grounds are beautiful and really peaceful and quiet but close enough to all the action. The accomodations were spotless and there was plenty of room for everyone. The drinks at the pool bar were great!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, tropical, artsy, clean and fun designed home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Judith-Ann4411
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parrot Key was so much fun! It is right on the waterway where they offer jet skiing. The tour guides were very knowledgeable and fun. The Parrot Key had many pools and beautiful landscaping! The staff was very professional and helpful. It was also convenient to Duval St. where we visited everyday or night. The next time we visit, we'll definately stay at the Parrot Key!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lush and tranquil pool areas”
Reviews.Author: jillty
Reviews.Content: It's funny that my perception of the pool area kept me hesitating to book the hotel. I booked, we just returned, and the pool area was my favorite part!!! The way it is designed is soooo beautiful. The pools are small, but with 4, they are not crowded, and each can have it's own "vibe". They are connected by winding walkways, and the surrounding landscaping is so lush and lovely....it's a secluded feeling. The music is PERFECT....not alienating to anyone.....all makes for a tranquil, lovely setting. The rooms were sooo attractive. Very tasteful. Comfy beds.....nice big shower. We were in a 2 bedroom unit. You enter a foyer shared by 2 units. Entering ours, you climb a flight of stairs to living room, bedroom with king, and bath with tub and seperate shower. upstairs is a queen and bath/tub bathroom. two balconies on main level. feels like a tropical treehouse...looking right into the trees. no complaints. wish i was still by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Was much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: johanad
Reviews.Content: We are three women friends who travel together yearly. After making our reservation, and reading all the reviews, we were worried that we'd made the wrong choice by not choosing to stay in Old Town. Our worries were unfounded. Parrot Key exceeded our expectations in every way. We had, at a price that we couldn't have received in Old Town: three lovely bedrooms- each with its own bath and TV, a full kitchen and living room, beautiful grounds, four small but peaceful pools, water views, and amazing quiet . One of group was't feeling well and was worried that her coughing would bother us. Not only didn't we hear her, we didn't hear any of our neighbors. We were all surprised that we heard no noise from anyone around us since we were in close quarters. Because we had a car, we had no problems with getting in and out of Old Town. Note that, when you purchase a parking slip from one of the street machines, that slip is good at any approved place in Old Town which includes both street parking and parking in city lots. Our slip cost $12.00 for the day. This was an excellent stay for us, and one that we all highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it makes itself out to be . . .”
Reviews.Author: Austinbe
Reviews.Content: This place has no beach . . . it is a good place to get lots of room and is clean . . . but it is very expensive and in an awful part of town for the price. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Deep Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: travelinman0805
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay here, two weeks, and it was blissful. The Front Desk staff greeted us graciously, and they continued to do so throughout our stay. The in-room amenities were top notch (very important to us), from kitchen facilities to linens to towels. The variety of pools made lounging a delight. The bartender had a delightful personality, and the maids were both gracious and thorough. Easy access by car to in-town Key West activities.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mkellis
Reviews.Content: After a huge search for hotels in key west (where even the Days Inn was around $150 on a highway) - we found Parrot Key Resort. We looked at comments here and decided to book. Amazing place. 4 pools (warm), each pool having luxurious pool loungers around them. Each also had different sculptures. Grounds lovely - each room has a door to the pool areas. Tropical plants galore. Rooms so serene. Customer service great. Would highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel this is a resort”
Reviews.Author: lawdawg102
Reviews.Content: My wife and Stopped at this location after taking a 2 week cruise of the Gulf. After Our return we decided to stay a few days in Flordia as well as a stop in Key west for a few days. As we drove into town we stopped at the Parrot Key Resort as it was right of themain drag and located right next to a shopping center. Upon our arrival we went to the Lobby to check for a room. We were told that there were no hotel rooms but there were Suites and Cottages. The Suites Were 249.00 the Cottages were 350 to 500.00 if they were on the water. We asked about a Suite there was one available My Wife also asked if they has internet access. We were told Yes it is included in the rate. We then said sure we would like to stay. After to given the paper work to sign we were avised that the Daily rate of 307.00 a Night and that this would include a resort fee of 25.00 a day. This covers the Internet and Parking. Well After we were commited to our stay we got our key and made entry to our room. Each suite is devided into a hotel room and a Suite. This has one Common entry and then two doors one for each room an A and B. there is also two door bells located outside each door which rings. After making Entry to the Common door we entered our Suite walked up a very long and Narrow flight of steps then we found no elevator access. thus many of these units are not ADA compliant.. On the first floor you will find a Bedroom, Living room, Bathroom and Two Balconys. as well as two nice HD TV's. There is No Work Space, There is No Micro Wave, there is also a second bedroom up a second flight of steps. During our First night of our stay were were suprised with how quiet things were but after several attempts to access the Web there was No Luck. The Next Morning after Passing the several drunks slepping in the bushes on the property as well as the occiasional panhandler I asked for a refund for the resort fee because the web did not work. My Wife and I spent the day in Key West checking out the sights and having a good time in town. At about 1600 we returned back to our room and found that our room had not been cleaned up I contacted the front desk and was advised that we are a resort not a hotel and thus your room will be cleaned between 1630 and 1730. House keeping finally showed up They Did not Vacuum, They did not make the bed, They Just stacked the new towels on the Toilet, I was also again not able to gain any access to the Internet for the rest of our stay. We also got new set of Guests down stairs they Kept Pushing the door bell mulitple time to get their kids to open the door the problem was they kept pushing our door bell not theirs. This was going on from 1745 to 2400. In addition there Kids kept runnig up and down the stairs, slamming doors, jumping on the bed and overall just making enough noise to keep us awake. We called the front desk to please ask them to stop after we spoke to them. The Front desk did nothing. As they said this is a resort not a hotel. We went to check out I asked for a Refund of the Resort Fee they did reduce our rate by 10 percent for the second day based on the internet. But The service here was terrible, The Lack of response is so not right. In Closing I have had better service at a Motel 6, I would not recommend the Parrot Key Resort for any Reason

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravellingLady
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely recommend that you stay here. Easy to get in and out of, and once you're there, a pristine slice of Key West heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mmonnin123
Reviews.Content: We travelled over 2000 miles ( with two children under 4) to reach our destination of Parrot Key Hotel, Key West Florida. It was so worth it! Accomodating staff, meticulous accomodations, and most of all VERY warm outdoor salt water pools (there are 4 of them, all amazing)! As I have found out, most places do not heat their outdoor pools.... so beware! Very safe to stay with children, and the best part was, we just opened our patio doors to the living room, and we had sand. The kids could play, and we could go for a walk. You really do not have the leave if you do not want to. I highly recommend Parrot Key. Very tranquil (great music on the grounds). So serene (fantastic cabana's) and a quaint bar grill. Great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY GREAT HOTEL - GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: BostonBinx
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at Parrot key for several days with friends . it has great friendly service , a good gym, big rooms that are nicely appointed elegant and comfortable . Great prices . A real getaway and oasis . I would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly - a fove star hotel with affordable prices .

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: raisininthesun
Reviews.Content: Parrot Cay is an exquisite location for relaxation on your visit to Key West. I found the property to be charming and rich with detail as well as quiet and meditative. The rooms were extraordinarily well-appointed with three large bedrooms and three baths, a full kitchen, a living room and both a porch and a balcony. We could have spent the entire weekend INSIDE the room and been quite happy, but the three lovely pools and the short walk to shopping, bike/jogging path and restaurants inspired us to enjoy the lovely Key West weather and â€œchilled-outâ€� vibes. The fitness center was more than sufficient for solid weight training and cardio exercise. There was even space for yoga/pilates, etc. Staff were more than accommodating and went that â€œextra mileâ€� to insure our stay was more than enjoyable. The small touchesâ€”like orange juice and cookies/snacksâ€”were appreciated. The desk attendants were helpful and had good energy. They eagerly shared restaurant tips, directions and local info. This, along with the superior accommodations, made us certainly want to return! My wife and I had planned to go back to the Ritz in Key Biscayne on our next trip to Florida. After staying at the Parrot Cay, thereâ€™s no question, we will come here!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the keys”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegTikka
Reviews.Content: For the third time in as many years we have stayed at a Singh resort, 3 years ago at Tranquility Bay and the past 2 at the Parrot Key. My wife and I travelled with our 2 kids (4 and 11/2) and although the weather in the keys was not as warm as in the past years, we still had a great time. Even when the temps slipped to the lower 60 ,the heated pools made it extremely hard for us to get the kids out. (it was a nice touch) We had a 3 bedroom cottage that was our home away from home. Beautiful views of the bay from our master bedroom, top of the line appliances and a sand beach at our doorstep for the kids to play. ( the kids are already asking when do we get to go back to our cottage in florida) The ample room allowed Grandma to visit for a couple of days giving my wife and i a much needed break to hit Duval and enjoy the sounds and foods of the keys (an experience in itself) As always the grounds were lush and beautiful. The staff was happy and helpful and full attention was made to make our stay as memorable as possible. Would i recomend the Parrot Key to families wanting that keys experience with relaxing atmosphere for all YES. We are already planning our holidays for next year and Parrot Key and Key West it will be. (hopefully better weather next year)

Reviews.Title: “off the charts best resort in keys”
Reviews.Author: awesomegeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Parrot Key Resort last winter for a week. If we could have designed the ideal resort it couldn't have been any better. The rooms were roomy and comfortable. Every unit is next to a pool that is beautifully landscaped. Food and drink also nearby with fast service and great menues.Someone knew how to design a resort! The service was as nice as the facilities and then some. It was simply a well-run resort that provided one of the best vacations we have had together at a great price! We already have reservations to return next winter.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice When Travelling with Friends or Family”
Reviews.Author: tom_stewart
Reviews.Content: Our large three bedroom, four bath townhouse suite had lots of room for everyone, a beautiful pool and lounge outside our door, very comfortable beds, luxurious bedrooms and offered lots of privacy. I loved this resort!! Management is friendly and helpful. It is outside the old town core but we rented bikes and enjoyed an easy peddle to downtown every day. And there are lots of stores and amenities right next door to the resort. The grounds are beautiful. This place was recommended to us by a friend who lives in Key West and knows where to find the best deals in town. We were not disappointed. I felt the cost for a large three bedroom suite was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Key West, bar none.”
Reviews.Author: squiffy2010
Reviews.Content: I went for a much-needed relaxing solo trip in March. I definitely found what I was looking for and more. The setting at Parrot Key, both inside and out is exceptional. A choice a four pools nestled in exotic, perfectly manicured shrubbery, was amazing enough. But like everything, they went to extra mile and the pools are heated AND they are filled with salt water that is cleaned through natural processes. Not smelling like chlorine at the end of the day is priceless. The suites are absolutely beautiful and furnished with taste and with comfort and practicality in mind (fully equipped kitchen, patio furniture, comfy beds, good closet space to NOT live out of your suitcase etc...). I think each suite is different, which is great because I can't wait to go back and see another one! I have already recommended this place to all my friends and family! I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no resort, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Henk01
Reviews.Content: All rooms are around the 4 (small) pools. At 08:00 hours in the morning the music from all speakers start (nobody knows why when you ask but they guess that people like that). Nice on vacation to be woken up at that time by loud music. Actually the pools and grounds are nice but there's music from all corners. First morning I went to the tiki bar at 10:10 hours to get coffee and a few bagels or so. Reaction was (bagels were still on the buffet): "we're closed come back at 11:00 hours. Others guests who we're still drinking their coffee told us to go across the street to get coffee (excuse me, I have to go across the street for coffee at 10: 00 in the morning in a 4****star resort ?). Next morning at 10:00 hours I went to the Tiki bar to get Beach towels, answer to question was: " no beach towels, come back later". Question: "When are there beach towels ?", Answer: "There are beach towels when they are there". Nice service in a 4***resort ! Day 3: Room was not done by 17:00 hours, I had to run after the Assistent manager for 40 minutes before they managed to do the room. Mistake he said, they forgot to do it. Actually, room was never done before 16:00/16:30 hours. Tried to use the internet, during the day, la la, not fast but ok. Some evenings impossible to use the internet, no connection at all. They told us they only had one line for the whole hotel. No working desk or table for eating or so. in your suite Nice suites but not very practical. You pay $ 25,00 resort fee for very slow internet ,loud music at the pool and bad service. I stayed there 4 nights and paid over $ 200,00 a night and we have been served by people who (I guess) must have worked at the goelags in Russia.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Keys - will come back”
Reviews.Author: saltyfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed during annual fly fishing trip to the lower keys. First time there. Great rooms - new, clean, upscale but relaxed keys style - not too swanky - just right. Easy on-site self parking a huge plus. Location great to meet up with guides - no hassles with downtown traffic. I had a great ocean view room with sandy lounge area outside. Awesome for post-fishing chillaxing. Poolside cafe bar area great for more chillaxing. Staff very helpful with getting downtown tips and recommedations. Will stay there for next year's trip!! Mega comfy bed a real lifesaver after long days on the flats.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique resorts in Key West”
Reviews.Author: mlapointe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Parrot Key with friends and family on three separate occasions and each visit has been better than the last. This hotel is lesser-known as it's location is just a bit outside of the downtown area, but is by far the best overall resort I have visited in Key West. The three pools and resort feel, as opposed to traditional hotel, makes your stay feel more like you are renting a home and not just a room. This on top of a great and social bar area and watersport activities give Key West the resort experience that this city often lacks. It is very convenient to groceries and a quick $5 taxi to Duval for easy access to nightlife and additional restaurants. I highly recommend this resort and will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Julia999Chicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Parrot Key to celebrate our anniversary and had a wonderful time. The room we stayed in was oversized and very comfortable. The interior design was unique, tropical and colorful. The pictures were so pretty I wish I knew where I could buy them. Words cannot even begin to decribe the beautiful landscaping, which is thick and lush. Pink bougainvillea and palm trees everywhere. The resort is very tranquil and peaceful. It's only a 5 minute taxi ride to all the action on Duval Street but we spent more time at the hotel than we thought we would because it was so nice. We we sorry we only came for the weekend because we really enjoyed ourselves. Our room was along the water and it was a beautiful place to watch the sunset every evening. We give it two thumbs up with a snap. :)

Reviews.Title: “Restful & Relaxing - A Perfect Island Get Away”
Reviews.Author: ShuliM
Reviews.Content: Everyone in our group was able to relax and unwind. The rooms were very large there was plenty of room. The decor is special - not your typical hotel style. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit, but they also have single rooms available. The plants and flowers all around the property are beautiful. The pool bar serves great frozen drinks. There are four pools that are all connected by a sidewalk, but separated by the thick landscaping. We took a jet ski tour right from the resort and had a blast. We recommend Parrot Key Resort to everyone. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “We're Already Planning Our Next Trip - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: RachelliTampa
Reviews.Content: We had 6 adults and 6 children/teenagers in our party & everyone had a great time. There was more than enough room for all of us. The lush landscaping is stunning. It makes you feel like you are in a tropical paradise. Beautiful sculptures & garden decorations around the 4 pools create a warm, inviting atmosphere. The Key Lime Colada at the pool bar was a big hit. We relaxed so much in the resort that we didn't want to leave it! The rooms were beautiful, the beds as comfortable as home. We enjoyed it so much we are already planning a trip back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Service Poor but Comfortable Facility”
Reviews.Author: upbeatlass
Reviews.Content: The rooms are attractive and comfortable, but the house cleaning service did not maintain the rooms well. During our seven day stay there, we often come home to poorly cleaned bathrooms, floors and countertops. Several time we had to wait for towels for the pool area. (There is an additional charge for towels.) Often the receptionist at the front desk worked alone which resulted in frequent waits and brief, sometimes abrupt, answers. Overall the receptionists/ concierges were helpful but there needed to be more available for assistance and they needed to say â€œyes, we can help you,â€� more often than the â€œno, that canâ€™t be done hereâ€�, response that we got. For example, we asked for a chair for our back porch facing the pool and were told that we could not have one of the many that were available on other porches. Parrot Key has many restrictions such as no smoking on the facility and no personal alcoholic beverages in the pool areas. I chatted to a smoker hanging out in the Walgreenâ€™s parking lot next door and he suggested Parrot Key provide a designated smoking area on the facility. Iâ€™m not a smoker, but I thought that seemed reasonable. The managers and owners of this â€œresortâ€� need to pay better wages to attract better employees in house cleaning and hire more employees to provide services commensurate with the cost of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Impressed”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyOld1
Reviews.Content: Accommodations at this "resort" range from cottages to basic rooms. It appears they cater more to families with older kids and groups verses couples. Although located in a business area of town it was 'okay' once you were inside their compound area. The walkways were as previously described "somewhat pretty," but they felt more like mazes in a private condo complex then in an "upscale resort." We checked-in at 4:20 pm and arrived at our room at 4:30 pm to find the cleaning staff still inside. (It was certainly not due to the previous occupant getting a late check-out as the neighbor advised me they had not seen anyone in our room the previous night) After they left we dumped our luggage and went to find the resort's bar/restaurant for some dinner and drinks. When we did find the bar, we were advised that it was closed for a wedding. (The pools also closed early but the hotel still charged us a resort fee for each day) We went out for take-out and when we returned the parking lot was full. We had to wait for a space which was miles from our room. Possibly this was due to their wedding as we had no real problems the remainder of the stay, but most times could not get parking very close to our room. This "resort" has no ice machines and no fridges in their single bedroom units. Nor in these units do they have any other standard amenities you would expect to find in an upscale resort ie: microwave, iron/ironing board, sofa, etc. When I asked staff why no ice machines they advised me that there was no need because all of the cottages and most multiple units had full kitchens... except of course, our single bedroom unit. Apparently they had just converted three bedroom units into single and double units. They offered to have ice from the bar, delivered to our room. They did...only it was over an hour later and long after we had eaten. I cannot comment on their food or bar service etc. as we never went near their bar again. Nor did we use any of the pools (3) and, only sat outside our room on the "beach" once in four days that we were there. Instead we spent all our time and money in old downtown and anywhere but this resort. Which is not what we wanted nor what we expected when we booked a "resort." Cleaning was definitely an issue and like the other reviewers we also found cleaning crews in our room more than once after 4pm. The reason may be due to the fact I never saw any cleaning staff at this resort until well into the afternoon on any of the days we were there. As in most of the mid-range hotels in the Keys there are only showers in the rooms and luke-warm water is the norm most of the time. The beds here do seem cheap and are not very comfortable. Additional thoughts: I have traveled extensively and been to Florida numerous times dating back to 1969, but had not visited here for past several years. On this trip we traveled southern Florida visiting both coasts and the Keys. We spent well over $5000 on our 9 day trip and felt we did not get our monies worth especially in comparison to other areas of the world we have traveled. Most stays were in near top-end hotels, Hilton, Marriott etc. and a couple of resorts including this one. It appeared that unless you were paying a minimum of $400 - $500 a night you got a less than quality room in a run-down hotel. Especially anywhere near water.

Reviews.Title: “Over Sold”
Reviews.Author: jhatter
Reviews.Content: We travlled to Key West and were stunned when we arrived. After reading the resort description and other reviews I was not expecting to pull into the resort beside Walgreens and Home Depot. Yes, we had the pleasure of being beside two busy loading docks. The fitness centre is not "world class". It is four machines pushed up against a wall in a very small room with no windows. We ended up running beside the highway smelling fumes from all the cars. Not exactly relaxing. The kitchen is not well equipped. It was really a bit of a joke. You could not cook in ours. Two very small pots, a frying pan for 1 egg, no dish towel, no dish detergent. It basically felt like camping. It was a three bedroom with an eating table with four chairs. We were there a week and our room was not swept the entire time. Walls are thin and the beds are uncomfortable. The staff are nice but under-staffed which makes for long waits. I waited over two hours for an answer to a question. The grounds are lovely. So, if you want to take a long drive and spend a lot of money to be in less than 2 acres, this is your spot. For the price, I certainly expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Hotel made the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Pasadena_MDMaryland
Reviews.Content: The facility exceeded our expectations. I traveled with a friend and two teenagers. The three bedroom cottage was perfect. Each bedroom had an adjoining bathroom and two of the bedrooms had balconies. The third floor bedroom had a large window overlooking the water. Off of the living area was a porch skirted by some sand with a lounger. The Hotel is its own sanctuary, lush with tropical plants, soft music, and unique outdoor ornaments. While others may complain about the nearby Walgreen's and Winn Dixie, we found it to be an added convenience. The staff at the front desk, in particular Elena as well as Jessie at the water sports facility, went out of their way to be helpful. I would recommend the guided jet ski tour of the island which departs from Parrot Key. The Key West commuter bus has a stop near the Hotel which will get you downtown economically ($2) a person. Hint - obtain a bus schedule beforehand. No one in my party wanted to leave and if I do go back to Key West, I will definitely stay at Parrot Key!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo but lacking in Hotel Services”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4Fun_2010
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night, $2100 (room only) stay at this property. Upon my arrival I was surprised by it's location. The Parrot Key is NOT in the historic district of Key West where restaurants, nightlife and shoppping are found and it is nowhere near a beach. It is located next to AND across from big box shopping so if you like Walgreens, Home Depot and Publix grocery stores in your front yard you are in luck. You will NEED A CAR or Taxi to get anywhere. That said, we were very pleased with the interior of the condo...great space, an adequate kitchen, each bedroom had a bath, moderate but new furnishings, tile floors throughout. This hotel offers very limited "hotel type amenities"... one small outdoor cafe which closes early and has a very minimal breakfast and lunch menu, no pool side service, a fitness center consisting of two treadmills and one stair machine. The complex features 4 small pools which are beautifully landscaped but not large enough for lap swimming. Again, this complex is NOT near a beach, and offers very minimal water views (none from most units) so you wont enjoy sunset views of the water while sipping a pina colada! At night we heard quite a bit of road noise so if you plan to go, request a room FAR AWAY from the road or bring ear plugs. The best rooms are those facing the bay (but be aware that there are tall stands of Mangrove between you and the view, so you can only see the water from your upstairs balcony). We had a great time in Key West but if I had it to do over again I would have chosen Casa Marina or the Southernmost House (be particular about the building you choose) or the Hyatt (had we wantedt to be in the throws of Duval nightlife). Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A true resort experience”
Reviews.Author: whitey56
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week at the Parrott Key Hotel and Resort with Family. What a great place to relax and unwind. We stayed in a three bedroom cotttage, which had more than enough space for six adults to occupy. From it's very updated well appointed kitchen and 31/2 baths, to the extremely comfortable bedrooms and outside balconies overlooking four tropical pools, you would be challenged to find another resort with finer amentities on this island. A special thank you to a very attentive staff, especially Melissa and Elena!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: sdarrow
Reviews.Content: We traveled here on spring break with two 13-year old girls. All of us had a fantastic time. We booked one of the three bedroom cottages -- perfect for us. Three full baths were beautifully appointed and key for maintaining our sanity (remember -- traveling with two teenage girls). The kitchens were beautiful -- perfect for breakfasts on the go and afternoon breaks. The beds are unbelievably comfortable. If not for the draw of downtown Key West, I'd stay there all day. The choice of four pools is great -- when one fills up, just move to the next. The grounds and landscaping are stunning. Nothing more peaceful than sitting on the balcony outside our bedroom amongst the treetops with a nightcap. On a side note, I should mention that we booked one of the wheelchair accessible units, as I use a wheelchair. The unit has an elevator enabling access to two levels, but what was particularly pleasant was the subtle and aesthetic approach to making the unit accessible. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Triptographer
Reviews.Content: Unit was like new even though it was over two year old; even smelled new. The property is a series of row houses done in a Key West style, giving the feel of being in a quiet neighbor hood, complete with picket fence and lush vegitation. Insied, furnishing were very comfortable and the home was nicely decorated. The beds were awesome pillow topped with great pillows. Bathrooms were appointed in granite and the master bath had both a tub and separate shower. Second bedroom had a shower stall which seemed roomy. Every area was super clean. Large flat screen TVs in the LR and all bedrooms. The downside you are 2 miles from the historic district and parking over there is tough to find or expensive, but within walking distance to the fishing charter marina and a grocery store. The four mineral pools were nice; and separated from each other by a dense tropical landscape.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Vans50
Reviews.Content: Everything was fresh and new. The rooms were very clean and simply but nicely decorated. We shared a 2 bedroom suite with some friends. There were a bedroom and bathroom with a living area on one floor, and a bedroom and bathroom upstairs. There were two balconies. The outdoor landscaping was beautiful and there were four pools with very warm water. Each pool was separated from the other with landscaping and trees. The staff was friendly and eager to please. Try to get a garden view.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise:)”
Reviews.Author: kathrynat
Reviews.Content: My husband and 3 kids stayed here on Thursday, March 18th. We initially were just staying 1 night however, we stayed 2. We would have stayed more had the kids not needed to be back in school on Monday. The girls at the front desk were wonderful. They set up bikes for us and pointed us in the direction of good restaurants and the BEST Sailing/Kayaking/Snorkeling excursion (Danger Charters). They were helpful and so super nice. I also loved visiting with Mr. Booker. He was always tidying up when I went into the office:) Our cottage was amazing! The kids loved their rooms. My oldest loved the 3rd floor for himself:) Sitting outside on the porch having coffee in the morning or just relaxing for a few minutes in the evening:) We are SO there again next trip:) THANK YOU THANK YOU PARROT KEY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few things need fixing”
Reviews.Author: thinplace
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Parrot Key, but an accumulation of "niggling" little things kept it from being a great experience. Our room was clean and nicely appointed. Not too often to we see crown moulding in a hotel room. Although the hotel advertises Free Wireless, it didn't work. Even the wi-fi signal to the complimentary computer in the hotel lobby was so weak, no internet connections were possible. The technician who tried to help said the hotel had recently gone from 70 to 140 units, and the signal they had contracted for was no longer strong enough to service all of them. I agree with the other guests who were disappointed with the Walgreen's parking and the "unavertised" resort charges. Our check in was delayed because they were having problems activating room keys (they forgot to make an adjustment to daylight savings time) With no shuttle to the downtown, we decided to walk - the clerk told us it was 1.5 miles. To Duval Street though, it was closer to 3 miles with not too much to see on the way. While we enjoyed a great sleep, it was interrupted at 6 a.m. by two hotel employees (right below our window), having an animated conversation about how to fix a pool valve. We'd probably try the Parrot Key again, but would hope they start to focus more on the little things that often make such a bid difference to travellers.

Reviews.Title: “attractive property away from Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: c7alt
Reviews.Content: We did 2 nights at Parrot Key. Inside the property, the vegetation is lush and colorful. Very clean, pools are well-kept. The poolside bar is the only food option on property. We had very good luck with 2 meals (outstanding fish tacos). Others were not so lucky during a busy lunch, where several orders were prepared inaccurately and sent back. The rooms are clean, new and quiet. Great plasma tv's. Staff was OK....courteous enough, but not especially welcoming. PK is 2 miles from Duval St. You'll need to drive or take a cab ($12). Outside the property are nameless/faceless strip malls/convenience stores, etc. No atmosphere. We could see the Home Depot a 9 iron away from our room. If you want a clean, quiet & comfortable place away from the mayhem of old town, this may be for you. You will need to get off property, however, to eat, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Attention to Detail -- Refreshing and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: safalab
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive and step onto the grounds you take a deep breath of relaxation. The landscaping is so lush and lovely that you feel miles away from it all...yet you're only steps away from the history and attractions of Key West. The individual residences are crisp and clean and feel very private. The inspired design of several pools gave a very intimate feeling. And fnally, friendly staff topped it off..... a wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate-Artistic Attention to Detail - relaxing and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: bradweeks
Reviews.Content: You take a glorious deep breath when you arrive here -- steps away from the bustle of Key West you feel like you are in an oasis, just like the pictures! I was amazed by the beauty of the grounds, the inspired series of intimate pools, the bright clean and private individual suites. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. It's easily accessible to all the fun and history of Key West. A lovely getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Very clean, but a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: smchris1
Reviews.Content: The second floor room was fantastic, but had some design issues. The water pressure was very low, the counter height was made for little people and the towel rack placement made it difficult to go to the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the front and back balconies provided great views. A conventional restaurant should be available on site for the class of hotel. You have to leave to property to get a bite to eat, even a snack. The on site restaurant was an outdoor cafe , but closed early and offered a limited menu. I would stay here again, but would prefer a location closer to The Westin's location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice and Clean Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jackrussell01
Reviews.Content: We went to Parrot Key March 2010. The rooms were very clean and the service was excellent. Only wish they had more onsight dinning choices. We had the water front room, with a nice patio, however the small beachfront is a bit deceiving you do not have access to the water. The parking at night was terrible not enough spaces close to the room! Very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “We simply loved Parrot Bay !”
Reviews.Author: Graact
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the hotel in February, 2010. It was an awesome experience, starting with the friendly staff ( in particular Jeannie at the pool bar ), tastefully decorated and VERY clean rooms, and overall comfort. Loved the pools and the grounds. We plan on a return visit to KW next year and this is where we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful!!!!! 4 Pools-excellent,”
Reviews.Author: lobsterlarry
Reviews.Content: rooms superb in appointment and comfort, staff attentive to every need--Jeannie exemplifes this caring concern. It was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor check in and maid service during our stay. Mile and a half from Duval”
Reviews.Author: TripMember69
Reviews.Content: Check in was a disaster here. Worst I have ever encountered and I travel for a living. We were early to standard check in time but had to wait 3 hours for room to be cleaned. Maid service very spoyyt during the stay. Could not seem to replenish the in room coffee two days in a row. Desk staff not very knowlegeable about local attractions and definitely not flexible. Accomadations were very nice and the room was clean and bright. Resort definitely needs to offer a shuttle to Duval street . You have a walk to old town or an $11 cab ride each way

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking at Parrot Key Resort ruined our short vacation”
Reviews.Author: OneoftheJonesgirls
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made and confirmed by Parrot Key Resort one month in advance of our trip. After friends traveled to our home near Orlando from Virginia, we headed for Key West for a long weekend of visiting with our friends we hadn't seen in 2 years. We reserved a three bedroom garden cottage so that the 6 of us could be together, have a kitchen, living area, etc. in order to spend some time catching up after 2 long years. When we arrived, we were told that our reservation was lost. After asking to speak to the manager several times we were told that he/she was unavailable. They then directed us to Casa Marina where we were put in 3 different rooms in different buildings approximately 1 block from where we had to park our vehicle. These accomodations did not facilitate the weekend we had planned. We were also told by the desk clerk at the Casa Marina that Parrot Key overbooked that Friday & Saturday by several rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt pick this resort again”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisTracymac
Reviews.Content: The hotel says "waterfront" the only water you can even see is a little sliver. I asked the reservationist if it was on the beach and she replied yes. Was not very happy when i got there and there was no beach.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: 1cabin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in this "luxury" resort....I use the term "luxury" loosely for the following reasons: #1-guest does not have to choice but to swelter in the rooms, as the AC cannot be turned down below 70 degrees....#2-towels for the pool area were not available until after 10 am....#3-floor in our room was not swept for three days-gross!...#4-no ice machine, needed to get it from the pool bar, which was not always open....#5-no place to sit and watch tv in the room except on the bed.....#6-and what was the $24 per day resort fee for? there is no beach-no entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: auggster
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at Parrot key resort and offer the following opinion regarding the property: Pro: The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the rooms are clean and practically new. Con: Every downstairs room has a beautiful spacious porch from which to enjoy the lush environment - but no chairs to sit in! No reason was offered for this oversight. Con: Parrot Key bills itself as a "luxury" resort and even charges a daily "resort fee", yet many features were unavailable or off limits after sundown. The property has four beautiful lighted pool areas but close all but one after sundown. No reason was offered for this restriction. Con: The "luxury" room I stayed in did not come equipped with an iron and the laundry facility on site didn't either. Con: Don't be misled by their use of the term "waterfront" in the property description. There is no beach, per se, just some sandy areas within a fenced area without water access. The only real waterfront views are from a few second story rooms. Con: Ice buckets are furnished in the room but there are no ice machines. You must go to the pool bar for ice but it's not always open.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great people made it a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: hazels2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were well appointed and thought out. The grounds and four pools are beautiful. The staff was very helpful. Jeanne and Elias at the Cafe and Tiki bar were exceptional. Booker was very attentive and kind in helping us with our luggage. The Singhs have done a superior job in decorating and staffing this facility. We used Five Sixes taxi to get around and found them to be reasonable and prompt. We'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel if you like...”
Reviews.Author: amoore4017
Reviews.Content: Ok this hotel is what every romatic dreams of, lush grounds,beautifully styled rooms, hip furniture, hip music, stylish pools. But I like to get my own ice and have a vending machine for drinks. I don't like having to call room service for everything. There was plenty of closet space. I like more than one chair in the room for seating. I am short, so tall beds are a mountain climb. I also like more surface area to set my bags on or set my makeup on in the bathroom. I like more than one set of towels per person in the room. Because of previous reviews I did not expect a water access beach so I was not disapointed there.The laundry was free but closes at 8pm. The restaurant seems to be set up for only light fare but it is not over priced. I had forgotten about the resort fee. If you use the pool, exercise room, parking, and the laundry then the resort feels the fee is justified. If they had included a free downtown shuttle then I would feel like the fee is justified on top of the price for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Freakin awesome”
Reviews.Author: tginley
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! Jeanne, Elias and Erik were fabulous. Service was spectacular. Can't wait wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: sterlingridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a last minute trip to Key West , Fl from Vermont for a little sunshine and R & R and we found just what we were looking for at Parrot Key Resort. The room was beautiful and clean with a private outside deck that lead to a sandy beach and palm trees with very comfortable lounge chairs where we relaxed with our books. We also ate at the poolsice cafe and had a wonderful lunch and greeted by pleasant staff. The 3 pool areas are very private and quiet with beautiful gardens and nice quiet music playing. Very tasteful landscaping and art sculptures made the resort a pleasant stay. We especially loved Booker T. the maintenance gentleman that always had a smile and a greeting for you. We are resort owners ourselves in Vermont and I give this resort a very good review. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great time away..... loved it all”
Reviews.Author: clymerjack
Reviews.Content: recently my wife and i enjoyed a long weekend at this resort and had a great time... weather was wonderful and the resort and staff were great. a special thanks to Jeanne she was great!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All Fluff, No Substance.”
Reviews.Author: JoeFarmville
Reviews.Content: So I am so over not being able to recieve wifi here (front desk: "I've heard that the signal is stronger at the pool. You might want to try there." Umm .. yeah. NO. It's 7pm and pouring rain. ) That is the final straw to make me write this review. But NOW I'm getting one bar. Haha. Irony. (Update: Lost the signal a couple minutes later.) So good things first: We had a 3 bedroom cottage at $399++ night. ($24 resort fee). TheÂ place is amazingly beautiful! Only 2 years old and filled to bursting with hanging vines, flowers and tropical trees. I mean really, really beautiful. I've traveled over the world and stayed in $1 rooms in Asia, 5 stars in Europe and I work at a 5 star myself. This is one of the most beautiful properties where I've stayed.Â Â  Free laundromat. Gorgeous rooms. Beautiful home-sized granite and stainless kitchen. Easy to find. Lots of basics nearby, groceries, gas, franchise restaurants. Â Â  Now for the bad:Â  There are a bunch of little things which happen at places. (for ex, front porch light was out. 'Course there was no bulb in it!) and no bellman. (We were told they "can provide that service if we need it". So the super nice male desk clerk did it. He was great our whole stay.) These things happen. NBD. I'm just gonna list the unacceptables. Like the desk clerk who acted like I was stupid (remember, I'm in the business) and said, "I can help you over HERE", though there were already guests in front of her terminal. Umm... Â could she just have walked back and forth the 5 feet? Â  Note these are facts: trying to keep my opinions on the side.Â  3rd bedroom was naked. Like they ran out of decorations. (OK, this one was acceptable but just weird...) The other reviewer was right. We were NOT waterfront. We were Mangrove-front. They were also right about proximities. The drunks next door were REALLY loud.Â  Who ever heard of a resort pool closing at dusk. This was just plain wrong. (I tried to stick to facts but that is my opinion. Sorry.)Â  No food service from 10am until 11am while they "switch over" to lunch.Â  No food service at all after 6pm.Â  Â Â Â  They advertise luxe iPod clock radios. 2 bedrooms had no clocks AT ALL. Forget the iPod radio. (They brought us 2 when I asked).Â  No hair dryers in 2 or 3rd bath. No bath mat in master or second bath. Only 1 bar of soap in baths.
