So if you want to wash your hands later, like I did, you have to step into the wet shower to get the soap bath.Â  No mat inside of front door during rain Â Super safety hazard. I got an extra bath mat when they brought the missing ones. Â  No place to set soap on sink. Just lay it on the counter. NEXT TO THE PLASTIC CUPS! Excuuuuse me? Isn't that a classic joke about CHEAP hotels? I went downstairs and got glasses out of the kitchen. Geez.Â  If the parking lot is full they have "arranged" parking at Walgreens next door. It was pretty funny to see people pulling expensive luggage across the Walgreens parking lot. They explained that with multiple bedroom units, each unit will often have several cars. Ok. I get that. But could ya save me ONE SPOT to go with my $400 room? Couldn't every room have one reserved space?? Â SO I saved the worst for last:Â  First, the shampoos and lotions were not full. They were all at different levels Â So they were either (1) refilled or (2) used by the prev guest and not replaced. Either way UGH. Second, the the little area where you keep the dish scrubber on the front of the sink cabinet had water and ants in it. DOUBLE UGH. Â And last, the dishwasher had food stuck inside and smelled Luke fish. OMG UGH. Â

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great people”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach_11624
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort!! Fabulous location and easy bike ride to town! Jeanne at the Cafe Blue was just fabulous--so helpful about where to eat and what to see! The room was fabulous-the art work around the resort terrific--all the people were so friendly--even wished Happy Valentines Day by the nicest man--so kind! The rooms were so clean and beds were fantastic! We will be back when we return to the Keys!! Thanks for fabulous time! Love the Parrot Key Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kruthcinciOH
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed and would not stay at Parrot Key again. As regular visitors to Key West, we thought we would try something different but felt we made a huge mistake. Positives: beautiful grounds, nice pools, relaxing atmosphere, very clean, great beds, nice accoutrements, select front desk staff are awesome, Jeanie at the bar is great Negatives: restaurant has limited hours and very limited selection, very limited parking, no smoking anywhere on premises, front desk not responsive to requests(needed toilet paper and had to go get it myself), front desk worker made a horrible recommendation for an electric car company that another front desk worker said "she would NEVER have recommended", housekeeping is very inconsistent(they came one day at 5:30 when we were getting ready for dinner - a little late), one of the servers at the restaraunt was horrible, the hotel is too far from everything, the "resort fee" is quite baffling, there were no throw rugs(nice to have a spot to catch the sand), there are no windows in the workout facility, it's too far from the action In a nutshell, it's just a bizarre place. The inconsistencies made me think that there is either poor management or they just haven't quite gotten it together yet. I am generally easy to please, but I was disappointed. Difficult for me to understand the rave reviews because we spoke with other folks staying at Parrot Key and one was moving to another hotel and the other couple was just passively disappointed like my husband and I. Parrot Key has potential, but I will choose differently nexy time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: queenlori
Reviews.Content: This place was just what we wanted after staying in a less than ideal place in Key Largo...we wanted a little luxury. Luxury we got, along with comfortable beds, beautiful settings and supreme cleanliness. All the staff was very helpful, especially Melissa at the front desk. The four pools were wonderful and set amongst the trees so the trade winds did not bother sunbathers. Loved this place. Easy to get on bus to drive into old town Key West and walking distance to other restaurnats.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Wished we could purchase one!”
Reviews.Author: mirabella626
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! So quiet and so very roomy! The townhomes are huge and for the price, unbeatable in Key West! We have been to the Keys many times and the prices for what you get can be dissapointing but this place did not dissapoint. We had three bedrooms, a large kitchen and family room and two HUGE balconies! We did not want to leave. The pools were amazing as well and all the attention to detail in the pool/garden areas was beautiful. Now - the location is ok, on a main road but not really walkable to Duval and the marina but if you have a car it is just a fast drive anywhere on the island. I think you could also probably bike easily into town. The only other thing to consider is that there is no beach. There is a "beach" area behind some of the homes overlooking deep water but the sand is not thick and you would be starring right into someone's rental if you hung out there. I would reccomend Ft. Zachary Taylor state park beach but you need to drive there. If you know Key West, it is not really a place to go for all day beach goers anywhere. If you drive down from Miami make sure to stop at Bahia Honda state park - now thats a beach!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel completely lived up to the expectations”
Reviews.Author: hergent1
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to be part of the KEY WEST experience, and the city and this hotel really let that happen. The acommodations and location were excellent and the staff and employees were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this trip and stay was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: GAVHCTVH
Reviews.Content: Key West has always been a favorite vacation spot for me but the added luxury of the accommodations just made this visit the best! Parrot Key Resorts has 4 "heated pools" which with the temperatures in the 60's (which rarely happens) were a welcome addition. There is a great pool bar and cafe with excellent food and a fitness center! The hotel is a great place for families alike! If you try it I am sure you will like it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: PAjudy
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Parrot Key, The four pools are just gorgeous. We enjoyed hanging out there and at the Tiki Bar. Jeanne and Elias were just delightful. All the staff was geat to deal with. Would love to stay there again and would definitely recommend to others. Singh Resorts did a splendid job on this facility-everything we saw as very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “The whole family liked it.”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_I_Maureen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for my family. The rooms are very comfortable and the grounds and pools are lovely. We got a very good price on Travel Zoo, which I found through the resort's facebook fan page. My group was impressed when we checked in. That is a rarity. A few things were not working in the rooms (tv remotes and a toaster) but replacements were brought quickly. The kids love playing in the sand outside our back door. There are other families with young children for my daughter to play with, but it is not the kind of place where kids are running around screaming and out of control. There are free laundry facilities on the property. We found the staff very friendly and we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Scenic Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: mikemcBoulder
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and had a wonderful time. The rooms are large and well decorated, the courtyard is really pleasant with lots of tropical plants and the sandy beach area isa great place to read and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, plush, tropical spa-like resort”
Reviews.Author: NYCtoCLT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful "townhomes" on this very tropical, almost secluded-feeling property. Each of the four pools feels like a luxurious spa--subtle music, comfortable lounge chairs, exquisite plantings and decor. The rich colors throughout the entire property really struck me: very tropical. The townhomes ("cottages") were well-appointed, the bedrooms were lovely/romantic. Two balconies, little sandy area on the first floor/wood patio/deck with lounge chairs. Friendly & helpful staff. Across street is grocery store, drug store, misc sundries, perfect for longer stays at this resort. Cons: pool closes at dark, a little far from the action--requires good walking shoes, cab, bike or other transport, low water pressure in bathrooms. All-in-all, a total treat to stay here & I'd be thrilled to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool resort, spotlessly clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JanSWales_UK
Reviews.Content: The resort and the rooms are beautifully decorated, very comfortable beds and our room had a little veranda with two deck chairs and a lounge seat on the sand outside. Could see the sea if stood on tiptoe and looked right (we had shrubbery infront of us, overlooking the waterway) but we hadn't paid for a sea-view so no complaints. This is a new resort and it shows. We just had the lowest price kingsize room but it was spacious, bathroom was lovely and the linens and toiletries were of a good quality. Didn't try the pools but they looked very attractive. Tikki bar offers basic but acceptable fare. The staff were excellent, helpful and friendly, room was spotless. Minor points: the wifi worked but not in all areas of the room and there are no comfortable easy chairs in the room. Would not have wanted to pay the full rack rate (they were on offer at the time) but none-the-less a good experience. A good walk into centre of Key West (45 mins) or $12 taxi ride. All as described on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: debsview70
Reviews.Content: Superb resort and the accommodation was fantastic. The rooms were really spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and service was good. The pools were clean and private in lovely surroundings and not too busy either. Was a bit out of town, but an easy cab drive away to the centre of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a concept!”
Reviews.Author: josie503
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for a group of friendly couples traveling together. We shared a 3 bedroom, 3 story townhome with a common kitchen and living room area. The resort was immaculate to boot! Each bedroom had their own private bathroom. It is a very low key resort with beautiful gardens and 4 swimming pools. Just a $20 cab ride for the six of us to travel to downtown Key West together. Would definitely stay there again. Could not beat the price per couple per night as compared to the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “could have stayed forever”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingkanes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at parrot Key Resort in Jan of 2010. The resort grounds are really beautiful, peacful and private. We had a 3 bedroom 3.5 bath cottage. We also got an amazing rate on their website. The decor is really stunning and comfortable. The bedrooms are beautiful and comfortable. There was a full kitchen with all of the necessities, because of this we even ate in for breakfast and a few lunches There is WIFI throughout. This place just feels like home, but better! We had a corner cottage so I think that may have added to the privacy level. We had a spectacular view from the second floor. The pools are amazing and so peaceful, ( I think the expectation of serenity may be something for families with small children to take into consideration). I cannot say enough about the beauty of the gardens and pools. During our stay the gym and laundry were not avail, we were a little disappointed, BUT the resort did offer use of the gym across the street and even offered to have housekeeping do our laundry. We did not take them up on either offer, but we thought it was more than adequate. We enjoyed the drinks at the bar and parking was never a problem. I have read complaints on this website about this resort and I experienced none of them. This resort is truly an island paradise. We travel to Key west at least once every year, and we will not hesitate to make this our hotel of choice! I was so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “key west paradise”
Reviews.Author: delilady
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort was the perfect getaway for my husband and I.. The grounds are beautiful. Our first great impression was the front desk and check in. Very Friendly and accomodating. The cottage we stayed in was immaculate and supplied everything we needed for our stay. It was nice to return to a nice quiet place after going to Duvall Street. We are definitely going back to the Parrot Key.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden-view room and we were impressed with its size (very large) as well as the nice porch. The furniture and decoration were beautiful and the property is perfectly manicured around the pool and garden areas. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped with toiletries, hair drier, etc. They offer free wi-fi and it is super fast and easy to get connected. The location is not bad although not really close to the old part of town so it requires driving. It is VERY quiet! My only complaint had to do with the cleanliness of the place. I found trash under the bed and hair on the bathroom floor as well as coffee spills on the sink. The cleaning service did not do a good job before and during our stay and they did not replace the paper cups either so, while there was in-room coffee, there was no place to drink it from. The lack of ice and vending machines was strange for such a big resort, although there is a pharmacy next door which proved to be very convenient for last-minute needs. All in all, a really nice place, but there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: 458Magnum
Reviews.Content: The service at check in was not to good; after it got worse. We arrived in the evening, looking forward to relaxing in the hot tub-- they don't have one! So, we decided to unwind by one of four pools-- Nope, can't do that either- pools close at 5:30.(dark). We complained to the Staff and they were unwilling to even listen- they just continued saying the same thing over and over- sorry nothing we can do about it. We asked to cancell so we could move to a different location and they told us that they had already charged us for two days and we were not going to get it (our money) back. We went to the front desk and asked for a cab, but had to wait until the desk clerk was finished with a seemingly personal phone call. She was also rather rude. At check out, we had to calculate our own bill. Seems the front desk people didn't know how to use a calculator. We tried several time to contact the manager/ Owner- no call back. The front desk did slip-up on that one too. When we tried to reach the manager on Saturday, they told us he was not in; When we brought it up on Sunday, they said, well, he was here yesterday. Which is it? Last year, I traveled for business, and spent 220 nights in several hotels- never did I have this poor service level. Oh, and if you are a smoker- definately forget this place. I would expect no smoking in the rooms, but this place is no smoking on the property! They told us to just go to Walgreens parking lot or face a $500.00 'service charge' and they were quick to point out that they had our AMEX on file. I understand that the owners can make that their policy if they so choose; but, they should make that clear at the time of booking so people can decide what they want to do. I felt like I was held Hostage. I make a decent living, but I can't walk away from a +/-$600.00 deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds and design, rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: beachbreezeinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort during a very cold time in January so we were unable to truly enjoy some the amenities like the pools, bar and water. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and tended to and the details down to the potted plants and positioning are wonderfully done. The same holds true for the interior of the units. We had unit 41 which is 3 bedroom and 3 bath villa and has water views. The colors, furnishings and layout is again very well thought out and done. There are 4 flat screen televisions with DVD players, fully furnished kitchen and brand new mattresses put in the day we arrived. The down side is the oveerall cleanliness lor the unit eaves a lot to be desired. There was dust on much of the furniture, the bathrooms were not too well cleaned, the floors not mopped very regularly and the positioning of the furniture had been changed from original set up and needs attention. When a company puts the money and effort to furnish something at the level it did, it is unfortunate that the level of organization and cleanliness doesn't match that level. In addition, the walls are very well scuffed and much of the trim is as well. I understand the need for utilization and productivity but a beautiful assett is quickly deteriorating. Another odd item is that we had a three bedroom unit and a 6 cup coffee maker. Not a big deal but at Tranaquilty Resort in Marathon which is the same company, we had a 2 bedroom unit with a nice 12 cup coffee maker. A curious bit of "value engineering". I can understand the issues with possible noise and traffic as the location really is in the middle of a very busy area, however none of that affected us at all once we parked the car and strolled into the complex. Everyone is very friendly, Key West is worth the trip and there is plenty to do and this place is nicely done. The resort fee is a bit slimy as there really is no value added for that fee. Build it into the room rate or offer some value for the additional fee but I sense it is an operator's way to drive more revenue without incurring any additional expense. Having said all this, we definitely would stay at this Hotel again and would look forward to enjoying the pools and restaurant this time. We loved all the space of the villa and loved all the design features. If they could just spend a bit more on Housekeeping and a Preventive Maintenance program, this place would really shine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: DurbanPompanoBeach
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot, great service from Jeanne & Elias at the bar. Rooms/.beds are comfortable, more bath towels would have been great, but sure they would have delivered if requested. Enjoyed the pool area, little far from Duval, but cabs were reliable. Would return. Jason on our arrival was very helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront but you can't see the water unless you climb a tree.”
Reviews.Author: Diane062
Reviews.Content: When we have previously booked "waterfront" hotels we have been able to walk out and see the water. Resort is waterfront but their is no waterview as it is blocked by mangrove trees. If you went up to the 2nd floor or moved a tree you can see the water. The room we had with double queen comfortable beds was lovely and you could tell everything was new and it was painted in nice colors. Room was also, clean, with a flat screen TV, free internet. Housekeepers were excellent and polite. A room safe could not be found which is a pet peeve we have and for resorts in this price range one should be in your room. Or any room, we had one in our $59 room at the airport. A resort fee is charged per day, it should be just part of rate, there is nothing extra that a resort fee is indicated. Use of the gym and pool is a given at most places in the regular rate. A separate "resort fee" usually indicates extras i.e. such as hot tubs, spa, activity director, separate concierge, restaurants, mini golf course, on site small stores etc.... The concierge is the same person who checks you in and out, who was polite, friendly, very knowledge and gave good advice, but take a seat and wait for people to check in/out to ask questions. Shelly the bartender by the pool was friendly, knowledgeable and made me want to have her high energy level. She knew the ins/outs of the Keys and the visitor spots. No shuttle service to town. Next time I return to the Keys I would not stay here but book a hotel with shuttle service because parking downtown is $10-$20 everytime you go. So if the hotel is $20 more a day with shuttle to go back/forth a day it is worth it. We had our own car and paid to park.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place, wonderful staff, and wonderful services.”
Reviews.Author: ATH5Chicago
Reviews.Content: Parrot Keys is not only an awsome resort, but also has wonderful staff like Ursula, Melissa and house keepers. Their service is the best. Staff are very courteous and attentive. Its location is convenient to get to and from the airport, close by Walgreen and grocery stores and not too far from a golf course and Key West downtown. We got one 2 bedroom suite, very new unit. It was beautiful, clean and there were a flat screen TV w/DVD player in every room. The free high speed internet was very fast and easy to connect. The first day we checked in a few things missings like towels, iron, hangers etc. However, they arrived at our unit right away after we informed the front desk. There was no refrigerator but it was installed at the end of our trip. It did not bother us. I like everything about the resort except the room rate . It was a little pricey for the room because it was a busy holiday season. I would recommend my friends to stay at Parrot Keys. Family from Illinois

Reviews.Title: “incredible in winter, cannot imagine in summer!”
Reviews.Author: desiringtotravelmore
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff: thanks for the recommendations Shawn! One small suggestion for the hotel: stack a few extra towels. Tip: if you do a reservation for 4 on the phone, they'll try to push you to get the 3 bedroom cabin. Don't fall for it, the third bedroom on the 3rd floor has a sofa-bed and no balcony. Useless for us. The rest of the cabin was great. During our stay Key West was very cold, so we did not get to take advantage of the pool or catch any sun, so we'll be returning during summer. Need a car to visit Downtown KW!! Ask the front desk for parking advice...

Reviews.Title: “winter in the keys”
Reviews.Author: fx4ranger
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that the resort is very pretty. The front desk service was a little desirable, but the bar staff was GREAT. The room was great, but lacked what you would think a resort would have in extras. Top line on everything they did have. They did not cut corners on building the rooms. No gym though and we did have to request out room to be cleaned every day we were there. The staff was very friendly though. No room service. But there is a grocery store across the street which we utilized to buy fruit and beverages at. The gardens and pools were great. You felt as if you were in a private island when you were in the resort. I would recommend renting a car if you did not drive there or at the least rent some bikes or scooters to get down to downtown. You can walk if you are up to it. We did that and had the time of our life. Ask for Jennie at the bar she knows alot about the area and is super funny. Sean at the front desk knows of free parking areas which are very hard to find down town. Jesse at the water tours is a native of the keys and he was great a recommending different tours and fun facts of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space, but old town is a trek.”
Reviews.Author: Strombeekasaurus
Reviews.Content: We made these reservations for new years eve and were delighted by the size of the unit, as well as the balconies and Adirondack chairs. The pelicans actually came close enough I could hear their wings cut through the air! The only real drawback was that the walk to old town was pretty substantial--close to an hour and a half. On the other hand, it is conveniently located next to Walgreens and a number of other businesses. There is a beach area with lounges and cabanas, but mangroves separate the beach from the water.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGibson
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the resort, but I just spent 30 minutes on the phone with Amy - the resort's customer service representative - booking a trip for my parents to Parrot Key in 2010. She deserves special mention due to her utmost professionalism, guidance on dates of stay, and activities people of various ages can enjoy when at Parrot Key (and in Key West). I am beyond impressed with how she answered all of my questions and her patience and kindness in doing so. I wish there were more Amy's in today's customer service industry!

Reviews.Title: “Great time - will return with larger group - bring a can opener ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Ipodyguy
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent two nights at this Key West gem thanks to the many positive reviews on this site. We've stayed in Key West many times before at all varous types of hotels, B&Bs etc, but this was stood out. Pros The place is immaculate, the grounds are lush and beautifully landscaped and the pool areas (4 in total) were almost sanctuary like - in true key west B&B fashion. We had a three story 2 bedroom townhome, that was spacious and very well appointed - great appliances, 4 flat screens, 3 balconies - I'd say easily big enough to hold a family of 6, or 8 in a pinch. The hotelier's clearly put a lot of thought into the theme - though for some reason we couldn't find a can opener ;-) Cons: Though the grounds with their lush landscaping and intricate patheways creates this peaceful sanctuary, they could do a better job securing the property's perimeter. I was surprised that you could literally walk right into this area from the main road without being met by anyone on the hotel staff, or a single security gate. Also did not have a great experience with the hotel staff at the front desk. Wasn't certain if this was because it was close to Xmas and the primary staff were off, but it did feel like some basic training was lacking. For instance, when we arrived our room wasn't ready so we headed into town and asked to be called when it was. They never called us and offered no apology upon our return. Lastly, parking was limited and semi-challenging - I'd recommend taking a taxi into town In closing, for the money, a fantastic place to stay, particularly if you're looking for a quieter type of Key West getaway and their spacious townhome options just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “"Almost" perfect.”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: The good: This place is beautiful especially the pool areas. The entire grounds is covered in lush, tropical trees and plants to a point of obscuring the view in some cases. The units are large, clean and very nice. Staff was very friendly. The service was very good--to a point. The bad: We were initially placed in a unit next to in-house construction. Every morning at 8 AM there was typical construction noise. They said they would address it but after three days of no action we demanded to be moved. The management was very apologetic and accomadating and upgraded us to one of the nicest units. Had we been in this unit to start with I could probably remove my "almost". Also, no matter what anyone tells you on the phone there IS a $24/day "resort" fee on top of the published rate. One more thing. Resort is at least 1.5 miles from Duval St. so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Honey! It's a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: SummerwindChicago
Reviews.Content: Privacy! Beautiful grounds, well cared for, 4 pools, excellent staff. We felt like we were the only people there (had one pool to ourselves all day). Ask for Shelly when you get to the pool bar she'll give you the low-down on all the Key West spots to hit and local dish and dine. Now, we had a car, so it was a quick drive to Duval street and old town. If you don't... no worries, rent bikes- everybody does or taxi it. It's worth it! Priviate paradise. Picture perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Cozumel-Girl-TX
Reviews.Content: A much overdue review...but this place was amazing! We had a 3 bedroom/3 story townhome for my siblings and our spouses. We were so thrilled to see how nice, fun, colorful, beachy and just really how beautiful the resort was. Of course downtown Key West wasn't within walking distance but a quick cab ride and we were there! Nothing but good things at Parrot Key. We fixed breakfast and dinner in the completely furnished kitchen, very convenient! And even jumped in the heated pool in the middle of January! The grounds were so pretty and views from the balcony were wonderful. Highly recommend this place, especially to large groups and families. Can't wait to get back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Food, good converastion, super relaxed-paradise feeling atmosphere ..pools and hotel are so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sunmakesyouhappy
Reviews.Content: I had the best panini-basil chedder grilled chicken--yummy!!! Elias served it hot and fast, Jeanne at the bar has THE BEST STORIES!! She is a hoot!!! You find yourself reordering a key-lime colada (those are addictive too) while you listen to her make you laugh!!! Can you believe all these pools are available in this hidden oasis??? What a gem and the feeling of paradise is inevitable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments - poor location and is currently a construction site”
Reviews.Author: AdamWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November, the rooms are fantastic and finished to a very high standard. The pools and grounds are also very nice. A couple of things to be aware of the first is that this hotel is currently a construction site with noisy building work ongoing on at least half of the properties from what I could see and hear. Couldnt relax by the pools due to the noise. Would avoid staying here until this work is completed. Secondly this resort is quite a way out of town, not a problem if you are ok with driving in and parking but its not walkable in my view. One other thing is that I found the reservations department to be next to useless. When I received my confirmation it had an error, 2 emails, 5 phone calls later and despite promises I did not ever recieve a correct booking confirmation. if your happy with the commute into town this is a very nice place to stay just check that they've finished the building work. Also its on waterfront not beachfront like some of the other hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “too far from kw old town”
Reviews.Author: tripFlorida
Reviews.Content: great hotel and accomodations but location is too far from town, you cannot walk since the area is not that great. if all you want to do is stay in the hotel pool is beautiful and rooms very confortable except for the on going constuction and staff that is a little flaky

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable place”
Reviews.Author: FRUITCAKESVa
Reviews.Content: Wow. That the only word I can think of when become to Parrot Key. I mean words can not express how majestic this place is. My partners and I checked in a day before Fantasy Fest. Let tell you some, Fantasy Fest is as a dream coming to reality. Pools, gardens, waters sporst, drinks and food provided by Jeanne ( she is one of the kind), and Elias ( my gosh, he is handsome), gave us the best hospitality out of this world. Like I said at the beging, This resort is a breath taker!!!! Thanks guys from the botton of our heart. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key The Best resort ever”
Reviews.Author: HotBoyz
Reviews.Content: Friends and I went to Key West to enjoyed Fantasy Fest. Fantasy Fest was wild and crazy, I could not believe what we saw. But after all we had fun. Parrot Key Resort town house is so beautiful. Three rooms, king side bed and four big flat screen. The staff are number one. They provided us with anything we needed. The four pools and the three gardens are gorgeous. We had a blast with Jeanne and Elias, They are full of fun and they kept us well inforned about Key West life style. Food and drinks are the best. "KEY LIME COLADA AND FISH TACOS" are awsome besides the other stuff of the menu. We recommend Parrot Key Resort . We had fun in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Anneoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for the 1st time in July. My sister came from out of town last week to get married at our home. After the wedding we wanted a brief "getaway" to the Keys. There was no question as to where we would stay. They loved it as much as we did. Melissa was fantastic....from her warm smile to her great customer service. The grounds were beautiful. The cleanliness of the townhouse was great! Super job!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: EricaRosa
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Parrot Key. We were amazed of the beautiful house we had. All the rooms have an unique decor and view. The sunset from the master room was increible. Our chilrens loved the pools, and of course the tropical garden and the coconut trees. The staff were friendly especial Elias and Jeanne. We truly recomend this resort for everyone who wants to visit Key West. Thanks Parrot Key....

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: whackoFlorida
Reviews.Content: When you look at the pictures on line you think that there is no way that it really looks like that...well it does. The landscaping is incredible. The pool and pool bar was a 50 ft walk. The condos were great (new, flat screens, upgraded appliannces, private). The front desk was helpful, pleasant and accomodating. Tina and Ursula treated us like royalty. I will stay here every time i go to Key West. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Israel007
Reviews.Content: When my friends and I checked in and when we opened the door of our house we were amazed. Inside the house was beautiful. Four flat screen, kitchen, and the best the bedroom and the details was unbelievable. The pools, the tropical gardens and the hospitality of Jeanne and Elias was the best.. I truly recommend this resort to everyone who wants to go visit key west. Good job guys

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Parrot key resort ....”
Reviews.Author: elsantito
Reviews.Content: I've just recently visit key west, and me and my wife loved the Parrot Key Resort. We were very impressed with the view and the service, great parking area, pool, housekeeping and the best of all was the food!. I was very pleased with jeanne and her crew. Elias the cook, was very friendly and his meals were hot and tasty. Jeanne keep our glasses filled with drinks and we loved it!. I can see ourselfs coming back to key west sometime soon, and we are going to book with you guys again. Thanks for your hospitallity and great service!!! Sincerly Carlos S. Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in da rough”
Reviews.Author: tybo555
Reviews.Content: Great Resort. Next to Walgreens and Home Depot in Mid Town?? Oh yes. It is true. I was totally amazed by this Resort. The Foliage is incredible. The Villas are nicer than most peoples homes. There is nothing these Villas Lack. There are 5 Huge Flat Screen Tv's. Ipod docking stations in every bed room. Top of the line mattresses. Fully stocked Kitchens. 4 Bathrooms. The grounds are incredible. Plants that look like they have been there for years. 4 pools. A cool Tiki Bar with a great Bartender, Jeanie. She makes a wonderful Rocks Magarita. She steered us to two incredible resturants. A cool "non KW bar" called Virgilios and her attitude and warmth made us feel right at home. I was totally blown away by this awesome property and will be back soon soon soon!

Reviews.Title: “What To Expect... Lets Get Real! Secret $500 Fee!”
Reviews.Author: Airbrushguy
Reviews.Content: We were there the last week of July ........... I would definately recommend the Parrot because of how COZY* it is and theres really no other good choices in Key West and we DID circle the Island from pebble to pebble so TRUST ME...all the other hotels are dated and pseudo-skanky. All the other things you read in these reviews is correct...staff is friendly etc, resort is clean blah blah blah indeed those are all True, but I was TICKED when I found out that after I had checked into the room, got my key etc....a couple of days after staying there they had taken out a "Contingencie Fee" of $500! This was a another deposit they they took without asking us! BEWARE!!!! This fee evidently was in case you ran up a bill at the tiki-bar or left the room smelling like cigarettes or some other arbitrary damage to the property. So lets get this straight...I already paid my deposit when I booked the room...already paid for the room...and after TWO days of staying there they ASSESS this OTHER $500 CHARGE. Hopefully people will not have any debits pending from other purchases when this $500 fee is SLAPPED ON THEIR BANK ACCOUNT! Even though this fee is not actually "Debited" Per say... it is AUTHORIZED and Pending as an up and coming potential DEBIT! ALL THIS CRAP WITH NO PERMISSSION! OH! and if you need to use a business printer.. we had to go DOWNTOWN to be able to print ANYTHING! No business center in this RESORT!!! THAT BLEW MY MIND!!! Overall the Parrot was nothing to complain about just because of how cozy, pretty and clean it was, but the front desk was TOTALLY understaffed CONSTANTLY and we spent valuable time listening to the stressed out counter clerk rambling with the maintenance guy over and over, day after day. Other than that, the best part of Key West was the Catamaran ride over on the Key West Express ( $100 per person round trip/ AMAZING! ). If your not an alcoholic, there is not much to do in this city. It is wall to wall t-shirt ships with the same ole cheesy dated designs over and over and over at every shop. Going to Key West In July is like walking around 24/7 with a blow dryer in your face set on low. ITs horrible! The Commerce in Key West Is also dated and certainly there are no malls or up to date restaurants ( Except TGI FRIDAYS), and the restaurants that are functioning are half-[---]. People are barely getting by in this town and it shows. The Beach owned by the state was gorgeous, but the other beaches were kinduv nasty and again..DATED. Lots of thug-ish people walking around from Miami etc. Streets were not taken care of / paved etc. I would not recommend going here at all. I mean there are some gorgeous horizons to see on the coastline, but save your money and spend a couple of extra thousand to go to St Thomas instead! St Thomas is not NEAR as Dated As Key West is. There is just not hardly anything to do in Key West The coral reefs are barron do to the climate changes so dont even think about snorkeling! The best example of how much their struggling financially is: Their "Aquatic Museum" as about as big as a White Castle Hamburger Joint.....and was SUPER-SUCKY-LAME! And the price was like $20 per kid! One last thing...and its the biggest of all. There is a WAVERUNNER PLACE Connected to the PARROT RESORT. WE WERE RIPPED OF $300 in ONE HOUR! I am starting a website based upon the experience of this Company~! If you walk near the laundry room the waverunners are down by the docks and they do NOT tell you that you need EXPERIENCE TO RIDE THESE [----] THINGS! I almost seriously and LITERALLY killed my two daughters as we flipped one of these WAVERUNNERS! WE had to be assisted back to the docks and they had these two stoner guys running the place who liked showing off their pecks better than discerning if we were proper material for this hour long ride around the island. Mouth full of saltwater, potential death and am considering a major lawsuit against them. I am being totally honest, theres not much to do in Key west except party. Go ot the virgin islands instead.

Reviews.Title: “We found true paradise”
Reviews.Author: jimsgirl54
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our close friends to Parrot Key in October 2009 and stayed for 6 glorious days here. We truly discovered "Paradise". We have been to Key West many times prior to this visit but we never stayed anywhere quite so gorgeous and satisfying. From the condo to the several pools to the wonderful bar by the pool, everything was terrific. From getting greeted by Ursala at the reservations desk to being served by Shelley in the bar/dining area , this place really knows how to keep their guests happy and content. The housekeeping crew was courteous and polite always keeping our privacy as their number one priority while replenishing us with clean towels and supplies daily. The landscaping was magnificient filled with greenery that was breathtaking. The next time we come back to Key West for another relaxing stay, we will look no further; we know exactly where we will make our reservations. Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: “You cannot go wrong”
Reviews.Author: JIMBOBOB32
Reviews.Content: We went with some friends that had never been to Key West. We have stayed at a number of the better Hotels but none of those came close to the Parrot Key Hotel and Resort. Besides the fantastic service, landscaping, and the two bedroom suite we stayed in I cannot think of one thing wrong with this place. Flat screen TV's in every room, great appliances and when you needed something they were there in minutes to replenish towels, soap, and everything you asked for. Great location to everything. If you need to stay in Key West this in the only place I will pick everytime I go back. You will not be disappointed. Did I mention the Pools, they have four. What a great place to relax and just kick back and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jkbrown79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Parrot Key to celebrate our 30 year wedding anniversary. It was perfect and we cannot wait to go back. I can certainly say the resort lived up to the images on the website. The rooms were beautifully decorated and spacious and we enjoyed having a full kitchen to use for breakfasts and appetizer time in the evenings. The pools are kept so crystal clear....we made sure to spend some time at each one! We understand we were there during the slower season, but it was a perfect time! Kiel and Shelley suggested many activities and eating places to us on our first afternoon while we were visiting Cafe Blue. We have already told many friends and have been showing our pictures around. Like many folks have already said...you can spend your whole time right there and not go anywhere. The grounds are so lush and tropical you really feel like you are away from everything for a precious little while. Many thanks to all the office and management team; Ryan, Kiel, Ursula, Melissa and Tina for making us feel so welcome and comfortable during our stay. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't stop talking about how awesome the place was!”
Reviews.Author: goodpookie
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe our eyes when walked into our "room". The living room/dining room/kitchen was so nice. Everyone started roaming around and you could hear from several different places, "oh, look at this". The owners of the resort really went the extra mile with details inside the rooms. They are beautifully decorated and really have a tropical feel to them. The rest of the resort is just as beautiful. All the foliage makes you feel secluded from the rest of the resort. The four pool areas are beautiful. The drinks were delicious and the bar staff very friendly. If I ever go back to Key West, I will definitely stay at Parrot Key. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for a Celebration”
Reviews.Author: SunLover4462
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West to celebrate 3 milestone birthdays. Instead of haunting Duval Street, we partied for 3 days at the Tiki bar! Jeanne and Elias were fabulous. Jeanne made sure that we had our favorite beverages and Elias kept us well fed.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome time!!”
Reviews.Author: naty0916
Reviews.Content: I have no words to experience the wonderful time I spend at Parrot Key Resort. As soon as my friends and I arrived, the front desk lady greeted as and was very helpful to use. She also answered all our question. The plan was to go to the beach and get some sun we were celebrating a bday, but the hotel was so comfortable and relaxing that we prefer to stay at the pool. I definitely advise to check this place out!! YOU WOULD LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Shelley made our stay!”
Reviews.Author: texashulahottie
Reviews.Content: We spent time each day sunning, laughing and playing in the big pool. We were so fortunate to have Shelley take care of us each day, making absolutely everything tasty and yummy. Shelley went the extra mile, recommending great restaurants, bars and activities in Key West. And yet everyday, we were there we headed back to the pool to be pampered by Shelley. Her presence and attention really made our stay even that much more fun and enjoyable. Thanks Parrot Key!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Key West Resort”
Reviews.Author: SoFloridaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two friends found this hotel online and were not disappointed. Since this is a slower time of the year, we were upgraded to a three bedroom unit. The front desk girl (Melissa) went out of her way to make us feel very welcome the moment we arrived..she let us look at a couple of rooms before we decided on Unit 48 which overlooked the Bay. The accomodations more than exceeded our expectations; included is a fully stocked kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops. The living room and all three bedrooms have plasma tv's..there are 3 1/2 baths, balconies off the bedrooms, and the place is tastefully decorated in a Key West motiff. The four saltwater pools were all encompassed in a tropical garden and were very private. We all agreed that we would definitely stay at this hotel again and like Siskel and Ebert give it "two enthusiastic thumbs up".

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LDF27A
Reviews.Content: Clean units, great staff, close to everything! The service was great. There is no restaurant on site, but the outdoor cafe serves light meals. We rented a 3 bedroom unit. We're not used to stairs, so we didn't venture up to the 3rd floor other than to inspect it when we checked in, then out. We brought our son (23) and his friend (26) with us on this trip. They each had their own bedroom and bathroom. We enjoyed our daytime outings and time by the pools. The boys were able to go into town at night to enjoy the night life. The only thing we didn't care much for was the entrance to the complex. The adjacent shopping center parking lot has a cut-through and could prove to be hazardous. We understand it used to be a side street. We are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a group vacation”
Reviews.Author: Piggy2luv
Reviews.Content: Me and my hubby stayed here with friends on our first leg of our vacation. We stayed for 3 days. Very pleasurable, clean, spacious resort. We had a standard three story conch house.Bed was very comfy, I slept so peacefully. Full kitchen where we made breakfast each morning. Balcony was great, I woke up each morning and sat and soaked up the morning air, felt very relaxed. I am an exercise nut, I need to get my cardio each day. They had a small fitness center. Only three treadmills, so try and get on them when no one is around. Pool was great, had some beers at the tiki bar. Front desk was quick to take care of requests, for example, our remotes for the TV's in the bedroom did not work, they came an resolved the problem right away. We were missing the chairs from the balcony when we arrived and they made sure that the were there by the time we finished our drinks at the bar. I think we got a very good deal for spacious house we got, and it's an ideal place for family vacations or get aways alone or with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sylvia0960
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Tiki Bar at the Parrot Key Resort on my way to a Jet Ski tour. I thought that the service was excellent and that the bar tender, Elias, was very friendly and made wonderful food and drinks. I will definitely stop by the Tiki Bar the next time I am in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaNana
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful! The rooms were fabulous - the service from Shelly and Miguel at the Tiki Bar was fabulous! They both treated us like family, provided excellent advise on local events and the service was above/beyond! Not only did we have a wonderful stay, we made new friends with Shelly, Miguel and the others!

Reviews.Title: “Group Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Raven300
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Key West I was not sure what to expect. The resort housing was fantastic. The rooms were well equipped, clean and had plenty of room. The staff were helpful and accommodating. Specifically Shelly & Miguel from the TIki Bar. Shelly made a point of engaging our group and ensuring that we had everything we needed while at the pool/bar. She was awesome! Miguel makes a mean fish taco which we could not get enough of! Great team you have there. The nightlife in Key West was great fun. Reminds me a lot of New Orleans - which I love. We'll be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: cherik08
Reviews.Content: This was not your typical "hotel room" - the 3 bedroom townhouse was huge and the upscale key west style decor was fabulous! The staff was very friendly. I called down and told them we were running late for checkout and there response was "no problem". Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: fire_chief92
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key is definitely a nice place. The rooms and in fact the whole resort are new. The main problem, as pointed out by others, is that their advertising and website are very misleading. Educate yourself beforehand and you'll probably have a decent trip. The hotel is not well located. It's basically on the other side of Key West from where all the action is. Taxis are very expensive in to town. We paid $15-20 each way. If you want quiet, you'll find it here. Also, there is NO beach or beach access, despite what the website says. The hotel borders the harbor, and it's not really that pleasant and you can't swim there. The, however, grounds are very nice and well-maintained. The swimming pools were fun and the cottages extremely spacious. My main complaints are that housekeeping is a-w-f-u-l! Often they didn't clean the room at all and when they did (after I hassled front desk with a phone call), they wouldn't bring towels or take away old ones. We got in the habit of dumping our old towels out on the sidewalk in front of our cottage in a plastic bag. Crude, but it got the job done and forced them to take them. The telephone system is spotty. We could call the front desk but couldn't call other rooms where family were staying. The hotel bar closes at 6 pm(!). The swimming pools close at 9 pm, before it's even dark. The entire staff goes home at 11 so there is absolutely no one around at night if you need someone. We came here on our honeymoon based on the reviews. It wasn't horrible, but we wouldn't return unless we had a rental car, and we would most likely choose some place near a beach in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of Key West”
Reviews.Author: toney1
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key Resort was the best part of our trip to Key West. Typically we like to find a place with enough space to spread out and a little away from the noise of the crowds. This location provided more than we could have hoped for, even my picky husband was satisified. We were in unit #37, an "ocean side" view, that was quiet and very well decorated with all the amenities of home. Although we all agreed this was the favorite part of our vacation, the location is about 2-3 miles away from the activity of Oldtown and for those who don't have a car, a bicycle or moped is recommended. Even for those who have cars, a bicycle or moped is recommended, because parking in town was not easily available and overall the rates were high. Make sure you have a pocket full of change, because that is what most pre-paid lots require.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: thirdbaby
Reviews.Content: This resort was the best ever. It was friendly, clean, spacious, great value and perfect for our family of 5. I would recommend it to everyone. One person in particular stood out among the many friendly service people: Melissa Baldwin. She went above and beyond. We will definitely revisit this hotel, thanks to her.

Reviews.Title: “You will love this place”
Reviews.Author: tsingh222
Reviews.Content: Parrot key is beautiful. The townhomes are very modern and quite spacious for families or couples traveling together. We had a 2 bedroom poolside house, unit 73, and it was gorgeous. The house is decorated beautifully and another plus is that all the bedrooms have full ensuite bathrooms, even the third floor media room!!! The staff is very helpful. A word to the wise while you're in key west and staying at the parrot key, cook your own breakfast and lunch as that will save money. Key west dining is pricey but there are fast food places all over. The kitchen is so nice that it will inspire you to cook! A con would be that the pool temp. is too warm and it closes at 9pm and the cleaning women only change the garbage and make beds daily. They do not do full cleaning during your stay. On one occasion our cleaning lady folded the sheets over clothes!!! We were slightly annoyed but enjoyed our stay nonetheless. Parrot key is worth the money if you want to be comfortable with modern accomodations. Mr. Singh did a great job. I wish he had more resorts in other places!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST TRIP EVER”
Reviews.Author: lovthakeys
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the resort july 24-27th and had the best time ever. the resort is sooo nice and the employees are super friendly. Jeannie at the tiki bar makes real good maragaritas!!the townhouse was ice cold at all times and the beds were super comfy. only thing i did not like is that the pools closed at 9:pm its too early and that there were no jacuzzis. the place is very pricey i believe that people should be allowed to go into the pool whenever they want. another thing is that my friend smokes cigarettes and there is no smoking allowed so we had to walk to the walgreens every time. we had fun there at walgreens though. but overall i had a blast, loved duval street. OH AND WATCH OUT, THE HOUSEKEEPING SERVICE WILL WALK IN THE TOWNHOME WITHOUT EVEN KNOCKING! THEY WILL JUST WALK UP THE STAIRS. I WILL DEFENITELY BE COMING BACK TO PARROT KEY RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Spacious Resort for Groups!”
Reviews.Author: cjsclark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parrot Key in July for three nights..there were four women our group. When we got there, we were upgraded to an ocean view villa. No, it wasn't right on the ocean, no there wasn't beach access however, there was a water view and it was beautiful. Key West is not known for their beaches! The villa was spotless clean...the rooms were spacious and it was great that everyone had their own room and bathroom with the exception of two of us that shared. Housekeeping came every morning, we brushed them off as we were in the villa but they were happy to replace towels for all of us!! We had no problems with the inattention of housekeeping. Melissa at the front desk was very helpful and always had a cab waiting for us when we called for one. We loved the pools and had no problem finding a private one when kids were around. It wouldn't hurt to designate an adult only pool. Shelly the bartender was great! We had a great time chatting with her during a rain storm and the food was very good for lunch. Yes, the hotel was a distance from Duval and we would have never walked but it was worth it for the all the extra space and the beautiful pools and scenery. I'm not quite sure of another place in Key West that provides this! **NOTE TO SINGH RESORT** We heard a rumor that the villas may be made into traditional hotel rooms. I plead you to NOT to do this...I would be hard pressed to stay in a traditional hotel room that far from Duval!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing beats it.”
Reviews.Author: neeko34
Reviews.Content: Very nice place with all of the amenities. Relaxing views, pools, gardens. Flat screens in rooms and living room. Multi-level dwelling with private rooms, great when travelling with friends/couples. Even has Xbox in upper level for family oriented trips. The place offers value with a sophisticated touch. Been to Lobsterfest 8 years running and this place definitely tops over other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: texastigerr
Reviews.Content: The Resort is nice. The pools are nice and surroundings peaceful. Complaints include, We paid for and "Ocean View". Did not get it. What we got was a Bay View and you could not see the Bay because of the Palm Trees. A/C in the condo was not set up for three stories. Had to freeze out the bottom two floors to get the top bedroom cool. Advertised one adult pool. It didn't exist. You can only get pool side towels from the 4th pool and then you have to bring them back to Pools 1-3. The term Ocean View and Bay View is used too freely. Palm trees blocked the views. The location is good if you want to be far enough away from the business of Duval St. and Mallory Square. Staff did not seem to want to leave enough towels and wash cloths for 6 people. Had to constantly go hunting for more. 9pm seemed too early to close the pools. Staff leaves at 11pm so if you need anything you need to make sure you get it before then.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: Judaliciouswow
Reviews.Content: I was in awe of the gardens and pools. The resort is quiet with pure smoke free air. Quiet and soothing environment away from the bars on Duvall Street. We had to ask for a coffee maker and the door to the outside in the master bedroom would not lock but otherwise we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key feels like home”
Reviews.Author: bamban21
Reviews.Content: Excelent place to go with my family. We were able to have a babysitter at our condo and relax at night. Perfect size for family and friends. I would like to stay a lot longer.Excelent views!! Nelson Caceres

Reviews.Title: “Only complaint is that our stay wasn't longer!”
Reviews.Author: catoregan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Parrott Key Resort. The little cottages are modern, very clean and very tastefully decorated. We had a 2 bedroom with each bedroom having an ensuite bathroom. It was off season when we stayed so we had the swimming pool to ourselves!! It is a little far into the centre of Key West if you want to be within walking distance but that means it's lovely and quiet. Would definitely recommend this to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: CliodhnaD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort early last week and loved it. The villas were amazing and the resort is beautiful. Staff were friendly and very accomodating, especially Kiel and Melissa. The house was really well equipped and has plenty of space. We had the pool to ourselves for alot of the day and the privacy was great. It is out of season though, so i guess both the resort and Key West are busier during the season. It's worth noting though, that it's about a 25min walk to Duval street but taxis are easy to come by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, absolutely beautiful & friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheena81404
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key was absolutely beautiful.. One of the nicest & cleanest resorts I've ever stayed at.. All the staff was very friendly, helpful & efficient... This is a great place to stay whether vacationing with family, friends, or on your honeymoon! Very peaceful setting with magnificant views... Also loved the fact that the resort is 100% smoke-free. If you're looking for a great place to stay, I would highly recommend Parrot Key! I know you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful resort to relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Jvarella
Reviews.Content: Second time at Parrot Key. Loved the Resort!!! I will definitely return to Parrot key Resort. Gardens were really pretty and well maintained. Great and private pool areas surround of lush and beautiful vegetation. Rooms were plenty of space and beautiful interiors work, with balconies, special rooms for kids. And the location is excellent, close enough to the heart of Key West but not there, them you can enjoy of an active and passive activities.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the rooms and pool but not the location, service or amenities”
Reviews.Author: sclaas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to stay at this resort after reading the reviews here and two other travel sites. We found a great rate at Hotels.com. We booked a 3 bdrm poolside house for 4 nights. The actual house was great - four flat screens, two private patios, full kitchen, and lots of room. The other aspect of Parrot Key we liked were the four pools on property. They're small but the greenery surrounding them is pretty and they were clean. The aspects we were sorely disappointed with were the location, service and amenities. If you go beware that the resort is located about 2 miles from Merrion Square and 1.5 miles from the heart of Duval Street. Cabs for two people were about $10 each way to Duval. We ended up renting bikes for the entire four days which was a good way to get around. The biggest downside to taking cabs or riding bikes back and forth was that we couldn't go back to our room during the day or evening to clean up and change. We ended up staying downtown and hanging out at bars or eating dinner in the clothes we'd been wearing all day - lots of times that meant a bathing suit underneath clothes. We checked in on a Thurs night, our room was not made up on Fri, on Sat it was, on Sun they cleared the dirty towels and empty toiletries but didn't replace them. We called the front desk multiple times but never got an answer. Of the four days we asked for beach towels at the bar, they weren't availabe three of them. Also, the tiki bar is open from 11-6 daily and the restaurant from 11-5. Unfortunately the only restaurant within walking distance of the resort is TGI Friday's. Hence the reason we ended up staying downtown and eating in our bathing suits most nights! All in all we were sorely disappointed with Parrot Key. I'd only recommend this place to people who have a car and large family needing lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: williechristina
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We live in Marathon and went for a night. It felt like we were much farther from home than just an hour. Easy and fast to get anywhere, cabs readily available!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: kellymfra
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Parrot Key Resort for a week in mid May. We had a great stay and loved the property. The bayside views were excellent with a little private beach where my 2 year old played. I loved the townhouse set up and we had so much space for 3 adults and 1 kid. The cafe and pools were our favorite spots. Jeanne and Elias did an outstanding job serving us food and drinks each day and engaging us in great conversation. They were also very informative about where we should go for excursions. The food and drinks were great - I highly recommend the shrimp tacos and the bahama mama. The only low point came when we got very frustrated with the reservations staff. We asked to extend our stay for a day and they said no problem only you will have to move to a pool view room. We agreed to do this and the night before we were suppossed to move they said oh no we don't have any rooms available. We had changed plane reservations and made plans because we were told there was a room available. It ended up working out and we stayed in our original room but we were frustrated with being jerked around a bit. Overall I really liked the resort. I highly recommend renting bikes and riding to the action in downtown too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: beerlydevoted
Reviews.Content: After a rough couple of days sailing into Key West, my friend and I needed a comfortable bed for a few nights before heading back out to sea. My wife found the Parrot Key Resort online and texted me the info, and we biked over to check it out. It was beautiful, clean, and a great deal!!! We had a 2 bedroom unit with 3 1/2 baths for less than the Southernmost Inn was offering for a tiny basic hotel room that smelled like Clorox...ugh!!! Greeting us at the front desk were Melissa and Kiel, and they were outstanding---very friendly and helpful and got us checked in in no time!!! Another very helpfull staff member was Booker. He let us check out the room before we decided to stay---an immediate YES!!!. Booker is a great asset!!! He gave us excellent advice on places to visit in Key West and was very expedient in gettin us taxis and in every way made our stay at the resort pleasurable and memorable. Thanks to all the staff at the Parrot Key Resort, espceially Booker, Melissa, and Keil. We'll be bringing our wives down and seeing ya'll soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “I needed it!”
Reviews.Author: pineappleXiIota606
Reviews.Content: Very great hotel! Great rooms with very friendly staff. Kiel Kear at the front desk was always helpful and knew all the area and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: poorcollegestudent
Reviews.Content: The photos and reviews of Parrot Key do not even begin to describe how wonderful the resort is! Everything was perfect, from arrival to check out. Upon our arrival, check-in was quick, easy, and our room/price was accurate. The accommodations were also great! Three spacious bedrooms, three bathrooms, and a porch/balcony off of each room. Furnishings were well kept, the kitchen was well furnished and stocked with equipment/appliances, and the overall condo was very clean. Housekeeping stopped by each day to do a quick cleaning (sweeping, trash, etc.) and new linens were provided. My only complaint here is that our sheets were not changed at all during our stay, which was 7 days. The resort grounds were also beautiful. Very lush plants and foliage lined the sidewalks, pools, and grounds. In addition to being aesthetically appealing, they provided a great amount of privacy, which was nice. At check-out, we had no issues. The bill was ready, accurate, and check-out took no more than 5 minutes. We loved this resort and will definitely return. The price was reasonable for what seemed like five star accommodations. The resort is located about 2 miles from Duval Street, and the bike path does NOT go all the way into town. After renting bikes, we found driving or taking a cab much more reasonable, as the resort will call you a cab when you need one.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key - Very beautiful property.”
Reviews.Author: duhon
Reviews.Content: Came here with 3 other family members for a fishing/relaxing vacation. When we got to Parrot Key, we were not disappointed. The property is landscaped and tropical, just like the pictures from their website. It is located 10 minutes from Duval Street and near shopping centers, which were convenient for our group as we enjoy cooking and Parrot Key had a beautiful kitchen that we utilitzed to the max. The staff (Jeanne and Alias) at the Tiki Bar were accomodating and very helpful with suggestions for our off site excursions. We had but one complaint. Each day we would have to go in search of wash clothes. The housekeeping staff would remove the dirty clothes, but not replace them with clean clothes. Overall Parrot Key Resort is a beautiful property and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Retreat, Great Value, Bring Friends!”
Reviews.Author: Soundside_4
Reviews.Content: More than a hotel room - a beautiful home! Quiet, gorgeous gardens and tasteful interior decor. Great value. Fully equipped large kitchen with grocery stores within walking distance if cooking is part of your plan. Short drive into center of town. Note that the jetski concession on site is a bit overpriced - found rates 30% less expensive in town.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Landscaped Resort”
Reviews.Author: hebertm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 5 nights. Very relaxing resort. Townhouses were very nice and well equipped with everything you need. Four pools on site. Cafe that had great panni sandwiches cooked by Alias and drinks served by Jeanne. Both employees were very nice and very helpful with information that we needed. Wish we had talked to them before scheduling a chartered fishing trip with one of the locals. Only about 10 minutes from Duval Street, restaurants and shopping. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay at Parrot Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: hebertr
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. We stayed for 4 nights. Four great pools on the premises. The cafe located at the poolside was very nice. Friendly workers there (Jeanne and Alias) They gave very helpful tips for Keywest area. The only negative thing I kept noticing was housekeeping would never leave any new clean washclothes after taking the used ones. We had to keep calling for towels. Other than that, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for the most part”
Reviews.Author: mckinleykf
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is traveling to Key West. It is right off US ! and a short bike ride to all the action in downtown Key West. The rooms are absolutely beautiful with all the modern ammenities anyone could dream of. The landscaping of hotel was top notch and stunning. There are 4 different pools that are all separated by the beautiful landscaping and very private. If you should visit the Parrot Key a must stop would be to the bar to visit. Jeanne ( the bartender ) makes the best drinks around and Elias ( the chef ) made some very tasty and affordable lunches for my family and I. The only drawback to this hotel is the Front Office, I don't know if they haven't gotten all the kinks worked out of how to manage the front office but it was highly disorganized and very frustrating to the consumer ( this hotel has only been open 10 months and I am sure this problem will clear itself up with the correct management. ) Overall I would recommend going to this resort over any other that I saw on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: RosaBolivar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful place with a group of girlfriends and we couldnâ€™t believe our eyes, this place is gorgeous! The staff is super friendly as well. The decoration is beautiful and the appliances brand new. We stayed in a room with water view and both patio and balcony view is to die for. I definitively recommend this place and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: karifitz
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at Parrot Key and the accomadations were amazing. We had a three bedroom ocean view condo. The Condo was immaculate with great high def TV"s in every room. The back porch was so relaxing with a glass of wine. The gardens and the beautiful potted plants added to the lush landscape. The resort had 4 pools. Melissa at the front desk was always so very helpful. If you needed a cab she would call for you and the cab woud be there in minutes. Shelly at the bar was the "BEST" and her tips on Key West were great. Also the panini sandwiches at the bar were delicous and could be split. Alsonso's Restaurant on the Historic Pier was my favorite sea food restaurant. We ate outside and the view of the Marina was awesome. The highlight of my trip to Key West was the sunset sail on the Adirondack Schooner. I would highly recommend Parrot Key and I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Ready for another stay and soon”
Reviews.Author: Outoftownies
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the Parrot Key we immediately booked another night. Staff were great and helpful. The location kept us away from the noise and crowds of downtown with no problem getting to the city center. Next time we will take advantange of the amenities of the resort. The landscape is as if you were in a Botanical Garden.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: amgolden
Reviews.Content: We had another great stay at Parrot Key this April. It's so nice, we barely wanted to leave the resort to see the island!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: ashbieleigh
Reviews.Content: This resort was just the vacation we needed! It was quiet, relaxing, and so nice! I went to stay with some friends who booked one of the units and I have to admit that the service and hotel are awesome. The entire staff is great, especially Kiel (Kyle) and Melissa. They were fun, exciting, and knew where everything was that we wanted to do! Also, the bellman Booker was exceptional to making sure our stay was comfortable. I would HIGHLY recommend this stay to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: MaxandEmma
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone visiting Key West. This resort is perfect for a family. The resort is exactly as depicted on the website. The rooms are beautiful with lots of space. My five year old told me that it was his favorite vacation ever. He loved the third floor games room. He also loved the four different pools that he could visit at any time. The grounds are beautiful and very well mantained. The resort is quiet and relaxing. This resort thinks of everything. Everything you could possibly want is already in your condo. The luxury touches - granite countertops, high quality linens all add to overall quality of this resort. You will not be disappointed if you book this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tampatravelers_9
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time staying at Parrot Key Resort. The rooms are amazing and made me feel very at home. The staff is courteous and friendly. Especially Melissa and Kiel at the front desk. They helped to ensure my family's vacation lived up to it's full potential. Can't wait to make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Paradise, just awesome...”
Reviews.Author: richieonline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parrot Key for two nights this month. Check in was easy, they upgraded is no extra charge to a bay side condo. I had seen pictures and had high expectations but I have to say they were exceeded. The condos were definitely first rate but the pools (four of them) did it for me, it's like extremley tropical with nice ambient music. They were a little short on pool towels and I think they built this place to sell the condos not specifically as a resort but are doing the resort thing to make money until they all sell... that does not matter though, excellent experience! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ddsandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2009 with 2 teenagers-have nothing but wonderful things to say about this place. The rooms were spotless, the employees nothing short of pleasant and helpful. Only suggestions I can make is to have more beach towels and chairs around the pool! Was present at the incident the other posters talk about. Staff was nothing short of cordial and helpful. Perhaps if the posters had been more cooperative and less demanding, and checked their attitude, they would have ended up staying here.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 6friendsforlife
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Parrot Key Resort for 4 nights. It was beautiful. Everyone was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about all Key West attractions! Convenient with Walgreens, liquor store and full grocery store within walking distance. Facilities were so much more than we expected!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cmsMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parrot Key twice (unit 11 on March 8-11, 2009, unit 46 on March 8-9, 2009, and unit 38 on April 8-11, 2009). The first time we went with our college freshman son and his fraternity brothers. The second, we went with our younger kids. We loved it both times. The property is beautiful. The units are spacious and extremely comfortable. While not by the heart of Key West, everything is an easy ride away. The location is actually convenient. A Walgreens (and affiliated liquor store) next door and a grocery store, bagel place, and TGIF across the road, although you'd never know it when you are on the property. (Actually, when my wife and I went to an elegant dinner, the kids decided to stay in and bring in food from TGIF, so that was really convenient.) I was not there when the other recent reviewers had their bad experience. Definitely, something must have gone terribly wrong, since I can't imagine the folks here calling the cops on a guest. But some times things happen, and we've heard only one side of the story. Our experience with the staff has been excellent. Actually, the second time we were upgraded for free from a channel view unit to an ocean view unit, and it may have been by Tina (it was a lady who did it over the phone, and Tina sounds right). The ladies at the outdoor bar, especially Shelly, have been great and even remembered us the second time we were there. On top of it all, we have gotten great deals on the units (probably due to the bad economy). At bottom, we love this place and will surely return (particularly if the good deals continue).

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR BAIT AND SWITCH!!”
Reviews.Author: jocelyn620
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clearly in big troble, as is the entire chain if these places. Under staffed, poorly trained, not housekeeping to speak of. I paid in advance for three bed room ($2200.00) three monthes before hand, but was downgraded on arraival with NO explaination. On check out, the front desk clerck presented me with a bill for $1300.00. I told him I paid and he tried to take the bill away and say it was all Experida's fault. I have been trying to get a refund every since. There is NO ONE who will answer or explain the reason for this. Clearly, when you cannot get a hold of a book keeper, you know the place has BIG problems. Check out all the complaints with the owners on Goggle. He has some real problems-like JAIL time problems! Hope all the bad reviews I'm going to write are worth the $1000.00 bucks, guys!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful resort we ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: zzoombucks
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this place. The resort is even more beautiful than the website gallery showed. The attention to detail and the quality of what was put into the beach homes and the grounds were incredible. It was very clean, inside and out. No matter how beautiful a place is, the staff is what makes one's stay shine. Your staff is absoloutely wonderful and were the icing on the cake. Everyone was always helpful and friendly. They always steered us in the right direction of the best restaurants and nightlife - making our trip even more enjoyable. Particularly, we want to mention Jeane, Andrew, and Elija at the tiki bar - the best mix of warm hearts and cold drinks on the island! Booker's warm smile always made you feel at home.
