And we must mention Carlos at the jet ski rental - so friendly and thorough - he made my maiden voyage on a jet ski an awesome experience! I guess if I had any suggestions, it would be to keep the tiki bar and pool open a bit longer and have just one of the four pools an adult only pool to make it a little more peaceful for the guests without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Vaca09tioner
Reviews.Content: The units are large but there is no privacy. We got stuck in until #7 which is right by the road and it was very noisy. You could not even open the windows. There was also no view at all. The staff did not care. Also, although there were 4 TVs, only one of the remotes worked. Again, the staff did not fix this. I will say that the units are brand new so that was nice but it is just not in a good location. Parking was also a struggle. The units are very comfortable but don't pay a lot or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - 10 Minutes by Car to the Action in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jdlev
Reviews.Content: Parrot Key is a great resort on the outskirts of the action of Key West. There is no shuttle into town offered by the resort so you have to walk in (30-45 minutes) or drive/take a cab. A cab ride for 4 adults is $16.00 flat rate each way (plus tip). Parking in Key West runs $12 - $14 for the day. We paid $219.00 for a two bedroom townhome and it was well worth it. However, the regular rate of $500.00+ for the same unit seems exorbitant especially without a complimentary shuttle into town. The resort itself is beautiful with lush landscaping and modern, upscale accommodations. We spent a few afternoons/mornings relaxing by one of the pools and enjoyed sitting on our back porch in the evenings with a glass of wine. Things I wish I knew before I packed: there are towels provided at the pool with the tiki bar, the kitchen comes with coffee filters, coffee, salt & pepper, dishwasher detergent, dish soap and the refrigerator has filtered water and ice. There are free laundry facilities in the fitness building (all you need is your detergent and dryer sheets). Our two bedroom unit had one hair dryer (maybe they've added this amenity since one of the previous comments regarding the lack of hair dryers). Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Parrot Key Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential....but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: jalee27
Reviews.Content: First of all, as indicated on the internet photos, Parrot Key is a beautiful resort with brand new 3 floor condos , 4 pools and beautiful plant life throughout. It has the potential to be a great resort, but still has a lot of work to do. Most of it being with management and staff training. We arrived on a Saturday, and checked into our 2 bedroom house at the front desk. The front desk staff was young, and simply gave us our room key and pointed out our room ona resort map. We were not told of any of ther esort ammenities, water activities, workout room, guest laundry room, on-site cafe. Most of these we discovered on our own throughout our week there. The rooms are beautiful. Brand new with a good set up, spacious living area, nice rooms. My room was on the second floor, down the hall from the master bedroom. My main complaint is that my room had no windows, just two doors that opened onto the back desk, which had no deck chairs. I was looking forward to sleeping with open windows and an ocean breeze, but couldnt since the doors had no screens on them. Also- the air in the condo cannot be controlled within the unit. It is set at a standard temperature by the facility and the AC kicks on when necessary to reach this temperature. Frustrating since we would have liked to keep windows/doors open and enjoy outisde air instead of AC. Also- the third floor media room is a bit awkward. It can be used as an additional bedroom, but we never went up there, except to see what it was. It has a full bathroom, and a we discovered on day 4- houses the iron and ironing board. There is a gaming unit there, but no games. I assume you would have to get them from the front desk. When we arrived, we found several empty cases of beer on our back deck which had not been cleaned after the previous tenants. Otherwise the unit seemed to be in clean condition. The kitchen is sparsly furnished with very basic kitchen needs, so as long as you only need it for small food/meal preparation, it works fine. Also- they do now provide hairdryers in any of the units. Surprising since my mother didn't bring hers assuming there would be one there. Luckily I had brought mine or else we would have had to buy one somewhere. The housekeeping staff was inconsistent, our biggest complaint is that they do not knock and announce themselves but simply use a key card and just walk into a condo. Many times we were sitting in the living area having coffee or breakfast in our pajamas and a housekeeping would just walk in on us. There is a 'do not disturb' sign to put on the door, but a simple knock would have made us much happier. Also- they did not always replace towels/soap/bathmats in the unit. Most days we found they removed a towel or mat without giving us a new one. They also do not give you any kitchen/dish towels (we used a bathroom towel) and always start the dishwasher, even if there is only a glass in it. The location is mediocre. It says its a waterfront hotel, but that just means waterview. There is no access to the water (which is a sal channel) except at the watersports dock where you can rent ket skis or kayaks. It is next to a Walgreens & liquor store with a WinnDIxie Supermarket & coffee shop & small shopping plaza across the street, which is convenient. We walked across the street for coffee, bagels or other grocery needs in the mornings. It is about a mile and half from the downtown area, so you will need some sort of transportation. We walked downtown the first day, which was fine, but we realized we would not be able to do that daily, or each time we wanted to go out to eat. Taxis are limited and you need to call ahead to have one pick you up on the island. Electric cars are popular to rent, but are expensive. We rented scooters to get around (we were all comfortable driving them) which we the best option. They are easy to get around on and downtown has free scooter parking areas (electric cars have to use meters). The best parts of the Island were: Duval Street, which is entertaining to walk down at any time of day. There is always something going on and people wathing is so fun. I had the best cheeseburger at an approprately named open-air restaurant called Cheeseburgers (the island favorite- with pineapple and avocado). Visit Alonso's Oyster house on A & B Marina between 4 & 6 pm for half price drinks and appetizers, a great deal and huge selection, we made whole meals of it. We spent a day on the southernmost beach, which was beautiful. $5 for chair rental for the day and the staff brings around free treats like popsicles, strawberries etc. We also went to the Buttefly Conservatory, which was an amazing experience. Hundreds of butterflies and birds flying all around you. Absolutely beautiful. On our last day we made sure to do a water adventure and sailed with Danger Charters for the afternoon. We picked a kayak/snorkel/sunset trip which was awesome. We sailed, not motored through the ocean which a max of 20 passengers (as opposed to some of the larger companies who pack up to 100 people on a boat. The guides were great and knowledgeable, taking us kayaking through Mangrove island, and snorkeling through the shallow crescent where we saw lobsters and sting rays. We sailed home with free beer, wine, fresh fruit, chips & salsa and great company. Highly recommended. Overall we absolutely loved Key West. Theres something for everyone and all sorts of people there. Parrot Key is a beautiful resort and a great option if you want lots of space and a full kitchen/multiple rooms with bathrooms. Just be aware that the guest services aren't quite there yet. We had a lot of trouble getting a late check out, none of the employees really seemed trained to handle any of our questions and kept telling us the manager (Tina) would call us to confirm, which she never did. Kyle- the assistant manager was less than helpful and very short with his conversation with us. The resort is impressive, the staff and management, disappointing, but the atmosphere of the entire island more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best accomodations I've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyDoodle
Reviews.Content: The condo was beautiful, luxurious and immaculately clean. The pools were salt water, which were heavenly and the landscaping was extraordinarily beautiful. The staff was courteous, helpful and eager. The full kitchen was terrific, the free laundry surprised me, my children appreciated the media room and the atmosphere was the best medicine for the winter blues.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room”
Reviews.Author: hbierer
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed at the Parrot Key Feb. 20th to the 24th. These are not Hotel rooms, they are townhouses. Lots of room! We were supposed to be in a 2 bedroom, but they put us in a 3 bedroom, 3 1/2 bathroom house. It was great to spread out. There is a full kitchen including a dishwasher, big refrigerator and full stove with microwave. Nice flat screen TV's in all bedrooms and in the living room. There are 4 pool areas with comfortable chairs to lay on. Water temperature was just right. Only one bad thing, the walls are alittle thin. We had some younger kids next to us and they liked to run up and down the stairs. Location was nice. Right next to a Walgreens and grocery store across the street. It was about 2 miles from Duval Street. A taxi to Duval street was about $10 for the 3 of us. Parking is at a premuim near Duval Street but can be found if you get there early enough in the night. We found a public parking lot at City Hall a nice location. Of course, if you plan on drinking acohol, I suggest taking a taxi. There is a machine in the parking lot to pay for the parking, then you display the receipt on your dashboard of the car.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but has some problems”
Reviews.Author: floundering
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Key West. This resort is very beautiful. Great location, and friendly staff. But there are some problems in management and a few staff there. First I will start off that I do recommend this place if you are a family traveling to the keys. But again there were a few things wrong. We got there around 9pm, having called to verify that we couldcheck in late, they told us no problem. So my family of 7 go to check in and they have over booked all the rooms. So my ocean view room was not ready to go into and they had us move into a island side room at a discount for the night. The desk clerk had no idea really what was going on. And then told us to talk to manager, who would move us back to ocean side room at the discounted price. Yes they said they would honor the discount for the week. That night there is a highly intoxicated college kid trying to kick in our door, and cursing andyelling on our front porch into his cell. Needless to say security and desk were called as we have children there with us. Security comes out and asked the guy if he is ok!?!?! Then walks away leaving said drunk guy there on front porch who starts trying the door again. Security was called again and never showed, so Ihad to confront this guy and make him leave. First night over. The next day the manager moved us at about 4 pm. But did not honor the discount the desk clerk said she would. Thats ok we still got a steep discount off the price, just not what they said. (I am not complaining about this one... it was a great discount still nearly 400 a night off!!) Manager was very friendly. The rest of week we had trouble getting towels nearly every day. Cleaning staff did not clean. Sheets were not changed once. Still after calling and asking they brought what we needed. Just some things to think about. I do reccommend this place it is just fantastic facility. But the staff is not the greatest and is a little slow. Other than that there is no better place to go with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about Parrot Key Resort.”
Reviews.Author: DCATPUGS
Reviews.Content: Arriving to a beautiful resort in Key West made the trip well worth it. Parrot Key is centrally located for anyone with a rental car. We enjoyed the quiet and beautiful town home. Being able to drive to "Old Town" and the beach made returning to our resort a real pleasure. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping was "the best."

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LNandKC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Parrot Key for a weekend getaway. I was very impressed with how clean the units were and the attention to detail. We did not have a water front room, but it was still nice to sit out on the balcony. The pools are beautiful and very relaxing. Next time we will definitely come back with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top Of The Line!!!”
Reviews.Author: sally09Alaska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Florida to visit his mother and decided to do a side trip to Key West from Pompano. Last time we were in Key West was 17 years ago. I never expected this. We walked in and talked to the excellent staff, without reservations just because we knew Key West had alot to choose from once there. Once we pulled into the Parrot Key Resort ,i fell in love. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. It was so beautiful inside and out i instantly wanted to "hang out" there with one of the beautiful decks outside of the main living room and just take in the view of palm trees and all the tropical beauty around me. That was just the beginning. The kitchen and rooms were all 5 star! All in all we highly recommend that you bring your family or just yourselves to stay in any of their resorts. We are staying at the Marathon resorts next. They really did go above and beyond ! I acutally swam in one of the 4 pools and felt like a kid again!!! These 2 Alaskans are hooked!

Reviews.Title: “Recently stayed here”
Reviews.Author: johnnybeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb. 5 and 6. Some facts for your consideration: An attractive place. Landscaping is beautiful. The four pools are very attractive with the palm trees ,etc. The condo was fine. Hot water WAS a real problem. Walls ARE thin. There is no "oceanfront.' It borders the Florida Bay. There's land on the other side; there is no beach, the water is inaccessible. Be prepared for 'sticker shock' when you get your bill. There is a $19.48 charge per day for parking and a $24 a day "resort fee" added to your bill ( a charge that is not volunteered when you call).

Reviews.Title: “This place is the best!”
Reviews.Author: gbsutures
Reviews.Content: We extended a business trip from Marco Island and decided to fly down to Key West for a break. Found this location on tripadvisor and it really can't be beat. It is a little ways from Duval, so you will either need to rent a car (I don't recommend) or use the money you would have used to rent the car and pay for the resort parking and the taxis (which are expensive -- $15 each way including tip). You are renting a 2-3 bedroom condo. It has everything you could want. It sleeps about 6 to 8, has a full kitchen and 3 1/2 baths. There are flat screen TVs everywhere. The residence is beautifully appointed and super clean. The grounds are immaculate. The multiple pools are heated. Staff is very friendly. There are two balconies and a porch that opens to a man-made sandy beach area (not to the water -- most of Key West is rocky on the shores so we did not expect to find that it would lead to the water). If I had one suggestion, it would be that the fitness area on the premises had more equipment -- more variety and a few heavier free weights. But it was fine. The Parrot Key is also located by a Walgreens and a Winn Dixie. You can stock up on day one and you will be fairly set. The Parrot Key has pretty much everything if you are looking for a place that is a gorgeous getaway off the beaten path and a place to escape from the crowds of Duval. You can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to go to!”
Reviews.Author: JecaPeca
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating 2 b-day's in our group of friends & came across this resort online..I must say it was the best experience I have had in the keys thus far. The place is wonderful, clean, and anything you need, the resort faculty will do everything to accomodate you. I specifically was taken care of by Melissa from the front desk and was a wonderful person to deal with. She made everything happen very smoothly for us and I have to say, "OUR GANG" want to make it a yearly get-to-gether. Please call & enjoy this resort. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Bonding with friends”
Reviews.Author: mrsjetsetter
Reviews.Content: We had 3 couples in our group for my birthday weekend and stayed in a 3 bedroom. I couln't have asked for spectacular weather that weekend and sharing this with my friends. There was plenty of room for all of us. Walgreens being next door was convenient in stocking up on drinks, snacks, etc, all walking distance. Jet skiing was offered at the back of the hotel, for an extra charge, which was also convenient. After that we jumped in one of their 4 heated pools afterwards which was terrific. Pretty much the pool to ourselves. Someone came by to take our lunch orders and drinks and we just chilled by the poolside, what service!! Staff was very attentive and helpful with any questions asked. The whole complex felt like a tropical paradise . The sad thing was we only stayed here for 3 nights. Wish we had more time. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a spot!”
Reviews.Author: bogg0017
Reviews.Content: Summer Laetari (a wedding planner in the Keys) recommended the resort for our overnight stay in Key West. Wow was it a total package. The condos are huge and very well kept. Flat screens and stainless steel appliances. Even from the outside it looks perfect compared to any other property right down to the grass on the lots. I fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Wedding in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: blackredraider
Reviews.Content: I have been planning a wedding in Key West, FL and living in Texas over the past five months. I have now moved to Georgia, if things weren't complicated enough and have begun a new job. My mother and I were considering possible resorts for my 2009 wedding and we came upon Parrot Key in our search. My fiancee had also stumbled upon their website in her searches as well. I contacted the Resort and spoke with Summer Laetari about possibly holding an event their in February. She was very approachable and provided excellent information about the Resort and the surrounding area. She asked me to correspond via email, so that she could track our progress during our planning and have a reference to past conversations. Throughout the process she has been wonderful in answering all of my questions and concerns. Especially considering that I am in Georgia and my fiancee is in Texas. She gave me a great Word document that broke down all of the packages available and the relative pricing for each one. From this I was able to create a Powerpoint, that I was able to share with Summer in regards to our wedding plans. Summer did a great job in compiling my information into a spread sheet that broke down our costs from what I had found. She was also vary patient with our various requests for different pricing packages. She even provided us with a list of vendors in the local area. I look forward to holding my wedding at Parrot Key and know that it will be a success. Summer has been great to work with and has made the planning of this event pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Not just 5 star....10 star treatment and accomodations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morahcece
Reviews.Content: We were here for our son's wedding. We have stayed at many nice resorts and hotels, but yours was the best by far. We had a small problem with ants in our unit when we arrived, but we were moved to a different unit. Any need or request was met immediately. Summer, you did an A+++ job of coordinating the finishing touches for the wedding...I know my daughter-in-law made all the plans, etc, but you carried them out beautifully. I usually cannot wait to leave to get home...but would have been happy to stay a week longer! Chris Wilkes

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: gdlo
Reviews.Content: Our family of six spent New Years in Key West and stayed at the Parrot Key for a six day stay. Our ages ranged from 13-47. We were impressed in every way. Lush, mature, tropical grounds despite being newly constructed. Well appointed, impeccably maintained, super clean rooms and outstanding helpful staff. Melissa, Jeanne, Sherri and Booker the doorman were awesome. Will definitely return and have already referred to good friend since my return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wedding Location”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBw1
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I chose Parrot Key for our wedding and a vacation for friends and family. We had a wonderful stay and enjoyed the experience. The grounds are beautiful (4 pools, lush, tropical landscaping), the units are immaculate (3-level, spacious Key West-style homes) and the service is prompt and efficient. In a town full of overpriced, cramped, run-down, delapidated properties, Parrot Key is a fresh, unique and great destination. Wedding package pricing is very reasonable and include many options and choices for any budget. On-site wedding catering is high quality (food, drink, etc) and staff was attentive, polite and helpful. Also, the staff went out of their way to accomodate our requests and make us feel like we were the only guests on the property. Most importantly, Parrot Key events coordinator Summer Laetari did a fantastic job and made sure that our wedding ceremony and reception ran smoothly and was carried out specific to my fiancee's wishes. We definitely recommend Parrot Key to Key West travelers. Its a great place to stay, and a great place to host a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Keys Holiday trip”
Reviews.Author: Spaaahhhme
Reviews.Content: My family took a holiday trip to the Florida Keys and we thoroughly enjoyed Parrot Key in Key West. Key West is usually very crowded and busy, but inside this hotel you almost forget you are in such a busy place. The units are very large 2 and 3-bedroom townhomes built around beautifully landscaped pools. We swam every day and chilled out at night in the beautiful rooms. We didn't want to leave the hotel, the rooms were so comfortable and well appointed. All you need is a bathing suit, suntan lotion, and food - you won't want to leave the hotel. Don't miss this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for a family to enjoy Key West!”
Reviews.Author: GWBPA
Reviews.Content: The Parrot Key Resort is brand new so everything was spotless. When walking the grounds, you can't help but notice the wonderful architecture and tropical landscaping, which creates an atmosphere of a tropical paradise. It is hard to believe this resort is located on a major road. Each of the four pools is surrounded by this lush landscaping which includes towering palm trees, and were a delight to lie beside. The Paniniâ€™s at the cafe although a bit pricey (typical of resort cafes) were delicious. The drinks were also good although they seemed a bit weak. The rooms are spacious with tasteful furniture and beautiful artwork. And, the porch on the first floor and two second floor balconies really bring the outside and its sunshine indoors. The location is very convenient to both Old Town Key West and the beaches. Only one minor recommendation and that regards the music played from speakers installed throughout the resort. After awhile it becomes a distraction and takes away from that paradise atmosphere, especially the speakers located near the back porches. I would reduce the times that the music is played. Overall, I have been to the Florida Keys many times and I would definitely recommend the Parrot Key Resort when visiting Key West, especially for groups of 4 to 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: DBRose
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 (4 children, 13 to 20 years + 2 parents), and we also brought along a family friend - so there were 7 of us. The units are officially for 6 people, but they were great about adding one more, unofficially. They provided bedding and extra towels, though the extra accommodations were on the living room couch. Our unit was very new, clean, nicely appointed and comfortable. The kitchen has great utensils and appliances. The pools are great for sunning, not much for swimming as they are small. The staff was friendly and very helpful. One of the best things about this place for a family vacation is actually the amazing Walgreens next door. They are open 24 hours, and stock everything you really need in life in addition to the regular drug store stuff. We bought clothes, groceries, hats, pillows - and all at very reasonable prices. A great convenience. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “BEST in Key West”
Reviews.Author: larisska
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at a Singh resort, and once again I was blown away by the beauty of the buildings and architecture. The two days it rained, we made use of the 3 flat screen tvs in our unit; otherwise we were usually out by the four stunning pools and gardens. The staff is helpful and friendly, the views are to die for, even the panini by the pool are terrific! I highly recommend this hotel and have already booked our stay for next year.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: janmcc
Reviews.Content: I LOVED Parrot Key! We stayed in the three-bedroom house on the Bayfront. From the moment we entered the property, we knew we had made a great decision. The property is lushly landscaped, the layout is user-friendly, and the staff was warm and accommodating. The house itself is gorgeous. The kitchens were fitted with full size appliances, granite countertops, and dishes. The beds were so comfy with quality linens. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like it in Key West”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to a Singh Resort but my first one to Parrot Key on Key West. Amazing does not begin to describe my stay here and the property itself. To begin with, the property itself is exceptionally elegant on the outside. The lush green grass, tick and healthy tropical foliage and beautiful and CLEAN white sand surrounds the entire resort. There are several pools that are quite nice and the buildings themselves are pristine white as if they were built and freshly painted yesterday. I stayed in unit #8 which is, like most (if not all) of the rooms in the resort is a large, three bedroom unit with a game room upstairs on the third floor (complete with gaming chairs with stereo speakers.) The kitchen was very modern and the bathrooms (my personal pet peeve) were immaculate and the bed gave me the best night sleep I had enjoyed in several months. One thing that you need to be aware of if you are a smoker...all Singh Resorts are non-smoking properties...inside and out. There are designated smoking ares, but they take this non-smoking policy seriously, and I believe that it has a great deal to do with why the resort is so clean...no stray cigarette butts anywhere. Everything is pristine and new. Parrot Key is not like a hotel or even condo (ESPECIALLY for Key West) but a luxury resort that reminds you of the home you would want to have. My only regret...that I could not stay longer! Mr. Singh and his fine staff are to be congratulated on a fine property that brings real style and class that rivals any resort, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kimjoe33
Reviews.Content: Simply put, incredible. Beautifully landscaped, great service, warm friendly staff. Very peaceful. We are already planning for next year and we just got back today.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: linbaz
Reviews.Content: I recently took two days off from work and had made arrangements to bring my wife to Parrot Key for two days of relaxation and privacy.I was very happy with the location of our unit it gave us all the privacy we needed.The unit was gteat it was clean bright and homey we were comfortable immediatly.We also had plenty of time to enjoy the three pools that they have there even though it was a little chilly the pools were heated just right.I would recomend this getaway to all couples who would like to have some quality time together.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parrot Key”
Reviews.Author: scoobie642
Reviews.Content: It has been 4 yrs since we visited Key West and we were planning to stay at the Hampton Inn which was gone when we arrived to Key West. The Hampton was torn down after the floods and hurricane and replaced with this brand new property. The Parrot Key has only been open a few months and we found it was beautiful. We absolutely loved our 2 nite, 3 day stay at the Parrot Key in Key West. The property is immaculantly kept and the townhouses are wonderful. We stayed in a 3 story townhouse. Our children are 5 and 7 and totally enjoyed the space and the game room on the third floor. The balconies out each bedroom have great views. The sand out the back porch was just like the beach and the girls loved playing and we could leave the patio doors open and watch them play. The granite countertops and stainless steel appliances were gorgeous in the kitchen, which was also supplied with everything we needed to cook some of our meals. The 3 large flat screen TVs in each bedroom and the game room are gorgeous. The 4 heated pools were magnificent. The towels by the pool and server attending to any requests was great. The maid service daily was an added bonus. It was so nice to have clean towels, and sheets each nite. The unit was cleaned daily. I would recommend this place to everyone. The price was very reasonable. It was a great experience and we will definately be back to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hidden Parking Fee”
Reviews.Author: browley2008
Reviews.Content: This resort has a lot of great things to offer. The rooms were clean, spacious and very well done. There are 4 pools all equally as nice, my only negative comment is the hidden parking charge that was on the bill the day of checkout. The resort charges $14.00 / day for parking which they neglected to mention at the time of reservation., because they are a distance from town and they do have a large parking lot it seems a bit unnecessary. They may also want to consider having some type of happy hour get together at night so the people staying there can get to know each other...Overall the resort was nice and definitely a place I would stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property!”
Reviews.Author: KeysGuy99
Reviews.Content: My business allows me to travel and stay up and down the keys. In all the places I have stayed, this one is top notch! The grounds are immaculate with a huge variety of local plant life. There's not one but FOUR pools, each secluded from one another. All the units are three stories, each kept cleaner then the next. Talk about spacious! The top floor has its own X-Box game room, compleat with Bose surround sound and gaming chairs! I loved having a full kitchen so that I didn't have to eat out every night. It was great to hang out at Cafe Blue, the tiki bar, during the day a talk with the friendly staff. The front desk staff was amazing and helped with my every need. I can't wait to head back to Key West and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Parrot Key Resort is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: JOTX08
Reviews.Content: I am getting married at Parrot Key Resort in Key West in May. I went in October to meet with their FABULOUS wedding coordinator Summer Laetari. Their property is very beautiful, it's extremely green and lush. Parrot Key has 4 pools. It's very colorful and unique. Their cottages are brand new, very clean and well appointed. If you are looking for a place to have a destination wedding I would recommend Parrot Key! My family and I have already planned another trip to visit next month. Their wedding coordinator Summer is very knowledgeable about the property and their wedding packages as well as their capabilities. She is extremely patient and answered all my questions. She even came in on her day off to meet with me! She is VERY responsive in answering emails and returning phone calls - for anxious brides this is so important! I love working with her and I know you will too. She has made my life much easier as a Bride!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lynn0517_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parrot Key Resort during Fantasy Fest weekend. Although I have been on the grounds in the past and ate at the Tiki Bar, I have never stayed or been in one of the homes until that weekend. What I found, was a beautiful home with beautiful furnishings. The home captured the Keys feeling with style and class. The Resort experience was more than I imagined. While I was in busy Key West, with thousands of tourists, the Resort provided a peaceful tranquil experience away from the rat race. The pools were amazing. I, personally applaude the Resort, on the four pools and their size. This provided the feeling of your own private escape along with tropical privacy. The grounds are simply amazing foliage and very well kept. I ate at the Tiki Bar several times and had great service. The employees were wonderful. I had a maintenance issue and had immediate service and resolution to the problem. I would highly recommend this Resort. I can't wait to bring my family there for an amazing vacation getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Quaint Villas Of Parrot Key Beach House Resort !!”
Reviews.Author: Sailfish50
Reviews.Content: It Will Go Down In Our Memories As The Nicest Place We"ve Ever Stayed !! Bar None. We where blown away at the Tropical Landscaping Surrounding the POOLS, you could have your own Private Pool party in one pools & the rest of the folks still had 3 more Pool Areas to choose from, because of the plush thick Tropical Landscaping you could not see the other Pools. No where else have we seen this at any Hotel or Resort in the Bahamas or USA. The Units were unbelievable, New Top of the Line Appliances ( wish we had at home ) We Also could not believe there was a Big Screen Movie , Game Room on the 3rd Floor with a full Bathroom. " Singh Resorts out did themselves" Thank You !! Jim Penix

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: allykat922
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how beautiful the villas were. They were immaculate and comfy, felt like the comfort of your own home. I will definetly be staying here again and reffering my friends and family to stay there on their next trip to Key West. We have found our new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very serene!”
Reviews.Author: besitos856
Reviews.Content: This resort is a wonderful place to stay while in Key West. The suite is very nicely decorated allowing you to feel at home yet still enjoy the serenity of the Keys. Very central to the main area in Key West so it allows you to enjoy the Key West nightlife yet still have a peaceful getaway. I definitely recommend this to the couple who would like a romantic getaway AND to the family who wants a "vacation home" away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SGBMarathon_FL
Reviews.Content: I live in Marathon, just 50 miles from Key West. My family was down from Missouri on vacation and wanted to go to Key West for Halloween. We booked a room at Parrot and it was wonderful. We had a room overlooking the beach and bay with umbrellas, cabanas and chairs just outside our door. The room was beautifully appointed and spacious with two bedrooms and a bonus room. The grounds were lush with four pools to choose from. Pricilla at the front desk was extremely helpful - she gave us information about the happenings in Key West and had a cab waiting at the appointed time. All in all a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “What a room! What Pools!, What a view”
Reviews.Author: travelguyIII
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at Parrot Key. The check in person was very nice and even though we had a short wait handled everything we needed very professionally. She gave us directions showed us on a map and called the cab to take us there. The rooms were excellent, clean and had a great view. We visited off season which accounted for the lack of deep sand in the back beach but it wasn't an issue. We called the front desk to have someone show us how to work the Satelight TV, with in minutes someone was there and stayed until we feild tested it. The views were incredible of the pools and the gulf of Mexico from the upper balcony. We had the front desk arrange our dinner reservations at three great resturaunts one being Louie's Back yard and another was at one of their competitors hotel, no problem. Great tropical feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: FlordiaShe
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived we were greeted by a lovely doorman and the front desk agents. they were warm and freindly. The 3 story town house was amazing with more than spacious room and the beds were a dream, each bedroom had a out door balcony with chairs.. Each day our unit was cleaned and fresh shampo etc was left for us. The pool area was beautifull . I loved this resort it was peacefull and a added benifit from all the hussel bussell at the main strip. My family and I would and will return . What a wonderfull way to see the keys . I will recomend this resort to all my family and freinds. Sheila Henderson

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners92
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my brother-in-law's 30th birthday. We stayed in #35, a three bedroom, three and a half bath townhouse right on the water. #35 is the best unit at the place because it is on the corner with water on two sides. The units were very spacious and the pictures of the resort do not do it justice. The beds were very comfortable and there was everything you would need in the kitchens. The kitchens also had state-of-the-art appliances and OXO utensils. The resort was not very busy when we stayed so we had one of the four private pools all to ourselves. There were always fresh towels at the pools and it was salt water, not chlorine. The staff was very nice at check-in and check-out. We were able to check in at 10am and check out at 2pm for no extra charge. My only complaint is the townhouse was not cleaned once while we stayed. Fresh towels were stocked and the trash was emptied daily, but that was it. We would definitely recommend this resort to others and would stay here again in a minute. We only wish we could get the introductory rate of $349/night again. :(

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you are in your dream home!!”
Reviews.Author: sidney7474
Reviews.Content: This resort is just gorgeous, its like a little town of heavenly private villas. We enjoyed it tremendously. Customer service was excellent, Hurricane Ike was coming in, we decided not to stay the second night and they let us stay till 5 Pm and did not charge us extra. They were extremely accomodating. The place is gorgeous, its just what I would pick out for myself if I was purchasing a home. The lower floor is beautiful, great kitchen, outdoor private beach backyard. The artwork is exceptional and the decorating is very inviting. We really enjoyed it. You can walk to the Eckerd Drug Store for Munchies and Beverages. The pools are beautiful, fresh water which I was not expecting ,they were very warm, so they were not as refreshing as I would have expected. We were so sad to leave, it really felt like home. This resort is NOT close to the Historic District, just a couple miles drive, paid $10 for parking a day in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It & Will Recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: virgobabiez
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the reosrt and just loved it, we stayed a total of 5 nights! The cleanliness of the resort, the front desk staff, housekeeping, everything was perfect! I totally recommend this resort and look forward to doing much more business with them in the near furture!

HotelInfo.Name: Parrot Key Hotel and Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 2801 N Roosevelt Blvd, Key West, FL 33040
